content: Decent cafe food. Outdoor area is pet-friendly, no pets allowed indoors. Their chicken waffle dish is worth a try! Can get pretty crowded with family and kids during dinner hours. Overall nice ambience.

Went on a weekday afternoon for lunch, not much crowd on a weekday. This cafe is quite spacious, have an outdoor and indoor seating area. I ordered the Chicken waffles Chicken was tender and delicious. The only complain was quite warm indoor, seem like the air-conditional is not working. Overall, wonderful place to chill and will visit again.

First time coming to this cafe and will definitely go back again. It’s such a nice and comfortable place to chill in..The food is nice & My family simply love all the varieties that we have ordered.. 👍🏻

Visited them on consecutive Sat and Sun! Service staffs are friendly and polite. Ordered their mushroom risotto and truffle fries for both days. It was really good! Amazingly, their coffee was a gem for us. We didn’t have high expectations on their coffee yet it was the star for our brunch. The sea salt caramel latte was da bomb! Not sweet yet very smooth and produce good aroma of the coffee. Will bring our kiddos back for the food!

It's new !!! Have outdoor (pets allowed) and indoor seating. Nice, clean, spacious and cosy. Ordered the all day breakfast set which was tasty and a cafe latte. Will visit again. Only complain was the need to improve their online menu with picture of the food!

We were here for the vet's appt and was so glad for a cafe that welcomes little friends. Better than that the food is very good. The pasta was fresh yet light. We also had the croffles with a very crispy chicken. I would have stayed longer for dessert but with the current humidity we have to come back when we can sit indoors without the little friend. Very good dining experience and good offering of wines too!
Went on a weekday for brunch, was a nice and quiet place to chill. Really enjoyed the pasta, which is a recommended dish . Quite a decent amount of seafood (scallops, prawns, clams) given 👍🏼👍🏼

A nice cafe tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Consists of both indoor air conditioned and outdoor seating suitable for pet owners which is a plus. Ample seating space inside as the restaurant stretches quite far in. Service is good and relatively fast. Decor is pretty and they have interesting pieces of furniture and contrasting wallpapers and panels for a varied effect. Tried their speculoos latte and Peter’s Pancake which is quite good 👍😊

Pretty good food and service at reasonable prices. The rosti waffles were very delicious, although we wish they could be even crispier. Pancakes are fluffy, scrambled egg is creamy, bacon is not too greasy. The melon tea smells very calming although the melon taste itself wasn't very strong. The online ordering platform was missing photos for several items, which made it hard to visualize what the dish would look like or the portion size.

Relaxing simple decor. The outdoor area is pet-friendly, lotsa cute dogs there! Indoors has plenty of seating. There is also a small garden area on the other end, with goldfishes swimming around in a little rock fountain.

Wow.. love this place for its space... wide spacious and hippy green ambience... Nice!

Simply the space and deco makes this cafe super comfortable to laze and chill in.

And I'm glad the great food goes well with ambience too..

Been here twice already. And their pastas and burger is great!

And their online loyalty program is definitely tempting me to go back a 3rd 4th time...
And its only tempting because food and ambience is great..

Would definitely be back many more times
Found a nice new cafe. Great food, pet friendly and can cycle over the next round. Just a bit longer waiting time for a seat so better to book advance 🥂

My first attempt lunch experience.

Personally, I like their main menu items, the savoury items are not to my liking.

Overall dining experience is good. Nice place and ambient.

Strong contender to the existing upper Thomson road cafes like Columbus Coffee. Overall good brunch food, with nice platting and interior design. However could do better with their coffees (quite awful Americano). They should like consider providing better utensils (fork,soon) as the current ones are obviously of sub standard quality, similar to the ones we see in food court. It’s the non polished type and didn’t look or feel sparkling clean. Furthermore, all of their fork has stains between the grooves. Asked for change but all had stains. Ended up not using their fork. Lost my appetite a little. Chicken was great but wished they drained the excess oil before serving. The plate was filled with excess oil from the chicken midway during meal. Overall 3 stars with lots of potential for improvement.

Good food and pet friendly. Will visit again
Not bad for a 3 week old cafe 🙂

Update:
Went back on their 4th week of business with more friends. Waiting time improved.

A bright, beautiful, and spacious cafe with lots of greenery - reminds me of a laidback Balinese beach club/cafe. It has a open, pet-friendly outdoor seating area too!

Not your usual cafe fare, ordered a few unique items to try. They were all delicious!

This cafe is pretty near my place but first time trying. Reservations is recommended especially for weekends. Surprised that the indoor dining area was so big.
Found the price of the food quite expensive. Breakfast for 3 easily exceeded $100. They had a promo with Citibank but we had lots of problems with it as it couldn't accept applepay or if the credit card is stored inside the phone without the full 16 digits.
Order a few dishes to share, the one we enjoyed most is the Chicken and Croffles. Both croffles and chicken were well cooked. The Roffles platter was interesting because of the rosti waffles and also liked the way the mushrooms were cooked.
Service was very slow. Not sure if they forgot the order or what. The staff are all very young and had to call them over a few times to check the status of the dishes. The sides came almost last, the Spicy Chicken wasn't really nice it didn't taste Korean but the sauce more tasted like the Thai sweet Chili sauce. The Sakura Cream Tagliatelie also came late and serving was very small which left us unsatisfied.
Drinks were just pretty average.
Really need to improve on the speed of the food served. Not sure why the cafe wasn't even crowded at all early in the morning.
Lovely ambience and tasty albeit junky food, has a nice al fresco area for pet owners and their fur kids. Deep fried chicken and croffles very yummy. Fries were good too. We'll be back soon.

Loved the interior design and spacious. Also has an outdoor sheltered seating area. Our group of 3 had the croffles with fried chicken, the crispy chicken burger, the rosti with mushrooms & pork sausages, chicken tenders with korean spicy sauce - all of them were decently good. The letdown came in the form of their tarts where the crust was soft, and it just felt liked it was kept for too many days.

Visited the place on a weekday afternoon and was delighted that there’s no crowd. Huge space with ample seating area. Had the fried chicken, sakura pasta and the creamed corn (CCB).

The pasta and chicken were great but the corn was just alright. The sour cream was not a good addition to the corn. Drinks were on the expensive side too.

Didn't expect the food to be good, but it really is! The chef does fried chicken super well. We ordered the spicy Korean fried chicken it was out of this world. The CCB is also super yummy. The CAVA burger is huge but also very tasty. My husband and I were stuffed after these three dishes due to the generous portion of the CAVA burger. For the portion, the price is very reasonable. The downside is the waiting time, it took 40 mins for us to have the first side on the table. We had to approach the service staff to check on our order. The last dish, the burger took 1 hour. Service staff is quite friendly and attentive in terms of refilling water. Easy to get their attention.

The colors they utilized in their interior design were fantastic. The colors are black, white, and jade green. This is a fantastic mix. I went on a Friday night when it wasn't too packed. ⁣
⁣
To self-order, scan the QR code.⁣
⁣
𝐒𝐚𝐤𝐮𝐫𝐚 𝐂𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐦 𝐓𝐚𝐠𝐥𝐢𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 𝐒𝐆𝐃 𝟏𝟗.𝟎𝟎 ⁣
There are around 7 clams and 2 prawns. The platings are fantastic. The taste is bland, and the prawns aren't fresh. Tagliatelle from another Italian restaurant tasted better.⁣
⁣
𝐂𝐚𝐯𝐚 𝐁𝐮𝐫𝐠𝐞𝐫 𝐂𝐫𝐢𝐬𝐩𝐲 𝐂𝐡𝐢𝐜𝐤𝐞𝐧 𝐓𝐡𝐢𝐠𝐡 𝐒𝐆𝐃 𝟏𝟕.𝟎𝟎⁣
It's served with fries. This is the night's highlight. It's served hot, with super soft and fluffy buns and properly cooked chicken. The fries are one flaw; they taste bland and are not served hot enough.⁣
⁣
Total bill SGD 𝟑𝟗.𝟔𝟎 (Inc of Service Charge no GST)⁣
⁣
I'll definitely return to try some of their other dishes and review later. Meanwhile 2 stars for overall.

Here for brunch and dinner before. The otah bruschetta with grilled cheese is a must. Dinner menu is so-so, portion can be bigger even though the food is good. Love the place as it allowed furkid to accompany the hoomans under shelter. Nice cafe in a quiet estate.

May 2022: This cafe has really good potential. Love the space - bright and spacious. Food was also good. Order the Cava Burger (chicken thigh) and the wild mushroom pasta. Both delicious. I liked how the cheese was melted on the bun and the mushrooms in the chicken burger. There is an option to choose wagyu meat instead of chicken for $2 additional but I read about how good the fried chicken was and hence was not about to lose this opportunity to taste it! Was happy I didn’t! Anyway, I wonder how the burger which included a slice of pineapple would taste if I had chose wagyu!
5 stars service, staff very patient and polite. They have special food and drink. Delicious and satisfying. The pet friendly zone is spacious without worrying about rain or hot weather.

It's a spacious cafe with welcoming staff. Ordered the mentaiko fries - which was great for sharing. The salmon was well executed but we didnt really appreciate the rosti. Overall, its a nice find in the area.

Love the recommended dishes : Sakura Tagliatelle, Cava Burger. Food is really good, best part I can get to see beautiful fur patrons playing at the outdoor area. Didn't enjoy the lemon meringue tart though.

Great neighbourhood cafe with brunch food. Rather big space lots of seating outside and inside. We ordered the fried chicken and croffles, mentaiko fries and the mushroom risotto.

The fried chicken was really well battered, light and crispy and not oily. The coleslaw was also a really nice touch cause I’m not a fan of putting maple syrup on my savoury food. I would say a must try when you come here.

The mushroom risotto was everything you would want in a risotto dish. Simple and rice was cooked just right (slightly Al dente but cooked through).

Mentaiko fries were decent but nothing special.

You order and pay through a QR code which is always a plus.

We came here after seeing Daniel Food Diary’s review (though we know to take all the bloggers’ reviews with a big pinch of salt).

In a nutshell, the food here is decent. Just skip the desserts and the coffee (which is a collaboration with local Hook coffee but the cafe does not have a barista in house). After lunch, simply hop over to Thus Coffee which is just around the corner.

It’s nice, quiet and spacious spot for catching up over lunch. On a Monday noon, it wasn’t crowded at all. We had a nice far end spot where behind the doors is the backyard with a water well.

We ordered the otah bruschetta (sourdough), seafood aglio olio, fishy business (salmon), roffles platter and wild mushroom risotto. All of us rather enjoyed our respective main course.

Thereafter, we shared the ondeh ondeh cake, yuzu cheesecake and a warm apple crumble and also had cups of coffee.

The Apple crumble looked really funky and unnatural (take a look at the last photo) plus it was too sweet. The ondeh ondeh was nothing to rave about either. Coffee was served without inspiration (no latte art cos as mentioned, no barista) - it was just bland, normal coffee but at a barista price tag of $7.

Do reserve before going especially on a weekend as it can get packed.

First visit - Order didn't go through the online ordering system and we ended up waiting for awhile to realise it didn't go through. But technical fault, can't be helped. Anyway, reordered and our food came in adequate time. The spinach cream pasta was quite nice.

Second visit - Decided to try the otah, and sakura pasta. Interesting menu, both were alright.

In both visits, the drinks were slightly underwhelming. Nice atmosphere and staff though!

Went there for lunch recently for a family of 5. Overall food is nice and the service is good. However, and that is a HUGE but, the waiting time for the food is ridiculously long at 70 minutes after ordering!!

They did let us know that waiting time for food will be at 30 minutes or more. I think it is good that they let customers know that they need to wait. Hmm... but we waited for 70 minutes... AND even if there is lots of pre-warning or notification that food may take some time to prepare, waiting for 70 minutes for the food is not acceptable. They really need to look into streamlining the process or expanding the kitchen capacity to have faster turn around time.

Apart from that, please do make reservation ahead! With such a long turn around time from ordering food to serving, you don't want to be queueing outside waiting for table + waiting for food later!

The service of this place is good. There are many attentive young servers.

Food wise, it is tasty and unique. Some notable dishes are the Spinach Creatm Tagliatelle ($15), Seafood Aglio Olio ($15),  CCB (Cream Corn Bacon $9). We ordered quite a lot of other stuff too. Can look at the photos. Food wise, it is 5 stars.

Beautiful interior and very spacious, quiet on thurs evening. Food was veryyyy average. Melon tea by the pot, teabag type. Speculoos Cafe Latte was good because its totally not sweet at all though the name. Roffles Platter was very homemade... the roffles was not crispy and abit mushy. Sakura Cream Tagliatelle Pasta was below average, too much residue water from the seafood so the whole dish was very watery but the prawns were fresh. Seafood Aglio Olio was average. Fries with truffle & parmesan was good, very generous and huge serving, highly recommend. Visited this cafe to celebrate a friend's birthday so we also ordered a Lemon Meringue Tart which didnt taste fresh, below average.

Will recommend this place only for small bites and drinks. Good for a teatime break.

Great all-day brunch and coffee. I had the open faced wagyu sandwich and my wife tried the Rosti waffle platter which is gluten free. Both are well presented and tasty. It is cavernous inside with lots of space and good ambience. Pets are allowed in their outdoor seating, which is nice!

A really spacious cafe newly opened just months ago. Comfortable and cosy seating.. serving great pasta towards the Asian texture. Love❤️ the small portions available for the small eaters🥰 #msgreedysis #greedybuddiez

Was looking for coffee after dinner and stumbled upon this cafe. Big and spacious dinning area. There is also a huge alfresco dinning area where you can bring your pets along. Very comfortable environment. At around 9+pm was still quite crowded on a Friday nite.

Cafe pricing is on the pricier side for this order. Drinks are quite unique. Ordered the iced puffed rice cafe latte and a hot speculoos cafe latte.

Puffed rice went quite well with the latte adding some texture. Giving a cereal feel when it is soaked up with latte. Recommended to try. Speculoos latte is ok but hope that they can be more generous with the speculoos topping.
Cheesecake is average.

Nice place to chill after dinner. Will be back to try their food.

Came with hubby and kids on Sunday late afternoon . Kids and pets friendly . Quite a busy cafe at that hour so I think quite suitable for noisy kids to dine in . Ambience was great as I faced to a small tropical garden ! Love the plants especially for plant lovers . haha . I think chicken croffle was not bad-recommended . English BF and spam fries soso. Cappucino can be better ( quite bitter ) as I think the other cafe around the corner has better coffee . I was expecting better coffee

Great ambience, nice deco plus 5 stars for presentation! Melted nacho cheese dripped over the entire Wagyu burger served with fries. Lovely idea. Was expected a patty but it was yakiniku Wagyu but I'm not complaining cos it was well done. Impressive. Just didn't like that fries served was only warm, likely fried and put aside for quite a while. Waffle and chicken wasn't that fantastic according to my lunch companion. But still, decent for sure. Wash it all down with a pint for a wonderful dining experience.

Celebrated Father’s Day here. Coming here to try the food because it’s recommended by danielfooddiary. The food is fantastic. We tried the otah bread, ice latte, croffle chicken & seafood pasta. Price wise is $20 ish per pax. Ambience is good too.
Pet friendly cafe in a quiet neighborhood. Quality of food is better than expected but selection range not wide- wish they have more desserts choices~

Had the mushroom linguine, mentaiko fries and spinach pasta. Enjoyed all of them. Portion size was good, mentaiko was very flavourful and had a torched flavour. Mushroom linguine had a generous amount of mushrooms and they were cooked well without too much of an earthy taste.

Could improve the acoustics in the restaurant though as there were not many people but it was very noisy. Good place to hold events but if it's so echoey it will not be conducive.

Do check out the well. It had a few dead leaves though. And the door to the back garden was locked.

Also there was a super smiley server, she was really cheerful, wish all servers were like her.

Good cafe, good choice of items/menu and friendly staff. Prices very acceptable for this area as well. We had the chicken croffles and the otah bruschetta, both tasted really good. Don't know what it is, but it's just missing the x-factor for a five star review.

Food is ok and environment is good. Nice outdoor place for people who wants to bring their pets over to chill.

This places serves western food. Can get pretty crowded and noisy during dinner times.

A little far from MRT, but this place is worth the distance.

Will definitely come back here for more next time!
Food is very yummy, and place is very bright and roomy. The croffle and chicken was a big hit with everyone, and I loved the chicken burger as well.

C.C.B was my favourite dish! Head down to the cafe to find out what I mean 😉

Attracted to the amazing ambience of this cafe! I highly recommend all of you to have a sense of it too!

- Food; EXCELLENT!! ⭐️⭐️⭐️ The food display was exquisite, the food taste just as pleasant as how it looks (I took video instead of photos, cant post it)

- Chill outdoor; can bring your pet along, I saw one doggo 😍 (it’s open 24/7 according to one of the bosses)

- Cozy indoor; the furnishing of the cafe felt like I was in a HIGH END restaurant with affordable food, there are high chairs, sofas, and other different types of sitting to choose from (closes at 10-10.30pm)

Location: Pet friendly cafe located near a vet, a small park, catsmart, petlovers, and a nearby cafe to chill with your pooches after having a walk at lower pierce reservoir, ample parking.

Cafe: Came here a few times. Cafe is very spacious for small and big groups but price wise is a bit on the high side. I find a cup of cappuccino at $7 quite exp. Got the caramelized (coffee with a whip of caramel at $8). Food is acceptable & bug portion but not so fantastic. Service is very good, staff will immediately ask a choice of cold or warm water, and provide a water for the pooch too. We'll come back for small bites and some drinks.
Interesting place to dine at a hidden corner. It has a “secret” garden that’s quite cool too with mist timing. Food is nice and ambiance is cosy, clean and spacious. 👍🏼

The cafe is very Instagramable , it’s nice for chill out n photo n meeting up with friends , beer r very affordable price .
Owners r friendly couple
Chicken is too small portion size can be improved, maybe add more vege to make it feel more worth it , we prefer smth that is bigger portion. Coffee is a little bitter , can be improved.
The English breakfast cauliflower is not really fantastic, it will be better if u can change it to mash potatoes or sweet corn or potatoes salad . The bread is too thin n small it will be better if u guys can change to a thicker one . Taste wise is perfect . Like a 4 star restaurant. Thumbs up owner .

Nice and spacious cafe in the quiet Sembawang Hills with friendly staff. Seems to be pet-friendly with many customers with dogs out front.

Had typical cafe food with some interesting twists e.g. Nacho Cheese on Wagyu Burger, Rose Matcha Latte. However feels slightly pricy, even for a cafe, (~$20), especially if you order cmmon cafe food

Would recommend to try if you're in the area, and get the more special foods on the menu (like Otah Bruschetta) instead of things like the typical American Breakfast set.
Spacious restaurant with a modern deco. Attentive and prompt service. Good food.with little pleasant surprises.

Pet-friendly place. I wouldn’t say it’s fantastic or novel but I tried it because of the good reviews. The otah bruschetta was thin and laid on top of a slice white bread. It’s quite hard to cut and dry. In terms of spiciness and taste, I’ll rate it 2/5. In the end, i grab it with my hands and eat it. I don’t think it’ll order it again because it’s not worth $18 (add $2 for cheese topping). Coffee is so-so ($7 up)

Went on a Thursday evening and the space was quiet and serene! A lot of space between tables which made it a plus for an already dog friendly establishment. Service staff were attentive and responsive. Ordered three mains: Sakura ebi tagliatelle, seafood aglio olio and a small breakfast plate, found them all to be nice! Hot latte was also good! But apple crumble was very disappointing cos it was soft and mushy, hence minus one star!

The food is really good. Good ambience for a restaurant to be situated in an educational institution. I love the flavour of the food and one of the better orh nee yam paste dessert. Will go again. So good that we left nothing behind. The crab is not their best dish though. I will omit the crab. The sauce is good, the problem is the size of the crab. Not big enough. Opt for bigger size crab should solve the problem.

First time trying this place (or perhaps I’ve been here many years ago but can’t really recall). It’s located inside ITE at AMK and is really convenient for those who drive with its ample car park and location just off CTE.

The food is delicious and sizeable. The one dish that stood out was their Peking duck. It seemed like every other table ordered one when we were there. The fat and juicy skin was not lost when cut and well preserved.

It was very packed and full on the Saturday night when I went and I must say that you will definitely need to make reservation first. And oh, this is a family restaurant so it’ll be bound to be busy, noisy etc. Hence I’m surprised with some of the other comments about the noise - you want peace and quiet, please choose a fine dining restaurant or Angie’s where there’s a surcharge for noisy children 🤣

This restaurant is not the usual ones that you can find in shopping malls as it is actually located inside ITE College Central nearby nanyang polytechnic as well as Ang Mo Kio and Yio Chu Kang MRT. It is fairly accessible via buses as well because there is 1 bus stop just outside the campus.

The restaurant serves traditional kind of chinese style cuisine, the ones you will normally find at weddings, zhi char style and etc. On a weekday, they serve mainly the students and teachers at eh ite and during weekends, you can expect to see more members of the public patronising the restaurant. The interior looks very classic and it resembles alot like the traditional chine restaurant where I attended wedding as a small kid in the 90's era.

Food wise, nothing to should about. I think it's really pretty decent and average. The prices are definitely on the higher side as they are restaurant based. Some of the must try dishes includes perking duck, prawns and claypot tofu. The servers and staff are friendly and will accommodate to what you need. Top up of drinks, refilling of tea were also prompt.

Overall, it's a pretty good experience and I look forward to come back in the near future if I'm craving for perking duck. You can take a walk around the school after the meal as the campus is pretty huge and no students are there during weekends. There is also a sheng siong supermarket nearby so you can shop there before heading home.

The experience with the staff was not the most pleasant and same goes for the food . Set menus came with chilli crab that only consisted of 1 small crab and 4 mantous even for a table of 10 people . The food was average and nothing to praise , for the shellfood like abalone , it was overcooked and super rubbery according to my family members . There is indeed a need for improvement in the cooking preparations and taste .
Decent Chinese restaurant hidden within AMK ITE. Good location for a family gathering. Food wise was normal, nothing much to rave about. Prices was affordable. Service was good.

Excellent service form the crew, especially the restaurant lady manager.

Highly customer focus, provides good recommendation and very attentive to customer needs.

Great Cantonese food with good promotions, on top of that you get a 155 discount!

The Ireland peking duck is stunning, juicy, plump and delicious. It is succulent, very tender and nicely de-skinned by the staff right in front of you, perfectly wrapped in the serving skin with a nice sauce.

Shark's fin was excellent with this promotional price, served piping hot, HUGE piece of whole fin. The broth is so tasty, topped with bean sprouts

Wasabi prawns is good, could be better if the wasabi flavour be more pronounced, that's purely personal as some people may not be able to take the heat

Char siew and roast pork are to die for! good layers of fat for the char siew and roast pork flavour is good with a crispy skin

Overall dishes looks good. Been there twice already and making plans for the 3rd visit.

To the crew and chef, keep it UP. It's a good restaurant that bothers to keep their image and service, under any circumstances.

Another ordinary Chinese restaurant but with commendable customer service. Perfect Peking duck should be sliced thinly with nearly no meat sticking on the skin. Whereas, what they serve is just the opposite☹️. The rest of the food is just fine.. 🙂 #msgreedysis #greedybuddiez
Nice ambience and kind, proactive staffs. The peking duck and yam ring were delicious. We had a great meal.
Tried the Ireland Peking Duck. Very good. Promotion $58. Usually price $88. Worth it. Ireland duck bigger and more juicy than the normal duck.
Quiet place so can avoid crowds and yet have Chinese food. Came on public holiday during lunch. There are promotion & unique dishes too.

Staff was friendly and attentive. I was the second customer in the restaurant so the food was served very fast. Alice who served my table was prompt with request a humble hard working staff. Peking duck was roasted skilfully. The skin was light and fluffy but the meat marination was not good enough some part of it we can still taste a gamy smell. Spring onion and cucumber was a little dry. No presentation the wrap was all stack up in a pile served on a side plate $40 standard I can’t complain. The prawn cake was nice and crispy. The hot and sour soup and braised shark fin soup was both very starchy can’t taste much of the soup base. Green veg was decent. The worst is their signature deep fried honey coated mushroom. Full of flour! Wonder where the mushroom go? The credit and saviour of the dinner is their O NEEE.... the yam paste dessert. Smooth... melt in your mouth. Will be back there again for Chinese New Year eve dinner hope the festive dishes will be more appealing and appetising.

We booked several tables for an event and ordered the food well before hand. We were at the restaurant at 6.30pm. At 9.00pm, some of the dishes are still not served. Food too too long to arrive. Best to skip this place if you want to host a successful dinner event. Food is nice, but just not worth the time and effort.

Significant improvement on the food comparing to my first visit. Was thinking of holding more again but the service from the service crew greatly discourage me from going again. I do not understand why, is it because we did not order as per advise from the male captain? First Culinary, I supposed your response is highly appreciated. Hope to hear from you soon.

Food is good. Services needs to improve.
The crispy pork is a must try. Shark fins come in huge portion. The others are so so. The service needs to improve. Many aunties working. Never ask before changing the plates, after changing the plate. Even dare to wipe the fingers on our wipes.

A pleasant find in Ang Mo Kio area, which had a quiet environment for group meals. Service is good and fairly fast. Chinese dishes are generally tasty. Their signature duck is good, especially the Peking duck. Enjoyed the vegetable dishes, which weren't oily nor laden with monosodium glutamate. Doesn't leave you feeling thirsty after the meal.
Food here is consistently good. Service staff is commendable too.

I'm surprised. Food is good. The duck, salted egg yoke prawn, yam dessert... all good. 6 x fresh steam scallop only $18.

I will return.
Good value. Lobster and sharks fin on promo is of decent size. Taste wise not the best but better than many mid range restaurants.

Celebrated my sister's birthday there. A total of 5 pax dining. Total about s$230+.

We ordered Peking duck, duck meat fried noodle, salted egg prawns, claypot eggplant, pork ribs, double boiled black garlic chicken soup, 3 orh nee-pumpkin dessert and 1xue er dessert and 1 mango pomelo dessert.

My mum particularly loved the Peking duck, orh nee dessert and the claypot brinja.  I like the double boiled soup.

Nice ambience and a waitress assigned to us was a very polite Malaysian lady. Her service was excellent.  The food is quite good.  I like it that it was not too crowded and we had a very attentive waitress who served us well. Will go back for the 10pax set menu in the near future. Worth a try !

Ordered the items online for self-collect. Was worried about quantity so I called beforehand to ask and the staff was very kind to review my order and advise. I was updated about the order status promptly and order was available on time.  Food portion is generous and the passion fruit prawn, salted egg ribs and fish fillet with kailan were crowd favorite! Will skip the sweet and sour mushroom next time as the flour coating was too thick but overall very pleased with the tasty meal and the pleasant experience! Thumbs up! Will revisit soon :)

I love the food here and the quiet cosy ambience. My then fiance randomly searched for a nearby venue for our wedding lunch reception and found this place. We have dined here several times and always good.

55 Minutes to Serve Fried Rice

Off all the order which was served within 20-30 minutes, It took 55 minites and 4 request to expedite our order for Vegetarian Fried Rice.

While the other dishes were served, timely, it got so cold since it had to eaten along with fried rice.

Restaurant was occupied at about 60% only and 55 minutes to serve fried rice was to stretched.

Date of Visit 13-Sep, around 12:10.

For the pricing of this restaurant, the food is definitely not up to the mark.  There are many more better Teochew restaurants in town, that charge the same price, but serve much better quality food.  Do not bother to try.
Excellent restaurant situated in ITE Ang Mo Kio. Dishes are exquisitely prepared. Must go and try. Their pu er tea is super special mixed with glutinous rice. Lobsters are really something!

Ambience was good.  Ordered 4 dishes for a family of 3.  Prawn pancake and the hor fun were good but have to eat it while it is hot.  Poarched chicken was normal and egg plant was too oily.  Overall rating was above normal.  Price a little steep.

Ordered the promo chilli crab & Peking duck. Both are nice but have to top up $15 to fry the duck meat with Ee Fu noodles, the fried noodle is little too salty.
The salted egg prawns are very dry and not creamy.
If there is no promotion, food items are considered pricey as the serving portions are small.
Good food good service at reasonable prices. Set meals are a good deal with good spread of nice food.

Honestly a hidden gem! Food items on the menu are pretty pricey but they always have promotion on Special dishes like Peking Duck, chilli crabs which make the visit a fairly sweet deal. I love the KL-styled char siew and Peking duck. Definitely worth a try!
Very good quality food cooked in traditional taste and decent service. Only downside is that food would be considered to be on the salty side, and price is on the pricey side

Went there for lunch during one of the weekend. Food is nice, service is good, place is clean. A little bit on the costly but overall I will still recommend this place.

My personal liking goes to the bittergound bee hoon and the oyster mee sua.

The signature sio bak was good, being crispy and a little chewy with a good lean to fat ratio.  At $15, it was a little on the pricey side.

We also liked the chai poh Teochew hor fun, which had wok hei.  The manageress recommended we try the steamed scallop dumplings with roe, but we found them on the fishy side, similar to the siew mai.

The fried radish cakes were okay, but the egg tarts were good.

Ambience and service were okay.

If you are looking for authentic Cantonese dishes, this is one restaurant that you would want to be in your list to check out. I use of my own photo and some from their site as the dishes was eaten too fast by my family. Love their roasted crispy pork! It's really awesome, must order! We order the longevity bun in advance as we are celebrating our mother's birthday. Which is better than those i had as theirs are handmade with nice warm, not so sweet pure lotus paste. Well, i could go on for more but go try it yourself. Oh! last thing, portion are big if you order medium like me.
Ordered peking duck and chilli crab for delivery. Both taste good. Crab very fresh, full of meat. Must try. Free delivery charge for order above 80.

Food were decently nice. Ambience like a typical Chinese restaurant. Prices soso, but cheap if presented the ite alumni card.

We had my dad birthday dinner at first culinary.  Had notably memorable kl style char siew, Peking duck (duck from Ireland). The rest were normal chinese restaurant food. No complaints.

Went on a weekday evening. Not much crowd.

If travel by public transport, not the most easy. Have to take bus to reach to destination.
Very good service, food was very good too. Surprise food gem at ITE College Central.

First visit, wasn't expecting much due to the lack of reviews, however was shock by the amazing experience. Fish is very fresh and this dish is super delicious😋😋 other dishes that we ordered surpass our expectations as well😁😁
It was a bit hard to navigate around when inside the ITE but other than that it was quite a pleasant experience! Love the char siew and sio bar. Very cosy restaurant, suitable for family dinner!
Spacious, comfortable and good ambience restaurant located in the ITE! Good customer service and friendly staff, recommend us a lot of signature dishes! Highly recommended!!

I liked this restaurant for the good food.  They are very well prepared and delicious.  However,  when I was there with my family 2 weeks ago,  it was super crowded and noisy.  Too many families having birthday celebrations and moving around making it hard to hold our conversations.
Good Chinese restaurant quality food at reasonable prices. Nice ambience - quieter, less hectic. Suggest for you to make reservation first before heading down especially for bigger groups.

Food is ok and reasonably priced, but service needs much improvement. Service staff Amy portioned our food out of our sight behind a pillar, so we don't even know if she indeed served us all the fish or all the noodles or all the orh nee etc.

She also ignored our feedback that our dishes were not served in the order we'd like. Noodles were ready as the 5th course when it should have been the 7th. We told her about it, she acknowledged and read out the remaining courses from our ordering chit and brought the big plate of noodles away so we thought she served it to another table. But turns out she just brought it behind the pillar to portion it out for all of us.

Also, a few staff served us at least 2 rounds of diluted-until-cannot tea until we asked to change the tea bag. Did they not see that the liquid they were pouring into our cups was clear and not at all brown?

And not sure what the staff were rushing for since we left about 30min to closing so it can't be for a next seating...my sister's plate and cutlery were cleared just as soon as she bit into a piece of pork, she didn't even have the chance to use her chopsticks to shift the meat to a more comfortable position in her mouth because the chopsticks were already gone as soon as she put them down on her plate.

Ordered their set dinner for 5 pax. The first half of the dishes are nice. However, the last 3 dishes were overly salty, the veg, the brocoli and the noodle with duck. All five of us found it too salty. We paid closed to $500, for this price, there are much better restaurant out there. Service is above average.
Nice Chinese food in neighbourhood area. Always crowded during weekends. Located in ITE Central.
Went there for chinese new year and the food was excellent. Especially the carb noodles. The pork was crispy and tender
The foods here are always the best and it at a reasonable price. Service are excellent

The service is excellent. Truly appreciate that the staff keep refilling the tea in our glass. The fish is fresh. Food is delicious. The roasted meat is nice but slightly hard. I have a wonderful lunch time. Thank you!
Awesome service and sweet crew who gifted my daddy longevity peaches for his birthday. They even made it fresh cos they ran out of it. Thank you!!!
Surprised to find an interesting cantonese restaurant in ITE, that serves pretty good food and reasonably priced too 👍😋

Really wonderful food to satisfy even the sharpest of tongues in my family.
I tried almost everything on the menu already and can say..... I'll be back as everything is very well done.
Best part is..... the pricing is so fair and it's a wonder they are not yet on Michelin or Bill Gourmand.... keep up the standard

Chanced upon it at ITE Central, during the open house today. The waitresses were professional in noting my mum's allergies, and were polite. The dishes were presented beautifully, and the food was great. Wouldn't mind coming back again.

Service was attentive and thoughtful. Staff were very accommodating and fulfilled our request to change to another table (although only after a second request) even though they were very busy. Drinks were topped up promptly. But do take note that there is an interesting charge of $2.50 per head even if you do not drink tea, eat the peanuts or use the wet towels. Food was good but not spectacular.

Went on a Saturday afternoon and it was very quiet, which we appreciated. We ordered the 6-pax course meal and really enjoyed the food. It was yummy, and the food was all served in a timely manner right after one another. Will definitely come back again soon!

Followed Thomson East Coast Line MRT Train ads and found this restaurant.

For 5 pax we ordered
Lo Hei with Salmon
Crispy skin chicken
Yam Ring with scallops
Stir fried Vegi
Braised Pork with bun (Chinese hamburger)
Mango Purée Sago

Overall experience: Priceless. Dishes all taste good.

Very old school restaurant. Came here for the first time with fres. Reminds of fragrant garden in Upper Serangoon and chin lee in bedok. Overall dishes were OK, in particular the chicken was well roasted.

Founded in 1975 by Oh Joo Chong as a catering business, Gim Tim Restaurant opened its flagship outlet in 1989 in 157 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 4, where it remains to this day.
.
For over 33 years, Gim Tim Restaurant has positioned itself as a Modern Chinese mid-range dining experience, and it still draws in the crowds especially on weekends. Reservations therefore, are a must.
.
Ambience at Gim Tim Restaurant is modern classy, with a touch of sophistication. The air-conditioned interior is flanked by glass windows offering a view of the quiet estate, while warm lighting casts a soft glow over the white clothed tables and cushioned high back chairs.
.
A small chandelier gleams at the ceiling entrance, lending an air of elegant luxury. The exterior al-fresco seating is sheltered and just as comfortable, with a serving table at center stage.
.
Service at Gim Tim Restaurant is affable and attentive. The mature staff engage guests in jovial lighthearted banter, yet work efficiently at taking orders, fulfilling requests, and clean up quickly when diners leave.
.
Sometimes, they proactively ask to clear finished plates and top up drinks. Staff demonstrate good product knowledge and offer astute recommendations.
.
Food at Gim Tim Restaurant is Modern Chinese cuisine, centered around Hokkien, Cantonese, and Teochew cuisines. Chef Lai Yong Meng draws on the best techniques honed over the years, and with fresh premium ingredients, each dish is a delight.
.
Popular award-winning favourites and unique signature house creations feature on their extensive menu. Portions are sized for communal group sharing. Prices are mid-range for a restaurant, budget about SGD $62 per person.

First time trying this place on a weekday dinner. No queue. Was invited to join an extended family gathering dinner. Did not managed to take many pictures because was busy entertaining people. Parking is easy. The place is renovated like the environment for wedding dinner. Food and price are decent but I dont like the fish maw soup. Prompt customer service, friendly staff. Worth trying this place with family.

Love the traditional variety type of Chinese food here. The roast duck and chicken were crispy and well done as usual. The cold combination dish was great too! The sliced garoupa fish dish turned out fresh and flavourful, the way I love it! My fave must be the braised tofu with tau kee as it was superbly done with broth that was not too starchy, just right and really tasty!

Standard of food dropped significantly from the first few times of our patronising before CB period; service was decent but the food does not justify the value of food paid for. Very disappointing.

As requested by owner, purely on personal taste buds and opinion:-

1) 金龙鸡 (chicken with sotong paste): there was hardly any sotong paste it’s just deep fried skin with sauce. On previous occasions you could clearly see distinct paste filling. If it were for cost cutting measures, please do so without compromising the dish.

2) 菠菜(vegetable): the vegetables tasted tough to the teeth were slightly salty and did not appear as fragrant as before. Overall, was tougher to ingest and can be improved.

3) lobster with boiled rice: the lobster meat appeared dull and stuck to the shell and did not appear as fresh. The soup was slightly fishy to the taste buds.

4) hae chor: the fillings were less crunchy and not as well done, it was previously very well fried and crispy, but on this occasion it was barely so.

5) braised pork bun: the braised pork were tougher to the bite, but overall decent, save for the bigger portions of fatty meat.

have ordered a couple of rice dumplings with abalone, unfortunately the nice pyramid packaging was run out.😪

it was peppery but it was big with lots of different ingredients and it tasted great overall!  recommended!  shall buy more next year!! 😋

All dishes are pretty decent except for the scallop. The scallop dish was cold and the scallop not fresh at all. Service wise was not up to standard. Waitress tonality towards answering customer questions was bad. she does answer question but her tonality would need to be improved as she somewhat seem to brush customer off.

Satisfied - Happy and pleased with the delivery and quality of the food. I ordered a mini buffet service. Food was warm and well-packed when delivered. Drinks and cutlery were provided. The sauce for the fried fish was seperate to prevent the fish from getting soggy. Portion size was sufficient for 10 pax.

Dissapointed with the lack of followup service.
Called them on Friday night to enquire about the mini buffet service but did not receive any updates from them even though they say they will send me a WhatsApp message. Have to call them again later and the person told me to make an online order.

Meanwhile I would like to thank staff Xin Yun for assisting me with change of delivery timing when I called Gimtim on Saturday evening. 👍

Other than the lack of followup service, I would highly recommend others to use their online system to place order for mini buffet. It's well-worth the money.

Food's delicious! Their signature duck and pork in the bun is amazingly good. The rest of the food that we ordered were good as well, but it was the duck that melted in my mouth and keeps me dreaming of the next time I go back.

I think they served an extra appetiser (fried fish skin) that was crisp, tasty, but still light.

We were seated all the way in a corner, so, sometimes it was hard to signal to the wait staff, but otherwise, food is great. I think the external seating is just for the Lunar New Year festivities, as it doesn't look permanent.
Attended a wedding dinner here and I enjoyed the entire night. Food is good. Service is nice. I don’t feel like being rushed. And my wine is always filled without me noticing it. Jia You!
Tasty food. Reasonable prices. Decor is pretty plain but compensated by the quality of the food
Went there to have reunion dinner. The restaurant is located at the HDB block. Decent food, good service. Paid $468++ for a table of 8. Considered slightly expensive.

Impressed with the food and service provided. The food was decently priced and delicious. Highly recommend the coffee pork ribs and the traditional spicy tapioca rolls. The staff were friendly and attentive as well even though we came at 8pm.

Restaurant seems to not be able to handle the crowd after ease of dining measures. Called ahead for a reservation and booked for 4. We approached the staff to confirm attendance and “enjoyably” waited for 46 mins (20 upon 20 mins and more), paying for carpark to enjoy the “majestic view” of staff serving tables for customers waiting after mine. They also kindly advised that we will only be able to get our seats after tables have enjoyed their dessert (an estimated additional 20 mins). Went before the easing of measures and food and service was still good. As for now, kindly reserve and enjoy at your own risk.
We celebrated Mother's Day at Gim Tim and my parents enjoyed the meal! Food is good and the charges are reasonable.
Extremely slow service, food took over 30 mins to come, food quality sub par. Staff rude and restaurant is unable to handle a crowd. Will not recommend to others.
Great hokkien/ Cantonese dishes for family gathering. Good service. Outdoor tables available with wheelchairs access
Came on a Sunday, preparation of food was really slow (due to the crowd) remember to make a booking before coming for air conditioned table. Overall food quality was mediocre.
Used to be good food here! Standard has dropped a lot and they skimed on the ingredients. Not worth a visit anymore.
Food is not bad. But we waited very Long for the next dish to arrive. Like 20 minutes?
One of my all time favourite restaurant. Really good food at very reasonable prices. The helpings are generous and everyone in the family loves the food!

Casual Chinese restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating. Serves all the classic dishes like fried noodles /rice, stir fries, braised dishes, seafood, etc. Their house made tofu, whole roast chicken, yam basket, and braised pork buns are worth trying. There is a clean toilet for customers as well. Can be crowded on weekends (pre-covid), so work booking a table ahead.
Remind me of the old days.
Nice food, reasonable price
Ordered delivery for Mother's Day. Delivery was prompt and the food were yummy! The standouts were the Kong Bah Bao and Fried Prawn with Pumpkin Cream!
Don't understand the hype at all. Food was average. In fact it was way below average. The other 4 or 5 stars reviews are probably paid reviews to deceive the public. Avoid at all cost.

Tea was added with lots of water, asked to change but said that it was like that, but ended up being able to serve much darker pu er. Pretty sure they served pu er they even said they added water because they were afraid we couldnt sleep at night 😇
Pai gu was really hard!!
worse on top of all these is that toufu which is the fastest to make was not even served after 2 reminders...as we see food on other tables streaming in.
WORSE DINING EXPERIENCE DID NOT FEEL SINCERE AND REMORSEFUL.
Good old brand that can be trusted for some authentic and good Chinese food. Been around since my grandparents time! Value for money
Wonderful dinning environment. Great service crews. After 2 years, it is as great as before.
Food was great! Repeated customers of this restaurant, always love to go back to try their dishes 🙌🏻

Bak Chang. Saw a writeup.
Called v early around 10am. Cust service was great and helpful. Ordered to collect.
Restaurant was busy at 11.30am when opened.
Staff pleasant. We split bills.

Back Chang with scallops was very good for the price point. Taste was v good. Not oily. Not jilark.

Will definitely buy again.

And will try to eat when circuit breaker is off

Do not ever book a wedding banquet with this restaurant. I booked a wedding banquet on November 2019 for my wedding to be held at Singapore Chinese Cultural Centre (SCCC) on December 2020. Due to the covid-19 situation, SCCC had refunded me the booking deposit for the venue. However, Gim Tim (the caterer) abide by their “non-refundable” deposit and forced us to use the deposit to invite our guests for a meal at their premises under a HDB void deck. As a wedding is a once in a lifetime event, and Gim Tim was reluctant to refund us with our deposit, we were forced to get our guests to their premises at Ang Mo Kio. I had since then swear on telling everyone I know of to not patron Gim Tim. My family and extended family will never ever visit or dine at Gim Tim ever again. Please think twice before you spend money in this restaurant. There are so many restaurants in Singapore and will you ever want to help a restaurant who behaves and acts in such a manner in difficult times?

The failure of including the longevity birthday bun (of great significance) for order of their celebration set. C'mon, how many of a 70s does a person have? Your terrible act has spoilt a birthday celebration!  A promised return call to be made by their supervisor took hours (claimed that they were very busy when I am told that the call will be made within the next hour) and it was near their wind down operation hours by then.   A slipshod reply "we might have gotten too busy and we have forgot to pack in the longevity bun. We offer free desert at your next visit" - is that your method of service recovery? Do you even see the point that you have ruined a celebration by missing out on the most important item?!  And the food was way too salty!

Do not order the Orh Ni (Yam paste coconut dessert) . The one we ordered was sour. Upon checking with the staff, they admit the ingredients were from nights before and prepared a new bowl. The chef even came out to stare at us angrily for no good reason. The new bowl have a stale vegetable oil smell. The rest of the dishes were ok and their service was mediocre. It was not priced to their standards. At the same price range we could've gone peach garden and avoided all this. They used to be good not now. Not that great.

Poor delivery service  as when the food arrived to our doorstep it was already cold.

The delivery was supposed to come from 11.30 pm to 12.30 pm but it only came at 1pm without the full order as it lacked the condiments like the sauce and cucumbers for the peking duck ( had to wait for another hour for it).My daughter had to rush off to work without having a Father's day meal together with the family because of the late and incomplete delivery.

The quality of the food was subpar to the standards provided when dining in.Quantity of the peking duck was so much more lesser compared to the one we had when we dined in at your restaurant and the crackers lost their crispiness.

Overall disappointed with the delivery and not worth ordering delivery again for such big occassion as our Father day's lunch was ruined and everyone was left frustrated after this late delivery.

January 24 Dinner.
If you want to come to this restaurant, please expect the following:

1. Air-con was not turned on prior to guest arrival. Guest have to remind them.
2. Dishes were served wrong and have to be reminded as well.
3. Interval of each dishes is 20 mins and food was cold when they arrived.
4. Demand payment when we are not even halfway through the dinner.

If you can meet the demands of the crowd, don't accept them in the first place. All the best to your business.

Ordered several dishes, if I recall about 6 dishes only. Each time a dish is served, the next takes 15 minutes. That’s fine, but what is totally disappointing is the lack of quality in our food. The crab was bitter and slimey and the meat was either too salty or underseasoned.

Rather than keep up a facade of a finer dining experience (interior and atmosphere really reminded of a wedding dinner), perhaps they should look into improving the quality of the food instead, just a suggestion.

Best Thing Here: Fried Fish Skin, Peanuts
Avoid: Everything Else

Been dining at this place occasionally for a few years now, generally the food is good and service staffs are prompt. During birthday cake cutting, they will blast the happy birthday song loudly, quite old school but fun anyway. Price is reasonable too. Location might be bit hard to find for first timers thou.

Food quality and standard dropped compare to 5 mths ago. We missed the golden crispy chicken hence returned for another visit. But we will disappointed with the dishes that were served (coffee pork rib = meat tough; canopy fried rice = overwhelmed tasteless stale rice). However, the red grouper steamed hkg style is great, fresh and tasty today.
Was impressed that they served very good food. But sadly the staff did not provide good service, which makes the overall experience slight bad. 4 stars for the food not service.
efficient service
Good food, great service... Even our children like the dishes we ordered.
Attentive staff and quite decent food
Service level is great!  Food tastes great! Located in hdb and may look humble from the outside but the Chinese food quality is definitely comparable or better than a five star hotel's restaurant.

I like the restaurant as the chef is famous in tv, he knows the ingredients and good skills  creates a gormet meal for people to enjoy. The atmosphere is casual and relax and enjoy. The mood and place is good for dinning. I will go again.

This is a warning for everyone. For the price that you pay here, you will get non-existent service and food that is worse than what you will get at hawker centre.

From the beginning, their service staff did not care about our needs; half their staff kept glancing at their watch and pretending to be busy. The seating was too close and uncomfortable. The tea was watered down. The sound system broke and was horribly managed.

The food is even worse. The roasted pork was partially uncooked on the inside, with the skin side being extremely tough and tasteless. The appetizers (lotus paste bun and other assortments) looked suspiciously like what I could buy from the FairPrice supermarket cheaply, and were poorly prepared.

The "sashimi" turned out to be cheap raw red grouper that was meant to be cooked in hot soup, which was merely a thin broth with some herbs and too many red dates. The pot's fully metal ladle was left in the boiling soup, scalding our attempts to get it out. In addition, the staff walked around with the burner lit dangerously close to our hair.

The spinach and vegetables set was tough, cooked in a pot of overly salted water using cheap fried anchovies. To add insult to injury, when I brought champagne there, the staff did not care to ensure it was chilled.

The exterior of the restaurant was dirty and wet with what looked like the tossed out leftovers of food. If you are going there, wearing shorts and cheap sandals will be a suitable choice.

All in all, the price you pay at this restaurant ensures you obtain bad service, badly cooked food, and an extremely uncomfortable dining experience. For the same price, you can dine for far better at Imperial Treasures, or a classy Japanese restaurant, or even a well-run restaurant.

You have been warned.

Reserved two tables for tonight dinner.
Meal serve was a bit slow due to lack of manpower, but the dishes were delicious.
May want to come again & try the peking duck.

overall the good quality is good, just that the portion is rather small. didn't expect the noodle quality is so little, tho the taste of the pork noodle is rather yummy. 生煎包， 小笼包， 南瓜饼& spring rolls are all very good. can skip the 酒酿，the taste is rather mild. the chrysanthemum tea is chargeable, $2.40 per jug, not FOC as commented by other reviews.

Quaint little authentic store below a HDB. Not very accessible by public transport. Bosses and chef are Shanghainese. Do give them a call before coming to make reservations as the crowd is very unpredictable to prevent disappointment 🥲

Flavours wise everything is freaking amazing. 🤩

Would HIGHLY RECOMMEND the vegetable spring rolls and pan fried buns. Would say portion wise is really small. But it's good enough not to over eat. Average cost per dish is $6.

Complimentary homemade Chinese chrysanthemum tea w no sugar inside in a huge flask 😍 really feels so homey I love it 🥰

This is a small family restaurant with 3 staff only. Always make reservation before you head to the restaurant as there are limited seats. A cozy place where you can get authentic Shanghainese foods. We recommend fried bun 生煎包 and spring roll 春卷.

Food tastes good. Price is cheap. This is a small family restaurant with 3 persons only. That might be why some people reviewed abt service. Coz they don’t have a lot manpower. But they also don’t charge 19%.  And the auntie boss is friendly.  So in general worth revisiting.

Small little restaurant in Ang Mo Kio which has been around for Many years. Home cooked styled Shanghainese food. Simple yet authentic taste. Owners are from
Shanghai who has settled in Singapore for many years. High standard food with reasonable price. Totally worth a try !

Authentic Shanghainess dishes. Must try... shanghai Xiao long bao, Sheng Jian bao and the Popiah ( abit oily). Dishes portion not big we ordered 10 dishes, just right for 3 adults, 1 teenager and a kid. Recommend to make reservation as the place is not big.

Generally very very oily food; standard has dropped a lot.

The beef soup noodles- in the menu pic, the beef portions look ‘substantial or decent portions’ but when it came, it only had three skillet pieces!!!  And it was not cheap!!

The dried ‘spring rolls’ were gooey, which I understand that’s their norm but it was incredibly oily.

Personally the steamed dumplings skin was a bit on the thick side.

Oh yea the deep fried tau sar pau was truly truly oily and the tau sar portions were so pathetic… and did I say oily ?
As was the deep fried dumplings…. Both had thick portions of skin.

😖😖

Beef noodle with very tiny beef
cannot believe there is no spring onion for 葱油面 & fried buns 🥲
Maybe the dumplings & spring roll are the best, but I won’t come again.
you may avoid ordering noodles.

This is a very nice 4.5 star lunch spot for some cozy family style non-pretentious Shanghainese fare. The popular dish seemed to be the Shanghai fried buns, but although the meat and soup inside was flavorful, I find the dough a little too soft - had better versions of this elsewhere. The star of the show was surprisingly the fried egg with yellow chives. It doesn't look like much, but the egg was fluffy with many layers, full of umami and the earthiness of the yellow chives just gave it that perfect bite. The other surprise was the stir fried french beans - not oily at all, each bite juicy with a spicy kick. The chicken noodles were springy and nice, and the xiao long baos were okay. Would be back to taste the rest of the dishes. Packed on a wednesday afternoon for lunch. Note, they only accept cash - and call to reserve in advance.

Cozy place where you can get authentic Shanghainese food!

梅菜扣肉包($2.50 each), 春卷 ($6) and 醉鸡 ($10) are must try on the menu! 梅菜扣肉 was nicely done, the pork belly was really soft and tender. Dip the fluffy bun into the sauce for a greater gastronomical experience! The crispy 春卷 and its flavourful filling goes perfectly well with vinegar. 醉鸡 was very juicy and there’s a lightly gelatinous feel to it. You can taste the booziness of the 花雕酒, definitely better than DTF’s version!

We pre-ordered 生煎包 ($6) when making our reservation. Bite with caution as the scalding soup bursts right through the bun. My family loved it but I guess I just don’t enjoy pan fried buns that much.

We also tried 上海小馄饨 ($3.50), my to-go breakfast when I’m in Shanghai. I absolutely loved it, even though it’s just wanton soup to most people.

小笼包($6), a tad bit saltier than DTF’s, but more flavourful with a more chewy skin. I liked it and thought it was better than DTF’s, albeit sadly, there’s no ginger slices to go with it.

Ended the dinner with 南瓜饼 ($2.50 each) and 酒酿丸子($3). Loved the chewy 南瓜饼 that had red bean fillings.

酒酿丸子 really fell short of expectations, cos my grandma used to make this at home. The glutinous rice ball was great (I love all mochis) but the rice wine was too diluted hence resulting in a watery rice wine soup. Could be better if it were more starchy and add more rice wine.

Overall still a great dinner and I’ll be back to try the noodles next time!
Authentic and quality foods. The taste of almost every dish is so "surprisingly" good. Not a huge portion per dish, price is reasonable with such standard.  Small stall probably family biz.

A small restaurant with a very limited menu. Run by a very prideful chef . They dun serve chilli and vinegar will only be given occasionally. Recommended will be 梅菜扣肉 Braised Sliced Pork Belly with Preserved Mustard Vege . Pork belly braised till  the fat and skin are gelatinous, soft, and melt easily in the mouth, the sauce is sweet and fairly sticky unfortunately this restaurant dun serve rice. The pork rib noodle was nice but a little blend. French bean was crispy and spicy. The popiah was something different from our local , filled with cabbage pork in a sticky savoury sauce. The chicken was heavily over dose with wine. The dessert on the other hand lack of wine taste. Their dish is more to the sweet note. Their dumpling skin was rather thick not my cup of tea .

5pax lunch at 上海人家 on 16.8.2022

quite below expectations from watching dr leslie tay video

kong bak pao was ok quite flavourful braise pork

生煎包below expectations not enough soup & quite hard

小笼包was better meat & soup very tasty but the second piece much better than the first so some problems with consistency

pork fritters was nice

did not have 醉鸡

spring roll turn out to be the best dish..very sweet tasty fillings very crispy skin and tender fillings

egg was good too not sure worth $10.75

the 2 handmade noodles were good the
braised beef better than pork👍🏻

overall nothing great & quite expensive S$93 for the type of food we had

I seldom post food reviews but I decide to make this my first food review because it was such a bad experience that I hope more people will know about this before visiting this restaurant.

We decided to try this restaurant recommended by ieatipostishoot. Celebrating my wife's birthday, we dined in with a large family but items offered on the menu were mostly "appetiser" size and the mains option were only beef noodles and pork chop noodles serving portion for 1 pax, there are no large family size servings options.

When we arrived the staff was rude and asked to shift our seats to make way for their robot server when our seats were already very cramp together.

The portion of dishes were pathetically small and expensive.

Braised pork slices with bun were very thinly sliced.

The Pork Chop noodle taste like dry instant noodle.

The beef noodle only have 3 small piece of meat. Definitely not worth $10 per bowl.

Fried Spring rolls were very very oily.

Steam Xiao Long Bao is quite nice and juicy but no ginger served with vinegar sauce.

No chilli sauce serve in this restaurant.

Not long after our meal we were asked to settle our bill and leave because there was another later reservation.

Overall very poor food quality and poor customer service experience for our family.

Definitely won't go back there again.
Food is pretty authentic. This is comment from my Shanghainess friend. Menu have limit dishes. Dish serve quite fast, their handmade noodle is a thumb up :)

Authentic Shanghai food. The menu is rather limited and a bit hit and miss over all. Some dishes are good, e.g. small wonton, yellow chive fried egg, others are pan fried Pao, scallion oil noodle are just so so.

2 small gripes, cash only and don't have white rice (yep, not typo, it's a Chinese restaurant that does not let you order white rice)

Portion very small.
Love the spring roll, noodle and crispy pork.
Need to call and reserve

Have been to this cosy and authentic Shanghainese restaurant for many years.

They have a small menu but everything on it is worth the space in your stomach. The 生煎包 takes about 25mins from preparation to table so be sure to order in advance so the boss can time it to your arrival.

It’s a very cosy sitting of 7 tables so I never take chances with walk-ins. Always make reservations.

Definitely value for money authentic food!

Nice little place tucked away in a housing estate. Quite popular given the queue before opening hours. Food prices are very reasonable and portions are acceptable for the price. Taste wise, very home cooked feel. The fried spring rolls had a unique ‘wet’ style filling. The Shen Jian Bao really quite nice.

It's OK but really nowhere close to nice or a place I'll visit again.

Place - this place is very small with around 4 tables, each table can sit 2-3 comfortably or squeeze 4 to 5 pax but not recommended. Looks relatively dated, nothing to look forward with nice or decent ambiance for the likes of mini restaurant.

Food - nothing to look forward, noodles are just cooked with some sauce, nothing flavourful. Xiao long bao is worse than those you ordered at kopitiam.

Price - fairly affordable considering its a mini restaurant below public housing HDB, nowhere close to any amenities. Do note they accept Cash only, no cards or QR payments.

Overall I'll give a modestly 3 stars it's OK. But it's a place I'll never want to visit again.

I hv to say the boss is friendly n attentive. The restaurant is small n a little warm. The food is okie. If u r staying ard tt area ya I think it’s a good place to go if u r craving for Xiao long Bao.

First visit. Lucky we made reservation beforehand as the place is small.
Food is very tasty and authentic! 3 person bill came to $48.60.
If you love variety then this is great as you get to try a lot as the portions are small.
Personally I like the wanton which is so smooth and its served in chicken soup. The chicken mushroom noodle and pan fried buns are fantastic along with the pumpkin pancake which is my partner's fav.  Not easily available elsewhere. Great way to end the meal.
XLB is the least of favourite as there is barely much filling or soup in it but it is still very very tasty.

It's a small family restaurant serving authentic Shanghai dishes.  Knew the restaurant since it was first established at Upper Thomson Road more than 10 years ago!

The owner is very friendly and very passionate about his food.  He came  to Singapore to work as a professional when Singapore and China established a formal foreign relationship.

All the dishes served are awesome and reasonably priced. If you have been eating 小笼包，生煎包，醉鸡 from other restaurant chains, I would recommend you to try this place for a different experience!

Surprisingly better than those found in the Chinatown.
Authentic Shanghainese food.
Authentic Shanghai Family style dishes. Must try in AMK
Mainly Shanghai dumplings ( steam and pan fried ). Stir fried vegetables is delicious but the noodles is a bit sweet.

Small family restaurant with a limited menu but we loved everything we had! They only have 8 tables and only do two sittings per mealtime so definitely make a reservation. High quality food at friendly prices; you can really taste the love and care put into every single dish - the xiao long baos are freshly made upon order so expect to wait a little.

You'll only have one chance to order so I suggest to order more than you think is enough ;)

Delicious authentic Shanghainese food in a small family business tucked away at a quiet corner in amk. The XLB is comparable or even better than DTF's. The chef takes pride in his food and does not allow customers to takeaway food which will not taste as good if taken out. Advisable to call to book before visiting as the restaurant only has ard 6 tables.

A small authentic Shanghai eatery located in an housing estate. It has 7 tables so definitively you need to made an reservations.
If you looking for dumplings, then you will be disappointed as they stop serving due to time constraints.
They have limited items but it is tasty. I would highly recommend Braised Pork Bun. The bun is flavorful, pork is thinly slice and the salted vegetable is slightly sweet and not salty at all. Xiao Long Bao taste is different from others.
Food potion is small so if you are a big eater do order double.

Though limited menu, the food here is good. The 梅菜扣肉 with steam bun is particularly good. Simply heavenly.

Almost few places left that you can get a nice and decent 生煎 these days.

The homemade noodles were also nicely done.

I'll be back for 梅菜扣肉 soon.

This is a small humble stand alone restaurant under the void decks of a HDB flat. There are hardly more than 8 tables in there and do be sure to call and make a reservation before heading down. They are almost certain to be fully packed everytime i go over without a reservation. They serve really solid la mian, xiao long baos and sheng jian baos (favourite). For a small restaurant, i think the items in the menu is just sufficient for them to run the store efficiently without giving much choices to diners.

in my opinion, i love the XLBs here more than other stores. Only issue with the XLB here is that the skin have not achieve the standard of DTF type. But i feel that the meat and soup within is better than DTF which makes it a must visit place for me. The sheng jian bao here is well done, not oily and the stuffing is very season and marinated.

Definitely will be back to visit.

This is my first time commenting. Please don't visit this restaurant.

They don't serve rice, no ginger for 小笼包, vinegar is diluted. The 罗汉寨 which costs $10 is canned button mushrooms in a watery gravy. 茭白炒肉丝 has no 肉丝. 1 dish didn't arrive. All the meat is canned. 小笼包 and 生煎包 tasted frozen. And I haven't even mentioned the lacking service.

The waitresses were also quarreling in the background when we were paying (only cash is allowed). Everything is bad, from the service to the food to the portion to the price. Will never come back ever again.

The menu selection here is pretty limited but having patronised many times over the past three years, I'm still happy with whatever they serve =) Xiao long bao is really nice, as well as the crispy pork strips. Love their beef soup noodles too.

As for service, it's a hit and miss depending on how busy they are. Yesterday when I was there some lady in the kitchen was scolding someone else at the top of her lungs for a good 30mins stretch, so if you can enjoy good food and block out tension vibes it's totally worth it! (= Remember to call and reserve a table to avoid disappointment!

Pricey due to its small portions, menu is also very very limited (so tried most of the dishes). Their best dish was the fried spring roll which brought out the sweetness of the cabbage and was served piping hot and crispy. One wrong order was we wanted stirfry wild yam but came egg with chives which was nice. Not a fan of the mei Cai kou rou ( the taste and pork abit dry) but the lotus bun had very fine texture. Noodles texture was good, taste of the chicken one is better than the pork as the 2nd was abit bland. The braised beef noodle broth is very tomataey.The pan fried bao bottom was overdone so was too hard but filling was good. Wantons are just ok. The stir fry french beans looked so pathetic with small portions and just pure bean. XLB is not too good, felt that the wrapper was too chewy and the filling too little to taste. Overall was disappointing meal and money could have been better spent on zichar.

This block 151 is a interesting place that provides good food like Kowloon dim sum and soi 19. This shanghai place which is at the opp end of the block from the coffee shop serves really good food. We ordered, xiao long pau and 2 noodles and it was really good. Will definately be back but we need to come only when we have 1.5hr as the wait can be pretty long during lunch time.

Here is my honest review useful to you:
I visited for the first time with much apprehension. I read the recent reviews of this place, and was quite afraid that the bad reviews were true. I felt uncertain but decided to take the risk at the end.

I booked in advance for a table, and I pre-ordered the famous Sheng Jian Bao (basically Xiao Long Bao but fried).

I entered the shop to a welcoming boss. Seated, and looked at the menu. The menu is very limited especially for a China mainland-hailing restaurant. These types useually have very large menus.

This is my opinion regarding the limited menu. I actually like it because it tends towards quality dining, fine dining. What do I mean? Simple, the harder it is to make dishes, the more effort it takes, the smaller the menu offered by the chef. Commonsense. So, I hope none of you ugly customers criticise them for this point. Menu is limited, but so what? Every dish is lovingly made. Many dishes are handmade.

I ordered quite a number of different dishes. Probably about 25% of the entire menu.

Here is my general comment on the food. How was it? Excellent. Excellent. Excellent. The noodles were handmade, and no, I am not just telling you it is handmade just because the menu says so. I can see and taste that the noodles are handmade. The shape, the non-uniformness, the springiness, the body, the texture. Handmade noodles.

The vegetables were cooked simply in fragrant oil. Excellent. Definitely novel to the usual "HK Kai Lan" or "Spinach in Oyster Sauce" in zichar stalls/chinese restaurants.

The Xiao Long Bao was good enough to rival Din Tai Fung.

But the main star of the show was the Sheng Jian Bao. I will not go into detail. All I will say is that it had taste and bite to it. It isn't just xiao long bao wrapped in a different-shaped bao. It is more than that. A Bao in its own right.

The red bean bun dessert was a very good finisher to an excellent chinese meal. Sweet but not too sweet. Very chewy bun.

I may not have described every dish to you, but I want to end off by telling you that from what I have tried, I can tell that this is a quality over quantity place.

Some commentators complain that the portions are too small. I say this: the prices are small too. Definitely cheaper than eating dim sum in expensive hotel chinese restaurants. If you think the portion is small, order more than 1 serving. Very simple. Very, very simple. There is quality in their dishes. Handmade noodles and handmade baos require a lot of labour effort, labour hours. You think they buy their Bao skin from a distributor then wrap meat inside? Of course they have to knead the dough, flatten it, cut it into small circles, and wrap meat and veg inside. Wake up, Singaporeans. You expect to pay cheaply for a lot of Baos?

Some commentators complain that the service is slow. I say this: it is run by a very slim crew. Their food is quality. You expect crazy, big-chain, 20-man kitchen to churn out your food? The consolation is that they serve your dishes once or twice every 10mins. So it is actually okay. It takes a long while for every dish to come out, but at least it keeps coming. They dont do one table by one table from what I observed.

Some commentators complain that the boss shows favouritism. I say this: You dont? I thought most of you are chinese too? "Ka Ki Lang"? "Guan Xi"?  So what if the boss likes to chat with regulars, and laughs with them? So what?

Finally, they serve free flow chrysanthemum tea. You can see the yellow flower petals in the jar served to you.

Amazing. Yes, the best chinese restaurant I have gone to. I think of the expensive, grand chinese restaurants.... you know what? They're different. Hard to compare. But this place doesnt lose out on taste at all. Not at all.

I wish them the best. I can tell they just want a humble, simple, quite life in this AMK enclave.

As for you, make sure you call well in advance to book your table and your Sheng Jian Bao. Simple. Ignore all the rubbish comments here from ugly Singaporeans. Call, book, then, go, and eat. Very simple.

I've heard good things about this place for many years but today my first time there it wasn't that great... Menu is very limited and prices are acceptable but noodle portions could be bigger. Xiao long bao is shanghai style, the skin is thick.

Nice cozy restaurant that served very good Shanghainese food. The soup dumpling, pan fried bun, braised pork bun and spring roll are must try snacks at this restaurant. The chicken mushroom noodle is very also a must try spicy dish. Do take note that it is better to make reservations if you want to eat at this restaurant.

Will not return again foods so so..... I visit 3 years ago still can give it a try when I visit again with my family on July 2022 but as I return to this restaurant found that still no change no sell rice. Foods portion too small and expensive $130 for 4 pax. If you are big eater don't go try. If not you can give it a try. Boss and waitress not so friendly only choose guest to talk.

I seldom come across food this bad, but when I do, I feel responsible to the public to post this.

Service staff were impatient and inattentive from the start - rushed and missing orders, tea not refilled, internal conflict among staff
