Food was bad and expensive for the portion sizes - vegetarian luo han was nothing more than a pile of canned mushrooms in oyster/soy sauce (?!!!), sheng jian bao skin was tough and doughy, wild steam shoots which was supposed to come with meat was a sad puddle of withered shoots in muddy gravy with not a single strand of meat in sight. The best part - they don’t serve rice or ginger (for their xiao long Bao). Which Chinese restaurant doesn’t serve rice??

This is a far cry from the 4.0 review that is stated on Google and other review platforms. Not sure if the owners/chefs had given up on life.

Please do NOT make a trip to this restaurant. Even if you’re in the area or happen to live around here, you’re better off eating instant noodles. An utter disgrace to Shanghai/Chinese cuisine 🙅‍♂️

(NB - they should seriously consider redirecting their investment in the service robot to serving better food. Or at least try.)

Poor customer service, the elderly women serving the food has a frustrated look on her face all times, super unwelcoming, when asked questions, she just turned her head and walked away, not replying to my question

Super long waiting hour, took 30 minutes for a table and then 1h30mins more for them to finally serve all the food, the Shengjian Bao and Tangyuan took the longest and wasnt even that nice. I am very disappointed upon the fact that they have a 4 star review but it was one of the worst restaurant i have ever been to

Bad food quality, the Shengjian Bao we waited for the longest was as hard as a rock half of it was soft half of it was hard, there is also not ginger to pair it with the Shengjian Bao and XiaoLong Bao. The vinegar was also diluted.

The price is also expensive for such little food with no quality

I can understand why we needed to take 30 mins just for a table, because they took so long at serving the food, the items on the menu is also so less yet we waited so long just for a simple dish

Get the shengjian bao. Best I've had in Singapore. The other foods are totally legit. Menu is small so you can feel free to try everything.

Spring rolls and meicai kourou bao was amazing

We made a reservation after watching a video review that said the food was better than DTF and what you could get in Shanghai. We ordered xiaolongbao, shengjianbao, kongbabao, pickled cabbage roll, fried pumpkin cake, jiuniangwanzi.

Food was subpar for the price paid. Amount of meat in kongbabao was miserly and thinly sliced. Xiaolongbao and shengjianbao had way too much MSG, so much so that it hit us on the first bite.

You would do much better going to crystal jade or DTF.

Server was more interested talking on the phone than serving. Xiao long bao didn't come with ginger and looked like frozen one from supermarket. Noodles suppose to come with chicken or pork chop three pieces came could not tell what it was.

For the love of god please eat somewhere else.
This is not the way to do business. the food is quite okay. however the portion size is extremely small, service is incredibly slow and owner turn down walk-in or takeaway based on mood.

Service was slow. Food took some time to arrive. I quite like the noodles but the meat was a bit tough. Xiao long bao was average and it didnt make much of an impression. Fried pork while crispy lack flavour. The pork belly buns are pricey at 2.50 each and I think the ones at paradise is better. The chilled chicken while tasty wasn't worth the $10 for a very small portion. The highlight was the fried buns, those were good.

A small unassuming gem of a restaurant quietly hidden in the depths of Ang Mo Kio.

It was a very simple menu, every item was decently priced, and they arrived each was carefully made.

Drunken chicken was delicious. Other yummy things included the pan fried meat dumplings, pumpkin dumplings and Xiao long bao.

Highly recommended.

It’s a small place so book before you go.

Nice little Shanghai place, the food is nice. Try the spring veg roll, it’s not like what we eat outside.

The drunken chicken is also nice. And the fried pau is good too. Portion is rather small.

It’s popular, please remember to call and reserve a seat to avoid waiting

Sunday night dinner at this quaint little restaurant with just a few tables - called last minute and wasnt able to get a table initially but the owner called back to say someone cancelled 😅 lucky haha

Food was pretty good: pork chop noodles were decent but the flavour lacked depth. The chicken and mushrooms noodles were better with the taste of ginger cutting through the sweetness of the mushroom and soy sauce. The cold drunken chicken was yummy and tender while the xiaolongbao’s soup was very flavorful!

All in all pretty decent food, price in the mid ranges at $68 for 4 people

Small little restaurant with only 7 tables
Hidden at a corner of a HDB block.
Reservation is a must
Food is home cook style nothing special
Some of the fryed dishes are abit oily
Come in small portion
Prices are slightly high
Worth to try are the pumpkin ball, xiao long bao, shen jian bao and popiah
Cash terms only
Aunty serving got alittle attitude problem
Plenty of parking lots right behind the block.

The Deep fried prawn ball with pumpkin and butter sauce was the best and most yummy dish! I’m still missing it 🥲

Pork belly meat was tender and soft too.

Overall value for money as all the dishes we ordered were delicious. The meal was made even better as we ordered deep fried baby squid which is uncommonly found these days at Zi char places, a dish we rarely get to eat.

Will be back for more! 👍🏻

It in a coffee shop. Smoking area is causing the air to feel polluted. The food is better then normal zhi char and lots of variety.
They have one of the best deep fried pork belly

Went for mother day dinner on 7 May 2022 after nearly 2 years of covid restrictions.. enjoyed the food alot 😊

Good zi char place for any occassion. Just finish with early reunion dinner and didnt disappoint 😊

Great food, I particularly love the chicken in herbal soup where you can taste the yummy XO taste,  salted egg black pepper crab that's so milky and buttery and the crispy floss egg plant! Super yummy!!! Also, the service staff were quick, attentive and efficient! They even served us complimentary dessert after dinner, such a pleasure to be having my dinner here!

slow service, told us 15 mins wait but ended waiting 45 mins for just 3 dishes. kankong was ok, white beehoon was bland. we came here to eat the baby squid which we had before, but sadly the standard dropped, small portion and relatively hard to chew. smoking area in coffee shop made the wait v unpleasant.

Came for their perennial fav Dong Po Rou (Braised Pork Belly). Still as yummy as I rem. Good sauce with the pork which isn't gamey too. But the sambal kangkong was pretty pedestrain. Spent $24 for 2 pax.

Food: great tasting dishes throughout. What really hit the spot was the pumpkin prawns dish and Dong Bo pork belly. I’d definitely order it again. On top of regular zi char dishes, they also do interesting ones like black currant ribs, chrysanthemum fried fish.

Ambience: kopitiam Zi char stall lor.

Price: reasonable. Sure, there are cheaper Zi char places, but if you value quality, I’m sure you won’t regret forking out a little extra.

with so many other interesting dishes to chow on, I’m looking forward to my next visit!
Good food at affordable prices. Already crowded on a normal weekday. Ample parking in front of coffee shop.
Value for money.

Kam Jia Zhuang is our family ta pao Zhi char place to go. It’s convenient Cus all we do is to call them up, ask them for specials of the day, pack and we pick it up. Place is usually packed on Saturdays. Value for money zhi char. Highly recommended dish : SEAFOOD CRABS with black pepper. Other zhi char dishes include prawnball with pumpkin sauce, lemon chicken, lala bee hoon ( very good) and Ha Cheong Kai ( Fried chicken wings ). Do give it a try. 🐼🐼🤪❤️

Ok.. this is decent.. not stellar.. it's not a destination for cze char (for our family) .. great if it's downstairs your apartment. Contrary to some other comments - we enjoyed the 招牌 beehoon the most, pork ribs, prawns, eggs, and vege were all average.

i stay few blocks away and i eat quite often. recently, the standard has dropped a lot. dont deserve to be top zi char list. maybe they have changed the chef, but the taste is not up to standard. sweet and sour pork may not be their signature but is a common dish, i was disappointed that the meat is terribly small, meaning you eat more flour. the sauce for black pepper pork chop is diluted as well.
Sweet and Sour Pork Rib rice with egg. Taste good too.

It's a neighbourhood zi char restaurant that doesn't really stand out despite the reviews. I tried the special bee hoon and imperial pork chop rice. Special bee hoon attempted to be like white bee hoon (sembawang?) but doesn't quite make it. It's not bad but not special. Prawns were bland. Pork chop was dry and the sauce didn't have much flavor. Rice was hard and dry. OK for a neighbourhood zi char but not worth traveling for.
Tasty food at reasonable prices. Do try the fried fish with mango sauce

Awesome. Food was all good though a bit of over fry / burn in the Har jiong chicken wings. Every dish was well put together. Special mention to the spicy chrysanthemum fish dish. Service was good and very accommodating to our requests. Awesome.
Food was great. Recommended to book in advance. Really enjoyed their signature prawns.
Food tastes good. A different kind of butter taste for prawn and different kind of sweet and sour pork taste for the rib pork.

Above average zi char, not spectacular. Price are 10%-15% higher than your neighbourhood zi char. Have been eating here since young, and still having it often. If u stay in jurong or changi, not worth travelling down tbh. I personally love the sambal fried rice, give it a go!
Prawn was great. ribs were so-so. noodles were OK.
Amazing seafood at affordable prices. Do pre-order your black pepper and chilli crab!
Serving good Tze Char dishes. Need to go earlier to avoid the queues.
I like the Zi Char they served here. Its above average. It's get crowded over the weekend. Call to reserve a table if u can.

For a zichar, its really good. The sambal chilli there is flavourful! We had the sambal kangkong, very tasty. The deep fried pork cutlet was really good too. The fried seafood egg was like any other egg elsewhere, nothing special but still good. The pumpkin butter prawn didn't have much pumpkin, but the prawn was fresh.

2nd visit here. First visit was good. But this time, not so.

Reached around 6.45pm and was told the wait will be 30 to 40 mins, which we are fine. After 40mins, one fried chicken was brought out and rice. With each dish coming out every 10mins, need 1 over hour for all dishes to be out at 8pm.

Food is good however it's taking too long for hungry diners.

P.s. Another table came later than us but got our their food earlier.

Made famous by an exposure on TV. Their culinary skills are not too bad and  the family had served the neighbours over the decade if not more. Prices are fair and there are ample parking. But prepare to wait on weekend dinners.
Love the Fry bee hoon! Delicious!
Tasty sweet and sour pork, well plated too 👌

U do not deserve any good review

Irresponsible zi char stall 😑😑😑

Definitely a good place for good Zhichar specials!  Why specials?  This family-managed business has absolutely what almost every food hunter would like to find and taste.  Good price,  ample parking lots,  good food,  friendliness,  special chef recommendations although most times have to wait.  With good food waiting is fine isn't it.

Tried their new year set dinner. Taste and freshness were good but the serving was so small it was almost funny at times. Not that affordably priced considering the serving size. The food was served extremely slowly too making the entire dining experience disappointing. The deep fried brinjal w pork floss (not part of the set) was good though.
Value for money, superb food even with takeaway.  Ordered again for mums birthday and always good so far.
The food are getting more and more expensive. It cost $5.60 to dabao a packet of Hor Fun. Also the portion has become much smaller too.

Crab: Fresh but salted egg yolk sauce was not up to mark because it tasted diluted.

Prawn paste chicken: batter wasn’t crispy and the taste of the chicken wasn’t strong.

3 eggs spinach: Diluted and mild taste of the 3 types of eggs.

Enoki with tofu: I don’t taste the soya in the tofu.

I expected more as I thought it was famous.

Not a big crowd on a weekend night. It was fairly manageable.
My friends and I loved the quality of the zichar food. Great food and wallet friendly. Remember to try the signature dishes. We will be back again!
Decent tze char with lovely signature food and slow braised pork belly
Food is good & price is reasonable

Came here because of Food King. We ordered Dong Po Pork Belly, fried fish with chrysanthemum sauce and the pumpkin prawn balls. They were all good, huge portions but not fantastic. With the family crowd on that Saturday we went, you know this zhi char has a certain standard that they won't fall below. But food-king good? Hmm probably not.
Great tze char dishes to be found here. Prices are decent although it can be steep for some of the dishes. Family loves the food here. Two thumbs up.

Pretty good tze char in the neighborhood. Taste great at good price. I will definitely come back for more even though im staying in sengkang. Will like to try the fish head steamboat. One of their specialty is the blackcurrant rib... Which is like sweet sour pork + pork rib king... Not bad

Big n succulent pumpkin prawns! Pumpkin sauce is so flavourful you will want to ask for more. Best ribs I've had! Marinated in Ribena for 4hrs and then fried and coated w a mysteriously tasty sauce. The oomph will haunt you until you get your next fix. Do remember to make a reservation or you may have to expect to be turned away. Don't wait! Make your reservation now!

This is considered out of the way although a short walk from the MRT station. Luckily we decided on a late night dinner instead reaching at 9:30pm on a Fri night. Even then we can still see the remnants of the dinner crowd so would advice those who want to eat in peace and not wait too long to go before or after the peak hours.

We only ordered 3 dishes and all 3 feels quite solid. The drunken chicken soup was tasty and full of Chinese herbs. Both my dad and mum can make better soups but this is as good as it gets when you are eating out.

We had the egg omelette whilst pretty normal for tze char was done pretty well. The egg was not rubbery, and one can get a good bite from the other ingredients egged into it.

The pumpkin sauced prawns were the highlight we think of the dinner. One may be lulled into thinking this is a healthier version of salted-egg yolk sauces. I rather think this is a deconstruction of what is common place with something else surprising. The creamy feel of the sauce when one bites into the prawns is eyebrow lifting to say the least. And I can't help but wonder what is added to replicate the salted egg yolk but not kinda taste.

Overall is definitely a place worth checking out, if you have the time and patience to travel all the way (remember how crappy the red line is right now). The food will reward you for your trouble.

Though on 2nd thought, there is always this naggy feeling that the tze char store is as good as the chef is. And no chef and his team is permanent. If anything, I would savor the experience until the next discovery.

First time trying this stall after searching google. Turns out to be quite good despite the fact that we bought take away. I believe it will taste even better if we were to eat there. Food portion was ok and not too small. Will be back again to try eating there.
A good budget Zhi char and quite environment.
First time here, fish head curry, it is $24 but pretty tasty. Brinjal and okra is cooked through. The tomato tasted a little weird. The tofu with enoki dish is pretty good too.
We made reservations. When we arrived, the waitress directed us to share a table w a stranger. Is that allowed? Perhaps the boss or even MOH should look into this.

Overall above average. Good food, reasonable price, lots of parking, walking distance from amk mrt. But crowded place and long waiting time. It’s better to make reservation by calling them if your group is more than 4. Will come back for this.
It's a nice che zhar stall in the neighborhood of Ang Mo Kio avenue 3. Price is very reasonable and taste good.  You can call for reservation or go early if you don't want to wait for the table.
Steam fish very fresh and well cook I like it,will go back to patronise again.

Excellent food quality at decent prices!

Must try:
- Horfun
- Curry Slice Pork Rice
- Ee-mee Stir Fried
- Claypot Tou-foo
- Deep Fried Pork Cheek

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content:
Tim Sum variety remains but the quality had definitely dropped, but taste is still consider ok for a neighbourhood Tim Sum.

The only thing that need improvement is the cleanliness as tables are always sticky as I could tell that the table cloth is hardly rinsed.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: my family was being blessed by a sumptuous breakfast as the household members were down with covid. it was a really nice meal, especially the char siew puff that taste amazing!! the porridge comes with a lot of ingredients and it’s tasty. service is extremely good too. my friend mentioned that she asked for a change of item and called them up they were so nice to help. highly recommended!

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: June 2022: came for dinner to satisfy dim sum craving for dinner. Had a few long only cos we were not that hungry. It’s part of a coffeeshop and not fancy at all. Food was ok, not as tasty as those hotel level dim sum, but better than the typical coffee shop dim sum stalls. Stall owner had great service too. Even selected a few videos for us to view while we were having dinner. Maybe cause we were seated at table 2 - right in front of the big screen. We thought all the dishes were actually tasty. I liked the Paper wrapped chicken the best! Good choice for dim sum dinner near home.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: Had a wide variety of satisfying dim sum at this place.  I have to say that generally it was quite enjoyable though the standards were uneven.  For example, while the Chee cheong fun and the char siew pau, char siew seu and har kau were well done, the potstickers were done with too thick a skin and the egg custard buns didn't exactly ooze with goodness.  Nonetheless you get what you paid for and you would have an okay experienxd if you choose the right dishes.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: Very decent, humble tasting dim sum. Wide selection and for the price, it is well worth. The chee cheong fun is a must, with its preserved vegetable and lard garnish. Very authentic. The har gao is our least favourite; sufficient prawn meat, but the skin was slightly mushy and more fragile than usual.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content:
Liu sha bao ($4.50) that doesn't liu. Imagine my disappointment when i bit into the bao to see solid bits... but the liu sha does taste great! Only pity is that it's too small.

Menu doesn't indicate price so it is inconvenient to make payment. The staff took my order while standing far inside the stall. She shouted the price $4.5 but somehow i interpreted as $3.8 and made the payment on Grabpay. It was only few minutes after my payment that she walked over to where I was sitting to tell me that i underpaid. She also didn't validate at my point of payment. Stall owner should consider indicating the price on menu.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content:
Handmade dim sum
Do not sell special braised chicken feet

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: Really yummy 😋 handmade dim sum. Accepts all payment.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content:
The quality of the dim sum is so so
Rude stall assistant gives it a negative impression. Porridge taste very plain. The rest of the dimsum taste is very heavy on the gravy. The only upside is that they have many varieties. Price wise is not worth it.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: Traditional Hong Kong dim sum to satisfy all your circuit breaker craving! Definitely taste better than the looks. Easy ordering online for pick-up.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content:
Average and not worth the queue and your calories. All the dim sum just too salty and the porridge is tasteless.

Go try next door fishball noodle as it seems taste better.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: The queue is always long and that gave me the impression of 5 star food but I would give this place 3.5 stars! There are hits and misses as is the case with almost, if not every restaurant. I find the seasonings of most of their dishes spot on even if some of the dim sum did not make the cut for me. I liked their siu mai, har gow, prawn fritter (明角虾) the best. The rice noodle roll was not bad although I would prefer a thinner sheet. The taro balls would have gotten my thumbs up had the taro's texture been more "powdery" and less dense. I should not compare but I always use Crystal Jade's egg tart as benchmark for flaky Chinese egg tarts. Lo Mai Gai is a must order whenever I have dim sum and although the sticky rice was soft enough, the overall dish did not excite. The kopitiam had decent Kopi peng and Teh-C peng.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: No frills. Not fantastic. Self service. Quite speedy although Coffeeshop was packed full during meal times. Not going to be winning any foodie awards. A rather wide variety available. Very decent dim sum for the price.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: All their steamed stuff like xiao long bao and cheecheong fan had v thick skin which im not a fan of. But the prawn beancurd deep fried dish was da bomb. Best in SG i’ve tried. Generally v flavourful.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: The Dim sum average taste . Missed those good old day at The Neptune Theatre Restaurant was a well-known restaurant and theatre in Singapore that was in business from the 1970s to 2006. Housed in the Overseas Union House at Collyer Quay, Neptune was famous for hosting topless revues and large-scale dinners. During the day, the restaurant served Cantonese dim sum fare that was popular with the office workers in the area. (Text taken from inforpedia. ) 🧊🧊🧊

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: The food was much better before. Still, for the price and the range of dim sum they offered, worth a visit if you are in the area.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: Reasonable price but dim sum is average, except for bbq pork pau which is quite tasty. Lotus leaf glutinous rice tastes bland and hard, probably need longer steaming time.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: A dim sum place that is near home. The variety is not bad with many of the dum sum dishes to be available. However, the taste is just normal street standard. No crowd at 10am on Friday morning, pretty relaxing for me.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: My favourite dim sum place in SG. Love the red bean pancake. It's the best I've tried and a must-order (a little oily but I can live with that). Also the crispy mango prawn roll is quite nice as well. Would have given it 5 star but the char siew pao tasted a bit stale today... Nevertheless, one of the best places to go if you are craving for dim sum 😋

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: This dim sum is worth more than a 3 star. Always have a lot ppl especially on weekends. Usually will be full house on weekends as early as 9am.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content:
First time at this coffee shop restaurant over Sunday morning. The food was nice and reasonably priced. Waiting time was rather short estimated abt 10 minutes, contrary to some who complained abt the long wait?!
My family and I were satisfied with the food and the service. Definitely a gem in the neighborhood where you keep seeing people joining the queue. Will come back again for sure.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: Long que but poor taste..  Restaurant pricing but at poor food quality...!!  Chee chong fun skin was so thick.. Fried stuff was too saltty..  Har kaw skin was too thick too !!..  It was a total disappointment... Porridge quality was acceptable.. Pricing is way too high.. Damage $75..!! .. Liu sao bun is not watery but with solid yellow hardened paste!...  Just disappointment..!!  Avoid if can!

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: There are variety of dim sum to choose from. The usual time to wait for the steaming time and served. Skin of the dim sum is think and taste good from the inner content.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content:
Not bad food, though service kinda confusing coz they might not be the most meticulous in ensuring what they have served out tallied with what we ordered.
Place kinda warm coz outdoor eating.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content:
Was happening to view my archive picture and decided to post about this.
First of all, queue is long. Waiting time is long. Staff on duty was kind of rude
When it’s my turn, the auntie was communicating with me in other language Cantonese and Chi? Ask what is she promoting me for the new dish, she reply in Cantonese which I don’t uds. I tot why not just try lo.

End up I’m getting 1 slice of abalone that cost me $10. Really not worth the try

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content:
Food is not so nice. The guo tie wrapper was thick and the filling was dry. The egg tart custard was jiggly and tasty, but the pasty was somewhat soggy. The rice rolls were so thick, it was like eating chunks of steamed rice flour. The steamed chicken feet were good though.
This stall should indicate their prices clearly, either on the display or on the menu. We only got to find out the prices at the point of ordering.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content:
spent $19 ,  not cheap nor expensive.. but yummy.
there have BLACK vinegar with sliced ginger, sign of bone fide tim sum purveyor

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content:
Ordered a truck load of food. Had to wait quite awhile to que cause of the crowd. Recommended to go early.
1st batch of Siew mai was raw, informed them and they did a quick swap. Turned out great!
Har gow had super plump prawns, super worth it.
Best dish was the steam black bean pork rib.
It's at a coffee shop, recommended to sit outside, away from the zichar stall if not you'll be perspiring like we did.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content:
Queue: When I first reached at 10.30am, there was a queue. However, when I left there wasn't any queue.
Food: Good amount of varieties. The quality and taste of the food is average for me, not bad but not exceptionally nice.
Price: My family ordered 12 dim sum, 1 porridge, and 1 rice, for $53.00. Not too expensive but neither very cheap/affordable.

UPDATE: Went again this morning. Maybe because it was early in the morning and there was not a lot of customers, when my aunt went to order she was pressured by the staff into ordering additional items.
This is what I considered bad service. I never like the idea of being push into buying.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: Food is good, handmade! Better then the huge chain around Singapore with gold in the name. Staff is friendly too! Unfortunately I don't live near to eat it often.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: Food there was delicious but a little salty to my preference. Tried to order take away frozen dim sum from them for breakfast for my family but seems like is still the best to eat there as the frozen dim sum which we ordered wasn’t as good.  Their best dish is giant har gow and lotus rice

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: Ok ok lah. Whilst fried stuff was decent the rest was so so incl Char siew sou. The century egg porridge was a big disappointment. And service was so so..

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content:
Summary: For the price-to-quality and long wait, go somewhere else.

The good: The food was of decent quality and the shrimp chee cheong fun had quite a lot of prawns in it. The average price of each dish is about $3.50, which is par for the course at a dim sum experience.

The bad: Despite the price, it isn't a full dim sum experience never it isn't a restaurant, but charges the same price. The operations are messed up with a lot of inefficiencies, leading to the customer collecting their food in bits and pieces (you need to collect it yourself - again less than a dim restaurant experience, where they deliver to your table) and the wait can be very long, depending on the dish - I had to wait for about an hour for the freshly fried red bean pancake! By then I wasn't hungry and lost eating momentum - I would have rather they didn't offer it at all if I knew I had to wait that long.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content:
13 Dish | 50+ bucks

3rd visit

Quality is dropping with every visit...started out really good that we went for twice consecutive weekend.

However it's still really crowded with the another wanton stor holding the fort. Hence expect to wait for 20 min or more if you have a group of 4 and more.

Overall it's still offer affordable price for a neighbourhood dimsum

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: Pretty lackluster but still edible. You probably have other better choices in this coffeeshop unless you are craving for some dim sum

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: Nice solid value for money dim sum. Not the most refined but it's comfort food like what I've been used to. Nothing less. Will visit regularly.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: Decently priced, decent service. Came here in the afternoon so it was really hot. Liu sha bao and chee cheong fun were great; xiu mai and xlb were not so.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: Variety of choice yes, price is considerably cheap compared to other neighborhoods dimsum including 1.30 dimsum. But overall food is below average, would rate 4.5 / 10 max.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: Nothing fancy. Just your regular neighbour dim sum. Not bad either.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: Nice place for tim sum in hong kong style. Lots of varieties and freshly made from steam to fried stuffs. Love the congee too!

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: You can tell easily from the rude stall assistant auntie and unpalatable food. Moments of cooking so cack handed and unprofessional, that I want to congratulate the stall on its incompetence.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: If I stay nearby I will not mind having dim sum there.  Chicken feet is nice but a bit on the pricey side given that is a coffeshop setting. liusha pau was not too bad and the price was OK.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content:
I don't have much choices in Singapore to compare with but I think the taste is good and the price is reasonable. Its a more friendly budget version of YumCha. The food that I ordered here cost around $26.90 for 2 person. I am happy with that as my brunch. =)
Probably due to Covid-19, the space its kinda limited and of coz it's food court place so don't expect it to be comfortable and airconditioned environment but it's rather cozy and windy..

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: The food is quite good. Better than canto paradise.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content:
Taste quite authentic Malaysian style dim sum.
Particularly like the yong tou foo which reminds me of old days 😋 though a bit pricy ($1/piece in average)
Char Siew bun and Egg Tarts are nice too.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: Its a pretty good Dim Sum place that isnt Swee Choon! Their baked goods are the best the bbq pork puff if I remember the name right. Only thing is queues are long, and there isnt much seats, and today was fine. But before Covid, the queues to get food and finding a seat is long! Be prepared!  But worth it~

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: Dim sum is delicious! Wanted to visit the shanghai restaurant next door but they were full so we settled for this instead. Got to give a good review because everything we ordered was surprisingly good. Radish cake was smooth, siew mai was juicy and liu sha bao was runny. Good!

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: Delicious! A wide selection and affordable. Egg tarts and char siew sow are nice.  Siew mai har gow are delectable.. only the steamed pork ribs falls short a little.. affable cashier despite the long queue.. however the queue seems to be shorter than the fishball queue next to it.

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: Asked for more mayo on my youtiao and he squeezed the whole mayo OVER my whole plate with my spring rolls. Eh trying to be funny???? Who eats spring roll with mayo?? Problematic!!

restaurant name: Kow Loon Hong Kong Dim Sum
content: The food is alright, pricey.. but alright. My biggest concern with this stall was the rude young man at the counter. Now I don’t expect great customer service, but neither do I expect to be treated so rudely. The gestures the young man used to rush you to return the buzzer, and the manner in which he returns you your change, it’s as though he’s angry at you for something or you owe it to him..? It really does spoil your mood when food is supposed to bring you joy, so no thanks, I’m not heading back there.

Second visit. Food is nice and the less salty/oil makes the dishes we ordered seems more healthy. The fish maw soup comes full of fish maw and other ingredients. The fried baby squids are crispy. The chicken wrapped in cabbage is good.

Ordered A Couple Of Times Thru Home Delivery, For Special Occasion.  I Must Say Food Always Delivered Promptly Within Selected Time Slot. My Family Love The Food Esp Lobster Porridge. Other Dishes Were Good Too.

Cold plate was very generous in portion . 东坡肉 was ok flavour is there tender and nice. The 麦片下 was dry and blend shouldn’t order the one without shell. 菜包鸡 was acceptable but I feel the chicken inside was lack of flavour and abit bland have to go with the sauce to taste . I love the 2 wok fried vegetable .
Best tze char restaurant around … ordered their red grouper… meat for fish porridge and bone for stir fly bitter gourd with fish bone..orn ni (Yam Paste) is another must eat..
Food is quite good but service can be further improved. Price is very reasonable but the waiting time can be very long.

I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of this meal - the salted egg crab became the best crab I have tasted (replacing the butter crab from Melben), and I expected the lobster porridge to be bland or full of MSG, but instead got hit by this umami bomb of seafood sweetness. Crab - plump and sweet, with a sauce chock full of salted egg and surprisingly light. Lobster porridge - the star is the stock - seafood sweetness that is just the right balance of sweetness, saltiness and umami - drank two bowls and no MSG reaction at all. I will definitely be back for this gem tucked in the middle of nowhere

Update: went back on a Monday and the crab was still good (a little less salted egg taste), and the lobster porridge broth was so dilute - tastes like corn more than lobster…and the lobster was slightly overcooked. The most disappointing dish was the hk steamed grouper - $50 but it was frozen dry overcooked fish.

I decreased this rating to three stars due to the hit and miss of the dishes, and the inconsistency.

Lobster porridge was the highlight; the porridge and the broth was rich and flavorful, but the lobster itself was lackluster at best. Other dishes ordered tasted great too. Overall, it was an enjoyable experience.

The signature items are really worth a try and tastes great! It's right beside a public carpark which might be a little difficult to find space during dinner time. Must order the cabbage chicken which is sold in limited amounts daily as well as the toufu.

Good airconditioned zi char place. We had the set for 10. It included the lobster porridge in claypot with the lobster served separately (a very tasty and yummy one), cabbage chicken in claypot, steam grouper Hong Kong style, scallops with broccoli, tofu with enoki mushrooms and puay ling vegetables, smoked duck with jellyfish, braised abalone with mushrooms and sea cucumber, and orh ni for dessert. I didn't eat the abalone dish as it came out just before the dessert and I was way too full for it. Should have served the dish earlier. My 2 favourites were the lobster porridge and the tofu dish. Price was reasonable, service was great. Very attentive service staff. The place was clean but could have been more comfortable if the air-con was functioning properly.
Staff are candid in their recommendations. Food are tasty, even the old folks like it. I guess they have the 古老味，reminiscing the old style zhi char taste I am used to in my childhood.

Chui Xiang has much to offer.
Food without MSG.
Selected decent pricing dishes (eg whole soon hock fish around $20, white pepper Sri Lanka crab less than $50).
And most importantly, great cooking!
This is one of the restaurants among Casuarina road that operates for a long time, I attributes it's long standing towards the value and quality of their food.

Order the popular lobster 🦞 porridge and some recommended dishes, very flavourful and the lobster is very fresh.. the oyster 🦪 egg is also nice 👍🏼. Do take note that the place do not have sheltered carpark nearby.

One of the best tze char eatery in Spore. Highly recommended 👍👍👍 the must tries are Marmite Pork Chop, Lobster Porridge, Cabbage Chicken, Dong Bo Pork, Sambal French Bean, Fish Maw Soup, Beef Horfun, and many others. Yums....
Had a yusheng here. It was ok just that it was a bit too dry (not enough sauces). Salted egg fish skin is crispy and tasty. Marmite pork ribs are tender. Tofu with golden mushrooms are nice too!
Pretty average dishes. Nothing special that really stands out. Lots of variety to choice from though. 5 dishes total price at 130 SGD including one pot of chinese tea.

Not your typical zi char restaurant. In addition to the regular dishes, they do a good amount of fresh seafood and the extra ordinary lobster porridge. The deep fried soon hock fish was excellent as well as the salted egg sauce crab. White bee hoon was also very good. Parking in the area may be a bit challenging but well worth a visit.
Really nice Zi Char place and pretty affordable too. Would recommend the salted egg sotong and coffee pork ribs! The signature cabbage chicken is interesting and worth trying too!
Great food at reasonable prices. Highly recommended to try the Prawn Vermicelli and Marmite Pork Ribs.
Ordered Cabbage Chicken, Fuyong Omelette, Peppered Salt Fried Cuttlefish and sambal sweet potato leaves. Fuyong Omelette not great, the rest good. Reasonable pricing.

The first time my family patron this restaurant was at Commonwealth Ave.  Though the atmosphere was not as good as some places at that time, this was more than compensated by the reasonable price and nice food.

Most dishes are good, to name a few:
Marmite Pork Ribs, Braised 'Dong Po' Pork, Fish Maw Thick Soup, Cereal Prawn, Salad Fried Prawn, Homemade Toufu with Enoki Mushrooms, Prawn Paste Chicken, etc.

The current location is not as spacious as at Commonwealth and you may need to book especially on weekends. We have and will continue to go to this kitchen at their updated location which is at 126 Casuarina Rd, Singapore 579514
Usual hang out place for nice food n decent price

Ordered the steamboat - $35.
Fish is extremely fresh, soup is slightly bland but gets sweeter as it simmers with the vegetables. Has yam, tofu, cabbage in the soup as well.

Beef hor fun is great, been here 3 times already and ordered each time. Quality of the dish may vary, not as nice when it’s crowded but it’s very good when it’s less crowded.

Ordered cabbage wrapped chicken, marmite pork, French bean with minced meat and pineapple fried rice, for delivery.

The cabbage wrapped chicken is unique and hidden with some chestnuts, wolf berries, etc.
Long cooking made the cabbage soft and disintegrated with a tinge of sour taste.
Overall not bad but the chicken is a little bland.

Marmite pork is disappointing. Marmite taste and flavour is not there.
Maybe due to long delivery time, the pork is soggy but this should not affect the marmite taste though.

Pineapple fried rice is okayish but bland.

Maybe it will taste better and yummier if dine in.

Very yummy, reasonable prices. Try the salt / pepper fried squid. Light and tasty and squid was tender. The homemade tofu with enoki mushroom was also a gem.

We came early for dinner (about 545pm) and food was served within 10 mins - very fast!

Recommended.
Value for money, good food.
Beef hot fun with egg sauce was so delicious! Value for money as there is set meal for 6.90  for the big portion of seafood Mee hoon soup and a drink
Good food at very reasonable prices and good service too. A recommended place to go for Your celebrations.
Food is tasty and not too oily. Price is reasonable.

Second time here..
Food was good especially their marmite ribs and tofu (silky smooth).

Will definitely return to try other dishes.

Slightly overpriced.
Food was very good, love the experience! Prawn paste chicken was delicious, venison was tender and tasty! Would definitely come again!!

It's closest to home cooked food that you can find. There is no msg in the food and the taste is genuine. Had their signature lobster porridge. The lobsters are very fresh and the size is around 300gm each so the piece of meat is quite decent. The 3 eggs vege dish is very good and so is stir fried red garouper filler meat. The tofu is really smooth and you can actually taste the bean. Price is very reasonable.

food here is great but the timing displayed here is a scam. google stated that the store will be opened till 10.30pm on a saturday but arrived and they said they’re closed for the day at 9.30pm (we arrived at 9.15pm) -,-

The area was located near Old Upper Thomson road, where there were open carparks for parking. Convenience was of concern when we reached there. Service staff were friendly and nice, as we made our reservations through phone. We ordered the 6 persons value set meal together with an extra fried rice for our kids. Food taste were surprisingly tasty and  the portion were huge!. That was a plus point given our first time patronizing the stall. Price wise was a bit on the high side with Service charge and GST imposed, hence a 4 star review for the restaurant. Good to revisit again for the tasty food served.
Crowded during the weekend. Not enough staff. Food quality is ok. White Pepper Crab is nice.

I like the second day cny gathering. The booking a week ago for us is 1045 to 12 cos others booked earlier got 12 o'clock slot. As this is cny period any slot is good for us cos we just need a place to eat with iur loved ones. The food is average but the memory lingers a long time.

I patronised the branch at casuarina road. Called one day before to inform them I will pick up the order at 11.15am. Reached the shop at 11.04am to settle payment and collected my order at 11.32am. unpleasant experience. If you can't honoured the time, then let me know when I put in my order and not having your customer to wait for God long how long! I need to rush off to other place fyi. I have to rush them to speed up because I have other appointment to attend to!
Lobster porridge very nice. Black pepper beef is tender. Marmite ribs tasty. Yam paste is average.

We ordered their signature chicken braised with cabbage and also tao fu with jin chng gu & spinach - very yummy. Their prices also reasonable. The waitress also very good - she advised us above 2 dishes enough to eat for 3 of us which is true. Fully recommend this place.
Above average local restaurant - worth a visit anytime.
That's only word can say "yummy" and reasonable price.
Food here was decent. Staff is friendly. Serving is fast.

Great place for lunch where they offer lunch sets with a drink for around $5-7 depending on what you get. The place itself would benefit from some sprucing up especially the toilet as it can be somewhat dirty at times. Apparently famous for the lobster porridge but I have yet to try.
Food is OK and price reasonable

Food taste is so good permeate the stomach that increase one's appetite.  Chef has excellent culinary skills which draw the best favour out of each dish and the sauces greatly enhanced the natural taste of seafood and meats.  The chilli sauce is a must try and unforgettable.
Should patronise this eatery if you are near that area after a walk at lower pierce reservoir.
The best crabs dishes.

Very good quality zi char food at relatively decent prices. Read the reviews on this place earlier and ordered the pumpkin prawn, salted egg yolk sotong, Marmite pork ribs, smoked duck with jelly fish, and cabbage wrapped chicken in claypot. Really loved the first 4 dishes as they were executed very well! The cabbage chicken was interesting but too soft and drenched in gravy for my liking. Chicken was also a bit dry on the inside. Service was friendly and prompt. Got nice drinks like lemongrass drink and water chestnut which was refreshing. Parking can be a killer here so opt to take public transport or Grab if possible.

Truth be told, it's just another tse char place around the area. Although there's a fancy story behind the place, and many people celebrating occasions at this restaurant, it's really just an above average tse char restaurant. Menu is extensive, and they carry good pricey expensive dishes, worthy of big birthday celebrations. If you're looking for simple cooked rice and noodle dishes, they also have it here. Personally quite like the beef hor fun and the dry beef hor fun.

Chui Xiang Kitchen never disappoints. Their staff are friendly and their lobster porridge is to die for. A pot of porridge is enough but their other dishes are great too that my friends and I always end up ordering more and overfilling our bellies with great food.
Fantastic value for money, well executed dishes. When ordering the beef hor fun, order the small portion for better wok hei. You can read the recommendations on the walls of the outlet

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content:
update as of Apr 22: Price increase. Sour veg fish is now $20+. not sure if its me, but i felt the fish slices has also reduced. Skewers price also went up.

Had a craving for sour veg fish and saw review for this place is not bad. It did not disappoint! $18 for the dish and portion is generous and the soup super appetising! Tries the skewers and love the spices they sprinkled on it. Decent prices, good taste and did not gave too wait too long. Will be back!

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content:
$122 for 4 pax!

Thumbs up to the staff for their attentive  service 👍🏻👍🏻

Food had been great!
Love the veggies dishes!
The young adults definitely will love the skewer options!

Worth to return for more

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Ordered 烤鱼，bean curd skin, spicy clams and skewers. Overall quite satisfying. Staff were attentive. Price for the skewers quite cheap but do note they require min 5 to order. Will return to try other dishes.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Don’t let the name and decor out you off. The chefs know their stuff here and the food is actually really good and the pricing is also good. Service is disinterested but good enough. Enjoy!

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content:
Chinese food restaurant that specialises in Sichuan dishes. The hot pots and some of the dishes have 3 different level of spiciness and the top level will melt your face if you are not a spice connoisseur.

Tried the sour vegetables fish stew at the spiciest level and it was blazing spicy. The heat didn’t mask the flavourful broth, sweet vegetables and the freshness of the fish which is fantastic. The skewers was very good with standouts been the mantou, garlic shoots and pig’s large intestines. Will try the bull frog fry pot the next time with the full family.

Pricing is very affordable for the taste and portions. There are alcohol available too and are served icy cold. Was there on a Saturday dinner and the serving staffs were friendly and adequate.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Decent food, good portions, decent prices. The dishes were all on the salty side. We ordered an iced lemon tea but was not served. Had to change it to a coke eventually as they ran out of lemon tea. But, they billed us both items 🤦🏽‍♀️. Only realised it after we left the restaurant 😣. Would have given it a higher rating if service was better or at least more attentive. Haiz..

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content:
Tried their signature frog pot (original) and thought it was not bad. The soup goes really well with the rice. The grilled eggplants was garlicky and went well with rice as well. Egg plant is def a must try.
The lamb skewers were OK, not gamey at all. The tomato egg drop soup was a little bland but considering the strong flavour profiles of the other dishes, I was OK with it.
The cold cucumber dish was so-so tho. Would recommend ordering their grill veggie skewers instead.

Service was a little slow considering that there wasn't a lot of customers in the shop. The interval between the dishes were quite big and the cold cucumber dish which is an appetiser came right at the end. Def an area worth improving for the shop.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Decent and affordable price Sichuan food in AMK. When i have craving for Sichuan food, this will be a not bad choice. However, if you really want good good sichuan food, i think other places can offer better.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content:
It's my second visit and this visit was 100% opposite to my last experience in 2021.I was not lucky this round. Even though I specially mentioned to have the soup less salty,
Every dish we ordered was way too salty ! 酸菜鱼，辣子鸡，肉串。。It was a treat for my 70 year old mom... but because it was way too salty, we didn't enjoy the meal at all. I had to scrape off the excess sauces on the bbq, asked for the soup to be diluted (which is still very salty).
I have feedback to the kitchen when I made payment, not sure if they take this seriously.. But I think I'm not confident of returning anymore. It was a bad experience for my mom who likes 川菜. $60 for very salty food that you can't stomach,  not worth.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: One of my favourite 川菜馆。Love their bbq sticks and also 辣子鸡. Price is reasonable. If you are coming on a weekdays, usually there is no queue. However, weekends recommended to book before coming. They have private room for booking too if you prefer to have some privacy. They also offer 麻辣香锅 and other nice delicacies.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: family favourite restaurant, dishes are value for money in terms of taste and portions, highly recommend the 酸菜鱼 (pickled vegetable fish, $18) as well as hotpot cauliflower!

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: The mala fish soup was really flavorful, with a bit of chinese wine. Beancurd skin is a side order. The spices in the meat skewers were good, masking the gamey mutton taste. Spicy chicken is unique, not your typical flavor. But a bit on the sweet side.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content:
Properly one of the best Spicy Sichuan Frog leg.
My favourites. Really very good and spicy.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Good beef mala and sour fish. Super addictive and appropriate for cooling evening. Spice level can be adjusted to suit your tastebuds. Overall a good experience.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content:
Despite its odd sounding name, this restaurant is worth a visit. It serves spicy mala Sichuan dishes.

The odd sounding name has to do with them serving bull frog as one of their signature. We had the chicken hotpot and added ingredients like beef, noodles, and vegetables. Although we asked for less spicy, to us, it was still very spicy so for those of you who are not so tolerant of spicy food, beware!

We also ordered some bbq skewers - beef, mutton, pork belly, chicken 🐔 ... all were tasty and nice.

We will be back to try their bbq fish and also their signature bull frog hotpot.

Recommended!

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Most skewers are good, pork belly skewers are especially awesome!! Ma la xiang guo is pretty good too; they cut the ingredients into bite sizes, very easy to eat.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content:
Ordered a steam fish Mala soup and a Ala Carte with multiple ingredient with medium spiciness! Really nice!
The taste is strong and flavourful but less fragrant as compared to the Mala store at NEX food court and Central food court. But still good and value for money.
Food was great...but I really dislike the ambience and the music.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Dropped by this place for Chong Qing grilled fish and was not disappointed. The fish and sauce is really really nice! We had the 香辣 soup based and added a few sides. The servings of the sides are really generous. Much much more generous than the famous Tan Yu imo. I will definitely drop by again for their MLXG next time! And, having robot waitress to serve the dishes is so innovative and cute!

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Chicken hotpot is nice..frog is also tender..BBQ meat skewers taste great too.. Price is neither cheap nor expensive.. atmosphere is good for some gatherings...

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Waited for more than 30mins for the food. Taste of the food so so. Price reasonable. The fried dry tofu not nice, fried rice only egg and spring onion, fish so so.. shui jia too soft.. staff very friendly.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content:
Super horrible service. Service staff belittle Singaporeans and prioritise mainlanders' orders. Waited 45 mins with no dish in sight and even shown aggression when we want to cancel our order. Junior staff knows nothing and senior staff is very very rude.

Overall if you're a Singaporean and decide to visit this place, make sure you enjoy feeling berated, demeaned and looked down upon like second class citizens.

Food in my picture is cold too, even sashimi is warmer than this.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content:
awesome place for 串串 and hot pot stuff !

nice food , reasonable prices for food abd beer!

recommended!

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Was at ah gu kaka wa for the first time. Tried the sour & spicy soup, la zi ji (crispy and tasty) and tomatoes scramble egg. The food was delicious and reasonable in price. The frog leg seems like a popular dish appearing on most of the diner's table. Could try them out if you are around the corner.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Quite a quiet place despite the loud lights and decor - the food was nice and reasonably priced. Had the sour spicy soup which was suitable for 3-5 pax. However it was so good that i finished it eventhough it was only 2 of us. The skewers were well seasoned and i enjoyed the chicken innards skewer although we were deceived by the sausage skewer thinking it was the taiwanese sausage but it turned out to be just overpriced ntuc sausage. The barley was another plus point. Not too sweet and was cooling after a hot meal. Overall, would return for a meal again and to try other dishes.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content:
Order food for non spicy for kids, but all food come with chili in it.

Told them that there are chili in the dish, they just took out the chili and reserve the dish again.

Very dishonest and dirty of the restaurant to re-serving the food.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Super friendly staff. Good food.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Foods were so so only. Staffs were super not friendly and were super attitude.. Unable to arrange for 7 peoples but able to arrange for 6 peoples. JOKE OF THE YEAR 2022. 祝你们早日倒閉吧

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Love the place and the foods!

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Friendly staff, great dining experience with a range of delicious dishes.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content:
Di San Xian (Fried Potato, Eggplant and Pepper in Garlic Sauce 地三鲜)
This dish is delicious, no doubt!

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Enjoyed the mala frog legs and sweet & sour pork very much!! Sweet and sour pork is crispy, the mala sauce is very good with rice. Service is good too. Probably next time I will tell them not to deep fry the frog legs ((: (personal preference)

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: I have been finding the satay and Mala fish taste like this for a long time..really really nice.even my grandpa said 👉No Complaint with the taste..price are affordable 😍😍😍😍😍

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content:
We walked in without reservation at 2pm on a Sunday afternoon in Dec 2021 and there were many available tables.  Service was pleasant and prompt.

We ordered several dishes including the Chicken Hotpot, Griddle Cabbage with Pork, Spicy Fried Chicken, Tomato Eggs, and some assorted skewers.  Out of all the food, only the skewers were good.

The Chicken Hotpot was very disappointing, it was oily and the chicken were mostly chicken bones with little meat.  We ordered the Large portion but it was very little.  We had to add a plate of spicy fried chicken as there was very little meat.

The Griddle Cabbage was very oily, serving was small, and there were only 3 small slices of pork in it.

Tomato Egg was too salty and we needed rice to go with it.  We probably wont visit again in the near future, but if we do, we will probably only go for the skewers.

Total pax: 4
Total cost: $130 (food, with 2 botts of beer and 1 llum juice)

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content:
Service Bad. attitude is terrible.
Their Restaurant At Amk Dijtsun Mall. ytd i take away Mala xiang guo. While i  was eating I found that inside the food got a piece of rubber band. I came to exchange but staff didnt say sorry. the 2nd time still got the rubber band. so i told them. But all staff showed the black  face and told me "You come again?". "The rubber band doesn't belong to us, it is your rubber band. We dont have that kind of rubber band". Omg! I just bought only. Their attitude was like I owe them money. That's unacceptable. Please look in to it seriously if u still want to continue the business in this COVID 19.  U noe This issue i can report ur restaurant To NEA

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content:
Terrible service.
Waited for an hour for frog hot pot.

Only 4 tables were occupied at that time.
A table arrived 15 mins later than us, has been served their dishes.
The waitress attitude was very bad. One of the waitress actually replied “不管我的事！问主长！” Superior actually gave us permission to leave as they are unable to serve the dish after an hour.

NOT RECOMMENDED at all.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content:
Ordered 烤串- chicken and pork belly, quite nice, min order of 5 pcs, after eating the 1st 5 pc I ordered 5 more pcs.
Also ordered the 醋溜白菜. It’s quite expensive for veg and the plate is quite small too. Taste is ok, for those who don’t like too spicy and sour dish shd be ok. But I like my 醋溜白菜 to be more spicy.
Overall taste is good for the dishes I ordered. Will come back and try other dishes next time.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Saltiest ma la i've eaten in my life

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: mala here is not too bad, is quite fragrant. price used to be decent, i believe there is price increment recently as its slightly more expensive than when i ate here a year ago.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Expensive and taste so so only

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Bbq is good. Loved the chicken wings.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Experience here was overall really good. Waiters were really friendly and the mala xiang guo was so damn good including other side dishes like mapo tofu. Prices were also reasonable

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Food and drinks reasonable. Loves the food yummy and spicy.  Will come again with friends.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: One of my worst dining experience. Will never return back anymore. Food portion is not worth for the price. Horrible staff service, when being approached by the staff rude manners and not being understanding.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Food was good. Service was not, their server was giving attitude problems and they did not have a clear system in counting the alcohol. Issue was solved in the end but overall there were many unpleasant moments with the service given.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: THE WORST PLACE TO GO. The food isn’t fresh and they’re service is poorly Match and I don’t understand what they are trying to do. If you wanna try good food and good service never ever come to this store, period.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Did not patronise but was at Djitsun mall today and saw a member of staff wearing her apron into the toilet cubicle. After coming out she left the toilet without washing her hands. Disgusting standards of personal hygiene. Plus f&b staff are generally not supposed to wear aprons to the bathrooms - how could they allow that?

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Food is good and value for money but service is horrible. Sometimes feel like my mala xiang guo is short changed and ridiculously long waiting time at some times.

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Not good, feel they discriminate locals

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Food is reasonably priced and tasty

restaurant name: Ah Gu Kaka Wa 国昌川味馆
content: Food is somewhat overpriced, wouldn’t recommend getting their frog dishes

restaurant name: Chang Cheng - 531 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10
content: The lady staffs is so rude and shouting with my wife after purchasing the food. So rude and still argue and I just told her off.

It has been a while since I've had salted egg anything, so my review may be a little biased. The salted egg pork ribs were flavourful and the sauce was generous. Enough salted egg omph in my opinion. The oysters in the oyster omelette were big and tasted fresh - no fishy taste. French beans were meh for the price paid and could be skipped. The special tofu didn't feel very special but still alright. The fried Ee mian was not bad too. Total cost for 5 dishes was $50 for 4 pax.

For 3 of us, we ordered the pork ribs, sambal kangkong and clay pot bean curd with 3 rice. Total $29.10 ... I like that they deep fry the pork ribs first then coat with savoury sweet sour sauce. The sambal kangkong was also delicious. Fried with enough "haebi" giving it a robust sambal belachan taste. I've eaten the same stuff elsewhere but it was another level up over here.  Highly recommended. Sorry for not having photos as we walloped the food and then realising after that we should have.
Good quality food at reasonable price. Good to dine in with well decorated environment that does not look like coffeeshop. Had pork curry rice and white bee hoon. Was good.
Food not really nice. 東坡肉too tough.taste not the same as last time.

My family's go-to zichar place as it's within walking distance and is better than the other one near our home. Prawn paste chicken and xo pork ribs are our favourites. The sautéed broccoli with garlic is also just nicely done, not undercooked or overcooked. Love their San lau horfun, too. Fried rice is quite good, so is their beef fried rice. Their fish slice fried rice wasn't good though with slightly cold fish slices like it was cooked beforehand, put into the fridge, and then just thrown in with the fried rice when the rice was done. Their chicken fried rice was also not so good with pieces of chicken that was hard.
This place got nice food with big portion. However, the counter staff (aunty) is quite rude and not friendly

Reached this place due to a heavy rain cutting a cycling trip short. It was nearing closing hours but the auntie who served us still did it with a smile. She was also considerate enough to remind us to order drinks if we need as the coffeeshop will be closed soon.

Tried the San Lao Hor Fun and the Ee Mee. Both were very tasty.

The San Lao Hor Fun came with thick gravy. The beansprouts were crispy and the fish slices were fresh.

The Ee Mee was fragrant and enjoyable with the slightly burnt taste which is missing from so many other Zhi Char stores nowadays.

Food is mediocre and average. Place is well-decorated and looks good from the outside. Assam fish we ordered was not fresh. Sambal potato leaves is near tasteless. Prawn Paste Chicken wasn't too bad. Gst and sevice charge is inclusive in the dish price. Hits and misses in their food. May come back here again if they improve.

0 would be my rating for their staff impolite and impatient attitude especially two of the short hair ladies (one is the cashier and another is the waitress). I went here twice and each time an incident will happen. They are rude, have no manners, and poor services. I will never come to this restaurant again! Good luck to their business!

The quality of the food is getting from bad to worse. And the service crew at Blk 422 AMK is so rude. I was having my usual lunch alone after a morning run nearby and ordered from them. When the food come, instead of placing the plate of rice in front of me, she placed it one seat away, and the sauce spilled out due to the impact when she placed the food on the table. Did I owe them any money? Or have I been particularly rude to them? I dont think so. So why do the customer warrant such attitude from the service crew? If this is the quality of service you are providing, all the best to your business.
I ordered the salted egg crabs and fried mantou. Chef picked the good ones and as requested, was given good amount of sauce. It was really yummy and we enjoyed it a lot. Thank you! 海中果然有宝。

We always come here for their crabs either salty eggs crabs, butter milky crabs and chillies crabs...
We came here before the lock down again so bought 2 crabs knew that sure cannot finish so we brought home for next day lunch with bee hoon added,  still very nice..
Price are so reasonable that we always come back again..

I wish I could leave a pic here too... just now got the order via Food panda.  And the size of fried "large" hor fun is simply outrageous! It's just a normal 1 serving that you can get from any other restaurants of this type in Singapore. Expected a dinner for 2 but at the end had to order from other providers. Oh, and the price for that "large" hor fun is $16!!!!

Zichar stall staff's attitudes are pretty lacking. Food-wise is disappointing and standards dropping compared to last year. Hopefully they can improve n train their staff well instead of replacing them every 6 mths or so. Staff morale is low & most of them seem forced to work.
No frills Zi char stall...but quality not as good as before..just stick with the usual noodles and rice dishes, avoid pairing dishes with steam rice...
Horfun taste good as usual but I saw a small little worm in my horfun 4 days ago. Was it from the vegetables?

Service at this place is like a unicorn - absolutely non-existent.
There were occasions of real confusion when we were conversing, obviously, in the same language but nothing went across.

this is 1 star because that is the minimum Google requires.
I like their fried rice. Portion is good and taste ok. Not the best but in amk area, its quite ok.
Okay . Because I stay above this coffeeshop.

Above the usual for a zichar place
Food was good and tasty and well portioned for its price
It will be good to have partition for smoking corner at Ang Mo Kio blk422.

Updated Aug 2018.
Standard drop from 4 to 2 stars. Mee Goreng is almost ketchup noodle
Good food. Value for money. Nice seating for an open air coffee shop.
Good food at reasonable prices in a HDB neighborhood and with better interiors that are comparable to restaurants.
Pretty normal food, genuine attitude. I seldom bother to give bad reviews.
Food was not very nice.. staff didnt seem very enthusiastic that we were there.
Value for money, great food. Best to book for special occasions.
Very expensive zi-char place. Charge restaurant price for a coffee shop setup.
Food was not very good. Staff did not seem very energetic that we were there.
Curry chicken rice! Pork rib rice and fried fish soup is the best!!!
Very good food at reasonable price.
The clay pot crab bee Hoon soup is not that great.
Ok. The food taste is not bad.
Pepper beef not bad
Food is ok but expensive
Great food good price
Opens late and now with new app ordering service
Food soso. Some Staff not friendly.
Great food and clean
Waiter not very friendly.

San Bao Vegetarian
Vegetarian food here
Very good food.
Great chinese food
Wonderful
Wok hei food here
Convenient Location

(Translated by Google) A place to eat seafood, usually go to the dishes, tastes great. It’s just that the dishes are too light.

(Original)
一个吃海鲜的地方，平常去菜式，味道都很棒。只是年菜显得太清淡了些。

(Translated by Google) Building

(Original)
Bau

It’s just a counter for taking away, no seating for dining at the moment
It’s soft launching, has not officially opened yet. Thus no long queue, waiting time (after order placed) is about 5-10min, kitchen will prepare upon order (steam or deep fried)

Food wise, not everything on menu is available now, e.g char siew polo pau.

Price wise is at the high side. But taste was ok . Will patronage again

Only takeaway. Price is about the same as a restaurant - perhaps due to the excessive packaging. Quality of food is good. Would have given it 4-5stars if price is more friendly given that it is located in a heartland.

Service has been pretty fast and the food is yummy.  The dumpling in spicy chilli oil is quite good though I will prefer for it to be even more spicy.

Visit my IG: Joslovesfood for more food exploration.
Went today, not much crowd during sunday lunch time. Friendly aunty. We ordered chee chong fun, siew mai, ha gao. Quite standard. Dont try the red bean bun, super dry. Rest of the food was ok.

As the name implies, this is more for take away than for dining in. There are a few tables inside but it is really cramped for groups more than 2 pax. Price is reasonable and standard of dim sum is better than most places - we had it dine in instead of take away. There was not a lot of take away when we were there so food was getting served about 5 mins of waiting.

Service is abit slow after ordering, approximately wait for 15mins.
The fried dim sum, example fried seafood bean curd, alot of grease drip when bite. Overall, food tasting not worth the price. Too expensive.
Just a look at the photo and you know how inconsistent the food is. Totally not worth it and it cost just about as much as restaurant price for takeaway.

Very pleasant experience. I frequent their flag ship outlet at Jalan Besar area when they were still those old run down dim sum place.
Now they are closer to me at Amk, I love their mee suah kueh. Always my favourite. Their banana prawn is awesome too. Yam paste with ginkgo nuts is good too.

Really nothing to complain about. It’s very very tasty. Their set menu is very affordable too !

Good job Swee Choon! But if possible to move inside the mall it’s even better so can queue and wait in aircon area.
Generally dim sum is ok except for the egg tart.. the egg tart need more improvement.

seriously big waste of time and money. also the WORSE hargao ive had in my life. cold and dry. ordered 2 pcs of meesua kueh and 2 pcs of hargao, and waited 20 mins! while my food sat at the counter turning cold! after i placed my order the cashier told me to wait outside the glass door and she would call me when my orders ready. the billboard which flashed the queue numbers never updated. i stood outside the shop for a GOOD 20 MINS AND GUESS WHAT? MY FOOD WAS LONG READY, SITTING AT THE INNER COUNTER, AND THE LADY NEVER NOTIFIED ME WHEN SHE SAID SHE WOULD. I GOT IMPATIENT AND ASKED WHERES MY FOOD, THEN THE LADY WHO PROMISED TO NOTIFY ME BUT DIDNT HANDED ME MY COLD FOOD. ALL THESE COULD BE PREVENTED IF THEY FIXED THEIR SYSTEM AND HAD BETTER CUSTOMER SERVICE!

Very good spot and conveniently located near taxi stand. If you crave for Swee Choon Legendary Dim sum this is certainly a good place to satisfy your craving. Self ordering kiosk works just fine. I step in , select few dishes for me and my family, receipt printed out with a queue number. Less than 5minutes my order are readily available. Taste as good as I remembered, food are excellent. Highly recommended 👍🏻👍🏻
Only takeaway, price wise rather steep! Compared to dine in. Do note that there is a price hike when you order via grab!

Ordered a bunch of food for takeaway, turned out they have missed an order despite the slow service and the little amount of people and orders from their takeaway board. I doesn't know how low standard this branch can gets but if Google review allows negative star this would be minus 2 star. They should have done their diligent can check the amountof food with the orders. Disappointed with swee choon for allowing their branches to provide substandard service.

slow service, we were told to wait for our orders in the hot afternoon sun, everyone was sweating. Order took about 10-15 mins to be ready though queue wasnt to long. Menu was rather pricy for a heartland takeaway kiosk, but sure if I will buy again. Shengkee & other dimsum/dessert  places provides better options, more choices & better value.
I like their plain chee cheong fun texture. French toast loved by my boy. Go off peak and the wait will be more bearable. We went like brunch hours. Not 5 stars because 输在har gao is disappointing.

I placed a pre-order at 9:30am to be delivered at 6pm, and my order was cancelled at 5:43pm without any form of communication. When I tried to place an order again, they cannot be found on Foodpanda anymore.

The Mrs and I ordered an assortment of dishes such as the porridge, tofu bomb, egg tarts, siew mai etc. The Mrs raved immensely about the porridge and it shows as we dropped by earlier today around noonish and the porridge was already out of stock. Personally, among all the dishes I tried, the tofu bomb is the one I would come back for. The price and portion is reasonable. It obtains what seems like diced up pieces of prawn, possibly fish paste, chives and probably small pieces of chilli. It is flavourful with a hint of spiciness from the chilli inside. As it's deep fried, it's the usual moist but mostly from the oil it soaked up from the cooking process. Ordering system and waiting time was acceptable. We were able to figure it out without any assistance. We will definitely come back for more again!

The worst customer experience ever! They ask you join the queue to order. After order, the system allowed you to order and pay. You will be asked to wait outside under the hot sun. After waiting for so long, they will tell you out of stock and refund you. So you basically queue to get refund of your own money! Such a waste of time! Staffs are rude too!

It says Swee Choon Express. It should be called Swee Choon Slow. I waited for 15 min for two orders of pao. They should not have the word 'Express' for the amk branch so as to manage customers expectation. I recommend that you make your order then go for a walk at the hub then return to collect.

Bot some pau and har gao...fresh and delicious. However disappointed with the fun choy...seem to have kept for some time...apparently staff did not observed slow moving food...Price is a bit stiff in this neighborhood area...though the packing is reasonable good.
Love it here, the dim sum still up to standard, just hate the long queue

Where is mine pulut hitam? When i reach home i found mine pulut hitam is missing.How can i claim this?On top of that the rice roll not even give me the sauce. A bit disappointed. Can one staff help to do QC on the food packaging to make sure everything is in order plsss.
Express kiosk for takeaway only besides taxi stand...prices abit high like those in yum cha rst to me... Haven't patronize for a long time
Ordered chee cheong fun thru grab delivery. No sauce was given. How to eat!!??
Dim sum is ok. Only can takeaway. Ordering and pickup system is similar to fast food outlets.
My advice for dim sum patrons. This is certainly not Express, instead the waiting time is damn long. Try it if you have spare time to wait.
Bad service and lousy order pickup management. The cashier was rude and the aunties are so blur, not helpful in checking order.
Hair in the rice roll😢
Great food as usual 😋

Very poor management, waited for very long but the food is ready and hiding inside🙄
Will not patronise anymore
Come and try.. 👍
Horrible tasteless peanut porridge without peanut NOT WORTH

(Translated by Google) The take-out chee cheong fun without the sauce, how should I eat it?
🙄
Bad review 👎

(Original)
外帶豬腸粉沒給醬汁 請問要怎麼吃
🙄
差評👎

(Translated by Google) Things are getting more and more unpalatable, the red oil is chasing hands, the smell of pork is very strong, and the bean paste buns have also regressed.

(Original)
东西越来越难吃，红油抄手，猪腥味好重，豆沙包也退步了

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: A very traditional looking shop and my friend commented she felt like shes back home in China. The 梅菜扣肉was really good. Not overly seasoned and jus right with rice. Love the salted chicken, simple but yet can taste the original taste of the dish. The chilli is really good as some reviewers have commented. 算盘子is very unique.. unlike the commercial selling ones that's very chewy, this is slightly more towards sour and also very powdery full of yummy yam rather than flour.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content:
Heard of this shop from reviews by some friends and decided to check it out. First feel is that the shop is really old school and authentic.

We chose the 4 pax package. The hakka noodles and suan pan zi felt like it was pre cooked, instead of cooked fresh. The taste of the hakka noodles were abit disappointing in the sense that it was to the blender side. However, this might be because the other dishes are saltier and the noodles might be meant to be eaten with the other dishes.

The yong tau foo is really nth to shout out about. Average at best.

The 梅菜扣肉 was towards the saltier side, but I really like the flavor. I would have given a higher rating if the pork was more tender. But some people like it that way. The chicken was nicely done.

Their chillis are a must try for those who are in for a kick and it really blends well with all the dishes.
