Staff was courteous, efficient, and nice. One thing I really liked was that this restaurant serves Chinese tea or warm water foc. Which is so hard to find nowadays and something I really appreciate.

Overall, price was very decent and it is a nice establishment to support and visit. All da best to their business.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content:
Authentic Hakka restaurant tucked within Sembawang Hills, been here for more than 30 years. Upon entering you will be greeted by a cozy vibe with traditional red lanterns and maps.

Ordered 4 pax meal for $52 that includes all their signature dishes. Tea is charged for $1 each, refillable.
Hakka Noodles and Mei Cai Kou Rou on the drier side but it was still as tasty.
Spring onion beef tripe is an additional order and it was chewy with light hint of spring onions that isn't overpowering.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: Authentic hakka dishes. 梅菜扣肉👍🏼👍🏼taste and meat is just nice. Chili paste is superb 👍🏼👍🏼 tea is $1 per pax. Deducted 1 ⭐️because the soup base of yong tofu is a bit salty. Overall 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: We walked-in without reservation on vesak day evening at 5.30pm. We are a family of 4. We are lucky to be able to have a table as the restaurant is fully booked. We were told that we can only have the table till 6.30pm as they have reservations. We are fine with it. We ordered the 4 person set which is a very big portion. Ordered additional 2 white rice to eat with the 梅菜扣肉. Best decision. Guess which dish got wipe out by us first 😄. Within 5 mins after ordering , the dishes are served. Wow. Impressive. As a hakka, the dishes fits our profile, salty enough...Will bring my parents here next time.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: Was disappointed with their menu selection. Imagine the four of us had to order every single dish on the menu to have enough to eat! So sad that COVID had hit this restaurant so badly that they had to diminish their menu to so small.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: When I made a few sporadic visits for takeaway last year, the food standard for their regular dishes kind of dropped. During the Chinese New Year period the 梅菜扣肉 was bland. However, last month's takeaway of their set menu was the best. All the dishes still taste good although it's a takeaway. The portions are big. Well worth the $48. My family polished off the food that night. But I have not tried their delivery service though.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: This should be a destination and heritage dinning location.  Love the nostalgic ambience and authentic Hakka food. Must visit.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content:
In my personal opinion, overall experience just average. Service is a struggle during lunch with only 1 or 2 staff available for the whole restaurant. Understandable... but...

The most disappointing is the quantity of the food served. Small portion is pretty much for 1 pax. While even medium at best is 3 pax. The worse dish is the steam chicken. Priced min. at $18.80 and smallest available is only medium size, full of bones & very little meat. I have to clean the bones like a vulture so there will be meat for my lady friends. I dare to say never in my life to eat such tiny quantity at such price.

Food in pics total up to $90 for 3 pax. Sorry last min. take because trying all food with too high expectations i guess...

Other than that, overall food taste like home cook. Nothing impressive much. Perhaps great place for older folks. Most customer i see are old people. Just observations...

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content:
One of the oldest hakka restaurant in Singapore. Bamboo windows, hazardous power sockets with too many plug-ins, round table with my grandmother's tablecloth, newspaper cutout on a piece of cupboard for a menu, and 1970s kampung photos made up the interior. Food looked homecooked, but the flavours are just....wow. Saucy salted chicken that fall off the bones paired with scallion oil dip, an unseemingly normal tofu with meat that exploded with umani, and a wok-hei fried-egg noodles are just some of the highlights. Love the vibes, would love to see this place stay like this.

Edit: Sitting by the windows, i saw the waiter rushing out with a bag of food towards a waiting car with windows rolled down. So they still do food pickup like the old days! Just so much memories!

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: Authentic Hakka dishes served at very reasonable prices. Food is not too salty, unlike many other restaurants. 猪肚 in the 猪肚汤 is super soft. 梅菜扣肉 is soft, fragrant, and you can savour the original taste of 梅菜. 算盘子 is soft and fragrant and not the rubbery kind. Only downside is very hard to find parking nearby.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: Authentic Hakka food with generous serving and warm hospitality. Their food are homemade dishes that will warm the cockles of your heart. The boss treats customers like friends and ensures that they are well taken care of. Would recommend making reservations on weekend as they would be packed.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: Fantastic service and authentic Hakka food. We absolutely enjoyed our dinner here. Will definitely return. Our child dropped her fork and the old man (I think must be the owner) came with a new set of cutlery without us asking for it. Very lovely man.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content:
Despite all the fave reviews, the place didn't quite live up to the expectations.

The food was decent and honestly nothing to shout about.

Service was less than desirable, especially when calling for a reservation. Pricing was definitely reasonable and we do really get too many hakka restaurants around, which makes this place unique.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: At last get to try this Hakka restaurant. Ordered a set for 4 at SGD48. Really worth it. Taste is close to original Hakka village claim by grandma. Do book early to avoid disappointment. Am lucky to walk in n have a seat.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: Pass by this restaurant many times before but did not entry as it seems to be rather rustic. Recently a famous blogger visited and rave about the food here. Decided to visit since we are in the area. So glad we did! The food is simple but tasty. They serve classic Hakka food and such reasonable prices!

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: Like their traditional Hakka food and the place is very cosy

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: The last time I was here must have been over 20 years ago… same familiar taste, very authentic Hakka. Just like how my grandparents used to cook. Must try: salt chicken, bitter gourd Yong tao fu with the bean broth… and abacus, of course.!  Even a simple noodle with minced pork.. al dente! Or QQ :).  Way ahead of Koo Kee… Place is simple even though aged.. personable service, like you walked into someone’s home. The patriarch pacing around the restaurant… and complimentary sweet potato  black sugar ginger syrup. A few elderly gentlemen just walked in.. and the patriarch just said: 我给您准备一个菜心、算盘子、酿豆腐…  customers just said… OK!   Do check them out soon. Keep the old banner and traditional taste going…

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content:
Super Old school One of the rate gems that has survived many decades
The gal ours almost taste home cooked
Service is personable
Price is  reasonable

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content:
This is authentic Hakka Restaurant. I'm so happy when found this restaurant which served authentic Hakka dishes.

The restaurant environment here looks like 80s. There is also lantern hanging with lantern riddles. Heard from the owner if guess correctly, may have prize.

Ordered some Hakka dishes like Miced Meat Noodle, Fried Prawns with Hakka Wine, Fried Yam ball and Yong Tau Fu.

I love the Hakka dishes here. Definately will come again....

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: We don’t have too many people so we could only sample some of their Hakka dishes but so far all have been fantastic. The boss even threw in a small appetizer Hakka spring roll which I guess was to thank us for our patience in waiting for a table. Services were good! Felt quite homely and like the older days when you still can see the boss in the restaurant, which is unlike most other that have been commercialized. Price was reasonable.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: This place serves nice Hakka dishes. Very homely & comfy vibe inside the restaurant too. Went there during off peak timing, so it’s not crowded at all. I ordered rice to go with the dishes, but next time I’ll order porridge rice instead😙👍

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: Very friendly staff who’s accommodating to our requests. Dinner with 24 pax and food was great. They even allowed us to bring our own cake with no extra charge; provided us with plates & utensils for cake cutting too.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: Authentic Hakka restaurant located at Upper Thomson area. Serves Hakka dishes such as yam abacus 算盘子, salted chicken, yong tau foo and 梅菜扣肉。Decoration is very 70's style and bring back memories from that era. Worth the trip up north if you are craving for Hakka food.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: The food was very light. Compared with the usual Chinese Asian dishes the food tastes more like home cooked dishes done by your grandma. Not very flavourful but not bad in general. Simply put it nothing really stands out much, but it’s a cozy place to have home made food. The only downside was probably the heat inside. The aircon was not working even though there are two. We kept sweating during the dinner. Hope it can be fixed.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content:
This place is super underrated !!!
The food here was so good that we ordered another round of the same dishes ! If you're looking for the classic Hakka Abacus (算盘子), look no further ! They made it really fragrant and soft in texture. The dishes in my images are definitely fail safe. Order them to try!

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: Recommend the preserved veg braised pork belly and yong tofu amongst the dishes I tried.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: No fuss or frills authentic Hakka cuisine, at very affordable prices. Must come for anyone who loves genuine good food.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content:
Earnest and humble restaurant. It is as though you are invited to a Hakka family to enjoy a meal in their home. Delicious, authentic, generous and affordable. For those who enjoy having restaurant food that does not have a 'central kitchen / factory' taste, this is definitely a place worth trying.

The dishes we tried are:
1. 客家付卷 - Hakka Beancurd Fritters
2. 客家酿豆腐 - Hakka Yong Tou Foo
3. 梅菜扣肉 - Braised Pork with Preserved Vegetable
4. 蚝油奶白 - Nai Bai in Oyster Sauce
5. 东江盐鸡 - Steamed Chicken
6. 萝卜丸 - Radish Balls

Note: Some dishes (especially the steamed chicken) may be a tad salty for some; but it's perfect for me!

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content:
Awesome Traditional Hakka food!
Good service and great food!

We ordered the Hakka specialties like, the 算盘子，Salted baked chicken, the Hakka tofu and the pig intestine soup.

The 算盘子 and Chicken is a must order.. Taste is really super.

Definitely will return to eat again if we are at Thomson area.

Rating : 5/5 stars

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: Very fast service with some interesting dishes. Closes a bit too early on a Saturday

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: Authentic Hakka food that is delicious and affordable as well! Very homely environment and portions are generous even for the small orders. Love the complimentary dessert as well.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: Yummy and tasty hakka food. Quick service, down to earth place. Very home-ly place and we love it!

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: True blue Hakka experience. It’s a really small restaurant so definitely recommend making a reservation the day before, especially if you’re a big party. The 梅菜扣肉 and 盐鸡 are legit. Portions are generous and an absolute value for money treat. Highly recommend it!

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: Good food, value for money. Restaurant is understaffed so expect some time in waiting. YTF is slightly bland but the abacus seed and chicken are very good. Will be back again.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: This is an institution! It's got that precious old school charm/ vibe, and the food doesn't disappoint, nor the warm/ friendly service from the stately hosts. 油麦菜，梅菜扣肉，客家炒面 were all very good, and still a handful of menu items we've not been able to order/ try. The patronage on a Friday evening seemed good and I hope the good business continues, so our local culinary scene could stay vibrant - especially with restaurants like this.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: The food in this restaurant was expensive. We (5 adults) ordered 6 dishes all medium portion and cost us $113.60 which equate to $22 per pax. The half salt chicken was too dry, yong tau foo soup, abacus yam and fermented prawn so so only. Only The vege was nice and mei chai pork belly not salty but okay. If u are not a hakka, please turn back.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: Food is delicious and price is very reasonable. 5 of us and less then $100. They offer us a free dish tat taste like shrimp roll & free sweet potato soup. I love the 梅菜扣肉 which is awesome. The stuffed toufu in Claypot is quite large so it takes up most of our stomach space!

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content:
The best and last few rare authentic Hakka Restaurant in Singapore that does justice to its true blue Hakka roots! 💯💯
-Salt Baked Chicken
-Yam Abacus Seed
-Fried Prawn w Hakka Red Wine
-Stuffed Beancurd
-Preserved Vegetable w Pork Belly
-Hakka Spring Rolls
Highly Recommended!

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content:
Made a reservation here and specially travelled here from the east. However, my dad forgot to bring his phone but only his token. The waiter refused to allow to enter since my dad do not have his phone.

I asked them to used the app to perform the verification but they refused to do so. Very disappointed by their service. They are probably sticking to traditions...

If you wish to come pls remember to bring your phone and ur old parents' phones too.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content:
Favourite Hakka/Chinese restaurant to have a hearty satisfying meal. You better make reservations esp on weekends, if not arrive when they open and you might be lucky.
A must order is their Hakka Tofu and Preserved Veg with Braised Pork. I also tried their duck before and it was amazing. This place is well loved by my family, hubby and friends too!

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content:
35yrs of serving Hakka food.
What can go wrong?
Top rated!

#梅菜扣肉
#算盘子

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: One of the best, if not the best Hakka Restaurant in Singapore. My favorite salt-baked kampung chicken #freerange

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: Really nice Hakka food. They feel like home food and very affordable for a restaurant.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: Overall not bad. The 梅菜扣肉 tasted more at the sweet side though. Would definitely recommend the vinegar pork leg. Yummms!

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content:
Very good food that tastes like a home-cooked meal at zichar prices, in a homely restaurant that harks back to 80s or even 70s Singapore. All the dishes my group of 4 had were delicious: preserved vegetables with pork, red wine sauce prawns, salt-baked chicken, yong tau foo, Hakka fried yam, even the basic broccoli. Service was prompt and attentive. There was no GST or even service charge! We'll definitely be back soon.

The restaurant also prepares bento boxes for takeout for only $5.80. If only I lived nearby.

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content:
Delicious family-run restaurant which has been around for generations. Hopefully it will continue to be around for longer in to the future.

Their salted chicken, braised pork with vegetables and tofu are all amazing. My favourites dishes. Great every time!

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: Nice, cozy and traditional setup restaurant to enjoy your favourite Hakka dishes and meals. Great services and fantastic dining experience. Will surely return again when craving for my favourite Hakka dishes that bring back my mum cooking and memories. 👍👍👍👍👍

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content: Cheery service, very tasty food! Don't miss the 算盘子 (fried yam balls, "abacus seeds") and the salt chicken!

restaurant name: Plum Village Restaurant, 梅村酒家
content:
Tried their set menu for 4 persons. We like the braised pork, tofu, and salted chicken (looks dry but it’s not, thanks god). The fried noodle is a bit bland and the yam chicken is not what we like.

Make sure you know a bit mandarin since they don’t have English menu and speaks little English.

It is located at Blk 555 Ang Mo Kio Ave 10.It is a neighbourhood Chinese restaurant serving Northern Chinese and Szechuan cusuines.The restaurant is not big in size , so sitting capacity is limited.The restaurant is quite vacant in the day and gets alittle busier in the evenings during dinner time.On Sundays the business is better.The food standards depends on individuals as taste and preferences for foods differs individually
Example if you like Northern Chinese or Szechuan ( Hot & Spicy ) foods , then you may like the foods.Parking wise is easy at the HDB car park behind.Public busstop is also just at the road ( Ang Mo Kio Ave 10 ) infront, quite convenient also.

Dated : 09/04/ 2019 ( Tuesday ).
Posted 2 photos.
Nice 🐠 and 🐣 very economical price
Value for money, good fo9d
Annoying staff with rude service.

Tried the Alacart buffet on a Friday night (need at least 3 pax). The food was really great. I recommend the spicy lala, prawn paste chicken, romantic prawn. The spicy steam fish is amazing too. Give the yam a chance, it’s amazing! The other desserts are so so only!  Definitely would come back again!

Wendy Tan service is really amazing! Kudos to her and her team for the great service! Birthday boy can dine for free! Would come back here again

Very good food and service. The abalone, LALA, and Yam paste is a must try!!!

Our waitress Wendy Tan really went out of the way to make us welcome.

😍😍😍😍 WILL COME BACK AGAIN!

This was where we held our wedding. I liked the flexibility of being able to upgrade dishes from the cheapest plan to those that we liked better. I also appreciated other perks that were included in the package including the printing of wedding cards, wedding favours and free corkage.

Owen was an amazing coordinator who never failed to respond to my questions and arrange to things I require on the wedding day. Wendy helped me on the actual wedding day, leading us in and out of the ballroom for changing, as well as with the tea ceremony.

We were also able to book a meeting room at the Grassroots' Club separately for our tea ceremony which made things really convenient.

My guests loved the ballroom and food and we had an amazing time all in all.

Thank you so much for helping us hold such a successful wedding! Eternal Garden Restaurant has proved that you don't need to hold your wedding at a fancy and expensive hotel to have a wonderful wedding. Would totally recommend this place if you're looking for a small venue for 50 to 100 pax though they can probably accommodate up to 200 people too.

The wedding venue was clean and spacious. It was not bad. We eventually chose to go with Qian Xi but i had a very bad experience with Torrance.

Torrance was really disrespectful throughout the conversation for discussion of prices, number of tables and so and so. Torrance paid no heed to me and talked over me when i am asking questions about the banquet. He looked at my husband the entire time and it was like i didn’t exist the entire time. I felt really horrible because it was supposed to be a gathered discussion, it seemed like my opinion did not matter. My husband even tried to include me but Torrance would just ignore me. Really really horrible experience. But because of time constraints we had no choice but to go with Qian Xi.

Thankfully, Owen was really helpful throughout the entire experience and provided lots of assurance and insights about the flow etc. Feedbacks during the food tasting was taken into consideration and food was really good during the banquet itself! Staff service was good as well!

Anyways, we had feedback to some of our friends about Torrance and they seem to have similarly bad experience. Beware of this Torrance dude cause he might just ruin your day.
good value for money!  Wendy Tan is the best waitress  Ive ever encountered in Singapore. Very friendly and she seems enjoy her work fully.

All the dishes are delicious, the best should be the steamed fish.
For those who're vegetarians they will separately serve if you gathered within same table

Kampong chicken and duck looked and tasted overnight. All the other dishes below par. Any normal zi char outside is better. Will probably not go back there again. Actually the worst i have been to.

Pro: Super friendly staffs.
Con: The food really can't make the cut.

All the dishes are delicious, the best should be the steamed fish..
Price $$
held our tea ceremony and luncheon banquet over here, excellent service and food is awesome!!
Wonderful place for birthday lunch. Had buffet lunch there, food and service was great.

(Translated by Google) Came here for the first time, every dish is delicious 😋
The dishes are hot, very satisfied 😍

(Original)
第一次来这里吃，每道菜都好吃😋
菜是热的，很满意😍
Teochew porridge is cheap and yummy

We came by for lunch on Good Friday holiday. Ordered the signature steam chicken, yam ring with sweet & sour pork and spinach. All dishes were well-executed and flavourful. Service was good at this outlet. Advisable to make a table reservation on weekends for indoor seating. Price was reasonable for the portions. Happy to be back again :)
Ordered for 6 pax today, food is good 👍🏻 chicken’s the highlight of course 🤣 bean sprout tasted a little raw, could be cooked more thoroughly. Portion is good and price is fair 😊

Food were nice, Chicken was tender and juicy. Love the Coffee Pork Ribs, Claypot Taufoo was pretty good, filled with fish slices, prawns, brocoli, black fungus, mushrooms and taufoo. Love the Fish Maw Soup too! The Chicken rice was delicious which was cooked with Alchemy fibre added and was said to be lower GI.

2nd May 2022, public holiday, took mom to several places but packed came over here as she never step in before.  She was lucky to get seats after I dropped her 1st.  The table is filled with side dishes, I enter 5 mins after and got a shocked.  The honey chardoew is nice, pigs neck braised, haebeehiam and braise peanuts are awesome.  Order the 3 eggs spinach and a plate of steamed chicken  for 1 pax , 1 pot of chrysanthemums tea and we are done.

Mom loved the food as she seldom dine out of her zone ar her neighbourhood.

Staff were friendly and helpful.  Overall my boss said good choice.
Phew...
Regardless which outlet you choose, the food is delicious (standard is there). Family of 3 -Had half a chicken de-boned, 3 plates of Cha Siew (very nice), fried toufu and a plate of veg.

The service was pretty bad. I mean, we’re paying customers, not the wait staff’s debtors. Food was slightly below expectations I mean… fried tofu is a pretty standardised dish. Chicken could be more tender and was fatty.

Try chicken house at upper Thomson if you want better chicken rice
Had a family meal, the service was great and so was the food. I made a booking and good thing I did it because it was soon busy for lunch!

This is the only place I don't mind steamed chicken instead of roasted chicken. The rice is very fragrant and we ended up eating many bowls. Service was good. The takeaway offer at $5.50 before gst is a good deal.

Taste: love it!
Esp. the tofu is really nice!! Soft and smooth and tasty

Vegetarian options available

Their Bento sets are really nice and premium. The only problem I have is only 1 Vegetables choice which is Kai Lan and nobody’s favorite. The restaurant at AMK is getting dated and is in dire need of a renovation.

Extremely bad experience. How is it possible that a chicken rice restaurant have no chicken to sell especially on Mother's Day? Extremely bad planning! It's a day of celebration, and you should anticipate that it's a day where crowds will gather especially since covid restrictions have been eased! Extremely disappointed as this is not the first time I have exprienced this. Will not recommend this place.

My favourite Boon Tong Kee branch. The service is good; steamed chicken is excellent as always; 3 eggs spinach is great; char siew is so-so. The only dissatisfaction is the rice - not as fragant as its Boon Keng branch in my opinion. Overall, still a good place for steamed chicken rice.

Used to patronise this place because food was good. Today's dinner us a disappointment.  The chicken is not tender and meaty like it used to be. Understand because of inflation everything is expensive. But for the price paid for this standard of food I think its not worth. Many hawker stalls now serve tastier chicken rice.

One of the more famous chicken rice restaurant in Singapore. Ordered their signature steamed chicken and also the fried chicken. Chicken wise is good but not the best. However, the fried chicken can be a bit dry. Also ordered the sweet sour pork, fried mixed vegetables, barbecued pork and the soupy spinach with Yong Taohu. The other dishes are great and complements the soft fluffy flavorful rice very well. Highly recommend their sides especially the barbecue pork. Ambience is good and service is prompt and efficient. However, can be crowded during lunchtime. Overall a good dining experience for family and large groups.

Good food at reasonable price. The service is excellent. The white chicken is a must try. We went for dinner for a family of 6 adults and paid $147 inclusive of service charge and GST. Ordered Assam Grouper, white chicken, homemade tofu, salad prawn, prawn ngoh hiang, abalone boiled vegetables. They served the char siew, boiled peanuts and shrimp paste as appetizers. They were tasty, especially the shrimp paste. If you like fatty char siew, it’s well caramelized and charred but not burnt. We enjoyed the nice ambiance and great service.

Great chicken rice of course!
Service was great and staff were friendly, food was served relatively quick
Usually gets crowded during peak hours

One of the worst Boon Tong Kee restaurant which is at Ang Mo Kio. The claypot liver was not cook properly looks like dirty liver. The claypot liver cook at Beliestier Road is so much better. The chicken rice is not serve hot, got to shout at them then they attend to you. Never eat there again

The best chicken Rice! There are many chicken rice stalls in Singapore  as it is a common dish Singaporeans have in our daily life. This stall to me, their way of making the Rice is the best! It is frangrance, not too oilly, and it packed in a bowl. You could simple eat it by itself without other dishes. The chili also very good! When people eat chicken rice,  another important factor is their Chicken rice chili. It is make with the chicken oil that come out when boiling the chicken and their special ingredient.  The chicken is tender and juicy, but not especially good. Usually they serve only the chili and dark black soya sauce, but you can and shold ask for ginger! This is traditional chicken stalls will serve. It blend very well with chili and black soya sauce also on chicken rice.

The other dishes that serve in the restaurent are well cook and delicious. They serve one traditional dish that is pig livers in clay pot, today you hardly find this dish. It is nice and smell really great with garlic. Another dish you may want to try is their deep fried toufu, its crispy and hot, it taste so good when u eat while it hot.

My wife and I went there for a weekend dinner. It was underneath a block of hdb flat which is uncommon but the service was prompt and the place was very family friendly (read: grandparents munching the life out of the drumstick, children monkeying around with mums keeping a watchful eye, dads with dismissive looks or have the eyes glued to their smartphones or the newspaper).

It looks more like a saizeriya restaurant than a Chinese restaurant but this food place brings me back esp the chicken.

Reasonably priced, good quick service, tasty rice and chicken, good for families.

Hainanese chicken is juicy n tender, however the rice a dispointment, the rice grain they use can be of better quality. The braised soft peanut is a great appetiser. The restaurant also have zi char menus which I think they have a good selection of dish. It is located next to a open air carpark.

Comfort food especially after or before  long overseas trip!! Always enjoy the rice and meats plus the chilli... and if the char siew is hot, worth the try as well!! Very good variety as well across tofu, yam ring and even sweet sour pork.. vege fresh and can order drinks with sugar aside.. and non aircon seating especially at this AMK joint.. enjoy the fresh air and amolw parking.. enjoy
Wait staff was very friendly. Chicken was tender, and the chicken rice was flavorful while not greasy.

It serves the best white chicken in heartland restaurants that I've eaten. The chicken was tender & juicy. Next is the sweet & sour fish. Very well seasoned & the taste is just right, served hot coming straight from the kitchen. Worth going there again.
Chicken is above average but the fried eggplant in mushroom sauce is good. Service is excellent, they refill our tea and ice promptly.

1. High prize for common street food
2. Good qualities for stuff eating
3. Quite greesy
4. The lemonade (orange something) not that tasty but nothing to pick atleast better than water of chrysanthemum
Surprisingly the stream fish was very nice. We never order chicken even they are famous for it. Just want to try other dishes

Purposely went there to have takeaway from Boon Keng as they have promotion using Amex. But is a little disappointed compare to the taste near to BK Station, I ordered the usual dishes I always did. The coffee pork ribs and pork belly wasn't really good. The chicken is still good. They didn't give enough ginger and chilli tho.

Had a feast for lunch.
Good standard for the various dishes.
Great customer service as well

It's a nice place to dine, nice food, chicken rice, sweet sour pork, fried tofu, egg omelette with prawn, all tasted very nice. Nice comfortable location, it's a residential area and it's quiet, thanks

咖啡排骨 is yummy, other dishes i had all tasty.
You better book the shop in advance.
Good food, but service standard could be improved. Should also consider introducing membership benefits for customers.
Conveniently located, so accessible with fuss-free parking, not so crowded setting, best of all consistent comfort "chicken rice" food!
Good.. love the dishes here. Tasty 🤤

Yummy!!!
We ordered Half a roast chicken, Spinach with 3 eggs, Fried Prawn Roll, Claypot chicken liver and Sliced Fish with Ginger. All for only $87!
Ample of parking space and if you are coming here on a weekend, do call in to reserve first! :)

I love the food here. Don't just think that coming here is just for the chicken rice. Their other zichar food like fried vegetables, fried tofu, sweet and sour pork is delicious.

My kids have been asking me when we can go and eat again.

Great chicken rice for a reasonable price. I ordered the white whole chicken. Soya sauce complimented the chicken well, and other dishes such as the sambal Kang Kong and crab meat steamed egg. Great atmosphere too. The app only applies for take away. Would recommend this place.

Was there yesterday afternoon with my customers. The service was fast and very polite. They have the warm and personal touch when ask for  recommendations of dishes. They know their menu very well. What food which page and even the ingredients. Well done. Will surely go again and support them.
Excellent service by the staff. Staff informed waiting time was around 30min at lunch, but was shorter than that. Food quality is always excellent.
The chicken and the chicken rice is ok. They should provide some drippings for take away I think. But staff is very friendly and professional. 😁

Plenty of parking lots outside. Service staffs are polite. Don't like that they ask you to get appetisers even before we started looking at the menu. The appetisers were $6 char siew (abt 10-12 pieces) and $2 steamed peanuts. Wet tissues at 30cents. I ordered $10 steamed chicken which seems not enough for 2 pax. Oil rice is nice but quantity is small. Their chilli is quite hot. Might not return. 925 yishun chicken rice has better steamed chicken.
Poor service.. long wait for collection when tour group came in tho I already made payment. Then forgot to put in one of my dish.. check before you leave.
Nice food, the usual BTK experience. It was quite crowded on a weekday lunch hour. Be sure to arrive early.

I must agree that Boon Tong Kee’s chicken is tender and good but then the service at Ang Mo Kio branch is really slow on all my 2 visits. For take away 4 packets of standard set order placed at Sunday 4.50pm had to wait for close 20-25 mins.
We had lunch for 3 person on 31.1.2022. The chicken rice taste was average. Pricy.

The chicken and accompanying rice with its sauce and chilli are always consistently delicious. The meat is tender and the soy sauce that soaks it gives it that additional oomph. Service staff is efficient and cheerful. Notice they are older staff and hence more spontaneous in reacting to customers' requests.
Best hainanese white chicken. Fuss free and so singaporean. Good mix of other local doses as well

The chicken rice that they are famous for is still pretty much the staple for this outfit, although they do serve up other complementary options as well. However, the food quality seems to have dipped somewhat since years ago, and many of the food items were slightly too salty (especially the roasted chicken).
As always, great chicken rice. Good service.

Atas chicken rice;
Fantastic service,
generous portions.

On the pricey side for 2; but as a family eating together, average cost sorts of goes down.

Tucked away,
Nice park opposite.

Very interesting place indeed. Very good services, most of thr staffs are bilingual too, even the older service staffs. Their chicken rice is very fragnant and its texture is also just for my 91 years old mother. Their steamed chicken is so tender and juicy too.

Had a family dinner here. Food is very good and value for money. Seafood very fresh too. Ordered all these dishes for $235+. Most expensive was the half roasted pig $125. May be a coffee shop but quite windy and not hot. Will definitely be back again.

1st time try out the food is tasty & value of money. A few dishes are recommended like sambal Kang kong, sweet & sour pork, beancurd with pork & preserved vegetable, Herbal chicken, Yam Ring  & golden cereal prawn. With definitely come back to try other dishes.

It's full house on a Saturday evening and it's a long wait for the dishes to be out. Food is nice generally but some aren't that great. The yam paste dessert isn't smooth enough. The steam fish is slightly overcooked.

Cheap seafood zi car place, you can’t ask for more these days. We had 16 pax with 8 dishes for 2 tables, only costs us $306. Really value for money.

Price - great!
Ambiance- can get a little stuffy since there’s is no aircond
Food - great!
Staff - easy going although they were super busy, they were not rude.
Location - good

We had
Pork meat bun - signature must try!
Curry fish head - Nyonya style, not Asam style, still good!
Herbal prawn in claypot - love it! Fresh prawn and legit herbal soup

Had an impromptu dinner here. Quiet, spacious place. Perhaps it’s a Thursday.

Service staff was polite and efficient. No hard selling or anything.

Ordered Indonesian pork (that’s the one in the claypot). It has a nice santan laksa taste to it. Perhaps it’s me trying it for the first time. There’s hae bee too, giving it a nice umami taste.

Minced pork with chai por tofu. Came totally drenched by the minced pork and chai por. Was nice except the saltiness came on stronger as you eat it.

Italian herb pork ribs. Not sure why I kept get reminded it’s salted egg.

Overall nice place for big groups. Food’s abit salty but I guess it’s bearable cos I like heavy flavours. ◡̈

The food is not the best zi char out there but definitely very decent and has a home cooked feel. Not too oily or salty and we were very happy with every dish.

Curry fish head was good. They tried to promote their more expensive red grouper but we had sea bass instead which was already very fresh, moist and well cooked.

Only thing is because this place is absolutely so big, it is hard to get someone when you need something or want to order.

For those who didn’t know. You be surprising that this well-liked seafood restaurant hide inside an Industrial Estate at Ang Mo Kio.

Kian Seng Seafood Restaurant @ 4013 Ang Mo Kio Industrial Park 1 #01-450 (Food Centre) S(569629)

Nice Chinese Cuisine • Live Seafood • Signature Nonya Curry Fish Head •

Also provide catering and delivery services for event.

Try it next time you came to Ang Mo Kio.
Affordable zichar located at amk industrial. Wide variety of food choices and can BYOB foc. Food is tasty but some are abit salty for me.

4.5 stars. Been wanting to eat here and we regretted not coming here earlier. Came at 5 plus in the evening on a weekday and there was no crowd. Ordered sweet and sour pork, hokkien noodles and kai lan with salted fish. The dishes arrived quickly. The sweet and sour pork wowed us, succulent, crispy and juicy, with pieces of pineapples and tomatoes. The other dishes were delicious too and the portions were huge. Love the vegetables, very fresh and crunchy, with fragrant pieces of salted fish. The noodles were nicely done with wok-hei. Belacan chilli was good and spicy. Would definitely return to try the other dishes!

Came on a Sunday night, many tables filled. Expected the food to take a longer time as the place was packed. Food arrived a lot quicker than expected. Probz 10mins from ordering.
Food is value for money.
The star of the meal (for me) was the fish head fried with bitter gourd.
Minced pork tofu with chai poh was a miss.
Price slightly high. Business pretty good though. Ordered the Kong Bak Pau  (10 for $24). Taste is good but the pork is very thinly slice. The Hong Kong noodles just too salty for me.

The chye poh kueh tiao was an eye opener, very unique taste! We also loved the braised pork bao and salted kampung chicken! Sambal kangkong was a flop, too watery... Overall better than an average zichar place but price is also higher... Will be back to try other dishes!

ordered a prawn paste chicken and salted egg crab
prawn paste chicken is average, prawn paste taste is not strong . but chicken served hot
salted egg crab - too much butter taste , cannot taste salted egg . too much overwhelming sauce of  butter milk . crab is fresh and meat is soft and easy separate from shell

overall price- $83

I was there on Sat with two other friends. We ordered spinach in superior stock, golden cereal prawn, salted kampong chicken, a chilli crab with 6 mantous and orh nee with ginko nuts. The place was under-staffed and was packed with customers, hence we waited quite a while (1) before being directed to the reserved table and (2) for our dishes to be served. The food was average, nothing exceptional.

Not my first time here, I had always been impressed with their menu... Today is my first try of their 龙虎会 Crab with Seafood In Claypot. This is not ordinary curry or laksa crab, it's the most innovative Crab Beehoon I have ever tried... It has the savoury seafood umami, don't be surprised to find salted fish and Chinese herb dang gui in it, amazing cocoction, super fresh & firm crab meat 👍👍👍. Must try!
Traditional Zhi Cha at an industrial area coffee shop. Huge space and the food are good but no air-con.

Location is relatively convenient. The restaurant(the setting is actually a canteen in the day and restaurant by night) occupancy rate was ~70% during my visit. Reckon the food was slightly above average but the bill was HIGHLY about average (you probably would prefer a better setting, in air conditioned environment with the price you paid). Parking is always an issue over there... so,  go early if you need a slot. As for the waitresses... not that friendly if i may compare against my previous patronage. Generally, still an OK place to go for.

I came here over few occasions always ordered their signature dishes. This time just pick few dishes from the menu. All turn out good if not better than other restaurants. The fried baby squid is one of the better one. Ordered a deep fried sea bass HK style. We thought is $28/kg but it was $28 for the fish. Good value.

Me and my wife was scouting for a great crab place around amk. This shop did not disappoint me at all. Even tho we did not order crab ( because we wanted to test those other dishes first) we will definitely be back for the crab.
Nice food if u are in the area, toilet is abit old school.
Relaxed atmosphere. Despite the full house, service was prompt and food arrived fairly quickly. Food was prepared well. The carpark valet service was a plus indeed.

Dishonest and low quality food. Don’t waste your time. We asked for red grouper. They gave us a black/pearl grouper instead and still charged us $76 for the fish. Total was $92 and fish was not even fresh.

First and last time eating here.

The $80+ crab was huge, full of eggs and very fresh. The mantous were had an almost crispy skin and soft white insides. The kai lan was yummy, not old, soft not chewy. The cereal prawns were large and fleshy. Overall, definitely a recommend. Only thing is the chilli crab gravy loses out to the one at Casuarina Rd.

Food was excellent and service was great too. Staff very friendly and accommodating. They also took steps to ensure safe distancing. Parking is little hard but they offer free valet which is a huge plus. Will definitely be back!

My favourite dishes : Coffee Pork Ribs and Jing Long Chai. 5 stars for these 2 dishes.

A non air-conditioned food court in an industrial park but never felt warm or stuffy here.

Overall 4 stars because they often forget to serve us our food when it is crowded and need to keep reminding them. Happened a few times for the many times we dined there.

But will still go again and again.

Surprising find for us - was looking for bak kut Teh rather than zi char last for dinner. However we were not disappointed by this choice!

The steamed sharks head was of course, the highlight of the night. The taste of the 99.9% collagen based filing was excellent. The rest of the dishes, were good - and the overall cost was only S$85.

Old fashion zi char place, crowded 2 days before CNY, guess many are having shou gong fan there.

The ambient is ok, normal coffee shop style, just much bigger in space.

The dishes order were mostly tasty, except salted fish sprouts (which I didn’t spot any salted fish) and braised tofu (which didn’t look or taste super appetising).

Nevertheless, recommend three egg spinach, herbal chicken (the soup was really good), wok hey hor fan!

Tasty zichar.
Love the chilli gigantic crab and deep fried baby squid
Total, damage $115.40 for 4 dishes with 2 rice

A regular places I would go for my daily dinner or lunches..

They have great cook and their dishes are very savory even when the places are fully crowded, their standard of the food never fails!

Staffs are very attentive and polite. I would recommend for great cze char and various dishes are always my favourite.

Service Quality: 7/10
Food Quality: 8/10
Pricing: Reasonable
Ambience: 6/10 (though its a coffeeshop, but it's very neat and clean)

The food is really bad. Cereal prawn dish, the prawn not cooked. Served vegetables to wrong table and still wanted to serve the same dish to us. Rest of the food is below standard. The cleanliness of the coffeeshop is also really bad.  Won't be going again.
Parking is still challenging even with their valet parking service on weekend. Price value is good.  Food is of zhi char standard . Some hit and misses
Big place for dining. Friendly service staff but food are ordinary like any neighbourhood hor fan stall. Tea and coffee are good though.

My favourite place for crab tang hoon!! Crab us very fresh and often the meat at the legs are firm and juicy.. no kid. The tang hoon is cooked nicely with right amount of sauce firmness and yummy til the bottom of the clay pot.. if you know what I mean. The variety is plentiful and often a place for mid price family gatherings etc as they also serve roasted whole pig which they do themselves.. we also like the pork or fish sweet and sour since seperate.. parking is relatively easy too and on weekends they have valet..  enjoy.

It is my first time trying Buddha jump over the wall. You need at least 10 ppls and need to preorder in advance. Their other food dishes also not bad. In total, the cost for each person is about $100..

Operated by a couple, serving lunch, not noticeable at this canteen, located near Eunos Industrial.
Ordered for a portion for 2 烧腊鸡饭、reasonable at $10.
Good service, affordable pricing, generous portions, tasty food.

Food is decent and prices are friendly. Didn't like the fact that you're forced to take their peanut and acai if you sit on tables with table cloth. Overall experience is good. Value for money. Bai mi fen is good

Large spacious and casual sitting. Mostly excellent hokkien style dishes. The crab bee hoon and nanru pork were especially good. The three egg veg could be better; not enough of the eggs. Service was prompt for a large restaurant. They even have valet parking.

Simple enbience. Food really above my expectation. Especially from Coffee Shop Zhi Char Stall. Service 4.8 out of 5 . The crabs are huge $68 per kilo That's the current price. Own by Mr. Lee. Quality of food and freshness are above standard. Worth my try to travel from Jurong to Ang Mo Kio.
Overall prices reasonable worth eating
Join as member you are entitled to 5% discount
Industrial area in AMK for Zi-Char. Their chilli crab was a little spicy though, but nice and very fresh. Well cooked too. Reservations recommended

The food was rather tasty. Personally I liked the water chestnut fritters, crab tang hoon ($60/kg during this Chinese New Year period - you can call and ask about the crab price before going down), and definitely the yam dessert!

This place may be located in an industrial estate but it is strategically located at the junction of AMK Ave 10 and Ind Pk as well as directly opposite Pathlight School. The best dish is the suckling pig. Mama Mia! So yummilious!  The crab was so well done and the crab sauce very good too. The rest of the dish were just very delicious and finger licking good. The price is worth it. The place was well patronized even on a weekday.  That showed the quality of the food and the ambience was just right. They even have a public announcement system to inform cars that are blocking others.  Great place to be! Great Job to the chef and servers alike.😁
Dinner for 3... Hotplate tofu was good, sauce is different from the usual. Prawn paste chicken was tasty! The salted veg duck soup serving was generous. Orh Nee was a let down. Wasn’t fragrant...

The zichar here is by far one of the best I have ever eaten. The quality of the food is quite good and affordable and the portion is just nice for 3 pax. We ordered the 咸菜鸭汤 which comes in a very big portion - easily good for a group of 6. The dessert orh ni is quite a let down though.

This mixed tofu is good, taste of lard. Salted vege soup is appetising to me. Vege is huge disappointed, too oily. I was there for Chinese New year dinner, their staple food like yee fu noodle and Vietnamese fried rice is good, but other dishes is horrible, fail in presentation and taste.
Food was good, service was quick and responsive. Friendly and helpful staff.
The pork ribs herbal Italian is good. Prices are reasonable. Food is yummy!
One of my family's favourite restaurants. We always enjoy the food here!
Food is good and price is reasonable. Except can be crowded during special days, when reservation is required. And they serve only set menu during such special days
Crab is super big and at affordable price. Kian Seng is also super generous with the chilli crab sauce as can be seen from photo. Will totally come back again for more!

Food - decent range of choices. Economy rice, Zi Char, Western. Have tried the ZiChar and the JWS western. The western is recommended.
Ambience - Coffee shop
Price - $.

Decent cafe food. Outdoor area is pet-friendly, no pets allowed indoors. Their chicken waffle dish is worth a try! Can get pretty crowded with family and kids during dinner hours. Overall nice ambience.

Went on a weekday afternoon for lunch, not much crowd on a weekday. This cafe is quite spacious, have an outdoor and indoor seating area. I ordered the Chicken waffles Chicken was tender and delicious. The only complain was quite warm indoor, seem like the air-conditional is not working. Overall, wonderful place to chill and will visit again.

First time coming to this cafe and will definitely go back again. It’s such a nice and comfortable place to chill in..The food is nice & My family simply love all the varieties that we have ordered.. 👍🏻

Visited them on consecutive Sat and Sun! Service staffs are friendly and polite. Ordered their mushroom risotto and truffle fries for both days. It was really good! Amazingly, their coffee was a gem for us. We didn’t have high expectations on their coffee yet it was the star for our brunch. The sea salt caramel latte was da bomb! Not sweet yet very smooth and produce good aroma of the coffee. Will bring our kiddos back for the food!

It's new !!! Have outdoor (pets allowed) and indoor seating. Nice, clean, spacious and cosy. Ordered the all day breakfast set which was tasty and a cafe latte. Will visit again. Only complain was the need to improve their online menu with picture of the food!

We were here for the vet's appt and was so glad for a cafe that welcomes little friends. Better than that the food is very good. The pasta was fresh yet light. We also had the croffles with a very crispy chicken. I would have stayed longer for dessert but with the current humidity we have to come back when we can sit indoors without the little friend. Very good dining experience and good offering of wines too!
Went on a weekday for brunch, was a nice and quiet place to chill. Really enjoyed the pasta, which is a recommended dish . Quite a decent amount of seafood (scallops, prawns, clams) given 👍🏼👍🏼

A nice cafe tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Consists of both indoor air conditioned and outdoor seating suitable for pet owners which is a plus. Ample seating space inside as the restaurant stretches quite far in. Service is good and relatively fast. Decor is pretty and they have interesting pieces of furniture and contrasting wallpapers and panels for a varied effect. Tried their speculoos latte and Peter’s Pancake which is quite good 👍😊

Pretty good food and service at reasonable prices. The rosti waffles were very delicious, although we wish they could be even crispier. Pancakes are fluffy, scrambled egg is creamy, bacon is not too greasy. The melon tea smells very calming although the melon taste itself wasn't very strong. The online ordering platform was missing photos for several items, which made it hard to visualize what the dish would look like or the portion size.

Relaxing simple decor. The outdoor area is pet-friendly, lotsa cute dogs there! Indoors has plenty of seating. There is also a small garden area on the other end, with goldfishes swimming around in a little rock fountain.

Wow.. love this place for its space... wide spacious and hippy green ambience... Nice!

Simply the space and deco makes this cafe super comfortable to laze and chill in.

And I'm glad the great food goes well with ambience too..

Been here twice already. And their pastas and burger is great!

And their online loyalty program is definitely tempting me to go back a 3rd 4th time...
And its only tempting because food and ambience is great..

Would definitely be back many more times
Found a nice new cafe. Great food, pet friendly and can cycle over the next round. Just a bit longer waiting time for a seat so better to book advance 🥂

My first attempt lunch experience.

Personally, I like their main menu items, the savoury items are not to my liking.

Overall dining experience is good. Nice place and ambient.

Strong contender to the existing upper Thomson road cafes like Columbus Coffee. Overall good brunch food, with nice platting and interior design. However could do better with their coffees (quite awful Americano). They should like consider providing better utensils (fork,soon) as the current ones are obviously of sub standard quality, similar to the ones we see in food court. It’s the non polished type and didn’t look or feel sparkling clean. Furthermore, all of their fork has stains between the grooves. Asked for change but all had stains. Ended up not using their fork. Lost my appetite a little. Chicken was great but wished they drained the excess oil before serving. The plate was filled with excess oil from the chicken midway during meal. Overall 3 stars with lots of potential for improvement.

Good food and pet friendly. Will visit again
Not bad for a 3 week old cafe 🙂

Update:
Went back on their 4th week of business with more friends. Waiting time improved.

A bright, beautiful, and spacious cafe with lots of greenery - reminds me of a laidback Balinese beach club/cafe. It has a open, pet-friendly outdoor seating area too!

Not your usual cafe fare, ordered a few unique items to try. They were all delicious!

This cafe is pretty near my place but first time trying. Reservations is recommended especially for weekends. Surprised that the indoor dining area was so big.
Found the price of the food quite expensive. Breakfast for 3 easily exceeded $100. They had a promo with Citibank but we had lots of problems with it as it couldn't accept applepay or if the credit card is stored inside the phone without the full 16 digits.
Order a few dishes to share, the one we enjoyed most is the Chicken and Croffles. Both croffles and chicken were well cooked. The Roffles platter was interesting because of the rosti waffles and also liked the way the mushrooms were cooked.
Service was very slow. Not sure if they forgot the order or what. The staff are all very young and had to call them over a few times to check the status of the dishes. The sides came almost last, the Spicy Chicken wasn't really nice it didn't taste Korean but the sauce more tasted like the Thai sweet Chili sauce. The Sakura Cream Tagliatelie also came late and serving was very small which left us unsatisfied.
Drinks were just pretty average.
Really need to improve on the speed of the food served. Not sure why the cafe wasn't even crowded at all early in the morning.
Lovely ambience and tasty albeit junky food, has a nice al fresco area for pet owners and their fur kids. Deep fried chicken and croffles very yummy. Fries were good too. We'll be back soon.

Loved the interior design and spacious. Also has an outdoor sheltered seating area. Our group of 3 had the croffles with fried chicken, the crispy chicken burger, the rosti with mushrooms & pork sausages, chicken tenders with korean spicy sauce - all of them were decently good. The letdown came in the form of their tarts where the crust was soft, and it just felt liked it was kept for too many days.

Visited the place on a weekday afternoon and was delighted that there’s no crowd. Huge space with ample seating area. Had the fried chicken, sakura pasta and the creamed corn (CCB).

The pasta and chicken were great but the corn was just alright. The sour cream was not a good addition to the corn. Drinks were on the expensive side too.

Didn't expect the food to be good, but it really is! The chef does fried chicken super well. We ordered the spicy Korean fried chicken it was out of this world. The CCB is also super yummy. The CAVA burger is huge but also very tasty. My husband and I were stuffed after these three dishes due to the generous portion of the CAVA burger. For the portion, the price is very reasonable. The downside is the waiting time, it took 40 mins for us to have the first side on the table. We had to approach the service staff to check on our order. The last dish, the burger took 1 hour. Service staff is quite friendly and attentive in terms of refilling water. Easy to get their attention.

The colors they utilized in their interior design were fantastic. The colors are black, white, and jade green. This is a fantastic mix. I went on a Friday night when it wasn't too packed. ⁣
⁣
To self-order, scan the QR code.⁣
⁣
𝐒𝐚𝐤𝐮𝐫𝐚 𝐂𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐦 𝐓𝐚𝐠𝐥𝐢𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 𝐒𝐆𝐃 𝟏𝟗.𝟎𝟎 ⁣
There are around 7 clams and 2 prawns. The platings are fantastic. The taste is bland, and the prawns aren't fresh. Tagliatelle from another Italian restaurant tasted better.⁣
⁣
𝐂𝐚𝐯𝐚 𝐁𝐮𝐫𝐠𝐞𝐫 𝐂𝐫𝐢𝐬𝐩𝐲 𝐂𝐡𝐢𝐜𝐤𝐞𝐧 𝐓𝐡𝐢𝐠𝐡 𝐒𝐆𝐃 𝟏𝟕.𝟎𝟎⁣
It's served with fries. This is the night's highlight. It's served hot, with super soft and fluffy buns and properly cooked chicken. The fries are one flaw; they taste bland and are not served hot enough.⁣
⁣
Total bill SGD 𝟑𝟗.𝟔𝟎 (Inc of Service Charge no GST)⁣
⁣
I'll definitely return to try some of their other dishes and review later. Meanwhile 2 stars for overall.

Here for brunch and dinner before. The otah bruschetta with grilled cheese is a must. Dinner menu is so-so, portion can be bigger even though the food is good. Love the place as it allowed furkid to accompany the hoomans under shelter. Nice cafe in a quiet estate.

May 2022: This cafe has really good potential. Love the space - bright and spacious. Food was also good. Order the Cava Burger (chicken thigh) and the wild mushroom pasta. Both delicious. I liked how the cheese was melted on the bun and the mushrooms in the chicken burger. There is an option to choose wagyu meat instead of chicken for $2 additional but I read about how good the fried chicken was and hence was not about to lose this opportunity to taste it! Was happy I didn’t! Anyway, I wonder how the burger which included a slice of pineapple would taste if I had chose wagyu!
5 stars service, staff very patient and polite. They have special food and drink. Delicious and satisfying. The pet friendly zone is spacious without worrying about rain or hot weather.

It's a spacious cafe with welcoming staff. Ordered the mentaiko fries - which was great for sharing. The salmon was well executed but we didnt really appreciate the rosti. Overall, its a nice find in the area.

Love the recommended dishes : Sakura Tagliatelle, Cava Burger. Food is really good, best part I can get to see beautiful fur patrons playing at the outdoor area. Didn't enjoy the lemon meringue tart though.

Great neighbourhood cafe with brunch food. Rather big space lots of seating outside and inside. We ordered the fried chicken and croffles, mentaiko fries and the mushroom risotto.

The fried chicken was really well battered, light and crispy and not oily. The coleslaw was also a really nice touch cause I’m not a fan of putting maple syrup on my savoury food. I would say a must try when you come here.

The mushroom risotto was everything you would want in a risotto dish. Simple and rice was cooked just right (slightly Al dente but cooked through).

Mentaiko fries were decent but nothing special.

You order and pay through a QR code which is always a plus.

We came here after seeing Daniel Food Diary’s review (though we know to take all the bloggers’ reviews with a big pinch of salt).

In a nutshell, the food here is decent. Just skip the desserts and the coffee (which is a collaboration with local Hook coffee but the cafe does not have a barista in house). After lunch, simply hop over to Thus Coffee which is just around the corner.

It’s nice, quiet and spacious spot for catching up over lunch. On a Monday noon, it wasn’t crowded at all. We had a nice far end spot where behind the doors is the backyard with a water well.

We ordered the otah bruschetta (sourdough), seafood aglio olio, fishy business (salmon), roffles platter and wild mushroom risotto. All of us rather enjoyed our respective main course.

Thereafter, we shared the ondeh ondeh cake, yuzu cheesecake and a warm apple crumble and also had cups of coffee.

The Apple crumble looked really funky and unnatural (take a look at the last photo) plus it was too sweet. The ondeh ondeh was nothing to rave about either. Coffee was served without inspiration (no latte art cos as mentioned, no barista) - it was just bland, normal coffee but at a barista price tag of $7.

Do reserve before going especially on a weekend as it can get packed.

First visit - Order didn't go through the online ordering system and we ended up waiting for awhile to realise it didn't go through. But technical fault, can't be helped. Anyway, reordered and our food came in adequate time. The spinach cream pasta was quite nice.

Second visit - Decided to try the otah, and sakura pasta. Interesting menu, both were alright.

In both visits, the drinks were slightly underwhelming. Nice atmosphere and staff though!

Went there for lunch recently for a family of 5. Overall food is nice and the service is good. However, and that is a HUGE but, the waiting time for the food is ridiculously long at 70 minutes after ordering!!

They did let us know that waiting time for food will be at 30 minutes or more. I think it is good that they let customers know that they need to wait. Hmm... but we waited for 70 minutes... AND even if there is lots of pre-warning or notification that food may take some time to prepare, waiting for 70 minutes for the food is not acceptable. They really need to look into streamlining the process or expanding the kitchen capacity to have faster turn around time.

Apart from that, please do make reservation ahead! With such a long turn around time from ordering food to serving, you don't want to be queueing outside waiting for table + waiting for food later!

The service of this place is good. There are many attentive young servers.

Food wise, it is tasty and unique. Some notable dishes are the Spinach Creatm Tagliatelle ($15), Seafood Aglio Olio ($15),  CCB (Cream Corn Bacon $9). We ordered quite a lot of other stuff too. Can look at the photos. Food wise, it is 5 stars.

Beautiful interior and very spacious, quiet on thurs evening. Food was veryyyy average. Melon tea by the pot, teabag type. Speculoos Cafe Latte was good because its totally not sweet at all though the name. Roffles Platter was very homemade... the roffles was not crispy and abit mushy. Sakura Cream Tagliatelle Pasta was below average, too much residue water from the seafood so the whole dish was very watery but the prawns were fresh. Seafood Aglio Olio was average. Fries with truffle & parmesan was good, very generous and huge serving, highly recommend. Visited this cafe to celebrate a friend's birthday so we also ordered a Lemon Meringue Tart which didnt taste fresh, below average.

Will recommend this place only for small bites and drinks. Good for a teatime break.

Great all-day brunch and coffee. I had the open faced wagyu sandwich and my wife tried the Rosti waffle platter which is gluten free. Both are well presented and tasty. It is cavernous inside with lots of space and good ambience. Pets are allowed in their outdoor seating, which is nice!

A really spacious cafe newly opened just months ago. Comfortable and cosy seating.. serving great pasta towards the Asian texture. Love❤️ the small portions available for the small eaters🥰 #msgreedysis #greedybuddiez

Was looking for coffee after dinner and stumbled upon this cafe. Big and spacious dinning area. There is also a huge alfresco dinning area where you can bring your pets along. Very comfortable environment. At around 9+pm was still quite crowded on a Friday nite.

Cafe pricing is on the pricier side for this order. Drinks are quite unique. Ordered the iced puffed rice cafe latte and a hot speculoos cafe latte.

Puffed rice went quite well with the latte adding some texture. Giving a cereal feel when it is soaked up with latte. Recommended to try. Speculoos latte is ok but hope that they can be more generous with the speculoos topping.
Cheesecake is average.

Nice place to chill after dinner. Will be back to try their food.

Came with hubby and kids on Sunday late afternoon . Kids and pets friendly . Quite a busy cafe at that hour so I think quite suitable for noisy kids to dine in . Ambience was great as I faced to a small tropical garden ! Love the plants especially for plant lovers . haha . I think chicken croffle was not bad-recommended . English BF and spam fries soso. Cappucino can be better ( quite bitter ) as I think the other cafe around the corner has better coffee . I was expecting better coffee

Great ambience, nice deco plus 5 stars for presentation! Melted nacho cheese dripped over the entire Wagyu burger served with fries. Lovely idea. Was expected a patty but it was yakiniku Wagyu but I'm not complaining cos it was well done. Impressive. Just didn't like that fries served was only warm, likely fried and put aside for quite a while. Waffle and chicken wasn't that fantastic according to my lunch companion. But still, decent for sure. Wash it all down with a pint for a wonderful dining experience.

Celebrated Father’s Day here. Coming here to try the food because it’s recommended by danielfooddiary. The food is fantastic. We tried the otah bread, ice latte, croffle chicken & seafood pasta. Price wise is $20 ish per pax. Ambience is good too.
Pet friendly cafe in a quiet neighborhood. Quality of food is better than expected but selection range not wide- wish they have more desserts choices~

Had the mushroom linguine, mentaiko fries and spinach pasta. Enjoyed all of them. Portion size was good, mentaiko was very flavourful and had a torched flavour. Mushroom linguine had a generous amount of mushrooms and they were cooked well without too much of an earthy taste.

Could improve the acoustics in the restaurant though as there were not many people but it was very noisy. Good place to hold events but if it's so echoey it will not be conducive.

Do check out the well. It had a few dead leaves though. And the door to the back garden was locked.

Also there was a super smiley server, she was really cheerful, wish all servers were like her.

Good cafe, good choice of items/menu and friendly staff. Prices very acceptable for this area as well. We had the chicken croffles and the otah bruschetta, both tasted really good. Don't know what it is, but it's just missing the x-factor for a five star review.

Food is ok and environment is good. Nice outdoor place for people who wants to bring their pets over to chill.

This places serves western food. Can get pretty crowded and noisy during dinner times.

A little far from MRT, but this place is worth the distance.

Will definitely come back here for more next time!
Food is very yummy, and place is very bright and roomy. The croffle and chicken was a big hit with everyone, and I loved the chicken burger as well.

C.C.B was my favourite dish! Head down to the cafe to find out what I mean 😉

Attracted to the amazing ambience of this cafe! I highly recommend all of you to have a sense of it too!

- Food; EXCELLENT!! ⭐️⭐️⭐️ The food display was exquisite, the food taste just as pleasant as how it looks (I took video instead of photos, cant post it)

- Chill outdoor; can bring your pet along, I saw one doggo 😍 (it’s open 24/7 according to one of the bosses)

- Cozy indoor; the furnishing of the cafe felt like I was in a HIGH END restaurant with affordable food, there are high chairs, sofas, and other different types of sitting to choose from (closes at 10-10.30pm)

Location: Pet friendly cafe located near a vet, a small park, catsmart, petlovers, and a nearby cafe to chill with your pooches after having a walk at lower pierce reservoir, ample parking.

Cafe: Came here a few times. Cafe is very spacious for small and big groups but price wise is a bit on the high side. I find a cup of cappuccino at $7 quite exp. Got the caramelized (coffee with a whip of caramel at $8). Food is acceptable & bug portion but not so fantastic. Service is very good, staff will immediately ask a choice of cold or warm water, and provide a water for the pooch too. We'll come back for small bites and some drinks.
Interesting place to dine at a hidden corner. It has a “secret” garden that’s quite cool too with mist timing. Food is nice and ambiance is cosy, clean and spacious. 👍🏼

The cafe is very Instagramable , it’s nice for chill out n photo n meeting up with friends , beer r very affordable price .
Owners r friendly couple
Chicken is too small portion size can be improved, maybe add more vege to make it feel more worth it , we prefer smth that is bigger portion. Coffee is a little bitter , can be improved.
The English breakfast cauliflower is not really fantastic, it will be better if u can change it to mash potatoes or sweet corn or potatoes salad . The bread is too thin n small it will be better if u guys can change to a thicker one . Taste wise is perfect . Like a 4 star restaurant. Thumbs up owner .

Nice and spacious cafe in the quiet Sembawang Hills with friendly staff. Seems to be pet-friendly with many customers with dogs out front.

Had typical cafe food with some interesting twists e.g. Nacho Cheese on Wagyu Burger, Rose Matcha Latte. However feels slightly pricy, even for a cafe, (~$20), especially if you order cmmon cafe food

Would recommend to try if you're in the area, and get the more special foods on the menu (like Otah Bruschetta) instead of things like the typical American Breakfast set.
Spacious restaurant with a modern deco. Attentive and prompt service. Good food.with little pleasant surprises.

Pet-friendly place. I wouldn’t say it’s fantastic or novel but I tried it because of the good reviews. The otah bruschetta was thin and laid on top of a slice white bread. It’s quite hard to cut and dry. In terms of spiciness and taste, I’ll rate it 2/5. In the end, i grab it with my hands and eat it. I don’t think it’ll order it again because it’s not worth $18 (add $2 for cheese topping). Coffee is so-so ($7 up)

Went on a Thursday evening and the space was quiet and serene! A lot of space between tables which made it a plus for an already dog friendly establishment. Service staff were attentive and responsive. Ordered three mains: Sakura ebi tagliatelle, seafood aglio olio and a small breakfast plate, found them all to be nice! Hot latte was also good! But apple crumble was very disappointing cos it was soft and mushy, hence minus one star!

Ordered from Foodpanda.

The curry fish head is soo goooddd….the thick, flavorful, creamy, spicy curry compliments the sweet and juicy fish so well. Comes with some eggplant, taupok, and some vegs.

Their veg and omelette is nice too.

Don’t be mislead by the ugly photo I took. It’s 100% worth the try 🤩

My kind advice to everyone is do not order from them via foodpanda or grab delivery. For $12.30 this is what you will get. I am regular to this store and they had been generous before. Till recently they have been ripping of your money with little portion. Recently they have increased some of their food price. Which I understand due to some raw material increase in price they have to make some adjustments. But reducing the portion with higher price is daylight robbery. There must be some business ethics when running a business. Recently they have been greedy only. This will be my last order..

Had dinner here with a friend, order beancurd on hotplate and steam fish. The beancurd was good but the fish was lacking. As my friend cannot take spicy food so ended up choosing the non spicy cooking. Price wise decent, payment type they take grab pay.

Ordered the chilli crab and cereal prawns based on reviews I saw on Food Panda. Portions were decent though they are priced high. However, the crab and prawns was not fresh at all! It’s as though they used frozen crabs, as the meat was very dry, whilst the prawn meat was tasteless. The chilli crab gravy tasted alright. Overall disappointing. For the price paid $50/crab, you’d expect better.

I ordered fried kway teow with cockles through grab app. It’s very delicious. Cockles are very well cooked and no fishy. They added lots of red chilli for me as I requested. Will definitely order again. Thank you.
One crab cost $50+ and did not taste good. The pepper crab that I ordered was of poor standard and disappointing! Waste of money!

Didn't really think the food here would be that good but I was pleasantly surprised!

Price isn't too crazy on par with typical Chinese seafood shops, but the quality is on point.

I truly enjoyed some of their dishes, namely the mee goreng, Sambal Kang Kong, Cereal Prawns and even the fried rice! Nice big portions and well worth the amount that you pay.

I would highly recommend this place if you are in the neighborhood, or you can get it on Grab/Deliveroo/Foodpanda as well.

I have been a customer at the Jurong West coffeeshop and moved to Yishun now. I really liked their Thai wings, sweet & sour fish, fried rice and kung po chicken at Jurong West. At Yishun I really like their Tom Yum seafood soup, Mee Goreng seafood, Thai style chicken (it's all about the sauce) and  prawn paste chicken! Looking forward to trying more dishes! Really tasty food!

I rarely will leave bad review on food cos to me, as long as u have food, u shd be blessed
BUT NOT THIS TIME
ordered stingray fr 2 pax $15
I am always super fine wf not cheap food as long as it does justice
Stingray is super small like 2 small slices and super duper dry n hard to chew :-(
Cockles costing me $9 for 15pcs is half cooked n cant swallow too cos despite chewing few times it is still a whole chunk
Paid $26 for 2 rice, 15pcs cockles & 2 small slices ray, it is a disappointment experience

Eat at yr own high hopes !
We have been patronising for years now. Their chilli 🦀 is 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼

I tried sea food horfun. The ingredients like prawn. Fish slices and sotong is fresh and they cooked it well. My Indian neighbours recommended it to me, he used to come three times a week.the atmosphere is casual and relax and enjoy. The assistant is helpful when I asked her for e address, and she said can call them.
💯 best delicious food. Must try thier seabase 3 rasa fish dish and Nasi Goreng Kampung. I will consider the best in Singapore .

Ordered at 1740. Got food at 1820. Just 2 packet. In fact, the lady that came at 1800 got hers before me. Attempted to check the status a few times and got brushed off, the male staff even told me to not ask him and go ask the one that took my order.
Disgusting food. Ordered Nasi goreng kampong . Received white rice. No salt no spices at all. Expensive
Good food at reasonable price. Chilli crab is the best seafood I ever had here together with fried kangkong. Clean environment.
I give you best combi from this place. must try SINAR's tomyam soup with salted fish fried rice, super tasty
The sambal stingray was great and the service was excellent, fast n efficient.
The go to halal seafood to go that is nearest to Sengkang.
They sell marvellous foods...
Rude incorrigible boss or staff.
Ok
Nice food to eat
So so food.

(Translated by Google) Seafood fried rice is delicious
The focus is on no pork dishes

(Original)
海鲜炒饭好吃
重点是没猪肉菜肴

Best penang prawn soup in Singapore. Better than 888 in penang, more heavy taste here. Now they have the dry one available, but I always come for the soup one. And they have big prawns too, I had it 10 years ago for $3.50/$4.

Uncle friendly and straightforward guy, but most importantly his hands are fast. No need to queue so long. Try it when you are around. :)
Quite authentic Penang type Hokkien mee. Really quite delicious especially the yuan yang. Recommended, serve quite fast too. Will be perfect if the soup can be more generous!

Ordered prawn been hoon soup. And had to agreed with another sharing the table that the soup is superb but could give more, quite a lot of prawns given but quite bland in taste. Not sure if the dry version is a better choice

Each bowl of Lor Mee comes with braised egg, pork slice, Kang Kong and fish cakes. Thick starchy and flavoursome broth is ladled onto springy yellow noodles. With their homemade chilli sauce and vinegar, the Lor Mee tastes as good as it looks, makes you want to go back for more.

Prawn Mee was equally delicious as well. Soup had distinct a rich flavour and pleasant aroma. Every sip of the soup, will open up your appetite more and I just couldn’t stop indulging. Definitely a great choice for a quick and delicious brunch.

Tried this famous prawn noodle stall last weekend. The broth was really good, rich and not too overpowering. The highlight I would say is the chilli. Gave a good kick for me! The prawns were fresh too, but 2 seems a bit little, an extra one would be better! :)

This prawn mee remind me of my childhood. At Malaysia, KL, Jalan cheras, there is one prawn mee stall at the road side. I have always missed this taste.

The soup is very rich, tasty and flavourful. Is very different from the Singapore taste.  Strongly recommend to give it a try if you are around there.

Long time nv eat.... since my sec sch days today my friend say feel like eating prawn noodles so i thought of them.. thought of eating this again....

Note order takeaway note they pack 1 plain soup is $2

Note they dont give u any soya with red chilli if want must ownself take / pack and ownself take also no carrier. U want u just take and throw inside ur noodle 😂. Maybe business too good. But im never returning here again. ( btw i run a noodle business too and i understand cost is increasing but $2 for plain soup and its not even the b1000 standard size its the smallest avail dessert container size 😅...and dont have a 0.013cents carrier for chili padi is ridiculous)

If u can accept all of the above then can consider takeaway.... if u eating there maybe need pay $1 for soup? Since takeaway is $2

After eating the prawn mee here, you will not want to eat any other prawn mee! I sometimes even have cravings for the prawn mee here! I love the dry version, which comes with dried deshelled prawns.
