(Will add extra vinegar) It comes with a bowl of soup at the side, which I will pour into my dry noodles when I'm almost done with my meal, mixing the soup with the sauces of the dry noodle. So I get best of both worlds! If u prefer fresh prawns, order the soup version and peel the prawn shell yourself. Haha. OK. I'm drooling now...
They also serve lor mee
AND a mix of both lor mee and prawn mee in 1 dish of u can't decide which to have and can't finish 2 bowls on your own.
Boss lady advised to call to check if you want dry version later part of the day, as the dried prawn always sold out early.

Although abit messy but taste really good for Penang prawn noodle. Very strong flavour though abit thirsty after eating.

Will wan to try lor mee next time

One of the best, if not THE BEST Penang Lor mee I have ever eaten. ( My photo doesn't do justice to it!)

Mouth- 'Full' of taste with thick gravy that seems to coat each strain of noodles! The chilli isn't over powering, subtly spice up the taste, simply making it perfect.
I had issue ordering online and the owner is so kind to look into for me.
My craving fulfilled! You should have yours too!

Found this place on Google map. The broth of the prawn noodle is good ( a little sweeter compare to SG prawn noodle ).
But I like it very much. I will be coming back.
Tastes authentic and good, sells only 2 specific dish but does both so well. Only con was the the lor mee gets watery after eating 30% of it, but flavourwise is great and will definitely come back
The prawn noodle is really, really excellent.  The chilli paste is authentic Penang style. This is a must try for all food lovers

All time favourite for Penang prawn noodle and Lor mee since my 1990s.. the lady boss has retired and pass the baton to the son. Although taste diff a little but still good, especially the specially homemade dry prawn, fantastic, you can’t find it elsewhere.
The only thing is the noodle price has been increased over time and time, not so affordable to fill an empty stomach.
But no choice if you have a craving.
Inflation and rent cost is real.
I always crave the prawn mee here. 😋 Their lor mee is also very tasty!

Yummy prawn noodle soup and lor mee!! The uncle at the stall was also very friendly and recommended we try the original prawn noodle and lor mee (though I wanted to try the yuan yang lor mee - with prawn noodle soup mixed in - which would have me $1 more). I'm glad I heeded his advice.

The lor mee was tasty and the prawn noodle broth rich in flavor.

It's only 4 stars cos it's a hawker centre
Prawn noodle was not bad but lor mee so so only

Try the penang prawn mee, the soup too salty. The lean meat a bit hard due to boil and place for long time. The lean meat should only cook when order to keep it soft and tender.Salt should reduce in making the soup. Prawn quite fresh.
One of the best prawn noodle in AMK central. Everyone must give it a try!

If you like noodles, you can try here.
Mee Soup or Dry mee or Lor mee all are very nice. If you got allergy with prawn then shall not go here. The strong smell of prawn in these delicious bowls.

My go to place for a bowl of tasty Penang Hae Mee soup.

I liked its authentic, robust and strong flavours.

Only thing missing? Hard boiled egg.

I grew up eating the Penang versions of prawn noodle soup and lor mee at this stall. The broth is extremely rich with the use of tons of prawn heads and shells I believe. If you want to try something different, order the dry prawn noodles with small prawns. The tiny prawns have been deshelled and cooked down to a shrivel but they are really delicious. If you upsize your order, you also get to enjoy some slices of lor bak and lor ng(egg) along with the prawns.
As for the lor mee, I always prefer bee hoon and upsized so that I get to enjoy more of the really well braised lor bak and a whole egg. Just typing this is making me drool again😁

Always come here for their 虾面， today decided to try their Lor Mee. I have to say it’s really good and flavorful. Especially the braised egg 卤蛋，super flavorful. Really a must eat!

However sometimes the owners can attitude a bit.

This stall has been Ard for many years. When I pass by AMK I will head down here for their Penang prawn noodle. The dry version is my favorite accompanied by the rich tasting prawn noodle soup. No this is not those typical prawn noodle store.This is Penang style prawn noodle!
I just try the Penang lor mee (Malaysia) , the taste and quality I can give 70% like Penang .....

Located at Blk 711 . The food is normal however hard to find such food in hawker now. The owner or the the worker is just too rude. Luckily that the business is still running  with that kind of attitude around
My go to fix for Penang prawn noodles! I don't know how they did it but it taste better than 888 ones in Penang. I did not try their lor mee although I had been ther for like 10 times. Haha.

I have been eating their lor mee for decades, and absolutely love the thick, flavorful broth. Their marinated egg is also very delicious, and it shows just how much time and effort has gone into preparing the ingredients. A multiple award holder at local TV food variety shows - it is a must try for all lor mee fans! We paid S$4.50 for this bowl.
Very consistent quality, one of my favourite prawn mee soup. Love it! 👍🏻

I never dabao this before but I heard many whom takeaway dry will not get the soup. The soup is the best Penang laksa I tasted in SG. Better than Penang cause it’s more sweet and gao with chilli pack a punch.

Uncle very straightforward, just tell him your order. Take, pay money and enjoy my mee.

V good hokkien prawn mee, v close to penang style. Wish soup can be less sugar. Perhaps thanks to his efficient helper hired recently, owner seems more chill, never scold customers already. Price recently increased but understandable.
It’s the best prawn noodles I had in Singapore. Totally must try!!

Whenever I crave for penang prawn noodles, I would be here. The portion is good for the price, the prawns are always fresh, the broth is flavourful and robust and the chilli elevates the taste. Yummy!

The Soup is a little sweet, but it balanced well with the chilli. It may not be the best I've had, but there's things I really love about it. They use the Ipoh Hor fun kind of kuay Teow rather then the usual big ones, very smooth and goes well with the broth. They even peel the middle sections of the prawns, for this I gave 1 more star. I love prawn heads, and most places you will need to deshell yourself if there's head intact, or they served totally deshelled prawn. It's a lot more work to peel only the middle section, for this I'll definitely come back for more.
The prawn noodle is superb and taste authentic like Penang one. Recommended !
It’s a kind of sweet tasting soup. Chili sauce wasn’t quite what I expected. A bit too citrusy. Overall not quite the same as Penang hokkein mee in Penang. It’s an interesting take though.

I have gone to this stall since I was young. In my latest visit today, I realised that the uncle has increased the price from $5.5 to $7.5 (L). I thought knowing the uncle for so long, I made a friendly remark that he has increased the price again. To my horror, he started scolding (very fiercely) at me, angrily returned my money and brushed me off telling me not to come back anymore in future. I knew all along this uncle has been rather rude to his customers but little did I expect that on myself. It says a lot about a person to drive a customer off in this manner, let alone a loyal customer for so long. Honestly, there are many other very good penang prawn mee around. He has lost me and my family forever.

Soup is rich and tasty, but uncle was extremely rude. I queued up at 12:30 pm (lunch time) and ordered 4 portions of prawn mee to go. He told me in chinese language that 4 portions will jam up the queue behind me and shouted to the 3 people behind ‘you got to wait because she ordered 4 portions’. I felt embarrassed. Now looking back, shouldn’t you expect such orders in the F and B industry? Are you sure you want to treat your patrons who support your business this way? Such an attitude was off-putting and destroyed my appetite. I would not be buying my prawn mee from this place again.
Fried kway teo is not Penang style more local style, fried with sweet sauce and Chinese sausage. Chendol not using fresh coconut milk. Disappointing :(
Like it's Penang Prawn mee, the taste is nice, but the amount of mee is less/not enough.. The prawn is consider big size..
Nice prawn broth and lor mee. Boss gets frustrated when business is good. Don't expect service ok. Order, eat and go.

I don’t understand why so many people giving positive comments on their prawn mee! I went to try for the 1st time after reading those positive reviews, sadly to say it is overrated, soup is too oily and lack of prawn taste! Will never buy again! The best Penang prawn mee I ever tried so far is located at amk hub malaysia boleh!
Rich taste lor mee. Overall is great. Prawn noodle is okay, I think it will taste better if add a bit of lor mee soup
This stall serves the closest to Penang Prawn Noodles. Lady boss very friendly and soup is superb!!!
This stall is a hidden gem! Their soup has incredible flavor. Try the dishes with bee hoon. You won't regret it!

I love the prawn noodles there. Soup is rich and sweet with spice. I understand some may said Uncle attitude isn't good. But for me, I just order, eat n zhao. So don't think too much on that, he won't even remember you if you come once awhile like me.
No kidding.. this is really really good.. and to think that I've been here for the lor mee all this while really triggers me! The Penang Prawn Noodles is da bomb!
My family loves it! But the seller is very stingy with the soup, doesn’t not give us soup when we order DRY noodle takeaway.
Thick prawn soup with nice chilli sauce, delicious
One of my fav Penang style yuenyang (lor mee + prawn mee) ! Standard has been consistent over the past 10 years

Delicious food at an affordable price, with a good variety of options. Only issue is finding a seat during peak meal times, and about ten minutes wait for the more popular stalls. Otherwise, it's one of my favourite places to grab a quick meal either alone or in a small group.

Chilli Pan Mee is the stall with consistent quality. The noodle is special which is not commonly seen here, thicker but not hard. When everything tossed together, u will appreciate the overall texture and taste. Oyster omelette is not oily but sweet instead of savoury. I would prefer more crispy crust. Curry noodle is average. Claypot rice has no smoky nor charred smell. Penang prawn mee is the least favourite as taste is quite bland. We always order chendol after meal but recently the price has increased so much.

My colleague recommended me wanton mee at Malaysia Boleh Jurong Point but its too far from my house. Decided to give Amk hub a shot and wasnt disappointed.

Sei Ngan Zai Wanton mee: my colleague said the noodle is nice, not the typical egg noodle but this is not the case at Amk outlet. Regardless, I enjoyed it because charsiew has the char taste, the soup is tasty with carrot and white cabbage, wanton is savoury and springy with big chunk of pork. Cost: $4.5.

Char Kway Teow ($5/$6.5): got no cockles at all. $5 for 2 prawn and small portion, its a bit expensive.

Ban mian: so so only, the onsen egg is nice though.

After all the hype, we tried this place out to avoid driving all the way to Jurong.

The food here is average at best. Jurong is better, at least from our last trip in Nov 2021.

The chendol is nothing like those in Penang or even any parts of Singapore. So it's bad. Skip it.

Charkoay teow was moist which is unlike Penang which is dryer.

Prawn mee was the only bright spot followed by KL Hokkien mee.

Didn't try out other dishes... Not sure if I want to waste my stomach space again there.

Delicious chilli ban mian. Initially I thought there's not enough chilli and sauce. But after stirring, each and every strand of the noodles was coated immensely with the sauce. There was pork lard to go with it too. It was marvellous. At $4.50 in this setting, it's very worth the price.

Rarely find char siew to be soft and juicy nowadays, all too lean and healthy, surprisingly good one from 四眼仔.
烧肉 also good, skin is crispy but doesn’t stick between teeth, good roast.
However sauce is too sweet for me.

I came back for this bowl. Probably the only competent chili ban mee in the area. Toothsome noodles, topped up for extra veg and the amount was generous.

Unfortunately I won't be back save for at odd hours. Queue management is terrible for this stall. I wasn't given a buzzer or any indication of when my food might be ready, so I hovered at the counter, getting more and more demoralised with every order that wasn't mine. It's good but not enough to warrant a 20 mintue wait. There weren't enough seats on a weekday at lunch either.

Pandan waffle is dense and kueh like. That suits me fine. The blueberry spread is a no go unless you want diabetes.

At B2 of AMK hub, same level as ntuc fairprice.

Many choices of local n malaysian food at reasonable pricing compared to other eateries in the mall.

Went in the afternoon at about 1. 30pm, quite crowded but was able to find a seat within 10mins.

Economical rice- About 20-30 different dishes to choose from.. The veg n meat we chose were delicious. $6.50

Fish soup- Ordered double fish soup. Soup is tasty, fish was also fresh. Opted to add milk.. $8

Would love to come back again to try other food.

Had the chai png today. While the 2 meats were good, the selection of vegetables was dismal.

The eatery is rather cramped up, so go during off-peak hours.

Would rate it as 3.5 stars.

Lovely Malaysian fare which is pretty much as authentic as it gets! Their Assam Laksa is definitely worth eating, and comes with generous amounts of toppings.

Apart from Assam Laksa, do try their Char Kway Teow, Curry Yong Tau Foo Char Kway Teow and Claypot Rice. It’s really quite authentic and bound to hit your cravings for Malaysian food in the right spots!

This place is packed during meal times. Been here countless times. Most of the stalls are pretty good. You'll get your hawker food cravings fulfilled. My personal favourites are the claypot rice & char kway teow

Many stalls only one staff doing cooking but they have 2 food sections. U need wait staff take turn to cook foods. Coffee is not hot  at all, most horrible coffee ever. Untrained staff? Used to a guy making coffee but today is a lady. Basic skill to make coffee minimum must be served hot!! So basic

My all time favorite chilli pan main. Not too spicy and oily. Everything just right and with the half bolied egg it exploded in your mouth. Must eat every time I'm here. Together I will always order the fish ball noodle. You could taste the difference from our Singapore style. The whole meal experience made it felt like you're in Malaysia. Missed going MY.
My go-to place for Assam Laksa. Love the BKT and Assam laksa better than any shop that served Malaysia food outside. Anyone who misses Malaysia food definitely should drop by for a try.

Huge variety of Malaysian cuisine, don’t go too near to closing time, most of the time, they will not entertain your orders by saying they are closing soon. Some might be rude to you, but this is 100% authentic Malaysian experience!

Always crowded near to, during or slightly after meal hours! Need to find a seat before going for an order. Tables are dirty as the cleaning staff are not doing their part to clear the plates and wipe the tables.

Wafer was warm and crispy on the outside. Durian was the cheap kind, on the watery side, hardly any sweetness nor was it aromatic. And it was $6.80. Only went to try it because of some food blogger. And I wanted to believe it was good. Disappointing.

Very nice piping hot claypot with dark sauce and sesame oil fragrance. Portion is generous with rice, chicken, Chinese sausage and salted fish. Those who love 锅巴will have lots to enjoy. The sambal chilli is very good too!

Having dinner at Malaysia Boleh, it is not the first time we have the fried kway teow, it comes with a little spicy taste, and that wok hei (wok thermal radiation) is really great! I have seen some stalls that they have the wok hei, but there is some portion of the food got burn. This stall did a good job on that, I dont see any burn on my food. It comes with bean sprout, spring onion green leaves, eggs and 2 median size  prawns! I prefer this spring onion to choy sum, as some times the choy sum might have a bitter taste, love it and will definitely come back again! ❤️
Waiting time is roughly about 15 minutes during 7pm on Saturday

Brunch at Malaysia Boleh@AMK Hub.
Highlight is the: KL Curry Yong Tau Fu Chee Cheng Foo 吉隆坡咖喱粮豆腐猪肠粉.
$5 (2 persons to share as we bought other food, too): CCF, brinjal, dry bean curd, wanton, sausage, curry sauce n a sprinkle of sesame seeds.
Great breakfast at Malaysia Boleh.
Please come later, like around afternoon for: FKT, KL hokkien mee, Hainansese chicken rice and many more.

Any food labelled KL, Penang, Malacca, Ipoh… I w eat. Missing these cities n the people very much.
Located at B2 of AMK Hub, this foodcourt is a very crowded outlet. The food is nice and the price is quite reasonable.

Was excited to find Malaysia food court with good variety at amk hub. Unfortunately the taste can’t make it. Tried the KL fried Hokkien mee and it’s a horror. Worst noodle ever! Whole plate is super black, including the cabbage and prawns. You can’t even see/ tell they are there until you dig in (there are only very few pieces anyway) Taste is totally off!!! Anyone can fry a better plate of noodle than this!!!

The Penang prawn noodle looks more promising with the hard boiled egg, small shrimps fry in chili, sliced pork and soup with chili oil. Unfortunately the soup lacks flavour, just salty.

The apom is also disappointing, soggy with hardly any fillings. The best thing I found here is the crispy pancake. Yeah, probably the only thing worth eating here.
A place where you can get many of Malaysia’s delicacies! And of which are up to standard and expectation. Would recommend Chendol and the pork cutlet curry rice. Asam laksa is not bad too!

Lots of nice Msian foods here that can fix craving on Msian food. Curry chee cheong fun and dry chili pan mee is my all time favorite. Personally feel the apam balik is not that authentic, it tastes like a kuih kapit..

Staff on shift was genuine n kind, very dedicated to her job and was nice to share her experience and changes in jobs toswrve others n finds joy in her everyday life which keeps her going. Loved the outcome fluffy, kueh and yet crisp thick pandan waffle that tasted nice even plain, although on pricey end of $2.30 for plain but alls worth the trip down cuz i loved the auntie that served me tday(:

Been a huge fan of this Msian foodcourt at Jurong Point for several years, so glad they have set up one nearer home at AMK HUB, and recently at Simei Eastpoint Mall too.

Apparently it's a foodcourt concept set up by Feixiong, who owns many EATs at shopping mallls. The best is the Penang fried kuayteow, full of wokhei n uses Ipoh stubby bean sprouts, curry chicken beehoon is yummy, more flavourful than HongLim's lemak style. Hokkien prawn noodles and fishballs are great too. Rojak's sauce is very authentic Penang style.

Recently they have added curry chee cheong fun, quite authentic too

Place : seats not enough
Food : good
Penang laksa has no sardine …
Good  variation of food, nice pork noodle and Penang prawn mee. Clay pot rice 's staff are rude.
The new waffle stall is awesome. Strong pandan favour and chunky thick waffle. Available spreads are peanut, blueberry, durian, butter etc. some are hotdogs too. Opens till 9pm ++.

Bought the Loh Mai Gai, Lotus Bun and Red Bean Bun. Price was reasonable. The quality was good, ingredients were fresh and taste was yummy. Will buy again.
Updated on 7 Sep 2022:
Had the Char Kway Teow and Char Siew Wanton noodles. CKT was good, delicious and flavourful, with 2 prawns, plenty of bean sprouts and pork lard. The noodles on the other hand was average, the Char Siew was too fatty. Soup was nice.

This Malaysian themed food court offered a wide variety of food. However, the quality was rather below average. The bak kut teh had quite a generous amount of ingredients for $5.50 but the meat was tougher than Mahathir and Lee Chong Wei combined, the soup lacked fragrance, the canned mushrooms were out of place and even the dark soya sauce with chilli was tasteless. The prawn crackers and prawn noodles were ok but far from great. The sugar cane was diluted. Seats were limited. Only cash was accepted. Also, the kitchen staff felt like they hated their jobs.

Recommended. Authentic Malaysia Food, the standard quite consistent. Love 辣椒板面，Claypot Chicken rice, hokkien noodles, Nasi Lemak, and Cendol here!

Updated on 6 Nov 2021: wasn't happy with the food here since last few visit. The food wasn't as tasty as it used to be, especially claypot chicken rice. And yesterday was our time tried their wan ton noodles (towards more sweetness) and fried carrot cake (towards more salty), to be more exact in Chinese.. 两盘没有灵魂的食物。😅 The dishes only "looked" authentic but the taste is below expectation. Same goes to kopi c ice. :(  was rated 5 stars in year 2019, but the food standards wasn't maintain since my past few visits.

Just wanted to grab a teh C after groceries shopping at NTUC on late afternoon.  Teh C more like water C. No taste of tea at all n $1.50!!! Wasn’t busy too. Hope the mgmt pick up on this and do some QC

Decent Malaysian food from across the country all in one, convenient food court. Quality varies by stalls but some dishes like the Penang Char Kway Teow are quite close to the original’s. Portion sizes can be a little small for the price but still worth a visit if you’re craving for Malaysian food. Food court can be crowded and some dishes like the Hokkien Noodles can take a long time to prepare. Some patience required.

Not sure why the Malaysia Boleh Fried Oyster no longer has the special Penang Fried Oyster taste. It's still good, but it taste like our regular local Fried Oyster. I miss their Penang flavored! Chendol still as good!

This is a disgrace to Malaysia street food.
Especially the service standard.
And the "no say" attitude in your preference of chilli or not. Because there is only 1 type set by the stall, simply this is their way which you have to accept.
Char Kuay Teow suck!

First time here, ate the claypot chicken rice
5/5 for me... Reasonable portion and value for the current market trend.
Food was quick and very delicious.

Also tasted abit of the fried kway teow, it was also very delicious.

Looking forward to trying other dishes in the future. 👍🙏.
Clay pot chicken rice is good. Carrot cake was very tasty! Youtiao rojak was a little disappointing. But overall experience was still ok 👌🏻 will visit to try the other food again.

The new cai png stall is for risk takers. Ordering cai png here is like navigating a field of land mines. The promo during the first few days of opening will lead you to think that prices are cheap with no surprises, but things then changed. Meat that look like they’re cooked in a similar way can cost very different. A bit of canned mushrooms lingering in veggie dishes will make them cost the same as meat dishes. They don’t inform you when you order the dish. Simply misleading.
Food is tasty and price is fair. Please improve the ventilation so that patrons do not leave the place with smelly clothes, the smell is noticeable after entering to Dabao.

Awesome Malaysia foods.  Reasonably priced and the standards of most stalls are consistent in all the Malaysia Boleh foodcourts in Singapore. The dried chilli ban main is definitely worth mentioning. The handmade noodles are chewy and very Q. Not the soggy sort. The sauce and chilli combo is just right. The addition of soft boiled egg further enhances the smoothness of the noodles. The ikan bilis are fried to perfection. Crispy and not salty at all. As usual, the foodcourt is packed with patrons from 3-5pm (weekdays) during their coffee and tea promo. Only 50 cents a cup! Highly recommend if your are craving for some authentic good old Malaysian dishes.

Went AMK HUB Fair Price shopping and came across Malaysia Boleh, decided to try out.  The Kalng Bak Gut Teh is very nice, highly recommended. Clay pot chicken is not the best I have try. Chendol is tasty too, have the authentic Melaka taste,  quite crowded on the Sunday Afternoon.

Always crowded on peak meal hours - try going on off peak hours. I tried a few dishes (prawn mee, wanton mee, roast duck, and the chendol) and it was - I think - the closest you can get to the original. Prices are affordable (not Malaysia affordable; Singapore affordable!). Dishes are quite reasonably portioned (I get full after one dish). The chendol I thought was the best of all the rest of the food, and is the first stall I would drop by.
Completely recommend, and sometimes I have cravings thinking about it!

Food is hawker price but portion is half. $4 for tiny bowl of prawn mee and assam laksa. Assam laksa never put prawn paste and not nice. Prawn mee is ok. Kl hokkien mee is good and $6. Wantan mee not good, and their wantan was not ready. Crowded only because of the novelty and good location
Ordered the dry banmian ($4.50) and requested more chillies. It turned out salty but not spicy at all. The popiah ($2.50) so so only and cendol ($2.50) was tasteless and diluted.

Ordered Claypot chicken rice via a delivery app.

Rice was fragrant with sesame oil. Taste-wise it was good. Salty and slight sweetness from the black sauce. Their chili is really spicy and slightly sour. I usually just mix it in together with the rice which adds an extra kick to the dish. For the ingredients, there were quite a few chunks of chicken but I didn't like that the skin was on as the skin was very chewy. There were also two small pieces of salted fish and only ONE miserable slice of my favourite Chinese sausage. *Sobs*
Well actually I have ordered this a few times and the amount of ingredients given are usually inconsistent.

Overall I do like their claypot chicken rice but I wished they were more consistent with the amount of ingredients in each order.
Own self check in without temperature scanning. Food not tasty anymore. My prawn noodle has a weird smell for the pork slices.

We stay at AMK and I wonder why we haven't been here before.
The food we ate, everything, from clay pot chicken rice, carrot cake, oyster egg, chendol to appam was awesome. We loved it and the food is very reasonably priced.
Malaysia boleh is similar to a medium sized food court, which offers its customers a plethora of food options (Malaysian food) via various shops/vendors under one umbrella. It is self service, and we get to see our food getting prepped before us.

The best parts:
1. Good quality food
2. Helpful staff who guides it's customers to get seats (this is a life saver :)...when hungry)
3. Though we have long queues, we get our food ready in a timely manner
4. Surprisingly, thr was less oil in everything
5. Absolute value for money

For all the above reasons, we are gonna come here again!!!  :) and recommend to others as well.

Those good food is good delicious but need to really take good care on how to store RAW food meats and seafood outside for long hours.  This can cause food poisoning if all the RAW food ingredient place outside for so long.  Hope management really take care this serious issue

Malaysia street foods and it's delicious. I'll say quite close to the taste I ate in Malaysia. Maybe the dining environment is different so you don't really feel the same. Price is similar to other food courts. At least it is a change from the usual food choices we have in other food courts.

$1 per stick only. Price is good.
But taste is too salty especially the black sauce part, perhaps it tasted better without black sauce.
Enoki roll after fried seem to overcooked until the enoki mushroom become very small but taste good 👍 just too small.
Overall taste is good except the salty black sauce which I think they did not spread the sauce evenly.
They also provide many different dips to eat with the skews.

Selection of food was a little small although most of the sticks were only priced at $1. Cooking of the food was really quick and the skewers below totaled up to $12. Taste wise, food was very decent although a pair would probably need to order more than pictured to be full. 4 types of sauce selections were offered. Generally a decent joint although i probably would not make a special trip for this.

Variety: 5/10
Taste: 5/10
They only serve processed meat but DLLM has meat on sticks and satay sticks. The rest of the ingredients are pretty much the same. Taste wise,  the seasoning is not as flavorful as DLLM. But,  their homemade chilli sauce is really good.
Overall,  it was ok but I'd still prefer DLLM as they have real meat.
Deep fry is the only choice. Relatively small selection. Pricing to portion ratio can be high. Coffee shop can get pretty crowded in the evening. Parking may be a challenge.

Carried only a small selection of lok lok items, which are all simply deep fried. Then either sprinkled with a salt pepper mix or brushed over with a soya sauce based marinate. Everything starts to taste the same by your third skewer. Special chilli sauce packs quite a punch.

Ordinary. Even though at $1.

Have been patronising Loklok 1991 for quite sometime and I must say that their Loklok standard is one of the more consistent ones out there. This stall is mend by young hawkers and have been around the area for a few years now. The coffeeshop has a few other stall that sells very nice food such as curry chicken and Thai food, including mookata as well as western cuisine.

Back to the Loklok review. Comparing it to the ones that I have tried before elsewhere, it is one of my favourite. From the sauce that they use, the chilli options that they have and the freshness of the food, it has been great so far. Their choices of Loklok is also quite wide but so come early or you might not be able to get some of the favourite options such as mushrooms, brocoli and etc.

Keep up the consistency and I will visit everytime I want to bring my friends over for supper!

my favourite lok lok stall in sg! im not sure if they bbq or deep fry, but it has more of a bbq grilled yummy taste and not oily. im guessing this could be a rare stall that do bbq over deepfry (most other loklok stalls deepfry)
Broccoli flavour is so yummy!! But wish their BBQ flavouring could be more standardised. Sometimes its nice sometimes it's not after such a long wait

I have just ordered this from grab delivery... Very disappointed with the food/per stick portion. And my food is mostly burned and bitter... I think most reviews here is either fake OR my order is done very badly.

I personally will not eat from their store in the future.

---------------------------
Responding to the owner's respond... Already said the order is burned and bitter...

Not sure, which part of my statements wasn't clear to you.

A good place to chill, $1 loklok per stick. They provide 3 types of sauce: Satay, Sweet Chili, and their signature chili sauce. However the place is crowded during dinner, might take time to get your seat.

A bit overrated and dry on few of the items, this Lok Lok seems to be deep fried only. Love the fried beancurd skin, mantou and the satay sauce.
There are also other choices like enoki mushroom with bacon, aubergine, cheese ball, broccoli, luncheon meat, quail eggs. Some of the food are really a bit dry and the foodcourt runs out of seats easily to mookata and the wait is long. I would come early if I’m coming second time.

Great sauce that adds bountiful flavor to the loklok. 1 dollar per stick. Variety is okay but can be better. Quite fast service and cooking. Good value and generally this coffee shop is hipster with good variety of other food to go with. Recommended.

Not a great value preposition at $1 per stick of very cheap ingredient. But you can't beat the good variety of fried veggies, meat and seafood to accompany your mookata (23 in all). Although there is a minor queue when I turned up, the food is served fast (within 10 mins). You can choose from a selection of 4 sauces (satay, sweet thai chili,  sweet sauce and  homemade made Chilli). The place was rocking when I turned up (around 7.45pm) on Friday. The place attracts the young crowd and I recommend the outer sitting areas ( which is cooler). The place can get quite warm because of the many platters of mookata sizzling. I have chosen the mushroom set paired with a few odds and ends. The tare sauce with a dusting of white pepper on it enhances the nuances of fried unami. One thing can be improved is the rate of replenishment of the popular ingredients, the ingredients can be standby in the larger chiller in the back and quickly replenished in small batches as the night goes on. I happen to missed out on the eggplant 🍆 and fried fish because of that. But overall a good spot if you are looking for a platter of fried stuff and to nibble in a patpong soi vibe.

Lok Lok served here are $1 per stick so if the item has 2 sticks, it's $2.
I would say the food was so-so, not crispy as expected and not really to my liking. All of the Lok Lok are drizzled with a black pepper sauce(?) which wasn't to my liking. Maybe would have like it more without the sauce. They also have sauces which you can grab yourself, satay, chili and sweet chili.

Just putting an honest review here.
Decent food (abit salty for me) decent price.
But i wouldn’t go back again because we queued for 1hr plus and waited 40mins for the food.

The stall owner is friendly and nice but really need to work something out to speed up the orders if you don’t want to lose customers.
Great taste, good selection of ingredients, value for money at  $1 /stick including premium ingredients like scallop. excellent service and located in nice hip coffee shop.
At $1/stick, nice loklok (and sauces) made from fresh ingredients, together with good service, we'll definitely be back again!

One of the best lok lok I ever have, the original sauce that came with it is already very nice as it is, and they still provide option for extra sauces!

Appreciate Daniel and Meng for going extra mile, making the delivery this evening when there's no grab driver. Thank you!
1 stick for $1 lok lok! 😋 The brocolli are a must-order!! The seasoning used is different from the other places I've tried as well, tasted more peppery than usual.

Deep fried to perfection. Mantou and taukee is a must!
Sauces are average, but the chilli is worth a dip.
Fun food for a late night snack with friends, I recommend the broccoli, seaweed chicken and breaded scallops. Service comes with a smile too!
food was good，fast and cheap
Very popular. Can wait 30min on weekend evening.
By far the best Lok Lok I have eaten in Singapore. Far better than the famous that the DLLM LOK LOK that need to queue for 2 hours.. 100% worth it
Have a sweet glaze(I'm guessing it's honey) on the Lok Lok. Just taste weird. Personally not for me.
not bad, affordable pricing. their homemade sauce is nice and goes well with the food. will come back again
Great spot to satisfy your craving for JB lok lok! Authentic and nice! Personal favourites are the oyster mushroom, broccoli and fish fillet!!!
Just fried food, nothing special. Home made chilli sauce is nice though.
Alot of sauce to choose from and really reasonably priced. Opens till late too! Perfect for supper :)

Food was not hot, just little warm.
Salty and small serving.
Chilli not fantastic.
Tried several lok lok, still prefers this over the others. Great food.
Wide variety of sticks to choose from, at affordable prices and four types of sauces to dip into. Happiness!

Food was so so only. Not sure why so many rave reviews. Very limited selection, no fresh meat, and quantity is small so you dont get much for $1. Broccoli was soooooo thin. Too much pepper. But overall average for lok lok
Very tasty, food well presented. Price wise very economical! Thumbs up for the service! ❤️

yay to good AND affordable loklok! went tonight and whilst the queue was long, food took really quick to come. the staff there were great and polite! the broccoli tasted amazing!! :D must try their mantou as well.

$1 lok loks are really affordable, flavour is pretty accurate and authentic. Overall solid. But I just wish there were more options like meat skewers and etc. Maybe do a premium $2 per stick series or something. Other than that overall its still a decent hang to get your Lok Lok fix.
Pretty decent Lok Lok, priced at $1 per stick with a variety of sauces (which you can choose 2). I particularly liked that they offer mantou cos who doesn't like a good fried bun right?

There are plenty of creative varieties when picking the menu, and the sauces are delicious. I really love their food especially the broccoli and bacon wrap enoki. Pleasant, fuss free and fast experience over the delivery process. Greatly recommend!☺️
Value for money $1 per stick but must wait a bit for the food to serve

For 1 dollar a stick.
It's pretty decent. Would love if they added more seasoning. Can't really compare to Johor standard but it's good enuf if you have a craving.
Theres Thai milk tea from the drink stall and mookata near by too. Overall a good place to chill and eat
Good place to hangout with friends and family, variety choices of food

My to go loklok place in sg ever since, we can’t go into Jb. I really like the chilli sauce, not sure why some ppl in the comments will say the chilli sauce is not spicy enough etc etc, personally I love it. If not spicy enough, bring your own chilli.

Do try out the fried mushrooms, it retains the crunch really well, I really like the Enoki wrapped with bacon. And yes, the fried Zai Er. Must wait for it to cool down, and after that the crunch.

Food is great and affordable at $1/stick.
Staff are friendly and service is fast!

Revisited this place a couple of times and will recommend to my friends.

After visiting a few loklok stalls, I still come back to this stall! This is really the best LOKLOK stall for me. The food was fried at the right temperature and duration! After a long day, this is my comfort food.
Surprise the variety not that many...lok lok served is too dried after fried...
Valued for money and their sauce for their Lok Lok are great!

Decent Lok Lok, seasoning and chili is on point, and all the people tending the stall are friendly and polite. Sticks get refreshed often enough despite the demand. For those giving a low score based on the price and the queue and lack of seats, omg what is wrong with you people... this is 1) Singapore, and $1 a stick is reasonable; 2) this is a kopitiam for crying out loud!

Salty and cold. Not worth the 2 hour waiting time.
1 hr queue and 1 hr to wait for food to cook.

Once the buzzer ringed, we straight took our food. So i not sure how did that 10 second walk from their shop to our table (since it was just beside them) cooled our food immediately.
Food is less oily and salty than others, while the sauces are just decent. 1hr queue to select the sticks you want; another 1 hr wait for the sticks to be cooked. Be prepared to wait!
By far the best lok lok in Singapore I have tried! Their lok lok have the perfect sauce & seasoning and especially their home-made chili sauce, it was the bomb. Must try!

Chance upon this stall selling Nasi Padang on the last row at the cheng san market and food centre. I was there around 1pm and the selection of dishes to select from was still huge. There was a short queue when i was there.

Selected 3 dishes, sambal hotdogs, egg and cabbage, paid SGD$4 for my meal. Food was pretty decent. Love the lemak chilli padi gravy, very rich and the spiciness level was alright. Portion wise, just right for me and quite value for money.

Their other dishes looks quite mouthwatering as well. I would try their other dishes next time round.

Over rated in my opinion. Overall taste quite blend and not very tasty.
Came all the way from bedok but was disappointed.

Awesome old school Nasi Lemak. Eggs are nicely browned and the rice still smells of coconut, not always the case these days. Sambal was lovely too! Begedil was not to my liking though. Chicken wings were pretty good, with juicy flesh!
Nasi lemak, $3, comes with fried chicken wing, egg and ikan bilis. Chili is spicy and rice is rich in coconut milk aroma.
Food is good. portion is very generous. Served by friendly makciks would recommend others to come here to try their nasi lemak and nasi sambal goreng
The Signature Royal is sold out so I opt for Fried Chicken and Fish. Chicken is tender and juicy , rice is fragrance and chilli is the main draw.

Ordered the Royal Rumble set which include a piece of everything.
The highlight is the chilli, not too sweet and not too overpowering, it is just nice for my liking .

Highly recommended if you are craving for a fantastic nasi lemak!

Went for Royal Rumble, $6.50.  Comes with Dish, chicken wing, begedil, otah. They used basmati rice, slight fragrance. Sambal a little spicy, good. Begedil also good. Fish ok. Chicken wing a bit crispy, not flavourful enough. Egg is runny which is usually overcook. Otah tasted soso. Overall very decent plate of nasi lemak.
Their Nasi lemak never disappoints. Always seen with long queues, that’s how you’ll know it’s good!!

Nasi Lemak. A ubiquitous dish easily found all around our island! Easy to find, but to get something really good, not all that easy!
Selera Rasa Nasi Lemak. It's hands-down our family's favourite coconut-infused meal. No attention is sacrificed to detail. The rice; bryani, cooked with coconut milk. This gives the Nasi that beady-rice appearance which doesn't clump together when served. Bryani itself already has an aromatic smell on its own, so infused with coconut milk, brings the flavour and aroma to a whole new level altogether!

Those wings! Amazingly crispy! We love just how our meal is accompanied by the 'music' of crackly sounds whenever somebody bites into their chicken wing! The seasoning permeates into the meat, moist and steamy-soft layers that follow the crispy outsides!

And what is Nasi Lemak without its sambal? The sambal used here is sweet and tangy, with hints of onion-sweetness, and paired with their already flavourful rice, makes for a meal befitting a Tuan:)
Please update the store's operating hrs diligently as there were few occasions that we came all the way frm Tpayoh unfortunately the shop was found closed. Thk u

Aunt  talking say give free face mask last when pay money say $1/- plus the order total add up, feel like the word can't believe from the start. Feeling so bad hearing negative sorry you need to pay second sentence :(
Good quality, delicious Nasi Lemak discovered here in this coffeeshop. Love at first bite. Must try. There's always queue here.

Was having lunch here yesterday n specifically check with stall their opening time n was told Mon to Thur until 4pm, rest on Friday ONLY!
I just went to buy but don't have again. Guess will just strike it off my list
As good as their main stall in Adam Road. No queue.
The sambal was excellent, ingredients were fresh but the price was a bit steep considering it's located in HDB kopitiam. Take note they suka suka open, suka suka close.

There were only three people ahead of me but the queue moved very slowly. Out of 7 choices displayed, only 3 or4 were available. Food quality seemed to have dropped. Only the rice and chilly still taste good. Ikan bilis are very small and the fried chicken was tasteless although it still kept its crispiness. Overall, this is still an above average nasi lemak meal. Thanks to the fantastic chilly.
The best nasi lemak.....no issue parking also.

Quiet place to have a good meal.
Here there are. Good spread of chine, Malay and Indian food.
Best thing there are nets surrounding the coffeeshop to prevent birds from flying into the coffeeshop.

suka2 don't want to open. came on tuesday, 02 nov, and not open even tho stated on google maps that it is.

NOT the first time either, even when the stated day of rest is every friday.

Fluffy and fragrant rice. Ikan bilis and chicken wings are crispy and tasty. The best is still the chilli sambal, which makes the nasi lemak complete. Too bad the whole lot of otah were snapped up through a pre-order and didn't get to taste the complete royal rumble. Next time.
The begedil and chilli was good. The rice was a bit hard for my liking and the chicken could have been seasoned longer.

This is the same stall located at Adam Road, the famous Selera Rasa Nasi Lemak. They used long-grain basmati rice cooked with coconut milk and pandan leaves. It is rich and fragrant until you can smell the delicate aroma from the rice. It paired well with their own-made sweet spicy sambal chili. I ordered the $5 set and it comes with otah, fried chicken wings, ikan bilis, egg and cucumber slices. They were all pretty normal, nothing really special and on a downside, they were all served cold.

Overall, the rice was really delicious and I thoroughly enjoyed it, but for the side dishes, I just felt they weren’t all that good to me.
Come and try.. 👍
Nasi lemak original set, simple yet fragrance rice n sambal chilli, a great breakfast meal to start the fay!
First & last time here. The prices are just as expensive albeit it being in a HDB. No government control this is what happens. Not for poor Merdeka/Pioneer  citizens like me.
Rice and the fried chicken is my fav. The chicken is not too salty or hard. Fresh and crispy!
Rmb to call and pre order. Else there will be chicken wing eet
Taste good.. the scent of coconut milk on the rice and the chili.. 👍🏼👍🏼
Good tasting. Good quality rice. Well balanced taste.
They maintain their sambal taste
Amk Best Fried Hokkien Prawn Mee!!!
Good taste nasikemak, wonderful breakfast
Not bad as usual. Too bad the coffeeshop is too far away in the corner.
Ok - nice lunch there.
Nothing much the price bit high.food is nice

Great nasi lemak

Have been patronize this eatery for few years. Great location besides FairPrice and hawker center around.
If you like to have your meal with cold air conditioning, and variety of Malay traditional foods, this place suits you.

I never order their other foods except their Malay Nasi Padang. Quite variety of choices, I especially liked their Chicken Merah (red means). With pick another 2 vegetable for a meal, it cost $5.80. Portion are quite big. Could easily feed 2 small eaters.

Foods cost are rising tremendously, I used to buy it at $5 for 1 meat 2 veggies. Reasonable enough they increased 80¢ more, as long as they keep their standard well. Hope they not increasing again.

Will only visit again if craving attacks. 😜

Friendly staff and great Malay food.
Must try their chilly sauce. They have a few type for different type of food. Spicy hot. Price is a bit pricey but really worth the price if you look at the serving of the meats per order.
Fish guts no clear totally, eat very smelly

Average food that's slightly pricier than surrounding Muslim food. But I like their coffee. Staff can get impatient during peak hours.

Busy but Generally can find seat during peak hours.
Great place for meals. Convenient location. Few minutes walk to Ang Mo Kio train station and shopping mall Ang Mo Kio hub. Usually not crowded.
Tried the nasi ambeng here. Turned out to be  a grand serving including beef rendang, chicken drumstick, tempeh, veg, steamed rice topped with dessicated coconut. Cooking standard was good.
The beef rendang is very tender!!! Not too sweet and very tasty!

Had the worst experience here. The Milo tasted so watery.. overcharged me with a fish and chicken for $8 when we asked why she reduce the price to $7.80. the tehc was watery too.. won't come back again
I ordered the food (nasi lemak) through foodpanda today but the rice turned out to be uncooked it was raw. The chicken tasted as though it was recycled.

Nice nasi ambeng. Tastes as if home-cooked. Good portion for 2. Price is ok for me.
Will come back if I’m in the area👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

Just had late lunch due to the nearby hawker centre being closed for a few days.

Standard of food is about same as those sold in mrt stations. But at a different price point.

2 stars for the black pepper chicken rice. The soup was as salty as sea water. The quarter chicken was refried to a shade darker than fast food chicken, and then tossed with the black pepper sauce.

3 stars as the ice coffee saved the meal.
Enjoy this delicious nasi meal from Assam tree, hidden in NTUC Ang Mo Kio (outside the Amk hub mall)
Great Food... nvn fail me whenever I wanted Malay food... love their mee Soto and Chicken lemak and the sambal.

Nice Nasi Padang. $5 for 3 sides and a generous portion. Mee siam is not bad $3. Nasi Lemak is not bad too at $3. Usually crowded and full during lunch time. The chicken rice stall is no longer there as of 29 December 2016.
Yummy nasi padang, but price can escalate. I had 5 dishes for 13bucks. Some of the stuff can be oily. Eat for an indulgent meal.

Located at the side of the standalone NTUC (not AMK Hub), this quiet cafe secretly sells one of the best nasi padangs. Spice level is just right to tingle the taste buds and the variety of food options is sure to delight.

Dishes go beyond the standard fare, and includes mussels and black squid (usually its chilli squid only).
Nice halal food. Always come here for the chicken rice

Very friendly staff that bring double joy to the great meal served.
Ingredients in the Nasi Lemak bring simple, but true in every ways.
Chicken Merah set meal is saucy with a pinch of hidden sweetness that lightens your taste buds.

Was there at 12.30pm.While waiting for medical appointment.Ordered a rice,sotong & 2 veggies with begedel and 1 can of coke and was charged $9.00 in a bills.Don't know of it was the actaual or certainly the staff just made the priced.

So i ask this chinese lady which i guess is the "manager" cause her colleagues called her, so i asked that if i could have a bag of soup for my chicken rice. She firmly just said "oh no soup no soup" when i literally saw there is a pot of soup behind them. After i walk off, heard the colleagues together with the manager laugh off at me thinking i didn't hear them. Super disappointed!! Is this how you treat your customer?! RIDICULOUS!!

The place is usually clean n its not too crowded even though they are popular for lunch.  Also like that their Kopi, bandung n lime juice is cheap n good. Sambal sotong is fab. As are their fragrant rice. The curry mutton is well spiced with robust flavours and their lemak vegetables  are legit.

Place is usually full because the food is that nice. Haven't tried the chicken rice stall in their outlet yet so I cannot comment.
The Long Tong is my favourite food here. For $3.50, it is value for money. Lotsa veggie and the gravy is tasty. And don't forget the sambal, it is a must!

i love the sambal crispy chicken but today very disappointed

dissapointed today morning i bought 2 packet rendang seems like yesterday balance rendang,eat mi siam the gravy got no taste,i had been here one yr ago almost once a week use to be v delicious especially the rendang n mi siam.

But the gravy when mixed with satay sauce goes well the noodles.

Saw lots of reviews and was excited about this being my 1st mee rebus experience. And maybe I just don't like mee rebus but not what I was expecting. The sauce was good and chicken was good. Satay sauce was great unfortunately they didn't start selling satay yet. Maybe I don't know but it seems like this gravy would be better on maybe something besides noodles? Not sure but didn't seem to go well together.  Flavorful but disappointing.

Ok the photo may look a bit messy but this mee rebus is good stuff. Noodles portion is larger than average, n the $5 'Power' version also gets u a decent chunk of chicken. Gravy remains nice n thick to the very last strand of noodle

$4.80 for mee rubus + chopped chicken chunks + satay sauce. I like the taste. Not  overly rich and doesn't make you feel jelak even towards the end. Generous portion of chicken. Even though its breast meat, it was not dry. Will definitely eat again.

Rich, sweet and creamy mee rebus. Easily one of the best in Singapore. Ayam is soft and tender, and the satay peanut sauce gives it such a delightful experience overall. It’s a very rich and filling meal overall, so prepare your stomach.

I am not a Mee Rebus fan as yellow noodles is not really my type of noodles. @rahimmuslinfood is the only stall that I am willing to travel all the way from the West to Ang Mo Kio whenever I have craving for Mee Rebus! Their Power Mee Rebus ($4.80) features Cut Chicken and Hard-Boiled Egg drenched with Satay Sauce Topping. The sauce is damn power lor.

Location: Rahim Muslim Food, 453A Ang Mo Kio Ave 10, #01-01, Singapore 560453
Queue already started when it opens. The portion is generous and the gravy is nice. However the chicken is bland in flavour.
Good value with great taste. Very generous with a whole chicken tigh in both mee rebus and mee soto. Satay looks more like bbq with double the amount of meat!

First time try. One of the best Mee Rebus I have. Thick gravy, big portion. The satay sauce addition is unique. Normal Mee Rebus is $3.5. add slice of chicken $4.5. Add a drumstick $6. Prepare for queue. Highly recommended.
Look at the Mee Rebus !!! Ingredient so rich. And quite delicious as well. Come Ang Mo Kio Avenue 10 Blk 453A Choong Boon Market & Food Centre @ stall #01-01 Rahim Muslim Food. Try it up !!!

One of the best mee rebus and satay I ever had. Mee rebus(power) is really good. The portion is really generous. The chicken satay is also really good. They only use chicken thigh meat. Every bite of the chicken satay is tender and juicy. If you like satay kajang in Malaysia, you will definitely like this one too. Going to try their mutton satay on my next visit because they don't have it today. - Satay only available after 3pm.

Food here has always been consistently good. I'm not a mee rebus fan but I will gladly eat the power mee rebus here, with chicken and slathered with satay gravy. The satay itself has a very tradional taste and texture and is good as well.
2pm on a weekday, short queue. Power mee rebus, with splash of gado gado sauce on top of the chicken drumstick. Last ate this 30 years ago. Happy to be reunited with this iconic dish!
power mee rebus is good. the mee rebus ok, but the power add on : chicken egg and satay sauce is great.

You have to be there early for their satay. Their mutton satay sells out really quickly. Their mee rebus is delicious. In early May, they received an award presented by the World Gourmet Summit. Testament to their food is good. This is a very hardworking stall.

Highly recommend this. My fav is their beehoon soto, remember to add their chilli as it packs a punch! For the price I think it’s worth it as the chicken is generous 👍🏻👍🏻 My dad likes their mee rebus, their power sauce (satay sauce) inside the mee rebus broth is really power 👍🏻

So sad @5pm they ran out of their famous m.rebus power($5) so ordered soto ayam($5).T broth is more cloudy,heavy ,rich n a bit salty, it reminded me of a halal Ramen I had@ Ayam-ya restraunt in tokyo,I prefer a slightly lighter version,like t one serve @changi airport kopitiam. After a few spoon full I get jelak. I don't think will order t soto again, will only go there for their m.rebus power or maybe try their satay.
Ps. Rahim gives more chix as compare to t other famous m.rebus with chix n satay  sauce @ AMK ctrl hawker stall
Thick robust and flavourful sauce. A bit too sweet, add more chilli to balance it out.

I will agree with the other folks here. This is the best mee soto in Singapore- one that can compare with Indo’s best. Highly recommended. For the Mee Rubus, they add peanut sauce which is nice but not for those with allergies.

Was excited to try their mee rebus after watching Chef Bob’s review but was unpleasantly surprised by the uncle’s rudeness. We came at 1130am and asked if there is still mee rebus, we didn’t know that they only open at 1230noon. To our dismay, he answered us rudely by saying “can’t you see we are preparing?” We don’t stay around there, so we don’t know the area well. We don’t need 5 star treatment, just be polite. Even though we never had the chance to try the food, I will never come back. I don’t owe you a living to be treated that way.

It's my go to place for mee soto. $4.50 serving gives a lot of chicken and one piece of begedil . Soup is favorful. Tonight I am lucky there is still chicken satay available. It's huge ... $0.70 each. Peanut sauce is not as chunky as other stalls.perhaps is end if day already.. Sad that mutton is sold out.  Normally the stalk close or sold out by 7pm.

Satisfying fresh take on the classic mee rebus dishes. A good authentic taste of mee rebus topped with a satay peanut sauce and if you prefer it with chicken and extra $1. Overall, a good plate of mee rebus but nothing special about other than the addition of satay peanut sauce. Service was fast and sometimes a short queue will be require during peak period.
P.S since its in Broadway kopitiam chain, expect the drinks to be super overpriced.

Food 3/5
Price 4/5
Dessert - /5
Ambience 2/5
Service 4/5

Ordered the power mee rebus after seeing a recommendation from a friend. It was yummy! Highlight was the sauce 🤤 will be back to try the satay (only starts at 3:30pm) and Soto (pictured here but it wasn’t mine).

Also, expect long queues!

Malay braised noodles, or Mee Rebus is a comfort food since childhood growing up in Singapore's multicultural heartland. And tucked in the heartland of Singapore is this Muslim food stall of more than 4 decade's history moving from location to location over the years. On offering is a few basic dishes only, Satay from 230pm, Mee Soto and of course Mee Rebus their specialty. Menu starts from $3.50, $4.50 Power Mee Rebus or $6 Extra Special. In general, Mee Rebus is a yellow noodle dish, and most places offer them with bean sprouts, fried taukua, green chillies and hard boiled egg, topped with fried shallots. The star is always the thick, taucheo sweet potatoes sauce with rich umami. Different stalls uses different braising base from mutton, beef, chicken, dried shrimps, ikan bilis to even swimming crab as soup base of the sauce. Some has strong taucheo taste, some rich while some watery, and mostly too sweet. Hence at Rahim's their rich and thick sauce has the right consistency, not too starchy and not too sweet. Enough savoury umami to coat the sauce, ans unique to this stall, top with a coat of peanut satay sauce. And on the side, if you like it spicy, black chilli and ketchup manis to add depths to the flavour. Enough sauce to coat the chewy noodles nicely, and add a whole lime to give the broth a tangy twist. The Power version gets you tumeric flavoured boiled chicken slices, and the extra special gets you a whole chicken leg. The chicken is nicely marinated, juicy and simmered to the right texture. Enough to bite chunks off the chicken meat, flavourful and tender. Bean sprouts and vegs provide crunch to the dish, and my only gripe is missing fried shallots or would have made this 5/5.

Mee rebus with chicken is delicious! The chicken is not shredded chicken, but bigger pieces. 1 whole hard boiled egg. What makes it special is the satay sauce drizzled on top. Taste wise,  this mee rebus is sweet. The soto ayam is good too.

Standard is still good after 1 year. But price has increased. Mee rebus with chicken is now $4.50.

The only problem I had with the stall was I was way too unlucky. For a long time, I wanted to try this stall but the first 2 times I went(on different dates), I was greeted by a closed stall and a notice that says they will be closed for several days due to some reasons and that we had to check their FB as to when they will open again. So this time I checked... nothing means open and so....

This is my third visit to this stall and I finally got to try their extra power mee Soto and mee rebus for take away.  It was good that the gravy and soup were packed separately from the noodles so that even upon reaching home, the noodles weren’t soggy.  Both came with a large chicken thigh which is nice and tender.

Personally I find the portion too big for me, I should order the normal version next time without the chicken.  Otherwise taste is ok, nothing out of the ordinary.
From the very best SOTO Ayam stall in the world ! Well known too for hai Mee rebus power and Satay, this stall has been my TOP fav since school days . Do support them !

I've been eating from Rahim from 1987 that is 33 years.

I've tried many so called
" esoteric"  sotos and after now I reckon this is the best.

This Soto is more inclined to the Indonesian style.

Some of the prominent differences are :

1. The materials  especially the chicken is very fresh.

2. The blend of spices in the soup is perfect.

3. The portions of chicken is generous and not OVERLY Cooked. So it's very SOFT, TENDER & SUCCULENT .

So the combination is thus  perfect and they have also  successfully RETAINED a home cooked touch.

In the past I've a Malay friend from Kuala Lumpur who came and packed 30 + packets and brought it back by plane ( what an effort)

So its has to be good.

If you've been following my reviews you'll know that my comments are very Conservative and alway "under promised" & over performed, always way above what I shared and you'll not be disappointed.

Do go and try once and you'll be longing for the taste of this unique Soto.

Bee Hoon Soto Extra Special. Extra special basically gives you a chicken drumstick instead of shredded chicken.  I have always lamented that bee hoon soto lack the meat but the option of getting a drumstick now from this stall... #shutupandtakemymoney.
1 norm mee robus - nice savoury sauce and mee soto special with huge drumstick and bagedel... soto sauce is not my favour but its norm. Chilli is power. Worth the trip

If you want to enjoy authentic and juicy satay, you NEED to get from Rahim Muslim Food!

Each satay is packed with thick cut of chicken meat, it is VERY WELL SEASONED, extremely JUICY and not to mention TENDER!

The satay sauce is more on the watery consistency, and peanut taste is not as strong as it should be. However, it does goes really well with the satay.

On top of that each chicken satay cost 70cent, and its really worth the bucks for the quality it serves.

Quality ✅✅✅✅✅
Price 💸
Overall ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
Finally found where you've relocated too! Missed your power mee rebus for years! Am very happy and satisfied now.  Standard still the same. Yum-yum !!! Will be back for more !

If you like mee rebus, you must try this stall. The gravy is thick and tasty. They added a scoop of satay sauce to the gravy before serving which makes the taste unique. I added some chilli sauce (meant for mee soto) and it gave it a spicy punch.

Mee Rebus with a twist, definitely worthwhile to add the poached chicken for just additional one dollar. Though the mee rebus is good in itself, the gravy is a tad overly gooey so the added chicken really help balance out the texture of the whole dish.

The stall uncle and aunties are all soft spoken with a friendly smile. The mee rebus was tasty and spicy with a tinge of sweetness. They lay on 2 type of sauce on the mee rebus which I think made it very tasty. The pricing was cheap too. My "extra special" plate cost $5plus only. It comes with a chicken thigh meat which taste soft and juicy. Best taste mee rebus in my personal opinion.
For those who love to eat very sweet mee rebus, then this is the one.  The satay sauce topping was even sweeter than the rebus gravy.
One of the best Mee Rebus in town! Generous portion and value for money! They add Satay Sauce on top which really complements the Mee Rebus very well!
The taste is unlike the usual Mee rebus you find elsewhere. The gravy is sweet and if you get the Mee Rebus extra special, they'll add a huge chicken drumstick with satay gravy.

Their Power Mee Rebus is the King of Mee Rebus for me. Tangy gravy doused with peanut sauce and tongue-tingling green chillies (scoop aside if you can't take the heat) topped with a generous portion of kampung chicken. You will leave with a bulging belly and wide smile on your face. The portion is hearty even though it's just $4.50 (think it's $5 or $5.50 now as of July 2022). A must-try for at least once in your life

After reading about Rahim's mee rebus, we made a trip there for lunch. We arrived just as the stall was about to open at 12pm. Already, the customers were queuing as they sat around the few tables in front of the stall. Somehow, each knew their place in the queue. Once the stall was ready, the customers formed into a queue.

The mee rebus was good and the portion was generous. A serving of satay peanut sauce was placed over the chicken and mee rebus. Sauce was thick enough to coat the yellow noodles. The sauce wasn't overly sweet, unlike most other mee rebus. Nice and hearty meal.
Food is a total no complaint, absolutely superb. Worth of every single penny spend. Whole chicken drumstick is crazy. Chicken meat must go with their homemade dark soy sauce chilli.

Tried to purchase some food from them but I assumed I went a bit late at about 4.45pm and their other items were sold out except a little balance for Satay. Maybe would try some other time. But I noticed that their not too customer's friendly or maybe they're worn out for the day!

The last time I ate their Mee Rebus “Power” was when they were at upper Serangoon. During that time I was already impressed with their  generous portion and price at $4.50.

Now after more then 10 years, (Thanks to CNA for featuring them) managed to find them once again and tried the  “Power” Mee Rebus again.
This time round I am Super impressed!!!!
It is still $4.50, taste and the portion remains the same  Which is generous!!!! How can this be possible as everything in Singapore have already spiral up.

Maybe it’s due to CNA featuring them the Q happened to be pretty long,
Plus they need to chop the chicken up therefore it took a while.
So tasty and delicious. I am no expert on the dish mee rebus but here it tastes superb. I have also sampled their mutton satay which is very nice as well. The prices are extremely low.
Good taste startedong time ago at opp Malay mosque now near Amk Interchange
The mee rebus is outstanding. Love the mee Soto too

Excellent tasty Power Mee Rebus (Satay sauce)
Must try!
Mee Rebus was very tasty. Chicken Satay was generous, succulent and satisfying. On top of that, prices were very affordable. Thumbs Up!!!

Mee Rebus was the best I have eaten for a long long time. Definitely worth the money paid and effort going there.
Returned to stall this evening at 6.35 pm since it is listed as closed at 7 pm.
Unfortunately the stall was already washing up.
Next trip will have my family go along to try the Mee Soto (reported to be just as good) as well.
Moved to new location. Best Mee Rebus I have. Lots of chicken. Satay sauce
The only halal food stall in this hawker center. Serving nice Indonesia and local delights such as lontong, tempeh, nasi lemak, and rendang.
Mee rebus too much on the savory side.  I would expect a little sweeter.
Delicious Muslim Malay Food

(Translated by Google) Nice rice cake

(Original)
Nice lontong

Great experience. There was a lot of stuff on the menu that my friends and I couldn’t understand and not wanting to hog the queue, we randomly decided to order them. Uncle was very friendly and took time to ask if we knew what the bowl consisted of and explained to us 💯 Lovely service!

Ordered the Mee rebus with drumstick, bagedel and chicken satay. Portion was very generous and Mee rebus gravy was really thick flavourful (might be jelak to some), but not something I would travel all out for unless I’m in the vicinity. Chicken satay and bagedel were really nice!

Their Mee Rebus is one of their signature dish you must absolutely try. The noodles were coated with thick aromatic potato gravy, which was so good that would leave you craving for another bowl. Definitely worth to queue and try.

Best satay ever. No short cut with fats trimming between meat like those in other satay places.

New Rebus and Soto, still the best.. Wow so yummy.

15/04/22
Mee rebus over rated. There are better ones. The satay is ok but still lack of flavour. However, the meat portion is generous unlike other satay sellers.

Food not as good as what it used to be.

Soto is diluted and the soup is cloudy unlike authentic clear soup.

Mee rebus is super thick and just does not taste like the authentic Malay mee rebus.

Mutton Satay is tender and peanut gravy is good. At last.. we can enjoy the satay.

The use of paper bowl and diaposable fork and spoon is a good improvement to avoid cross contamination of food.

Finally tried this famous stall as the queue was short today. Had the basic mee rubus and had it packed home. The uncle was nice in asking whether I wanted my noodles and sauce packed separately, which was much appreciated as my journey home was quite long.

I finally ate it some 45 minutes later, so the noodles were understandably slightly soggy. Quite a lot of noodles and the gravy was smooth, though not much tau kwa pieces or bean sprout to help cut through the cloyness of just eating noodles.

Perhaps next time I should try having it there.

finally this Hawker is back in business after renovation.

clean facilities, easy dine disposable utensils

what I enjoy the most is mee rebus with chicken, soto and mutton satay

for newbies, I would recommend mee rebus with chicken as I'm a chicken lover.

soto recommended for those who like soupy stuff

satay is a charcoal grilled meat [mutton, beef, chicken or tripe]
it is tasty when served with peanut sauce....yum² 😋

Mee Rebus was sold out at 6:45pm!
We settled for the chicken satay and beehoon Soto drumstick.

The satay was awesome, tender and juicy.  The satay sauce enhanced the taste further.  It was rich and full of peanut crunch.

The beehoon soto was better than expected.

We would definitely go back to try the popular mee rebus.
Always loving it! First time I had the satay! The chicken is so tender and soft!!

I'm on the hunt for the best Mee Soto place in Singapore ever since my favourite place closed down in 2017 (Palmer Road)

Found this place in a few food blog/vlog and was highly recommended. I've tried them and definitely enjoyed it a lot!! I might be partial to the taste of the shop that's not there anymore however this is my new #1 Mee Soto place. I'd highly suggest having it there while it's piping hot :)

Tip: add that one begedel with the mee soto please..
Mee Soto and Mee Rebus are always good. Long queue but just be patient and you'll get to order eventually. satay is also very good! Bang for your buck!

To be honest, the soup base is on the sweet side, even with the side of chilli, it was more to the sweet rather than spicy. I prefer savory taste so might not try again but other than that, the food is fresh. I would recommend their satay instead.

Introduced to this gem Muslim hawker, find their mee Soto, mee rebus and satays very delicious, affordable and satisfying. Hawker very friendly.
If I happen to pass by noticing no queue, will certainly eat. They sold out before 2000h on my last visit. 👍🏻👍🏻
It's been years since I'd been returning for great food here. Their mee soto, mee rebus, gado2, satays are just superb. You know they're open, when you see a long queue right to their shop 😋😉

Uncle was friendly and the preparation was super fast! Q but waiting time was minimum. I order the highly raved Mee Rebus+ babat with bagedel which cost me $5.70. Definitely one of the best Mee Rebus in singapore!
Bee Hoon Soto Drumstick. Probably Ang Mo Kio's central most famous Mee Soto stall and I only recently realise they actually have a drumstick version for the anti shredded chicken person like me!
Best Satay in Central Singapore.
Enjoyed the tasty soto babat and chicken, mee rebus babat and chicken  as well as the babat and mutton satay. Service was good.
To me, the best mee soto in Singapore hands down! Didn’t manage to take any pictures as i was too hungry. The broth is simply magical and key ingredients for all soup dishes!

Awesome bihun soto! Added a big fat bergedel as well and it was great! Place seems to be very popular! A lot of people had pre-ordered their satay as well! Stall owners were very friendly folks! Would definitely return to try the mee rebus!

The mee rebus was pretty good, the sauce was tasty and a bit to thick for my preference.

The gado gado was just alright.

Discovered this place 4yrs ago and the standards have maintained. Excellent gado-gado (peanut sauce over rice cake, cabbage, tau kwa, tempeh, potato, keropok). Tasty and rich peanut sauce. Food items also fresh and just all round well-made. The mee soto is also good and they have good quality potato cutlet.

#localguides #gadogado
Delicious mee soto. Worth the queue. Affordable price.
Incredible satay sources for Gado-gado and I love the Mee Soto too
Consistent long queue but moves fast. Worth the wait. Mee Rebus gravy is rich and creamy
Decent mee soto and mee rebus but I prefer their satay.
I came so far trusting google it say open… but when arrive its close!! Come on please update system
Satay 80cents per stick

The good taste of their food is well maintained.
But,prices of food served have gone up quite a bit.
So, do not be surprised. It's inflation.

First time ordering (saw the post in Hawkers United FB group). Ordered takeaway Kway Teow Soto, Mee Rebus and 10 sticks of chicken Satay in P2HA times - still so good even after driving home, we ate about 20 mins after purchasing. Can't wait to try when dine-in resumes.
Mee rebus is superb! though the gravy is a bit thick. Soto ayam we bought on Sat 14th Aug was without any chicken, strange.
Good and tasty one of the nice stall in this AMK food center.
Standard still maintained since the last time i came here 10 years ago. Best mee rebus.
Great satay and a very unique mashed sweet potato gravy mee rebus that is a little heavy for one person, so maybe share it.

Queue is long. I ordered the mee soto. Though it’s soup but it taste more like mee rebus w the peanut sauce taste. Not my kind of thing.

The black chilli n the bergadil is alright only

Maybe the mee rebus n the satay is better though I didn’t order. Lots of others do

Nice place to have a meal, take extra precautions(be sure to observe 1m distance) as this stall seem to have long queues most of the times especially lunch/dinner, and there are many other stalls with good food, like chicken porridge stall, fresh brewed soya drink(omo)stall and Indian Rojak stall, thanks

Good food and great price. Can't go wrong with their typical Malay delicacies like mee rebus, soto and satay. You'll burp louder when you try their specialties which they offer. Go try it out. You won't be disappointed...

Ordered the Mee Soto Drumstick and Mee Rebus Chicken.

Not worth the hype at all. Super mediocre. Very little ingredients and the soup is unflavorful.

I've had so much better one out there..

Had the Mee Rebus with satay - I think it's head to head with Rahim, albeit it has some interesting variation with the satay cut into the noodles, freshly cut red oninons and green/red chillis.  Also tried the Mee Soto/wing. Mee Soto was way above average. I personally prefer Rahim's mix of spice in the soup.
Had the delicious mee rebus with drumstick and asked for extra green chilli. Thick gravy. Must try!

Worth travelling from the east to ang mo kio just to have their delicious mee soto & satay (chicken/beef). Love the mee soto gravy & the satay gravy definitely a good combination 👍 Worth my money for paying these 2 delicious food that I ordered, you won't regret trying 😊
Fantastic food! Had the mee rebus with babat(tripe) for $4.5. Gravy was flavourful and a generous portion size. Highly recommended. Be prepared to queue though!
Stall selling various soto, gado2 and satay. Most of the time long Q
Yummy satay!!!
Average mee rebus only. Too watery for my liking.
They serve mee soto, soto ayam, mee rebus, gado gado with choices of add on & satay. All are delicious. For takeaways, soup & gravy are packed separately so the noodle & ketupat don't get soggy 👍

Affordable, authentic and delicious Malay fares - just the way we like it. They have been there for a least 30 years.  Last ate there around 1990. And not disappointed on this visit.

Ordered Mee Soto on a Friday night.  Service was prompt and friendly.  Taste just right. And only $3.

Live Mandarin Getai was put bonus. Singing is ok la. Free entertainment

Our first time patronizing this stall and eating gado gado, bee hoon soto with extra packet of cracker to go with.
When we ran out of the peanut sauce, the stall owner saw, came over and offered to top up the peanut sauce to go with the remaining cracker.
Thank you so much! I'm sure this made his and our day!
Wow.. never lost its tastes..  the dishes are all so authentic  like the gado gado n rebus is my favorites.. not forgetting the yummy satay, etc.

Was just here today, on a Monday lunch hr. Store's open, ordered satay and mee rebus. Que was a little long as expected but satay was ready in 10 mins. Really yummy and juicy satay! Mee rebus was sumptuous as well 🤗

First time at coffee shop in Block 631 AMK Ave 4. Tried mee soto at Mahan. The taste was great, spicy and sweet, yummy combo. Lots of chicken given, all for only $3.50. Malay food lovers should give this stall a visit

Sometimes eat.
Taste is same like nasi padang

I was like arriving there at 11 AM on Sunday. There were more than 15 people in the queue. So it took me about 20 minutes to take my turn. Both of noodles and the soup taste good, however a little bit salty. And I think the taste is not good enough for you to across the whole Singapore to come here. And if you are living nearby you can come here every day lol.

As per the brand, it’s fish ball noodles are closely associated with Malaysian taste. The fish balls are slightly softer in texture. Both fish balls and fish cakes are tasty. The mee pok is very well cooked with very good texture. Worth a try if mee pok is not your regular choice of noodle.

This traditional handmade fish ball noodle stall from Malaysia was indeed delicious. Fishball and Fishcake were really “Q Q” and the noodles with pork lard tasted Malaysian style. This stall will be my “go to place” now for my kway teow soup or mee pok. However, expect long queue and only open from 8am to 12pm only daily and closed on Monday. And the best part is, the uncle and auntie are very friendly and nice. They were very patient with your orders.

Fish balls soft, bouncy and tasty.
Noodle texture is perfectly cooked, not soggy or hard.
Pork lard is crunchy and fried shallots tasty fragrant.
Minced meat portion is small.
Overall good.
Avoid breakfast and lunch time crowd.

Nice handmade fishball! Came too late and all the other ingredients were sold out. Noodles tossed in dark sauce, fried shallots and pork lard which is very fragrant. Wish the pork lard were more crispy.

We arrived at 11am and there was surprisingly no queue. But once we bought our food, a queue formed.
