We ordered the small bowl ($4.50) and opted for Ipoh hor fun. Sadly, there was no more fish cake, so we only had the handmade fishball and tau pok.

At first I had commented to my friend that the noodles seemed like a lot. But in the end, I finished them in no time and was scrapping the bottom of my bowl. 🤪

The hor fun was flavourful as it soaked up the sauce. My friend thought it wasn’t salty enough but it was just nice for my palate. Plus the bits of pork lard gave it an extra kick.

I read a blogger’s review that the fishball isn’t as bouncy as others as it is handmade from only yellowtail fish meat and no fillers are added. But I thought it was very bouncy. Not a big fan of the tau pok but I don’t mind it.

Overall, not bad and will return if I’m in the vicinity. And I like that the cook and the auntie cashier are friendly. (I dislike hawkers who scold or are rude to their customers and will not patronise them regardless of how nice their food may be.)

Malaysian HupKee Fishball @ Blk 158 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 4 Coffee Shop. You will see breakfast crowd everyday except Monday. The handmade fishball are very “Q”. If you have 20-30mins time allowance to queue up can try it up. Good thing must wait !!!

Tasty soup, handmade fb & fish cakes. Not too salty, meepok texture is alittle soft. Pork lard & fried onion done superbly. Kind of like yong tau foo savoury version. 4.5 stars- Perfect for daily. Will be back!
Good handmade fishball with Malaysian style black noodles. The fishballs are good. Not like the standard factory produced like many other places. There's a queue most of the time.

I went to Hup Kee fishballs noodles a couple of days ago with my wife. I was in the q at 11.10am. After 20 mins, a lady came out and said no more fishballs and taupok. Only left fish cakes. Told her is okay though we were so so disappointed. When it was my turn after 35 mins wait, there were 2 fishballs each in our soup. When we tasted them, it was heaven. I had never ate such a fantastic taste of handmade fishballs. It pays off for our patience. We will definitely go back for his fishballs. Fish cakes were just as good. Noodles were just as great and tasty as well. Ample parking spaces for those who drive.

First visit was yesterday, second visit was the day after.

The above is the testimonial to how awestruck I am with the fishball and the taupok with fish paste.

Fishball has a slight chew to it. It's like eating a real tender rare wagyu beef but it's fishball!

The taupok with fishpaste was the highlight for me. Soaked with the savoury soup, a bite of it is simply a piece of heaven for me.

The noodle wasn't in the best shape as it was bought home instead of eating it at the coffeeshop.

Highly recommend it but do expect to wait a while.

Queued for 15-20 min, the queue may seem long but the uncle was real quick so it moved fast!

Their mee kia noodles nice and springy, had also tried their kway tiao and bee tai mak which are just as good. Go for their sambal belachan, a good balance of spicy, sour and salty. The rest of stuff in the soup you could tell they make their own. Definitely worth to revisit!

Heard this is the best fish ball noodles in Singapore, so decided to try it out. No doubt the fish balls and fish cakes are nice with their dry noodles filled with pork lard and shallot oil. Small portion of noodles with fish ball, fish cake and tofu are filling. I personally like their porcelain bowl and soup spoon, made the food tastier (my personal view). We arrived at 10.15am (Saturday 4 Sep 2021) and started queuing, around 5 people in front of us. It wasn’t too bad, it took 25 mins to get our food. We ordered additional fish cakes and fish balls. Total bill is $18.80 for 2 of us. Worth waiting and definitely will come back. If you come by MRT, alight at MayFlower, take exit 1-3 and look for Block 158. Walking distance from MRT to this stall.

Shiok, simply good.
Noodles done right, taste good with the freshly hand make Fish Cake (deep fried) $ Fish Ball.
Though the soup is kind of salty for me.
Highly recommended.
Very enjoyable fishball noodle. But portion size for the price isn't exactly good value by me.

Long queue at 9am on weekends. The handmade fish ball/cake is really nice. The dry noodle has special chilli sauce and fried lard. Worth a try if staying nearby. The boss is friendly even though he is busy, such good attitude is hard to find among stalls with good business nowadays.

Probably the closest to Malaysian style dry noodles you can get in Singapore, although not there yet.....but just. I think if it had a bit more dark soya sauce then it will be perfect. Their noodles are also Malaysian style too. Portions are very generous and noodles were packed with flavours from the dark soya sauce and pork lard. Prepare to queue at least 30 minutes on a weekend morning.

One of the best Msian style fishballs n fishcakes I have ever tried in Spore. Apparently made fresh daily, limited to 500 fishballs, till sold out.

Love the fiery sambal chilli sauce that goes with the fishballs, and the noodles are generously laden with crispy fried lard too. Prices have increased recently to $5.50/$4.50, big/small.

A simple bowl of noodles. Handmade fishball and fishcake texture are great. Their Noodles not bad. And their stuffed daopok is nice. Worth a try.
But, be prepared to wait. Queue time can goes as long as 40mins.

Authentic Malaysia style fishball noodle. Another hidden gems in SG.
By the way, be prepare long queue and usually 11am already sold out.
Yummilicious noodle which taste really like Msia.  Worth queuing and seller is so friendly.

Whenever am here during weekend, always see a super long Q for this stall but didn't get to try it till last weekend though there's still about 10 person in front but at least given that only 2 pax dine-in, thus waiting time is not as bad.

Loved how they are generous with the lard and fried shallots. Loved their fish cake and fish ball too as you don't get to taste lots of flour but more of the fish paste.

Coffee shop area also quite traditional with those antique kind of marble table with wooden legs and wooden round chairs.

Will definitely come back again if the Q is not that long or if I"m able to wake up super duper early for this (maybe when I got the craving). Lolxxx
The sauce of the noodle is quite different frim Singapore style fishball noodle. With lots of pork lard too. Handmade fishball and fish cake are very Q and chewy.

Nothing special. Precisely because it is not something special but a comfort food that you could (or used to) have frequently that make it special. Not something outlandish, but a well balanced taste that would evoke the feel of passing the North South Malaysia highway where you pit stop for lunch 😉.

Walking 2 rounds in Mayflower Foods Centre but many stalls were not open this morning.  So went to the nearby coffeeshop for the Malaysian-style fishballs noodle.  I had my dry mee kia with ‘一色’ yellowtail fishballs only ($5.50) and a piece of fish cake ($2.50).
The sauce mixture was slightly saltier but savoury & did not have any hint of vinegar in it.  "Also no black sauce for me!"
It was served with plentiful of fried shallot, chopped green spring onion & pork lards.  The belacan chilli paste was not very spicy but flavourful enough.
The mee kia was quite similar to the instant noodle and pleasant to the bite.  It has seaweed in the soup which made it very tasty.  I opted for fishballs only because I don’t like Tou pok. 👍👍
Worth the queue - tastes very similar to what you’ll get in msia, according to my msian friend. Will be back again!
Above average. Fishballs were super q. Other than that, nothing special for me.

Love this place! The noodles taste like Yong Peng noodles. The pork lard goes very well with he noodles! Noodles don't have alkaline taste. Belachan is on the sour side. Their fishballs has a fishy taste. Not my type. Fishcake is not bad. All are handmade. Came at early 8 plus on sat morn but still need to queue for about 25 mins. Noodle portion quite big! Saw the uncle doing ice bath for the noodles too
Very generous portions of springy noodles. The "bak yue pok" is always crunchy and flavouful. The handmade fishballs really good. Slightly chewy and not too bouncy. Noodle sauce quite unique blend.

Ok fish ball noodles, soup base smells nice but abit salty for me. Good portion of noodles.

However might not be worth the queue

Closed on Monday. Usually sold out by 11am(before the 2pm closing time). Mainly for breakfast since the fishballs are not enough to last beyond lunch. Fishball are very nice. Real fish meat without added starch. Silky smooth and bouncy chew.. My favourite. Noodles are Malaysia style (black sauce) so if u like the tomatoe ketchup type... This is not for you. The chilli dry noodle taste better than the non chilli. U can request the soup for all fishball if you are not a fan of fishcake and taohu. $4small $5big noodle. $4.50 fishball soup standard size. Overall is good.

Tired twice recently, once on a Tues the other on Thur. Fishball fishcakes and taupok quite good but the pork lards are stale on both occasions spoil everything... Hope stall owners see this and improve on the lards, if not, better don't put them out to serve

Pretty good fishball noodles. Ordered the large meepok and there's a lot of noodles plus decent serving of fishball and fish cake. The sauce is well mixed with lard and it's the Malaysian signature, which is nice. The fishballs have good texture too. Friendly service as well. Five stars if the noodles are just a little bit more firm. But definitely above average and worth visiting if around the area.

UPDATE: Changed to five stars because on second try, even with dabao, the mee kia was firm. Good stuff.

Malaysian-styled Fishball noodles at 158 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 4.

Many of my close friends know that I don't like eating Fishballs (except for Old Chang Kee's giant ones). Don't ask me why.

Ok. Back to this gem of a stall.

Queues usually start forming at around 0730H, and by around 1030H, they'd be sold out and that's it.

The sambal and sweet sauce combination is like how you'd shower a Muse with, throw in some Harp tunes and you're in Xanadu.

Taupok bursts with so much soup that it puts a good Onde-Onde to shame. It is swimming in a vat of hot soup, waiting to be served.

Fishcake is soft on the inside. Lembek when handled. The skin on the outside is fried, which lends another dimension to the texture. Yes. I do eat fishcakes. I'm weird.

The "Pièce de résistance" would be the Oinky Lard pieces. Fresh, crispy and oh so ..... generous.

Don't bother coming on weekends though. Extremely crowded and might sell out earlier.
Noodles is good and tasty, handmade fishcake is not too bad but the fish ball is a little fishy and mushy. But overall everything is good. Be sure to Q for a good 15 mins.

This is my fourth time here.The previous 3 times I was here and they were sold out. Queued for half and hour before it was my turn. Order the $5SGD portion but unfortunately they ran out of fishcake. Have to say the homemade fishball was really nice.noodle was delicious but was a little dry. Instead of the usual chill sauce for the noodle, they added something that looks like a dry chilli paste. for those who wish to try, strongly recommend you to come before 11am.

Popped by for lunch after seeing the reviews online. Fish balls were nice and bouncy and noodles were good! Decently priced at $4.

It was sold out by 12:44pm so my recommendation is get there early!
very nice fish ball ! fish cake is awesome too ! noodles are nice , tried both mee kia dry and kway teow soup . long queue though but worth the wait . highly recommended!

Ordered soup and dry noodle.
Noodles were very well cooked, Al dente.
Fishball was abit mushy, didnt quite suit my pallete.
Fishcake was brilliant thou, strong and bold taste.
Must be there before 10am if not highly likely will be sold out.
Would recommend the dry noodle over soup.

Very friendly stall owners, everything is handmade. It's $4 for a regular, $5 for a large bowl, the ingredients are definitely of good quality and they sell out by 12.30pm ish so be sure to get there early, I went there at 12pm for 3 days and they were all out. The noodles are made locally and their chilli packs a punch

My weekly fix of fishball noodle. My go to place with my wife. Fishball and fishcake are all handmade. It's totally different from other stalls which use factory made fishball and fish cake. Quantity of noodles at $4 is generous.

Pros: Noodle texture springy. Fishballs are bouncy and tasty 😋. Pork lard is the best I’ve tried in a noodle dish, not hard and dry.
Cons: I think the Tow Pok, Chilli and Seaweed is out of place. It felt like having a combination of JB wanton Mee + Teochew Fishball noodle + YTF + KL chilli ban mian.
Overall: A good bowl of Malaysia Noodle. Just not the typical fishball noodle.
Delightful fishball noodles in Malaysian style. Fishballs are self made. Simply unique and delicious. Good to be there no later than 11am to avoid sold out disappointment.
Very tasty and delicious fishball.very flavourful n fried cubed pork lard makes the dish go WOW!!

Awesome noodles which was pretty much close to Malaysia taste.

Worth the queue. Friendly boss too!
Nice noodles and stall owner is very friendly. But sometime might have a long queue to wait.

The quality of cooking is consistent, texture of home made noodles, fish balls and fish cake is excellent!  Increased in price: small bowl at $4.50 and large bowl at $5.50. Mostly 2 of us order the large.
Value for money.
Expect to queue for 10-20 mins on average between 9am to 10.30am
Came on a raining day and queue was short. Delicious! The DaoPok was especially good! Super friendly store owner.

The chef hand makes the fish balls and fish cakes. This is as authentic as it gets. Noodles (dried version) are al dente, topped with aromatic scallions and sauce. Be prepared to queue because everybody loves good food.
If u like savoury and spicy, look no further.

Decent cafe food. Outdoor area is pet-friendly, no pets allowed indoors. Their chicken waffle dish is worth a try! Can get pretty crowded with family and kids during dinner hours. Overall nice ambience.

Went on a weekday afternoon for lunch, not much crowd on a weekday. This cafe is quite spacious, have an outdoor and indoor seating area. I ordered the Chicken waffles Chicken was tender and delicious. The only complain was quite warm indoor, seem like the air-conditional is not working. Overall, wonderful place to chill and will visit again.

First time coming to this cafe and will definitely go back again. It’s such a nice and comfortable place to chill in..The food is nice & My family simply love all the varieties that we have ordered.. 👍🏻

Visited them on consecutive Sat and Sun! Service staffs are friendly and polite. Ordered their mushroom risotto and truffle fries for both days. It was really good! Amazingly, their coffee was a gem for us. We didn’t have high expectations on their coffee yet it was the star for our brunch. The sea salt caramel latte was da bomb! Not sweet yet very smooth and produce good aroma of the coffee. Will bring our kiddos back for the food!

It's new !!! Have outdoor (pets allowed) and indoor seating. Nice, clean, spacious and cosy. Ordered the all day breakfast set which was tasty and a cafe latte. Will visit again. Only complain was the need to improve their online menu with picture of the food!

We were here for the vet's appt and was so glad for a cafe that welcomes little friends. Better than that the food is very good. The pasta was fresh yet light. We also had the croffles with a very crispy chicken. I would have stayed longer for dessert but with the current humidity we have to come back when we can sit indoors without the little friend. Very good dining experience and good offering of wines too!
Went on a weekday for brunch, was a nice and quiet place to chill. Really enjoyed the pasta, which is a recommended dish . Quite a decent amount of seafood (scallops, prawns, clams) given 👍🏼👍🏼

A nice cafe tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Consists of both indoor air conditioned and outdoor seating suitable for pet owners which is a plus. Ample seating space inside as the restaurant stretches quite far in. Service is good and relatively fast. Decor is pretty and they have interesting pieces of furniture and contrasting wallpapers and panels for a varied effect. Tried their speculoos latte and Peter’s Pancake which is quite good 👍😊

Pretty good food and service at reasonable prices. The rosti waffles were very delicious, although we wish they could be even crispier. Pancakes are fluffy, scrambled egg is creamy, bacon is not too greasy. The melon tea smells very calming although the melon taste itself wasn't very strong. The online ordering platform was missing photos for several items, which made it hard to visualize what the dish would look like or the portion size.

Relaxing simple decor. The outdoor area is pet-friendly, lotsa cute dogs there! Indoors has plenty of seating. There is also a small garden area on the other end, with goldfishes swimming around in a little rock fountain.

Wow.. love this place for its space... wide spacious and hippy green ambience... Nice!

Simply the space and deco makes this cafe super comfortable to laze and chill in.

And I'm glad the great food goes well with ambience too..

Been here twice already. And their pastas and burger is great!

And their online loyalty program is definitely tempting me to go back a 3rd 4th time...
And its only tempting because food and ambience is great..

Would definitely be back many more times
Found a nice new cafe. Great food, pet friendly and can cycle over the next round. Just a bit longer waiting time for a seat so better to book advance 🥂

My first attempt lunch experience.

Personally, I like their main menu items, the savoury items are not to my liking.

Overall dining experience is good. Nice place and ambient.

Strong contender to the existing upper Thomson road cafes like Columbus Coffee. Overall good brunch food, with nice platting and interior design. However could do better with their coffees (quite awful Americano). They should like consider providing better utensils (fork,soon) as the current ones are obviously of sub standard quality, similar to the ones we see in food court. It’s the non polished type and didn’t look or feel sparkling clean. Furthermore, all of their fork has stains between the grooves. Asked for change but all had stains. Ended up not using their fork. Lost my appetite a little. Chicken was great but wished they drained the excess oil before serving. The plate was filled with excess oil from the chicken midway during meal. Overall 3 stars with lots of potential for improvement.

Good food and pet friendly. Will visit again
Not bad for a 3 week old cafe 🙂

Update:
Went back on their 4th week of business with more friends. Waiting time improved.

A bright, beautiful, and spacious cafe with lots of greenery - reminds me of a laidback Balinese beach club/cafe. It has a open, pet-friendly outdoor seating area too!

Not your usual cafe fare, ordered a few unique items to try. They were all delicious!

This cafe is pretty near my place but first time trying. Reservations is recommended especially for weekends. Surprised that the indoor dining area was so big.
Found the price of the food quite expensive. Breakfast for 3 easily exceeded $100. They had a promo with Citibank but we had lots of problems with it as it couldn't accept applepay or if the credit card is stored inside the phone without the full 16 digits.
Order a few dishes to share, the one we enjoyed most is the Chicken and Croffles. Both croffles and chicken were well cooked. The Roffles platter was interesting because of the rosti waffles and also liked the way the mushrooms were cooked.
Service was very slow. Not sure if they forgot the order or what. The staff are all very young and had to call them over a few times to check the status of the dishes. The sides came almost last, the Spicy Chicken wasn't really nice it didn't taste Korean but the sauce more tasted like the Thai sweet Chili sauce. The Sakura Cream Tagliatelie also came late and serving was very small which left us unsatisfied.
Drinks were just pretty average.
Really need to improve on the speed of the food served. Not sure why the cafe wasn't even crowded at all early in the morning.
Lovely ambience and tasty albeit junky food, has a nice al fresco area for pet owners and their fur kids. Deep fried chicken and croffles very yummy. Fries were good too. We'll be back soon.

Loved the interior design and spacious. Also has an outdoor sheltered seating area. Our group of 3 had the croffles with fried chicken, the crispy chicken burger, the rosti with mushrooms & pork sausages, chicken tenders with korean spicy sauce - all of them were decently good. The letdown came in the form of their tarts where the crust was soft, and it just felt liked it was kept for too many days.

Visited the place on a weekday afternoon and was delighted that there’s no crowd. Huge space with ample seating area. Had the fried chicken, sakura pasta and the creamed corn (CCB).

The pasta and chicken were great but the corn was just alright. The sour cream was not a good addition to the corn. Drinks were on the expensive side too.

Didn't expect the food to be good, but it really is! The chef does fried chicken super well. We ordered the spicy Korean fried chicken it was out of this world. The CCB is also super yummy. The CAVA burger is huge but also very tasty. My husband and I were stuffed after these three dishes due to the generous portion of the CAVA burger. For the portion, the price is very reasonable. The downside is the waiting time, it took 40 mins for us to have the first side on the table. We had to approach the service staff to check on our order. The last dish, the burger took 1 hour. Service staff is quite friendly and attentive in terms of refilling water. Easy to get their attention.

The colors they utilized in their interior design were fantastic. The colors are black, white, and jade green. This is a fantastic mix. I went on a Friday night when it wasn't too packed. ⁣
⁣
To self-order, scan the QR code.⁣
⁣
𝐒𝐚𝐤𝐮𝐫𝐚 𝐂𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐦 𝐓𝐚𝐠𝐥𝐢𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 𝐒𝐆𝐃 𝟏𝟗.𝟎𝟎 ⁣
There are around 7 clams and 2 prawns. The platings are fantastic. The taste is bland, and the prawns aren't fresh. Tagliatelle from another Italian restaurant tasted better.⁣
⁣
𝐂𝐚𝐯𝐚 𝐁𝐮𝐫𝐠𝐞𝐫 𝐂𝐫𝐢𝐬𝐩𝐲 𝐂𝐡𝐢𝐜𝐤𝐞𝐧 𝐓𝐡𝐢𝐠𝐡 𝐒𝐆𝐃 𝟏𝟕.𝟎𝟎⁣
It's served with fries. This is the night's highlight. It's served hot, with super soft and fluffy buns and properly cooked chicken. The fries are one flaw; they taste bland and are not served hot enough.⁣
⁣
Total bill SGD 𝟑𝟗.𝟔𝟎 (Inc of Service Charge no GST)⁣
⁣
I'll definitely return to try some of their other dishes and review later. Meanwhile 2 stars for overall.

Here for brunch and dinner before. The otah bruschetta with grilled cheese is a must. Dinner menu is so-so, portion can be bigger even though the food is good. Love the place as it allowed furkid to accompany the hoomans under shelter. Nice cafe in a quiet estate.

May 2022: This cafe has really good potential. Love the space - bright and spacious. Food was also good. Order the Cava Burger (chicken thigh) and the wild mushroom pasta. Both delicious. I liked how the cheese was melted on the bun and the mushrooms in the chicken burger. There is an option to choose wagyu meat instead of chicken for $2 additional but I read about how good the fried chicken was and hence was not about to lose this opportunity to taste it! Was happy I didn’t! Anyway, I wonder how the burger which included a slice of pineapple would taste if I had chose wagyu!
5 stars service, staff very patient and polite. They have special food and drink. Delicious and satisfying. The pet friendly zone is spacious without worrying about rain or hot weather.

It's a spacious cafe with welcoming staff. Ordered the mentaiko fries - which was great for sharing. The salmon was well executed but we didnt really appreciate the rosti. Overall, its a nice find in the area.

Love the recommended dishes : Sakura Tagliatelle, Cava Burger. Food is really good, best part I can get to see beautiful fur patrons playing at the outdoor area. Didn't enjoy the lemon meringue tart though.

Great neighbourhood cafe with brunch food. Rather big space lots of seating outside and inside. We ordered the fried chicken and croffles, mentaiko fries and the mushroom risotto.

The fried chicken was really well battered, light and crispy and not oily. The coleslaw was also a really nice touch cause I’m not a fan of putting maple syrup on my savoury food. I would say a must try when you come here.

The mushroom risotto was everything you would want in a risotto dish. Simple and rice was cooked just right (slightly Al dente but cooked through).

Mentaiko fries were decent but nothing special.

You order and pay through a QR code which is always a plus.

We came here after seeing Daniel Food Diary’s review (though we know to take all the bloggers’ reviews with a big pinch of salt).

In a nutshell, the food here is decent. Just skip the desserts and the coffee (which is a collaboration with local Hook coffee but the cafe does not have a barista in house). After lunch, simply hop over to Thus Coffee which is just around the corner.

It’s nice, quiet and spacious spot for catching up over lunch. On a Monday noon, it wasn’t crowded at all. We had a nice far end spot where behind the doors is the backyard with a water well.

We ordered the otah bruschetta (sourdough), seafood aglio olio, fishy business (salmon), roffles platter and wild mushroom risotto. All of us rather enjoyed our respective main course.

Thereafter, we shared the ondeh ondeh cake, yuzu cheesecake and a warm apple crumble and also had cups of coffee.

The Apple crumble looked really funky and unnatural (take a look at the last photo) plus it was too sweet. The ondeh ondeh was nothing to rave about either. Coffee was served without inspiration (no latte art cos as mentioned, no barista) - it was just bland, normal coffee but at a barista price tag of $7.

Do reserve before going especially on a weekend as it can get packed.

First visit - Order didn't go through the online ordering system and we ended up waiting for awhile to realise it didn't go through. But technical fault, can't be helped. Anyway, reordered and our food came in adequate time. The spinach cream pasta was quite nice.

Second visit - Decided to try the otah, and sakura pasta. Interesting menu, both were alright.

In both visits, the drinks were slightly underwhelming. Nice atmosphere and staff though!

Went there for lunch recently for a family of 5. Overall food is nice and the service is good. However, and that is a HUGE but, the waiting time for the food is ridiculously long at 70 minutes after ordering!!

They did let us know that waiting time for food will be at 30 minutes or more. I think it is good that they let customers know that they need to wait. Hmm... but we waited for 70 minutes... AND even if there is lots of pre-warning or notification that food may take some time to prepare, waiting for 70 minutes for the food is not acceptable. They really need to look into streamlining the process or expanding the kitchen capacity to have faster turn around time.

Apart from that, please do make reservation ahead! With such a long turn around time from ordering food to serving, you don't want to be queueing outside waiting for table + waiting for food later!

The service of this place is good. There are many attentive young servers.

Food wise, it is tasty and unique. Some notable dishes are the Spinach Creatm Tagliatelle ($15), Seafood Aglio Olio ($15),  CCB (Cream Corn Bacon $9). We ordered quite a lot of other stuff too. Can look at the photos. Food wise, it is 5 stars.

Beautiful interior and very spacious, quiet on thurs evening. Food was veryyyy average. Melon tea by the pot, teabag type. Speculoos Cafe Latte was good because its totally not sweet at all though the name. Roffles Platter was very homemade... the roffles was not crispy and abit mushy. Sakura Cream Tagliatelle Pasta was below average, too much residue water from the seafood so the whole dish was very watery but the prawns were fresh. Seafood Aglio Olio was average. Fries with truffle & parmesan was good, very generous and huge serving, highly recommend. Visited this cafe to celebrate a friend's birthday so we also ordered a Lemon Meringue Tart which didnt taste fresh, below average.

Will recommend this place only for small bites and drinks. Good for a teatime break.

Great all-day brunch and coffee. I had the open faced wagyu sandwich and my wife tried the Rosti waffle platter which is gluten free. Both are well presented and tasty. It is cavernous inside with lots of space and good ambience. Pets are allowed in their outdoor seating, which is nice!

A really spacious cafe newly opened just months ago. Comfortable and cosy seating.. serving great pasta towards the Asian texture. Love❤️ the small portions available for the small eaters🥰 #msgreedysis #greedybuddiez

Was looking for coffee after dinner and stumbled upon this cafe. Big and spacious dinning area. There is also a huge alfresco dinning area where you can bring your pets along. Very comfortable environment. At around 9+pm was still quite crowded on a Friday nite.

Cafe pricing is on the pricier side for this order. Drinks are quite unique. Ordered the iced puffed rice cafe latte and a hot speculoos cafe latte.

Puffed rice went quite well with the latte adding some texture. Giving a cereal feel when it is soaked up with latte. Recommended to try. Speculoos latte is ok but hope that they can be more generous with the speculoos topping.
Cheesecake is average.

Nice place to chill after dinner. Will be back to try their food.

Came with hubby and kids on Sunday late afternoon . Kids and pets friendly . Quite a busy cafe at that hour so I think quite suitable for noisy kids to dine in . Ambience was great as I faced to a small tropical garden ! Love the plants especially for plant lovers . haha . I think chicken croffle was not bad-recommended . English BF and spam fries soso. Cappucino can be better ( quite bitter ) as I think the other cafe around the corner has better coffee . I was expecting better coffee

Great ambience, nice deco plus 5 stars for presentation! Melted nacho cheese dripped over the entire Wagyu burger served with fries. Lovely idea. Was expected a patty but it was yakiniku Wagyu but I'm not complaining cos it was well done. Impressive. Just didn't like that fries served was only warm, likely fried and put aside for quite a while. Waffle and chicken wasn't that fantastic according to my lunch companion. But still, decent for sure. Wash it all down with a pint for a wonderful dining experience.

Celebrated Father’s Day here. Coming here to try the food because it’s recommended by danielfooddiary. The food is fantastic. We tried the otah bread, ice latte, croffle chicken & seafood pasta. Price wise is $20 ish per pax. Ambience is good too.
Pet friendly cafe in a quiet neighborhood. Quality of food is better than expected but selection range not wide- wish they have more desserts choices~

Had the mushroom linguine, mentaiko fries and spinach pasta. Enjoyed all of them. Portion size was good, mentaiko was very flavourful and had a torched flavour. Mushroom linguine had a generous amount of mushrooms and they were cooked well without too much of an earthy taste.

Could improve the acoustics in the restaurant though as there were not many people but it was very noisy. Good place to hold events but if it's so echoey it will not be conducive.

Do check out the well. It had a few dead leaves though. And the door to the back garden was locked.

Also there was a super smiley server, she was really cheerful, wish all servers were like her.

Good cafe, good choice of items/menu and friendly staff. Prices very acceptable for this area as well. We had the chicken croffles and the otah bruschetta, both tasted really good. Don't know what it is, but it's just missing the x-factor for a five star review.

Food is ok and environment is good. Nice outdoor place for people who wants to bring their pets over to chill.

This places serves western food. Can get pretty crowded and noisy during dinner times.

A little far from MRT, but this place is worth the distance.

Will definitely come back here for more next time!
Food is very yummy, and place is very bright and roomy. The croffle and chicken was a big hit with everyone, and I loved the chicken burger as well.

C.C.B was my favourite dish! Head down to the cafe to find out what I mean 😉

Attracted to the amazing ambience of this cafe! I highly recommend all of you to have a sense of it too!

- Food; EXCELLENT!! ⭐️⭐️⭐️ The food display was exquisite, the food taste just as pleasant as how it looks (I took video instead of photos, cant post it)

- Chill outdoor; can bring your pet along, I saw one doggo 😍 (it’s open 24/7 according to one of the bosses)

- Cozy indoor; the furnishing of the cafe felt like I was in a HIGH END restaurant with affordable food, there are high chairs, sofas, and other different types of sitting to choose from (closes at 10-10.30pm)

Location: Pet friendly cafe located near a vet, a small park, catsmart, petlovers, and a nearby cafe to chill with your pooches after having a walk at lower pierce reservoir, ample parking.

Cafe: Came here a few times. Cafe is very spacious for small and big groups but price wise is a bit on the high side. I find a cup of cappuccino at $7 quite exp. Got the caramelized (coffee with a whip of caramel at $8). Food is acceptable & bug portion but not so fantastic. Service is very good, staff will immediately ask a choice of cold or warm water, and provide a water for the pooch too. We'll come back for small bites and some drinks.
Interesting place to dine at a hidden corner. It has a “secret” garden that’s quite cool too with mist timing. Food is nice and ambiance is cosy, clean and spacious. 👍🏼

The cafe is very Instagramable , it’s nice for chill out n photo n meeting up with friends , beer r very affordable price .
Owners r friendly couple
Chicken is too small portion size can be improved, maybe add more vege to make it feel more worth it , we prefer smth that is bigger portion. Coffee is a little bitter , can be improved.
The English breakfast cauliflower is not really fantastic, it will be better if u can change it to mash potatoes or sweet corn or potatoes salad . The bread is too thin n small it will be better if u guys can change to a thicker one . Taste wise is perfect . Like a 4 star restaurant. Thumbs up owner .

Nice and spacious cafe in the quiet Sembawang Hills with friendly staff. Seems to be pet-friendly with many customers with dogs out front.

Had typical cafe food with some interesting twists e.g. Nacho Cheese on Wagyu Burger, Rose Matcha Latte. However feels slightly pricy, even for a cafe, (~$20), especially if you order cmmon cafe food

Would recommend to try if you're in the area, and get the more special foods on the menu (like Otah Bruschetta) instead of things like the typical American Breakfast set.
Spacious restaurant with a modern deco. Attentive and prompt service. Good food.with little pleasant surprises.

Pet-friendly place. I wouldn’t say it’s fantastic or novel but I tried it because of the good reviews. The otah bruschetta was thin and laid on top of a slice white bread. It’s quite hard to cut and dry. In terms of spiciness and taste, I’ll rate it 2/5. In the end, i grab it with my hands and eat it. I don’t think it’ll order it again because it’s not worth $18 (add $2 for cheese topping). Coffee is so-so ($7 up)

Went on a Thursday evening and the space was quiet and serene! A lot of space between tables which made it a plus for an already dog friendly establishment. Service staff were attentive and responsive. Ordered three mains: Sakura ebi tagliatelle, seafood aglio olio and a small breakfast plate, found them all to be nice! Hot latte was also good! But apple crumble was very disappointing cos it was soft and mushy, hence minus one star!
South Indian food (Veg/Non veg) available in authentic taste in reasonable price. Amenities is good. Can enjoy music when dining..
One of the best south Indian Briyani i have had in Singapore. Happy hour beer added. Cool place to chill with beer and chicken tikka

Very basic eating joint. Nothing special not seem to be hygienic.
North indians might not like.
Dosa for 3$ , only Sambar no chutney
One of the few places where you can find good and  affordable food in this neighborhood:) Staff are friendly too.

I went there during lunch time and they didn't have any prata, only biriyani, which I felt was a little disappointing since I had wanted to eat some prata.
I ended up eating the mutton biriyani here and it tasted pretty good. The serving was really big and it had cost me $8. My only gripe with it would be that there was a lot of rice and not enough meat, especially for the price of $8 for a biriyani.
Hoping to be able to try the prata if I return back there one day.

Pricey but delicious food.

Eat first pay later, no receipt. not sure if the price is as per menu.

I ordered chicken set ( briyani chicken) does not look like wall picture...seem like missing side dishes.

My friend ordered ala carte 2 meats and 1 veg no carb that came out to be $10.
Nice food options, great taste, friendly staff, bang for the buck, descent vibe, a tick on all the boxes. Must try place

It's a pathetic experience with management over hear. We ordered food and waited for almost 45 minutes, we clearly could see that the guy who was serving food was giving orders to those who came after us. When we asked for food management misbehaved its not that he is giving food for free, we are paying for food then he is providing his services, clearly doesn't know how to do business.

Visit here if you want to see mismanagement and get misbehaved.

Good luck if you are eating here.
Awesome and peaceful environment to have taste of Indian food. Customer handling and the way they treat you is nice. One of my favorite place in SG.
Very nice 👍. Is a must try. Very reasonable pricing. Very friendly staffs. 10 of us eat whole hearted under 76 dollars!
Great food, friendly staff and good price. Definitely will eat here again! :)
The opening hours are not correct. Please correct it is wasting valuable morning office time. I came at 8.45 am and it was closed.
Awesome & Delicious food
Not proper response when order threw online food delivery.
One of the best Indian food I have had in Singapore.
Nice Indian restaurant
Nice Indian foods
Best taste and quality food
Very nice
Awesome one

(Translated by Google) Good Brian

(Original)
Good Briani

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content:
Nice experience, walked in randomly for dinner.
Menu items are all indian dishes. Ample and spacious seating observed. Staffs very warm and friendly. Ordered briyani and meat dishes. Food was served fast and warm. Meat were fresh and very tender. Wouldn't mind visiting again. 😃

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content:
Pleasantly surprised, never thought such good Indian fare could be found in the heartlands.
- Plain dosai, fried crispy was delicious.  appropriately fermented, though a little greasier than I liked.
- Mutton stew grossly under-marketed.  Super delicious...why it is obscured with zero description and photos is anyone's guess.
- Rawa dosai was a little over peppered but still ok.
- Iced tea-O was too sweet.  both the regular and less-sweet versions were way too sweet.  better with 50% sugar.
- Service was an issue.  While everyone was friendly and efficient,  our server wiped our table (when clearing the dishes) with our USED wet ones.  This is highly unhygienic, and potentially a hazard to both himself and the next patron. He did not appear to return to wipe with another cloth or spray cleaner on the table.  Because of this, we deduct a star.

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Second time visiting. Great variety of items on the menu, amazing food, fast service (food came within 15 min of ordering), reasonable price. Will definitely return!

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Food and service is really good. All the servers are very attentiveness will come back again

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: The food here was amazing and filled me with such warmth. We tried the teh halia, cheese naan, chickpea masala and mutton briyani. It was an authentic experience and my family and I really enjoyed the food. 10/10. Would love to return again. We left the store very satisfied and happy.

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content:
Went for lunch around 12:45pm on a Sunday and it was fairly empty.

Upon ordering was shared that a number of items were only available in the evening and quite a number not available from the lunch menu (odd for a newly opened restaurant).

Waited close to an hour for our food to come, a family that arrived after us had ordered, ate and paid the bill to leave.

After a good long wait one staff told us that the rice we ordered can't be fulfilled as they have multiple orders in the kitchen (not sure why this was told to us after waiting so long and why it our order that was depriortized when we were the first few to come).

Food finally came, it was subpar some parts seasoned with too much salt and drinks too sweet.

Towards the end we checked on our takeaway item as well and noticed some back and forth- am assuming that order wasn't put in and that the chef just threw the ingredients together to make it then and there.

Shared our disappointment with the counter staff when paying and he told us the long wait was due to the soup my mum had ordered which doesn't make any sense because that was the first item to arrive.

First and last time here.

Might be my personal bad experience as it's a newly opened store.

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Went for lunch today, waited for the food almost 45 minutes. One of our juice that ordered never came till we finish our lunch and had to take away. Upon reaching the restaurant, though it was crowded due to mother's day, no water served. Looks like they are disorganized. Few who came and just walked out as nobody bothered to serve them. Please improve your service level. Thank you.

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content:
6 of us went for a lunch on Saturday. Ordered Chicken Lolly pop and Chicken 65 for starters. Both were really nice and crispy and well flavoured.
For mains.. we ordered Naan and few choice of curries.
The bearer recommended Kongu Naattu Chicken curry and Mutton Nenju elumbu kolombu. We ordered both.. nenju elumbu kolombu was a let down.. overly spiced and the mutton bone pieces were full of koluppu ( fat).. unable to eat.
We also ordered prawn masala and that was an excellent choice to go with Naan.
Overall, taste of most items were very good.
Food served within 5 mins of order .. not seen any restaurant serving food this fast. Excellent!!
Will surely return again.

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: I have to say that this is the best Indian restaurant I’ve been to in Singapore! Have overtaken sakunthala and gayatri on my list. Their chicken 65 is so flavourful, very well marinated. Their chicken and mutton is so soft and well cooked. We literally ate and took away for our families as well and have recommended it to everyone who’s seeking authentic Indian food but tired of Little India. Amazing amazing food! I’m in love with their food! I’ll be back every week for my weekly Indian food cravings 😍

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: One of the best authentic Indian restaurant in AMK. Served a wide range of dishes and options. Try the Uthappam. It’s good. My regular local india place to enjoy good food without having to go little india 👍

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: A cosy embience for family or friends get together.  Great customer service and yummy food varieties. Went for lunch on Saturday with mixed feelings about late waiting time and customer service however I  was truly surprised that all the  7 dishes we ordered arrived with less than 15 minutes wait.  Kudos to Mr Maari for recommending the chef's weekend specialities too. Will surely go for dinner soon.

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content:
Nice to have an authentic Indian restaurant at AMK.
Food quality is amazing and service was fast.
Polite and friendly staff.

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Was glad to learn that there is a Indian restaurant around my area. Am a vegetarian. Ordered North Indian thali - meagre rice portion and vegetables; besides paneer did not taste fresh or authentic - more like the instant ready-to-eat type. Also had Badam milk; saw the cook mixing instant badam powder to hot milk and serving. Quite a ripoff. Not stepping there again. Pricey and average taste. I doubt with such standards, they would be able to keep up for long.

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Tasty food and good service! A bit pricey.

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Good to have an Indian restaurant in Ang Mo Kio with air-conditioning. Looking forward to have more great Indian food. Had quick lunch today, love the food. Unfortunately, didn't take a photo.

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: I loved ur briyani . My son’s loved fried rice and fresh juice . Looking nice place . Service too good . 👍👌🏼😋🍹. Filter coffee so tasty 😋

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Great food, suggest coming on weekend to try the seeraga samba rice. The malasa tea was a little too sweet for my taste buds but everything else was great

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: We visited Ang Mo Kio Nandhana’s on the opening day. We ordered tomato soup, mutton soup and palak paneer with butter naan and spicy chicken noodles. Also we ordered tawa  fish fry and  for the dessert kulfi. The food was amazing and we really enjoyed eating it. We got the items on time and the service also was very good.

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content:
It has become our go to place for Indian food. Stopped going Little India 😅
Loved chilli chicken, chicken tikka masala, kadhai chicken with naan 🫓

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Visited yesterday first time, food is gud but little pricy, especially filter coffee is very nice, thank you for the gud coffee

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: seems like a good place to have indian food. briyani a must ry. Love Mr. Mari's service. great fod and the ambience is just wow

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Very nice Indian foods with reasonable price. Good Ambient too.

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Great food and service at reasonable price. Will surely recommend the restaurant to extended family and friends

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Good service. Tasty food. Will always go to the nearest Nandhana’s whenever I crave Indian food

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Have a good meals... The meals are tasty.. Specially their mutton dum briyani so good... And the staffs so friendly...

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Great taste and reasonably priced. They offer free home delivery for orders above $60

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Great food great taste great service.

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: I went today. Foods are amazing . Service too good

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Nice..

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Authentic food, good service and nice environment. Will come back again!

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Closest South Indian food you can get near Central.Decent price.

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Food was super taste and i enjoy the meals

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Restaurant is very clean and food is good.

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Loved the food and service

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Happy to have a good Indian Restaurant at Ang Mo Kio.

restaurant name: Nandhana's @ Ang Mo Kio Djitsun mall
content: Good food. Welcome to Ang Mo Kio
Other than the long serving time, the food is wonderful here. I had chicken murtabak and my friend had an egg prata, they taste great, very savoury.

Ordered Prata and iced teh tarik.
Affordable price, waiting time reasonable as prata is cooked fresh. Love the fish curry.

Ordered masala thosai and iced teh tarik yesterday, costs me 4.50. coconut chutney was really good.

No photos coz I forgot. Hehe

For me it is nice food Because it is vegetarian food for me.
Staff are all nice talking and Serving. Food and price are reasonable.

Teh tarik is not bad. And I also like the tosai masala there. The filling sometimes a lot some times a little. The rice and curry is also good.

Edit: Jun 13th, idk what this is, looks like uneatable

I had the Dum Briyani Mutton ordered via grabfood along with some prata. The flavour of the Briyani is simply suberb. I love the rice, the spice, the curry, and the melt in your mouth juicy meat.

Also I had enough left over to eat a small meal the next day so it was money very well spent.

Although this place is convenient Indian halal food but service is slow. This restaurant look clean and no smell but too many flies.
Restaurant owner need to pay attention to address flies and organize the place.

Nice and simple breakfast!
Seems like ONLY on Tuesday - they serve chickpeas

I have been eating here for long time ( may be frm  May 2019 )
as I like Indian food.
Since Feb 2021, they have all new staffs are working there and I am realizing, their food quality has decreased now.
It not taste good as before.

Don`t see Ravi also sitting there.

One Suggestion for this Indian restaurant:  Please manage the food quality and the taste you had like before..
Food is amazing. Mutton dosai superb and roti paratha good.

very nice food & value for price BUT BE AWARE they are close on every 2ND WEEK of MONDAY (The owner of the restaurant advised that i could update the post...)

All dinners do go on the days; when they have chickpeas & Indian salad that go so well with mutton/chicken/fish rice set

my papa simply love the food there!  me too...  yummy!

I do not like to call others lazy or slow but their idle demeanor and inefficiency is unbearable and simply intolerable. i went to order 4 pratas and 2 teh tarik for take away during national day to celebrate this happy occasion but their service was terribly slow and non-chalant. Are your workers paid to  mill about taking their sweet time or are they here to operate an FnB business? If i am the boss of this establishment i would get rid of the whole lot of them and have them replaced,  it's like the staff just do not care about their work. This is the worst place to get my indian food fix.There are better quality service elsewhere such as across the road, I will not return to such a lousy place even if i was paid.

My colleague and I ordered mutton briyani for lunch. The delivery was so prompt. Food was still warm and smelled flavourful. Since the recent days I have been yearning for mutton briyani. Neethe has appeased me with a delectable and a scrumptious meal. I didn’t expect the mutton to be very tender and too soft. Boneless mutton. Very satisfactory portion and the mutton pieces were more than enough. The cucumber salad was a sweet company along with the briyani and the mutton. It was really value for the money. And not forgetting the boiled egg. Thank you Neethe for providing me with such a heart contented meal. My request is please do not compromise the quality of your food for anything at anytime. Maintain it. If not increase the qualityof the food.

The place is small but the food is excellent. If you have patience this is the best place to have best Indian food in Singapore.
Must Try : Mutton dish / Biryani / Dosa ( I had chicken stuffed)/ Tea / Prata

Yummy and tasty dun chicken and mutton briyani.Generous serving and quick service.Reaaonable pricing too...We ordered Vasai for teatimecascwell and it was still warm when delivered. Will definitely recommend to everyone.

While their food is good, the service is sorely wanting. They are not friendly and don't know manners. They can't smile and they serve the customer just like a robot. An attitude and gratitude change will help.
Come and try.. 👍
Authentic homecooked food. Had their vegetarian set and it was great! Vadais were nice and crispy and the chutney was delicious. Will def go back again

Tried their chicken Murtabak, it was quite disappointing. At the first look, it seems good, but when I tried the first bite, it was tasteless and the flour is soggy, not crispy as all. The chicken meat was bland, and it breaks up into pieces easily. At the price of $7.00, I do not think it was worth it.
Tasty food, but they sell normal prata for $1.50 a bit expensive but there is nothing special about it.

Best place for Indian food in ang mo kio,
Milagu Pongal only available on Tuesday and Friday

Samosa stuffing is very healthy
Vadai is cheaper
Staff are extremely slow and have no sense of urgency. Even the delivery riders have to queue up when all their orders are not settled. They do not seem to be bothered that they are slow.

Not good place to go and eat. I had very very bad experience. Waiter is arrogant and shout at me when I Put my order and later add a additional parata
Totally wasted our time and mood
The prata was served hot and fast.Tatse is nice.The teh tarik is not bad too.
Prata n teh tarik is reasonably good. Only service is a little slow even when there's no crowd.
Nice and friendly people. Need to have a better system on how to order and pay up. Keep it up and you will get there!!! Food is pretty good.

Dum briyanis are awesome.
Chicken is moderate
Mutton is hot
Chicken dum briyani must try
Excellent mutton Biriyani
The chicken is hard as well as the prata . Did not enjoy food after trying a few more times.

wrong item delivered,could not reach them on phone.
This the third time food panda delivered  wrong item or shortage of items
Lovely chicken and Beef, and the rasam is amazing
Like the prata & tosai.  Not so oily.
So slow. Wasted my time for nothing special yet slow.
Good food
Nice food
Very warm poor ventilation
It's ok
Food prices Too expensive
No Test..No Clean...No Test Food..
Best thosai.
Everyone should try ,
Good
Power
Satisfied
Worst service
Food is delicious
Slow service
How I order in grab food. I wanted to change address within 5 secs but they didn’t let me to. And they cheated my 14.10 . They delivered to wrong address.
Their dum briyani is really good dum briyani 👌🏽
Food is really good! I like how the curries are not spicy and it’s edible. Good selection of food here. Taste wise really nice compared to other neighbourhood Indian Muslim food.

Passed by this area, so decided to try out this Indian Muslim Restaurant since it was lunch time. Ordered Chicken Murtabak and it turned out surprisingly good. Freshly made upon order, you will get an enormous Murtabak, almost the size of an A4 paper, and it was packed with evenly spreaded scrambled eggs, onions and chicken meat. The dough which was not too thick, had a buttery fragrance which was intriguingly delicious even you eat it on its own. Reasonably priced at $6.00, I think the food was really value for money. Do give them a try, when you are around this area.
The food here is awesome.had their fish briyani n the portion is great with affordable price..worth..👍👍👍

If you like Indian cuisine, you can have a try here. We often have our breakfast with eggs prata here. This shop is very busy at peak hour, you have to queue at least 20 minutes to 30 minutes at peak hours

It a nice and good place to enjoy indian food
With family and friends
Good place to have nice crispy Prata with Fish or chicken curry. It's hard to stop eating at one prata.

Nice food with friendly Boss and staffs.... avoid weekend or lunch time to have peaceful Teh Tarik. Prata, Thosei and Beryani is delicious even the Beryani rice is lesser than other Beryani seller. Highly recommended for food and service. And I'm a regular for their Teh tarik and beryani :-)
Nice relaxing prata place.  Good service. Great breezy location to kill a morning.
Cheap and good

A very homy style of restaurant. Condiments are self serving, free seating. Staff are nice and easy.
Tried their bee hoon goreng... sedap!! Delicious! Be it with mutton, chicken or other or just plain, is simple and good.
Roti John also a good try too, you can request for more ketchup or mayonnaise... mmmm...
Lastly,  their drinks are good and has a variety to choose from!!
Spoilt!!
Only thing is, their nasi(rice) still have room for improvement.
Overall, good place for small gather or dine alone.
Pratas are fresh and the curries are delicious. The environment is mostly clean and very comfortable.

The variety of food here is quite extensive. They serve both India Muslim and Thai Muslim food here. Crowd will start to build up before lunch. This place is quite popular with working adults as well as students from nearby establishments. Place is generally clean and the staff are helpful.
Good environment, good n fast service,  reasonably priced, good food... 5*

Patronize this place often, but the food (nasi goreng) has been getting so salty to a extend I've given up! Told them before when I was eating there .... they change for me slightly better, but take away... I had no choice but to throw the food away... waste of time if I've got to go back just to change food

The Nasi Goreng Ayam merah the fried chicken is not merah means red in color. It overcooked the chicken become dark color. Luckily the fried chicken the meat is juicy well cook inside. But the fried chicken skin is overcooked raw. I can still satisfy the chicken because the important is the meat is juicy

Love the food and drinks that they serve for their customers, especially their mee goreng ayam mamak! Some of the staff here, however, should learn to be more friendly when taking food orders from customers.
This small restaurant surprises me. It serves very delicious and crispy prata with very tasty gravy too. The teh tarik at $1 is very nice too!
Best. I like this place. The Boss and the Staff are very nice. The food all are good. Thanks.
Food is okay, able to satisfy my supper hunger. Not crowded and and easy to find a parking lot.
Prata the best around the area, thosai also. Boss is nice.
great price and awesome teh halia (order less sweet)
This restaurant is a hidden gem. Their prata and noodle dishes are a must try
Excellent place for Lunch ☕️👍🏼
They have great roti prata, cheap Indian Vegie Meal and other good stuff in general
Nice place to eat at. Food nice. Price ok
Nice place to grab and to eat wide variety of Indian Muslim food.
Food is awesome, nice place to hangout for supper too! ☺️
Great and decently priced food, it's just across nyp
Your daily mamak meal fix. Personal favourite will be the thosai and murtabak sardine.
The best Milo I’ve ever tried. Food here is amazing
Variety of menu to choose from. Friendly staff. Able to accept NETS.
Great food and a lot of variety!
Simple Indian Muslim food that's good. An everyday place.
The best food and experience here
Good Indian food shop with a wide range of Indian cuisine
Cheap and best restaurant. One of my fav around amk.
Food is nice and price is fair.
Great food
Good, tasty and affordable food on order..
A good service provided and friendly staff
Good food and price affordable.
Good food
Variety of foods n reasonable pricing
Great tasting food!.
Food is tasty!
Prata with sambal sardine. Nice
A famous spot in the neighbours qorth traveling for
Delicious food, nice servers
Gd to place to eat for breakfast..
Peace n relax not hurry
Quality of food is good. Nice for supper . Slightly expensive

The female Indian cashier gave 12 X 10 cent coins in change when I bought something for 80 cents with a $2 note... And her drawer had packets of coins in bigger denominations.. she was simply lazy to open them!

They charge $60 and food is not delivered. The guy on phone rudely says, its not his problem, contact grab and grab does not pick up the phone. He said money can't be refunded nor they can deliver food. Can't believe such things are happening in Singapore. Just lost $60.
Good food. Always consistent in serving and food. Love the 4 different types of sides (condiments) served when you order Thosai. Not many outlets does that. Well done.

The waiters/waitress were friendly and helpful.. Thank you for the good service given to my uncle and aunty who are regular costumer of srisun. . They love going to Srisun.. And will come again next time when I visit. Thank you

Food options can look quite overwhelming because there are so many options available from Indian to fusion to western.

Latest dish tried was their chef's recommendation - maggie goreng. Can't really imagine paying $4 for maggie with no meat (but got egg) - but it was so good! Maggie has a nice smokey wok-hei that I was pleasantly surprised by. It's not oily too.

However, maybe not get the thosai here. Not sure if the standard has changed but I tried that twice and both times the thosai took a long time, felt like it was made from ready made flour and came with watery curry. Prata was meh.

I'd recommend the goreng dishes instead :)

Had breakfast here on 7th March. Service was really tardy. Wanted to order a Tandoori and maggi goreng special and was told that Tandoori chicken is not available till 11am. Looked at the watch and told him it's 3 mins to 11am and then was told the chef is not here yet. Changed the order to just maggi goreng and Uttapam.

Uttapam came first followed by maggi goreng. Food was served without utensils. Uttapam was not too bad and it was my first time having them. As for Maggi goreng, it was very salty. Honestly felt that the price paid for the food and quantity as well as nonexistent service is way too much. I'm sure there are better options around.

Always here for their Teh Halia (less sugar), gingery and spicy enough.
Prata is usually alright, pretty standard. Sometimes I'll get the honey tissue prata to snack on while chit-chatting.
Thosai is a good choice too.

1 masala thosai is 4sgd. Will you buy??? Simply not worth it.
Honest opinion, the food taste for the curries, mutton, and chicken chicken gravy are really good. However when it comes to the goreng stuff, it is tasteless. Basically Overrated and over priced. I do buy their food once or twice a month, as much as I wanted to avoid getting food from there, for some reason... i became helpless at times due to time constraint and it is the only mamak shop available at my area.
They don't have everything which is listed in the menu.
I usually don't dine in, as I stay nearby. But that particularly day I decided to dine in and Ordered the impossible Rogan Josh and a plain thosai. I waited 20mins with the thosai to eat it with the plant base rogan josh. I'm not exaggerating with the timing. I finished my tea waiting for the Rogan josh gravy, I received a plate of impossible roti John 20mins later, And the staff insist that it was what I ordered, then when checked at the cashier, they still kept my order which I wrote with the pencil on the order pad they provided. Found out that the Indian lady (new staff) keyed in my order wrongly, sadly No apologies extended..
A short guy with medium length hair, who i noticed been there with AMK Srisun for long from pre covid, approached. He ask the lady very angrily about the order and shows unhappiness even before I say something.. Honestly I wasn't even complaining when I had to wait 20min for the gravy, but what pisses me off was, when he replied me that they don't have the impossible Rogan Josh With his stern face he asked whether I still want the roti John or not.. I replied him that was not what I ordered..He said ok no problem, and start to process the refund and the lady at cashier keeps apologising to him. I was Worried the new lady staff at cashier would be in trouble for this incident and I told this guy I will just take away that roti John since they already prepared. I asked him to pack it. I also asked Him For some fish curry for my cold thosai. He immediately served it to me. There was no thank You or sorry which is what lacking in these service staff. I remember that I even helped Him by moving myself to another table when he approached me, since there was a big group came later than me, Who needed  the table to be combined.
Anyway this  wasn't the only reason why I end up in Google Review, but It is mainly because I often hear my mum complains that these Srisun workers are very rude.. And sometimes intentionally talking unhappily and sarcastically whenever my mum is there to get her food for work, which is very disturbing while waiting there. She felt intimidated by the way they talk and treat her, I hoping that  something could be done, hope they treat and respect all customers fair and adequately.

The service is great, and the food is flavorful. It can get really crowded at times, but you can pre-order dishes for takeaway to beat the crowds if you are in a hurry, most of the staff here are bilingual, trilingual and even multilingual beyond that, so communication is easy for people of most backgrounds in Singapore

Was there on 11/2/22 late evening. Upon payment was told  payment by cash as NETS unacceptable. Ridiculous made me to travel to  nearest ATM to withdraw my cash. Please address this matter to your staff that's customer convenient is priority. Will never ever return to this outlet.

Eaten sambal chicken biryani. Sambal sauce salty too the max. Chicken too tough, leftover chicken???😑😑😑
$9 for a no standard briyani. Next time pls never bring me here again😖
I feel that to know whether a prata shop is nice or not really depend on their cheese prata standards. To me, this place feels normal only.
Worst food, not worth for price.. quality is very worst.. I don’t recommend to go this place again..
You can try the prata because it's really good but not the western food. Very expensive (range between $8-$15)

Mutton briyani $10.50
Taste 2.5/10
I stay a block away and I will boycott this place.

Bought 2 egg prata, 1 plain and 1 cheese prata, when i saw the pratas i was shocked. It was small and not fluffy at all. And the curry taste weird. My husband and i wasnt even full after eating the pratas. And they charged me $7.80 for the pratas which is not worth at all. I will not buy from here again.
Nice, well-managed outlet with good food and drinks which are promptly prepared and served.
Overpriced and underwhelming food. Have to wait forever for your order even when the place is called express. Save your money and time from this restaurant. Do not recommend at all.
Service is good food even better. Might get crowded at night

Food mediocre, yet had to wait an unreasonable amount of time for the food to be served. Coin prata came within 10 mins of ordering, which was reasonable. However, later on we had to remind them that we had another 2 dishes that weren’t served. Furthermore, the chicken briyani was already cooked and shouldn’t take so long to serve. However, that wasn’t the worst part, we ordered at 1527 and the ikan bilis white bee Hoon was only served at 1402. Everyone else had already eaten finish and only then had it been served which is absolutely ridiculous. Additionally, it seems as though the oil they used to cook the beehoon was reused as there was a rather strong odour.
Horrible food.. So much expensive and worst still rude staff

Always come during early in the morning after work. Good customer service even though it's just a mamak shop. The server is very polite. The food is..... SUPERB. Their potion of food is enough for 1 person & i'll tell you it will make you full. Really happy to eat there. Will come more often ❤
Just an average eatery outlet, however unless you get a seat outdoor, inside is pretty warm to enjoy your meal in this present weather condition. It us a bit difficult to enjoy your food.

Food is good, but unfortunately preparations for take out in general are very tardy, and they may cause waits for over an hour. 30+ minute to over an hour wait are not exclusive cases either, and happens more often than I'd like

Staff are very nonchalant. They tend to ignore orders until customer(s) assert some form of urged communication

From pratas to biryanis, Srisun got you covered. You can get indian rojak, mutton soup, murtabak, mee goreng roti john and thosai to fulfil any craving of the hour at this 24hr joint. Don't forget to take on a hot cup of tea or a delectable serving of Milo Dinosaur with your meal.
As always, great food at affordable prices.
Ordered in through Foodpanda. Maggie Goreng was tastless. Not sure if they deserve the 2 stars even.

As For Delivery Rider This Store Really Waste Our Time,Mostly Need To Wait The Early 30Mins And 45mins,Use To Wait For 2 Plain Prata And Briyani,I Have To Wait More Then 45Mins,And That Point Of Time The Store Not Busy Less Customer Dinning In,Seriously Name Srisun Express But Not That Express
Food quality is very mediocre, price is more than most Indian stalls and waiting time is long. But service is friendly and above average. 3 stars is about right.
Srisun brand says it all..

Lousy service. So many times the staff at the AMK branch pretended not to see you even though you waved at them! Today i feel like eating Indian food so I decided to give them another chance. I went to the counter and told him I want to takeaway a packet of mee goreng and 2 egg prata. The cashier at that time was not attending to any customers but chit chatting with his colleague in the kitchen. To my disappointment he pretended not to hear me. I repeated my order and he completely ignored me! Eventually I walked away without ordering. It’s ashamed that most F&B bosses are suffering huge losses at this period but the attitude of his staff is driving his business away.
not bad but Mutton Curry too salty. Portion is small, price abit in higher side. Suitable for people who are not so hungry as a supper.

Very lazy staff, apparently my takeaway order was on the table for a good 10 minutes while the staff was talking to each other before they went to check it and gave the food to me.

This is not the first incident I've experienced with this outlet, both from me and my friends. There has been times that they forgot our order to the point where I had to wait for 30 mins before they were done with the order, granted it was busy when that particular incident happened.

The only time you can get good service from them is when there's no one at the outlet. Maybe they will only make the effort when there's no business there.

If you really want to eat at Srisun, just make the effort to go to the Serangoon Garden outlet. I have experience good service there so I don't understand why the standards are not the same for all their outlets.

Had prata,impossible rogan josh,takeway impossible mee goreng.
Prata was ok standard,impossible rogan josh was very good gravy was thick smooth taste was very delighful.
But the mee goreng was was big let down there was this smell the chye sim was green yellow dry at rottening stage the sauce was spoil and impossible meat was nowhere to be seen.Had to throw away it was impossible to eat.

I ordered this morning some poori and it was good together with the side dish of potatoe.
I ordered again this evening Poori together with mee goreng.
However the mee goreng was too saltish..
Average Indian food. Was told chef different so tissue prata was different from usual as well?
These 'macha' are friendly. Crowd magnet. Food rating is 8/10. I just like the ambience where you can lepak with buddies for 1 or 2 teh tarik. Not too much ah.. Must take care of health oso
A small cafe which opens 24 hrs , standard food, price reasonable.

I got Biryani rice with mutton last night from this restaurant.
Its tasty but bit disappointed with more quantity of potato than mutton pieces in the dish.
It is good place toh have indian food. But have given me wrong order twice. They should double check the order before handing it over to customers

Just now i visit again to your sri sun express.  Ang mo kio Avenue 10.  Really totally Very bad experience again again. This time very terrible.  This time again same server. He talking with me like very rudely. Like really he don't know how to deal with customer. I am also from F&B dept. But this is not standard. Sorry guys. But now no chance to visit again and cannot give suggestion to friends of this restaurant

Food quality is really good but abit expensive compared to food  courts or other restaurants.
Also they need to improve their sitting place especially indoor.
Nice restaurant. Quick service. Okay food
Great Food and Drinks!
If I could give this place 0 stars, I would. It’s been 1 hour, and the food have not arrived. Wonderful service, terrible preparation.
Delicious Indian food. Wide range food you can choose.
One if the best place to hang out after midnight. Relaxing and cosy even if the stall is a bit in small in area but very very nice place to relax.
Ayam penyet super salty, slow service. Seems catered more for takeaways and food delivery. Do yourself a favor and head over to the Serangoon Gardens branch instead.
Food is great, price affordable just that the staffs nonchalant attitude .. Talking among themselves until you raised your voice.

Nostalgic old school feel to the place adds to the good traditional flavours. Pay after eating. So far only tried and like in order of preference byriani with butter chicken ($6), curry chicken ($6), lamb shank ($12.9). Byriani rice is light and separated well, not clumped together. IMO the prata is also good - my goto place now for prata for taste, portion and price ($1/pc for plain).  IMO sufficient portion for the price across the menu. Place appears to struggle with volume though... did I say old school. Hope they keep the taste, qty and ingredients if/when they do modernise the sales system.

Had a sumptuous breakfast: Lamb Shank, Egg Prata and Teh Halia.  The lamb shank is huge with chunky meat packed with spicy favours.  Egg Prata is crispy and yummy. However, the ginger milk tea lacks the punchy favour.  Friendly and prompt services made a pleasant dining experience.  Will sure be back.

The food here is scrumptious. Very generous amount of food that will surely fill you up. Bought similar food from this store and another just down the lane.

Ordered a full chicken piece from both sides, similar sized. The other side cut the chicken in half and served.

Al Zouq gave me a full piece. Every customer at his store received a huge lamb shank, or chicken piece. Price difference was $1.50. Worth it!

Will definitely recommend this store. 👍🔥🔥🔥

Update: FB page owner had informed me that he had sold to new owner. He got new owner to call me and refunded the cost. Amended from 1 star to 3 star.

Be warned if you are eating there for the first time! Super sweet like hell drinks and dishonest business with super long queue wth service preference going towards eat in and same skin colour.

I ordered face to face at counter yesterday for takeaway with the following food.
2 garlic naans
2 plain means
1 chicken tika
1 panner tika masala
2 hot tea
Paid $20 worth of CDC vouchers and $4.40 cash

The drinks are so sweet that one can be an instant diabetic upon first mouthful.

As for the food, I only got 4 naans and 1 chickpea curry instead?!?!?

Avoid at all cost.

Went there after watching the amk fireworks for national day.
Not the best place for service or food..
If an Indian Muslim place can't get the parata right, it's definitely a place to avoid.
The service us very slow, no staff to take the order I had to chase the cook to take my order directly.

They are so understaffed that you could walk away without paying a dime.
Not bad. With good Dum briyani and local dishes. Halal. Clean.

This is only the second time I've been here but the last time was at least 6 months ago. In that time, the service has become a bit lackluster and food preparation time has taken a lot longer. The food quality is still as good if not better.  Now with the market being closed for renovation, this is one of the limited options you have for Indian food.

Never knew Mutton can be so tender. Had the mutton hot plate and the naan was the best I’ve had-garlicky, fresh and warm! Chicken tandoori too sweet for my liking. $17.50 including lime juice for 2 pax. Very filling but a bit salty for me
Both the naan n prata are good. Chicken curry also good.

The previous store used to sell very good Indian food but not this new owner. Biryani was bland with mutton was scoped from curry mutton., clearly not cooked together. Butter chicken taste artificial.
staff generally pleasant. Prata, nan are good whole the bryani serving is generous. overall quite a good meal experience there over the few times, I hv been there.

Wow.. I'm surprised by the Naan!
And Masala Tea is sold here!
Been here a few times but always feel nothing special. Until I realized they sell masala tea here. I loved masala tea and they did it well.

Have tried their fried rice and noodles but ok only la. Then today finally tried their naan and wow.

I ordered the Garlic Naan with butter chicken. Butter chicken is okay nice,
But It's the Naan that's special. Never see before naan is like that. Soft, Puffy yet chewy like as though got mozzarella but I didn't order cheese naan so it's not. It's just the texture of the naan that's somewhat stretchy like mozzarella , puffy airy soft like bread yet you eat and know it's still a naan.

Highly recommended to eat naan and masala tea here.
Not a place to eat North Indian food.  limited options that too very expensive and below par taste. they don't have price menu and they charged more then what they told me before I started eating.

The lamb shank is very tender.
Nasi briyani rice has flavour there. Was a bit lukewarm.

For $8 the lamb shank meal is a great steal, if not for the rice i would have given it 5 star.

Feedback to the lady boss... she was very responsive. Will check out quality consistency 2nd time

My wife and I ate several times there, the food was good (don't expect a candle-light dinner hey 😉 ), the staff very friendly, and the price hard to beat in Singapore (with rice/naan and curry combos at 6 SGD). I recommend!

Delicious food! Amazing service!! Very satisfied with the meal and kindness shown. Highly recommend if you’re looking for authentic Indian food in Singapore! You won’t be able to find this kind of authenticity anywhere else! 10/10 recommend!
