Service on the slow side. Waited 20 minutes for a dosai when there were no customers at 5pm on a Saturday afternoon. Turned out they forgot the order.  Dosai was the "chewiest"  texture I have ever experienced for an egg dosai. Coconut chutney was tasty fresh and minty, dhal was thicker than most places (could actually see the dual!). Teh C kosong ice was disappointing though. Weak.

ordered the bryani mutton.  the bryani rice is quite light on the spices fragrance. generous amt of mutton meat.  it's meat on bone which i like.  its tender enough. curry gravy was flavorful.  overall i would say the dish is good, but not outstanding. i would say the best in amk. when i was there, two staff were talking and they appeared not keen in taking my order.  after they're done talking, one of them then ask for my order.  the cashier is polite. dish cost 7.50 but for the amt of meat and rice, it's reasonable. will buy again.
Yummy butter chicken dish with tender meat pieces and gravy that is not too sweet! Will be back for more. Naans were also fresh.

This is my “go to” spot for Teh Tarik. I recently enjoyed my first Briyani Chicken Tikka. The portions are more than ample. VERY friendly service - they recall me by name! Quick service. You have the option of eating outside under shade, or in an air conditioned space. For regional muslim Indian food, I doesn’t get more authentic than this. This is one of the best “village” stalls that can be found in Chinatown.

Ever since I know this place, I never stopped going here. As I worked nearby (Al-Muttaqin Mosque), I am so lucky to be able to taste from breakfast till dinner. My favourite? Tandoori Chicken, Briyani Dum, Teh Tarik and the Dhall! I will always help to promote to mosque goers to drop by this place and also, everytime anyone mention about Briyani or North Indian Food, Al Zouq will be the first in my mind and I will urge them to try!

Although it serves mainly North Indian Cuisine such as Naan, Briyani, Tandoori. You can still have your prata or Thosai fix here! Should try the noodle here too!

Very affordable prices. Portion is big and not stingy on the meat. Butter chicken was so flavourful and was really unique because of the smokiness.
The lamb shank was really tender and flavourful. Loved it. Palak paneer was good too although I would have liked it if the spice was stronger.
Nice biryani. Friendly services.
i love butter chicken and naan 😀
Garlic Naan, Mee Goreng Pattaya and the Beef Briyani were really great. Family loves it, 2nd time having it 👍🏻👍🏻
A nice quiet place that serves up remarkable roti pratas and nice teh si. A great place for a quiet breakfast or tea in the late afternoon.  Laid-back sleepy ambience for weekdays.
Don't like the taste of the foods.
Hiked price and taste nothing great.Chapati were not even cooked properly..looks like new guys took over.not same as before ...but old aunty who serve food still there
Great indian muslim cuisine here !! Price was cheap and affortable. Food portion here is big too. Friendly service by staff :)

Hi today i went here with my family to have lunch. The WORST!!!!!!! FOOD i ever ate super duper LOUSY BRIYANI fake dum briyani and fake butter chicken. The chicken is very dry tasteless  sound like almost rotten food they serving . BUTEER CHICKEN IS FULLY OF FOOD COLOURING AND  BONE VERY LOUSY FOOD. LUCKY I NEVER TRY ANY OTHER DISH. Not worthy for money and please AVOID to go there . Super lousy food and service so disappointed
You will get best butter chicken, The taste was amazing. Must try. Not so expensive and good quality.

My favourite place to order takeaway butter chicken biryani rice and recently banana leaf nasi lemak. The rice was very fragrant, meat was tender and curry not too spicy. Can order small sides such as stir fried brinjal, ladies fingers, cabbages and dal curry. I wish their naan could be thicker so that there is more bite to it. Their portion is big and price is reasonable. If you're not a bigeater, $10 can buy enough food (without drinks) for 2 people. The male chef and aunties packing the food are always friendly. Will visit this eatery again!
Food is good but service not so good due to lack of staff @ time of visit around 10 a.m.,
Best quality Prata in Ang Mo Kio. Go for it
Nice & clean place for a teh tarik. Staff very pleasant. Worth another visit to try tthe food.

Service was pleasant.   👍
Had mutton bryani.
The mutton curry was nice...
Mutton too was soft but just not enough of the meat...guess it's at the tail end of the day.
No papadum with the meal 😔

Tea was on the thin side but drinkable.

Had mutton briyani and teh Tarik.
The mutton was so tender, curry fragrant.
Best mutton briyani I had.
The place has is clean. Staff are friendly.
Awesome Lamb shanks here and thier pratas.
Great food & friendly service, reasonably price, tried the lamb shank bryani, it's very good, highly recommended
Butter Chicken was amazing, the texture and flavour was so yummy … loving it .. thanks
Most perfect butter chicken and naan in SG. Not 99% cooked, not 101% cooked, but 100% just nice.

I Ordered Lamb Shank Green Palak gravy with Garlic Naan it was too Good.
The Lamb was very Tender and Juicy.. This was the best Mutton I had in past many years.
The Garlic Naan was also good and went very well with Mutton Palak Green gravy/Soup.

Will visit again soon :)
Not to our liking.

Curries never disappoint. The blend n balance of spices is spot on. The Prata & Naan r crispy but not oily, very more-ish. Briyani Lamb Shank curry is yumz!

2 issues we hd ytd - the fried fish was hard n not fresh and d makcik forgot our Teh C kosong.
Pls maintain yr standard n you will last a long time here.

Great food. Reasonable prices. Unusual but pleasant location. Nice ambience. Very gracious hosts. Dont forget to return your used plates after your meal to the inside as they have few staff only and you dont want to attract the pigeons, do you?
Ordered the grilled chicken briyani and added mutton. Serving as large enough for two adults. The food is good and even better than some briyani restaurants.
Good portions. Value for money. And quick service. Loved the beef biryani
Good food! Good location, although place a little small but have friendly staff and price is also reasonable
Great indian muslim food with friendly staff. Peaceful weekend breakfast with my prata+fish curry!
Best plain tosei with side potatoes.. thanks
I ordered plain prata, not oily, crispy and Dahl sauce was fantastic as it was not too spicy also there was a nice fish taste.
Fried mee goreng look good but on the blant side

So bad order received.  Pay money but give like water as curry????
Vegetarian food 2 meals nothing vegetables. Given fish curry???
Tasteless food like this i payed $27.50
Money not eassy to get please understand.
U can review my order and what u given to us.
Delivery fee $4.89 for deliver this kind of food.
If u all cannot deliver as we order pls cancel our order instead giving ths kind of food.
first try
dis shid SLAPPED

Great place for prata. The Tissue Prata was really thin and crispy. They serve crispy type prata. The egg onion prata is delicious too.
We were first given chicken curry, and when we asked for a refill, were served fish curry. Both were flavourful and yummy.
It gets crowded, and there's not a lot of parking available. Go during off peak hours or travel by public transport.

The first I came here, I could not get in as it was full and waiting time was waay too long for my hangry self. This time, I came on a weekday evening. At 8pm the place was half full giving me ample space choices. I chose to sit out. The food was good, not great but the prata was the star of the show. I had ordered chicken masala, which is a chefs recommendation but I did not like it that much. The mutton dishes and the plain gravy that came with the prata was nice!

One of the better tasting prata eatery in Singapore. The prata is thin and crispy. The fish curry is thick and creamy, not the typical watery type. The mutabak is huge and good for sharing. The teh tarik is fragrant and bubbly. The fish curry is nice too. They also sell assorted Indian snacks. The price is slight higher as it’s an air conditioned restraunt. Try to avoid peak hours ie 12pm, 630pm.

Decent prata and iced milo, however the murtabak is too dry. Long queues for a seat but it moves quickly. It’s a good idea to walk off the calories after a heavy meal. Will try it for supper sometime.

Having a meal here is worth all the cravings. The Cheese Prata is very crispy and the curry has a subtly sweet but savoury taste. The Cheese Prata tastes very excellent and is full of cheese. The Chicken Biryani also tastes very delicious. All the curries have an authentic taste. The Teh Cino is not too sweet but it has a very pleasant taste of tea and milk.

Mutton Briyani is honestly a little disappointing at this price point. Rice was lacking in flavour and the mutton was mutton cubes.

Prata was also small and cold. They did not even bother reheating before serving.

There are definitely better Indian food elsewhere..

Ate there around 2pm today. Fortunately found a parking nearby. Last slot! Parking is not so easily available here.

Has mutton murtabak and teh halia ‘kao’. By default it will come with mutton curry. Asked for fish curry. Both curry is top notch. Had tried this place a few times and the curry is always top notch!

The teh halia is also very nice! Strong ginger and tea flavour.

The mutton murtabak is nice but I prefer the dough to be fried until crispy and it is not 😂😂. So the 4 stars.

Updated 23rd Jan 2022.
We went there for dinner today. All the food flavor is spot on and the texture of the various prata crispy and nice. The mee goreng also has nice wok hei. However, all of them was overly salty. The salt overpowered the rest of the flavor so definitely a minus point. So after today's experience, dropped to 3 stars.
The Indian cuisine is fabulous! My first time trying out and I am amazed by the flavour and quality of food.
Great food and ambience. The egg Benedict prata not only looks delicious, the taste is indeed superb. Really enjoyed my teabreak.

Fav mushroom cheese prata there… now you have to place order at the cashier. Service is bad nowadays.

Hygiene wise is bad. Oily utensils.

Last visit I order green tea… and in the cup of ice, there are seeds- looks like lemon seeds.

Asked the staff he say he don’t know… never even offer to change!

Went on a Sunday afternoon. This place is big enough to accomodate many people. Our order came quite fast despite the lunch crowd. I liked their mee goreng. Murtabak was good but was a bit burnt. We requested for nonspicy for the kiddos and the staff prepared yummy maggi goreng with hotdog. Noticed different races dining here too.

Terrible terrible food here. Ordered the briyani with Sotong and the Sotong is so hard and chewy. It tasted like it was cooked a few days ago. The rice was half cooked and was clumpy. The Maggie mee goreng is only half warm. Some parts of the noodles were cold. My drinks I asked for kosong, and I even reminded them no sugar, they added sugar to it. It was just a whole string of unfortunate food orders. Was good 15 years ago. It’s terribly disgusting now.

First time bought takeaway from this shop.  Most of the prata (eggs and plain) they gave me is burned.  How to eat like that. Terrible. This type of burned prata should go to the dustbin but they sold to takeaway orders which we can't feedback on the spot.  We threw most of the prata away. Worst prata and will be my last visit.

Still nice after my last visit 2 years ago.
Always delicious and satisfying!!

Seems like this is the only visible cafe around the corner surrounded by all the landed houses. My mom in law commented that this casuarina curry location is good because of the landed houses. I replied yeah but also due to the exit point of the awesome lower pierce reservoir trail. My mil and wife loved it although it seems to be a short trail maybe 1+ km only.

Anyway paper thosai is ok, ottapam (relive my memory when young treated by rajesh friend). Ginger tea are awesome after a cooling morning breeze walk!

For prata fix, anytime!

Personally prefer the egg or onion version as its prepared thin, crispy and long. vs the plain prata which is made thick and round.

Drinks are always too sweet, so I would ask for less sweet. Healthy living is the way to go.

Wasn't too crowded on a Friday evening.

Come here for prata on the crispier side - I had the kosong and the cheese + egg and both were great. Cost is on the pricier side, and the curry serving isn’t as generous as I’d hope. Quick service though.

Ultra disappointed! This family run establishment is a real shame when next gen took over..gone r the glory days..
Curry cold served, prata is like biscuits..n cold,,most lost important is they served all drinks n foods slowly yet the Teh Tarik n foods is cold diluted ..taste like yesterday drinks..the counter cashier stuck up, act like boss but apparently he isn’t boss,,slow, arrogant..
Believed they abandoned the restaurant standards and concentrate their catering business which is more profitable..
Judging on all past Low rating reviewers..is true facts! And management don’t learn to improve..
Bye, my very last time to eat here..

Everything is pretty bad including the drinks. Only the curry is nice actually.
I think they cant handle big crowds and just rushed to get the order out asap. Wouldn’t recommend at all. First and last time coming here.

Went all the way from punggol thinking it's as good as 10 years ago. I'm wrong .
Ordering - sorry aunty if I spoil your day dreaming at 1.15pm on a beautiful Saturday. Wasn't paying attention on my order.. but got it done.
Serving- was fast with my egg and onion prata and one kosong prata with a bot of mineral water.
Food- as u can see in pic is a little black with some charred black ash on it. Crisp...Yes it's crispy.. but a little bland on the dough. The egg and onion too was crispy but also tasteless. A nearby hawker can make slightly better one which Cost one dollar lesser. Curry was fish curry. A little sour but it's edible .
Damage is less than $7.
The *best* part was having my meal halfwaynthru and I saw a cockroach strolling in the restaurant. Hmm.. must be the captain checking on patrons. I got a video of it as I do not wanna alarm it. Should be the owner who need to check out his "employed" captain.
I was giving it a two star but dedicated one to the captain :)

Decent food but cannot deny a dip in standards over the last 2 years. Not easy to find tissue prata around but was slightly disappointed with a plain, tasteless tissue prata, had to add sugar ourselves 😅 Can skip the teh tarik too unfortunately

Pratas are crispy, but the curry sauce dip didn't impress. So if really want to try, don't take away. Only do dine-in for the crispy texture.

Tried the mutton biryani and it's not to my taste. The mutton is good (tender, juicy) with a favour full sauce, but my taste buds just doesn't exclaim with joy.

Return rating 6

Great ambience next to nature. Fantastic fresh air in the early morning and especially during the rain.
Food is good quality with nice choice.  Occasionally staff not willing to serve, otherwise friendly.

Have to agree with the other reviewers that the standard here has dropped, and prices are also too high.

Butter chicken and ultimate murtabak (filling is mostly mushroom btw) were not bad. They also forgot to serve my egg onion prata and I lowkey had to argue with them for it HAHA but I did get it in the end la

Ordered garlic naan. The naan came burnt on the underneath and it was bitter with every bite. It even left a bitter after taste that their iced limau did nothing to ease. I’m not even sure if it was iced limau or iced water with two limes. And I don’t know why the iced limau came in two different sized cups with different amounts (two of us ordered the same thing)

Naan was really so disgusting
Famous for their prata but prata was served cold hence food was average
Fast service, a bit long Q after 9.30 am, Prata good n the butter chicken so yummy

What a fall from grace. Used to be very famous and delicious in the 90s and 00s. The prata was very oily which made them very gelat. The cheese naan.....practically had no cheese. So not sure what they served us. Drinks were rather bland. No wonder there wasn't any crowd on that Saturday evening.

To be honest
One of the better Prata shops
Crispy hot (Most importantly)
Goes darn well with the fish curry (sour to kickstart your appetite)

Parking ample after 5pm and it’s free

Really can relax eat and chat with friends

Do come and try

(Non sponsored reviews, feel free to follow and discuss about food and places with me!!!)
We mainly ordered mutton biryani. The mutton wasn’t that tasty. My first time here so couldn’t compare and say whether standard has changed. It was just average.
Recent visited.. was disappointed with the lamb shank, it was not even warn..like a cold dish..Taste also very blend... disappointed and so expensive... However egg prata was still good...
One of the go to place after your morning walk around Thomson reserve. Prata and curry are okay. Like the outdoor seating as it isn't so hot and stuffy.

prata is pretty good and decent BUT the MILO TOWER IS A MUST AVOID. You would expect to get $13 dollars worth of milo but nope…the canister inside the tower thts supposed to separare the ice frm the milo isnt used, hence they pour the milo and the ice in the same compartment. Meaning tht your milo is going to get watered down AF. Its not like the milo is alrdy thick and the ice will thin it down. I tried it the second the milo was on my table and I knew the ice was gonna ruin the drink. Look at my photos

was quite expensive even for kosong prata. If im not wrong their egg and onion is like $3 but its ok i guess

Improved ambience, more casual family dining experience. Great service crew, and received attention from presumably the establishment owner, who was keen to have our views on the test debut of the lamb shank, which we encouraged him to have it as a regular item on the menu. I had the briyani with the said lamb shank and it was both visually appealing and palate pleasing. I also managed to wolf down a couple of pratas as well. Am returning for a repeat meal in a couple of weeks' time

A hustling and bustling place with great prata (slightly crispy), drinks, curries. Staff is very welcoming. Plenty of seating. Parking is a bit of a challenge because the area has other restaurants and people come to hike the Peirce Reservoir. Highly recommended.
One of the best place for egg and plain prata in Singapore

Favourite place to satisfy our Indian food crave. Bustling place with the aroma of the curries, chatter and the shouts of service staff orders filling the air. Service is always fast here and you will be in and out within 45 mins.

Love the fluffy white rice here, doesn’t stuff you out like other places. Masala dishes are all hits but the dry ones are more intense in flavour. Can’t miss dishes are the butter paneer, which is Indian cottage cheese and spinach.

Parking is sufficient but be prepared for a wait during meal hours and Sundays.

The food was normal not as what I expected. Serving of food is quite stingy amid the high prices. Ambience is just like at a hawker ctr but little better becos it's lightly airconned. Staff may be a little conservatively reserved,a smile could make us feel more welcomed. May skip this place for another visit.

Ok this is the thing. When I ate at the restaurant years back, the curries were flavourful. I ordered delivery this time round, ordered a masala chicken, egg and kosong pratas.

Delivery was on time. The masala chicken curry was cold. It should have been at least warm. The taste, bland.

Hope they will make some changes and bring back the flavourful and savoury masala chicken curry.

Nice casual and informal atmosphere, wide varieties of Indian food. The service is friendly and food served very fast. The lamb shank biryani is nice and good price. Prata, thosai, teh halia, milo donasaur are all very nice. Can be crowded sometimes inside the restaurant. Some prefer to dine in the five footway which is more casual  and relaxing. Good hangout place amongst the locals who need a nice Indian food fix.

Super Value for money. You can have food at peace. You can’t go wrong with your choices here. I love Teh Halia here especially along with tomato onion uttapam. Pls note tomato onion uttapam is not on the menu. You can request them to make one for you. It’s yummy. Curry along with egg parantha has just the right flavor to excite your taste buds. Don’t expect too high about ambience. If you Wana taste genuine taste, then this is the place to go for.

Superb quality indian cuisine. Located right between the junction of Upper Thomson road & Yio Chu Kang road.

They have air con seating on the inside & open area outside.

Ordered the $18.9 Lamb Shank to share. The best lamb shank I have tasted. The lamb doesn't have any single gamey taste or smell. The meat is just succulent tender & falls of the bone. They give a generous portion of basmati/biryani rice too. For the price I would say it can feed 2 pax.

Prata considered the crispier side which is totally my gem. $1.3 if I'm not wrong

The only down side to the place is that the teh tarik ice I ordered tasted very watered down even before the ice is melted into the milk tea.

Garlic butter nun $4.5 tasted light & fluffy but fragrant.

All the different curry I tasted tastes Abit on the sweet & sour side. (Mostly fish Curry if I'm not wrong) generally a decent standard restaurant price at a superb quality.

One of the heavyweights in prata in Singapore.
Prices have increased noticeably after recent renovations, and now is queue-order and pay-first, but food quality seems to be fairly consistent (read: still good).

Parking will always be a huge deterrent to visits at this outlet, so come during off-peak hours!

Always had a good meal here; although the queue on weekends are pretty long, they have an efficient ordering system, food is usually served less than 5-min upon order placed. Prices are quite steep with a Murtabak costing $9.00 but portions are generous.
Prata was very crispy. Curry is tasty. Long Q on Sunday but short waiting time to get table. Fast service. Chicken bee hoon is delicious too. Will come back to try other menu.. woohoo

Wouldn’t recommend their side dishes at all.  Tandoori chicken and butter chicken were so dry that you can barely chew the chunks of meat. Saving grace was probably just the gravy from the butter chicken.

Used to be my top prata go-to choice since it opened more than 10 years ago. However, quality has dropped drastically in recent years which prompted me to write this review after giving this place one too many chances to redeem itself. Last time, if anyone asked my fave prata I would say Casuarina. Sad to say, this is no longer the case.

Went a few times on weekdays & weekends brunch, and prata served was cold as it is bulked produced to keep up with the crowd dropping by from their morning exercises around the area. Even with this, service can be slow and inconsistent i.e., other people who ordered after you getting their pratas served first. Imagine waiting for 15 to 20 minutes only to get your pratas served cold to you.

Wanting to avoid having cold prata served to us again, we decided to strategise and go during non peak i.e., dinner. This time prata was served hot (thank god) as it was made to order BUT all the currys incl the curry/dal for the dosai we ordered was cold. They just can't get it right anymore.

What a disappointment. Its only downhill from here for Causarina if they continue to rest on their laurals and depend on their once good reputation.

There are much nicer prata, and prata curry around the area worth your money instead i.e. Al Rahman Banana Leaf Indian Muslim Food at block 603 Ang Mo Kio Ave 5, or Sin Ming Prata at Upper Thomson. All the prata and prata curry is served hot. Theres also much depth to the prata curry!

Been having it for years but the visit last night disappoint me alot. Plain prata size shrinked, serve COLD curry. Ordered their mutton curry, meat taste different, slightly warm, definitely not hot. Won't be back.

Prata still crispy but lately a lot of flies (probably due to the hot weather) which affect the dining experience and they kept landing on food, on our straws and 2 even flew inside the drink glass & land on the inside. Quickly finished our food and left.

Horrible attitude and terrible service. Will avoid at all costs. Says open at 7am buy the staff was inside and didn’t open the stall till 7:05. Yes. It’s only 5 mins but it’s the whole attitude. Customers are not considered anymore. It was raining and they don’t care about people getting wet. They don’t care and have a real stinky attitude. Really arrogant and not service orientated. Really rotten attitude. I asked when they opened, they answered me 5 mins ago which was 7:05am. They whole business stance is wrong.

Ordered a chocolate prata yet received one that tasted like a plain prata. I was told by the staff that the "black" part was chocolate but it was actually the burnt part. Staff ignored my feedback and mentioned "today prata maker was a different person that's why the chocolate was very little".

Refer to the difference between both photos of the chocolate prata from them and order it at your own risk
Food taste is excellent. Prices are really moderate and cheap

The prata has improved a lot with less oil..had poori with 2 different sides of potato and spicy pureed veg dish. But most important was the great service,attentiveness and the effort of the staff who greets all customers in English and with their goodnights...prompt service too.
Loved the idli, dosha and meedu vadai. We ordered these dishes for our small Onam celebration at home. The food made the celebration a pleasant experience for all. Keep up the good work!

Terrible eatery! Ordered a Maggi Goreng that they asked if I wanted chicken or beef while neglecting to add that meat costed extra. Was served a dish of over cooked noodles that costed almost $9. Eat here at your own risk! Definitely do not recommend!!!
Had veg briyani here. Food is tasty but portions served are ridiculously small for the prices they are charging.
The standard dropped. Murtabak portion is like egg prata size. Don't order
the food is very good and tasty 👍
Price very high but quality very low. Worst experience ever had. Must avoid food stall

Great service. maintain the good work.
Highly Recommended..
Very slow service. 30min wait for prata.

(Translated by Google) The taste is good but the quantity is low compared to the price.

(Original)
சுவை நன்றாக இருக்கிறது ஆனால் விலையுடன் ஒப்பிடுகையில் அளவு குறைவு.

First visit and already feeling good vibes about the place. I didn't try the prata yet. But epok epok and vadai both are great. Will update my review the next time I try prata and the rice/noodle dishes. :)

Maggie soup comes with nothing not even an egg!
Fried omelette is very salty! Food is bad and expensive and services are bad! Not worth eating
And all the staff also no wear mask!
Had their plain thosai and i like it!! Especially the coconut chutney and sambar, very flavourful. Coming back to try their pratas and other food items
Their food is great! The restaurant is clean and the staff are very accommodating/service oriented.

First time buying from them.  Too costly.  This is the first and last.  Will never patronise this restaurant anymore.  Just ask for some mutton cubes take away. Mostly $5.50.  Very very small portion ,a lot potato. 4 to 5 cubes mutton only. I was charged $8.50.   It’s take away. Not dine in.  Service charge??  Mostly I buy dum briyani from. Al haldeera Restsurant located at Toa Payoh interchange , basement.  Lots of rice. Boiled egg with papadam plus some salad bonless mutton and dalcha gravy.  It’s $8 to $9 only.  And the food taste so gd.  But at this amk.  Really disappointed and this is not the way to do buisness.  I took some photos of the portion of mutton will post it.  Pls pls. Think before dinning in or take away from this restaurant.  Cut throat.

The Masala Tea is is acceptable, the plain prata is soft & warm. The restaurant is laidback relaxing. The price is affordable. It would be great if they can expend the restaurant since they isnt much seats and the restaurant have potential. Reccomended.
One of the best Indian food I had in the recent years in Singapore. Super delicious. Excellent service.
Super chewy prata and high quality curry for a good value. Definitely a hit for a Sunday brekkie.
Authentic Indian food.Great service. Mutton must try

👍Food
👍Service
👍Cleanliness ✨️

Mutton Nasi Biryani

🍜 Food wise: Overall it was a decent biryani, it had some taste of cardamon, other than that, no other fragrance, probably too light for me to taste.

The mutton was quite good though, tender and succulent meat, with a good flavor of mutton!

The taste of curry was okay, it will be better if it was spicier.

✨ Ambience wise: Good place to eat in. Slightly cram sometimes.

🤵🏻 Service wise: Was alright.

💵 Price wise: $7.50

Came here for dinner.

Bee hoon goreng ikan bilis was not bad. But could use more ikan bilis.
Mutton soup was good and flavourful. Mutton was tender as well.
Masala dosai had slight crispy edges. Also not bad.

They also have prata promotion available only on weekdays. 2 plain or 1 egg and 1 coffee or tea for $3.30 which we got but didn't photograph cause I was hungry. Prata was good and curry was great. Tea was good as well. Doesn't have the astringent taste.
Mutton Briyani tasted good and soft but should have more given (accounting for the chunk of bone that comes with it). The bigger piece I had was 95% bone and the smaller piece was all bone.

01/01/2022 afternoon

finally, some good f××king food. delicious crispy prata not floury at all. kosong prata really hits home with its crispy exterior and soft buttery flavour. hot and delicious. teh terik and teh haliah poured hot and served, very yummy.

good customer service, friendly staff. free curry refill. fish curry is extremely savoury and piping hot.

standards have not changed and been consistent since 2019. show them some support! they only do deliveroo so eat there!

Very tasty quality food!! Had the bee hoon goreng & quick to served. Bee hoon is soft & fluffy easy to digest. Cook in high heat & Still hot even half way eating, highly recommended!! Not much oil used to cook the dish compare to other Indian restaurants usually very oily is a great encouragement for the revisit. Price is a bit high with plain bee hoon with egg only at $4, but is worth for eating a delicious food in air cond place. So glad i never stir the Hot lime tea as a lot of sugar at the bottom. Hopefully they can offer more vegetarian dish.

Great prata place to get your prata and teh Tarik fix...
Prata is flaky on the outside and chewy on the inside and not greasy. The fish curry also deserves honorable mention.
Teh tarik really hits the spot... not overly sweet, fragrant and optimal consistency 👍🏻
Choice spot to lepak with friends....😄
Consistent quality. The fish curry for prata is the best. The briyani is 1 of the best here.. love it always

I like the prata. Tad bit expensive than kopitiam but in exchange you have an air condition place to dine in.

Edit - recently went there for something other than prata and the fried rice is rather decent. The same can't be said for the tom yum.
Prata was normal. However, the curry was tasty! Aircon was too cold. It will be perfect if they can offer outdoor seating!!
Unfriendly cashier, super slow prata serving
Friendly staff, delicious foods, affordable price. Very nice staff lady offer me more chilies since the food is not spicy for my taste bud. Highly reccomended.

Have been a regular customer and fan of their food here for the past 1year, but my experience today totally ruin my rating of them to the pit bottom.

Went in as usual and saw a number of customers at front tables sitting down which I assumed that they are either waiting their takeaway or some are food delivery people waiting too. So I stand at the usual spot to wait patiently for my order to be taken.

At that hour (3-4pm), its not crowded and there are empty seats and tables. Behind the counter, 1 staff is making prata and the staff whom suppose to take order is packing (what it seems like) a big order and so I waited patiently for him to be done.

Then two of the aunties initially sitting down which I stated earlier whom I assume are waiting for their orders, started taking a tray plate and picked their indian rojak along the counter area too. I didnt think much, and one of the auntie started queing n waiting beside me with her rojak.

Then the staff packing finally done, and first thing he raised his voice slightly at me "you want to order, you stand at this spot la!" while pointing to the spot behind the auntie holding the rojak. I was taken by surprised and assumed he meant I should be standing behind the auntie, so I said "but I was here very long already!"
He said "very long also have to wait what!"
He look at the auntie and asked "Who come first?"
The auntie pointed at me.
Then that staff gave an LL face and said something along "then I take your order la!" as usual with the raised voice and fierce attitude.

I was damn upset by his lousy attitude and service that I told him i"ts OK, I dont want order already!" And left.

Prata Raya, even if you have good food, with your lousy attitude to customers, you can look forward to closing down when more people like me boycott your outlet for good!

Good Prata (kosong) and garlic, not so tasty kway tiao goreng, nice fish curry. There is air-con, and service was pleasant and waiting time was reasonable. Pratas were served fresh, crispy and tasty, unlike many prata places which prepare a truckload of pratas and become soggy by the time it arrives on our plates. Overall a pleasant experience!
Made upon order. Very crispy, lovely curry and kopi si kosong!
Indian and Thaai muslim hotel but idly is not available and dosa also not available in Saturday and Sunday.paratta is special here

Stands out as an air conditioned prata place at the corner of AMK hub. It can get a bit chaotic, and yes you can probably find a cheaper place to get your prata fix - but in a hot day this serves an oasis.
The prata is very crispy and nice. The aunty tending the cashier is also friendly and helpful.
The prata you order is made upon order,  Brayni is nice and the curry is good. Worth for money and waiting.
Simply local breakfast or brunch 😊

Absolutely amazing! This was a bit of a random find on our way back from Singapore Zoo and it’s one of the best prata’s I have had in all my time travelling there. The garlic prata is especially delicious! They are the perfect combination of crispy with a nice soft centre.
I also have to say that the ice chocolate (not milo) was fantastic. I can’t have milk and sometimes that means the iced chocolate/ milos can be a bit flavourless but this one was amazing. Wish we had found it sooner on our trip.
Cheap and Good.  Weekday dine in set of 2 kosong prata / 1 egg prata with a teh is so worth it.  $3.30.  Tasty asam fish curry

Ordered whole bunch of stuff for takeaway, including a pack of pappadum, 3 pieces inside. They took it to the kitchen for some reason.

When I open the pack of pappadum at home, there was only 1 piece inside. Perhaps the other 2 are in the pack of mutton briyani? Nope. It got taken out by them. Probably repacked and sold again. Come to think of it, my 1 piece of pappadum isn't as crispy as it should, it is a little stale, with a slight leathery texture.

While we are at it, mutton briyani's curry is waaaay too salty. 80% solid bone, 20% meat, tendon and fats.
A random find stumbled upon it by chance on CNY, the Maggie goreng was surprisingly good not soggy and flavourful, the teh tarek hit the throat smoothly...
Fxxking good pratas. I rate the best in the AMK neighborhood. Their goreng items on point too.

Trying this for the first time and looking at the long queue so look like very popular. However prata is very ordinary. Got my order wrong. Long waiting time. If it’s good it’s worth the wait. But 30 mins doesn’t justify that. Better off going to the market and order the prata and finish eating still less than 30 mins. Consolation they do serve 2 different curry but what’s the point when it’s not nice. Try only if you have 30 mins to waste and a stomach for lousy fried dough.
Overall, a decent prata place.  Not too crowded, good to meet friends for prata and chat.
Yes it is nice, you can try it out by yourself. I very sure never let you down.
The egg and onion prata is not bad, and I like the curry. However the mee goreng is too wet.
Prata was so crispy and delicious. One of the best ones in Singapore.
Ordered chicken steak for take away, turned out to be potato masala. More potato and less chicken. Taste was satisfactory and still doesn't know how potato and vegetables end up in a steak!!!

Cheap and good prata, air conditioned seating too.

Must order - mutton murtabak!

It is cheap and its good. You are buying what its worth!

Pricing will equate the taste of the food. Actually, even better!

If i would want to eat prata in the neighborhood, this is the place to go.

Staff are friendly. Location is very accessible.

I wish though that the store will be tidier. Thus the rating is 4. It could be 5 if clean and organized.
Soup Kambing.... always the best comfort food.  Great taste. All that is missing is the french loaf.

Garbage, even for a cheap Prata place.

One staff member sits by the safe entry and watches TV, the other little tyrant barks at you while you look for a QR code that they’ve forgotten to put up.

Meat is absent from food. Everyone is made to sit in one direction so it feels like you’re eating in a prison camp.
We are frequent customers despite the price. Get your sauce on the side for your roti john. You'll thank me later. The murtabak is pretty good!
Egg prata is really thick and nice...the curry is also not too watery and yummy😋
Pratas are freshly made. Teh halia is good.
I love their winter melon vegetable. But its not always available. My mom and i would eat here after most of her polyclinic visits.
Reasonably priced. The briyani chicken i had could be better if the food was warm.

closes at 10pm instead of 2am on friday..

prata's the soft kind instead of the crispy kind, but okok only
The prata taste nice, non oily and crispy.Their Thosai also yummy👍

nice place . prata is serve hot .chicken curry is nice and spicy .
a bit too pricey
Have a hearty breakfast as the food looks so appetising
1st time to this place also by chance as my hubby wanted to ear fried kway teow and bihun and also pack mi soup.He commented the food is delicious.

Lousy food standard quality ...inconsistent ... ordered egg prata but turned out plain prata with some bit of egg at corner. Was told its like that bcos its busy period. Is that how they serve? ...can't do proper prata during peak period ??? Also most part of prata was so tought that can't be eaten!!! Lousy service, & bad attitude !!!

I am a resident nearby and have been a regular at this eatery. We have been noticing poor attitude from the staff. If not for the 4 stars food, yes if you don't mind getting disrespect from the staff, demeaning looks from them, do patronise. They will make you feel like we are the reason for their sad life there. We owe them a living. It is times like this which makes me wish there is self ordering kiosk.
Because the prata very nice n the place so simple 😎😉

The cashier indian lady has attitude problem at prata raya ang mo kio hub outlet. She is not friendly at all and never smiles when taking your order like not happy doing her job. I ordered egg briyani and charged me sgd 5.80 and my order came out the briyani rice with just 1 fried egg. Usually Last time they gave me 2 round fried boiled egg. I did ask her if there is egg bryani but she never even bothered to inform me that there is no stock and only have fried egg. Feel cheated with this overprice egg briyani. The management of this prata house need to consider this staff. Thanks
I love their  prata and tea very  nice

Food taste good.  The prata is freshly made by order.  Expect to wait about 10 min or more after placing order.  Pricing slightly on the high side.  A simple meal costs approx $8-10 for 2 persons.  $2 for an egg prata.  The set meals looks more value for money. Though the place is usually crowded during meal times, the tables are cleared very quickly (even before my friend and I finished eating).  A little noisy here.  Need to raise my voice when placing my order and the number calling for your collection of prata buzzing loudly away.  My clothes smell of fried oil after dining in for less than 30 min.  Would recommend takeaway instead of dining in.

Nasi goreng kampung and nasi briyani are my favourites. Kinda sad they have to close early recently due to some issues, and not 24hrs anymore. We always patronise this place, its one of our comfort food. Good food and good service! Hope they will be back in 24hr operation :(
A quiet corner serving decent food. I enjoy the cool breeze and tasty prata that should be eaten promptly before turning cold and hard, albeit retaining good flavour.

Full house on a sat night due to restricted seating arrangement. Waiting time to be expected as they were attending to food delivery orders. Prata and gravy pretty good! Maggie goreng is spicy but very little portion of meat.

Superb prata. Slightly crisp on the outside, very fluffy on the inside. Curry is good as well and theres dalcha as well.

A much better place for your prata fix than a certain place two MRT stops down.

Very very good prata and teh tarik place. Came here because girlfriend doing manicure nearby. I thought it will only take 15minutes but Im wrong. In the end, I came inside this shop twice and to chill twice. Love this place!
Kway teow goreng is tasteless and there is no sign of mince meat.

I ordered roti john chicken with cheese on 27 July. Upon eating, I realized that they might had forgotten to add in cheese for my order. I approached the staff and asked him about it. He took a fork and poked on my food when I was eating halfway. It's so unethical and rude to do that to a customer. After that, he shouted loudly "What no cheese?" I was utterly disgusted by this behavior and I will not go back to patronize again. The old staffs before the renovation was so friendly and approachable.

Avoid this place ! Just had bee Hoon goreng topped with a Sunnyside up . Came without the egg and only maximum 5 small cabbage . Asked for the Egg, that guy just took from the leftover tray probably in the afternoon. And best of it with a the tarik , the damage was $6.30 ... Inflation ?
Love the Prata and teh tarik! I usually take out. If you don't mind dirty chairs and small spaces, you will have no problem dining in.

24hrs. Great teh tarik, teh halia, wide range of drinks choices. Love their Nasi Paprik, Maggi Goreng, Masala & Paper Thosai, pratas, fish curry. I'll be going back to try more items on their menu. Very attentive service. Windy, open dining area.

Unsure if the worker’s there were lying or telling the truth but apparently they told me that they dont accept CDC voucher’s as mode of payment.

This is completely misleading as there is a sticker of CDC voucher pasted at the wall right beside the cashier, which made me question the honesty of the worker’s here as well as  the boss. Besides that food takes time to serve during weekends and thay you have to be upfront and vocal about your order in order to place an order.

To end off, Customer Service is at an all time poor 👎🏻
Newly renovated! This is my go-to prata place in AMK. Way better than the one in Upper Thomson. Super crowded after the renovation.
Food is generally consistent. Prata is nicely cooked with a mild crisp.
Have yet to try the other stuff..thosai is decent. Not much on the menu is available. Nice quiet place for a meal
Not much prata place left. Quite good too
Convenient. Just right at exit 3 at MayFlower MRT. Good Food. 👍
Good place to chill. Nice ambience. The usual halal Indian food.

I like the prata here because it’s really fluffy, and I think it’s better than the prata house at upp thomson.

the thosai was huge, but only came with 2 types of chutney.

great for supper as it’s open 24 hours!

My go to place of my kids want prata. There are stalls selling you very nice, crispy, and oily prata. There are stalls selling below par soggy prata. This stall serves prata that's just right - crispiness within softness. It's not overly oily too.

maggie goreng combo $8.90 - MUTTON IS COLD !!
soup tulang $5 - tasty but salty .
didn't expect much for the services . initially wanted to order tulang merah 3 piece $7 (only 1 person is eating) but they kept on pushing us to buy 5 piece $11 ... and even ask "ENOUGH IS IT?" "WHY the rest never eat tulang merah" even after informing CAN'T eat !!
and when i decided to eat soup tulang instead , the person's face who took our order changes . try not to push your "food selling" too hard when customer doesn't want to eat it . no second time at this rest.

Have to try their Remix Murtabak at SGD6 (with chicken, mutton, sardine inside) but take note different cook have different ingredients, so if you're lucky you get lots of sardine and cheese, which is awesome. Big plate, can share for 2 persons.

The staffs there are friendly and easygoing. Their prata is nice. Recommended for those who have prata cravings especially during midnight because it opens 24 hours daily.

If you're lucky, you may bump into Christopher Lee and Fann Wong with their son having their breakfast there too!
Quiet, chill place to have your Indian fare.

Great tasting food at affordable pricing, they give huge servings too!
Open 24/7 but certain items are not available at midnight.

nice prata ! nice teh tarik! nice kopi chino !

recommended ! worth the calories !
Milo taste watery , got a hair on prata

I have never eaten coin prata without sugar before and its the first time I hear them saying coin prata don't have sugar lol. Really disappointed with their service and attitude. Like literally think twice before buying their food.
Also, the fish curry has a weird taste.
Variety of Indian food during lunch hours.Reasonable and affordable price.Taste wise just ok..ok..and spicy.

Recently the restaurant was renovated. The good aspect is that this restaurant is open 24 hours
Food quality is good. They have verity of food which includes Indian, Malay, Chinese, Thai and western.
The owner and management are Muslim and food is halal but they don't have singapore halal certificate as they didn't apply for.

Prata is delicious, nasi goreng and pattaya are all delicious. A nice little restaurant at Kebun baru neighbourhood area. Nicely decorated. Not crowded during dinner time which is good. Will definitely visit often. Highly recommended 👍.
Prata is good and yummy.  They have just renovated the place and looks cleaner with more seating capacity.  Assortment of drinks and Indian Muslim food.  Price seem to be higher after renovation.
Nice food. Worth a visit

The stall said 24hrs open. When there after my work around 4am with my work friends. There are 5 of us. They told us they are cleaning so we need to wait for 10mins. After 10mins of waiting they told us that the kitchen are still cleaning & told us to be back at 5am? Really dissappointed on how they managed the shop.

If you're a fan of spicy food, this place will satisfy--unfortunately for us, even when we specified one of our dishes to have no spice, the dish was still overbearingly spicy! Our suspicion is that they cooked our spicy food (the mee goreng and maggi goreng) in the wok first, then cooked the nasi goreng, which was meant to be partially fed to a toddler.

Have tried their Lamb Briyani which was very tasty. Nice mamak place to have lunch and dinner. When I was there I could see a long queue so I assumed that this place is quite popular for this neighbourhood. My briyani was fairly portioned and I think it is fairly priced.

The food are not bad but they are not consistent in their service, for example, Nasi Briyani usually comes with the papadum but some days they don't give (not that they don't have). They charged me $2 more than their menu just now. His face looked threatening and insisted that he is correct. When I told him that the menu mentioned otherwise, he told me to look again. I didn't because I would rather let him overcharged and not patronize that restaurant in future.

Honestly the nasi goreng kampung was the worst i tasted. Adding to that i asked for no veggies but mine came with loads of veggies. I hate wastage. The fried chicken and teh ice was good though. The food was quite pricey too. Overall decent.
Standard Indian-muslim food options. A bit on the oily side. Birds do fly in to the eating areas. Staff could be more proactive in chasing the critters away.

Friendly place. I was pleasantly surprised by the variety of cooked food this humble place serves. The prata gravy is much better than the one at Springleaf and Casuarina. Much much better.

Parking is also ample and convenient. Worth repeated visits.

Don’t go by Its long list of menu and the name that states it’s Indian. The prices are cheap but the food pathetically made. The mutton that we had was too hard to chew. The restaurant needs to improve a lot on its hygiene. They didn’t even provide a printed bill or break up of the items ordered. Cards don’t work here.

So, Indian Muslim (Thai) food. Prata, Dosa, mutton, fried chicken, fried rice, fried noodles. The quality of the food, especially the prata varies with the cooks. Can be anything from above to below average. 24 hrs, so rather convenient. Don't expect good service through. And the cooks are always smoking behind the kitchen in the alleyway.

Ordered prata which is served cold and hard. Vegetarian curry cold too
Ordered bee hoon goreng
Came with just bee hoon and some pieces of cabbage. Had to ask if that is all
The saving grace was the Teh halia (ginger tea) which is what this one star is for

All came up to $17. Is this expensive?
Prata is nice. Masala dosai also nice. They serve other food too.
I like roti prata and ginger milk here. They have fried rice with chicken or anchve. Some have nasi lemak and teh tarik. Many choices for redidents and workers at May Flower station. Yum.
Ordered chicken maggie goreng, indicate in the menu $4.50. In the end, chicken maggie goreng for $8 (chicken thigh with Maggie). The Maggie is salty and it is overprice.
The place clean,and the food are delicious I use to go every day because I stay nearby,and I suggest everyone must come and try the food.

The typical Indian food store with lot of variety.
I have to say their indian food taste real good.
Amongst all the parta and thosai are very ordinary with very less oil
Went for dinner, nice restaurant, cheap and best. Taste is good. Worth for money
The place is located at AMK. Lots of prata variety and the place is cheap! I would recommend someone that is prata lovers to come here and try out their food.
Great Indian food, mee / Maggi goreng is good. Rice set, especially with mutton, is amazing. YMMV

Not sure if this outlet is newly open or what.

Went there with my few Indian employees...

Everything also like not available.
No Poori , No Chapati, No mutton soup.. No murtabak...

There are like 6 staffs in the kitchen cooking...
But seems like.. keep getting orders wrong...

The food... Is plain so so...
My mee goreng is tasteless...
And it is like...
They use chicken with bones...
Means it is like..
Those fried chicken they leave at The counter to sell....
When they cannot sell finish...
They use it to cook the noodles....

So as the same for my employee.. mutton fried rice..
The mutton was the mutton at the counter...
Never sell finish..
And used to fried rice...
Close to 4 dishes we ordered...
Are quite badly cooked...

My next table customer was curse and swearing.....
Finish his plate of noodles in like...2mins
And left....

While the customer behind...Was typing to his friend..
How bad the food was...

Left without finishing the food....
I think it was the boss that came up to us...
And asked why we didn't finished the food...

Saw that their other outlet.. got not bad reviews...
But this outlet..
The food is just really not up to standard.

2nd time coming back after a few weeks. 1st experience was not good. Maggie goreng doesn't taste good. This time order prata, got my order wrong, banana prata became onion prata, despite having the receipt. Fish curry is too salty. Seems like they have a habit of getting orders mixed up or wrong. I missed the Malaysian indian cook and the local abang Malay guy who makes good teh tarik and teh halia

Biryani is phenomenal. The rice was flavorful and the chicken was tender. It's a relatively new outlet, do expect some teething issues and be understanding. I enjoyed their outlet at sembawang over the years too.

D Rubinah is a well known chain of restaurant. However, the ang mo Kio branch is quite poor interns or food variety and service.

After month of renovation, the restaurant was finally opened. After 1-2 weeks of opening, I went to try their food and was quite disappointed with the system. Even though there were 4-5 people in the kitchen, I observed that many orders were delayed and given wrongly to other customers. Thankfully, mine was not. However, I observed that the supervisor (who was also the supervisor of the previous shop there) was very demanding with the workers though they were trying hard. His constant nagging didn't help. The food is over priced weighed with the quality given. For a mutton meal, the shop worker asked whether I wanted papadam and I said okay. In a typical Indian food store (even in restaurants), papadam is not charged but here I was $1, I only got to know it when I looked at the receipt on my way back. If it is charged, they should at least tell. The rice meal was bland. Since they are new, there might be teething issue but I hope they rectify and bounce back better, soon with a good supervisor/ leader to lead.

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content:
New management by AL Mubin.

Prata is good and now it's served with two different types of curry; fish and vegetables curry. Chicken tikka ia tender and juicy too. Masala tea has strong taste, great to go with the prata and curry.

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: Staff treats customers badly. Did not show price and got mad at me indirectly when I asked and changed my order when it was too expensive. The cashier also did not get my order right because when i told them I was dining in, they packeted my food to take away. Food was a 6/10. Also it was too expensive.

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: Do not order their Nasi Goreng Ikan Bills from Food Panda my first time buying give bad impression from AMK branch, look at the rice use curry and cook so little vegetables and almost blank, rice is so dry no much ingredients $5 expensive will never 👎 order again! I stick to my Bishan Srisun Prata 💯 better than your Al Mubin nonsense popular!

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content:
Ordered the double egg cheese prata and it came very fast seems like pre cooked and totally no cheese taste and very soggy.
Ask the chef he claimed the cheese is grated into it I really doubt so cause I cannot taste any cheese at all.

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: ordered this for $8.50? 11 SMALL chicken? you feeding who? ur mother ah? rude staffs. claims 24hours but everything dont have. dont know if they’re purely lazy or what. first time coming here and i am regretting it he moment i see the people. took forever for food to come. waited 30mins for 2 naan. ridiculous.

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: One of the staff give attitude just because we wanted to order more for the same dish. Not to mention, when the staff said that he would get back to us whether or not the dish still available, they didn't even care. So we went to ask the same staff, he still dares to roll his eyes at us. But food is good just that staff.

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: It took me 1 hour for me to get my order ready. Other customer already got their food, but not me. When i try to ask about my order, one of the staff with specs talk to me rudely saying "ya ya ya, we still cooking." To be honest, this used to be one of my favourite restaurant before they change to a new name.

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: Not the best roti John I ate..  e other dishes was ok

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: Late night supper as I always see there is crowds during this hour so had to give it a try. Food isn’t too bad though the noodle felt a bit rubbery but the prata/drinks are better.

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: I order a Roti john chicken with cheese black pepper  and then u just give me a egg n onion?????where is the chicken go????

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: Spacious.Like the Alfresco dining.Onion pratas. Must ask for less sugar for tea tarik.Meehoon goreng too saltfish. love. iced limau on hot day. refreshing

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content:
Worse prata ever. Curry is diluted and the Maggie Goreng is worse.
Standard drop tremendously, will never eat here again

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: Very good service with amazing food. The bendi masala is a must!

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: Absolutely awful service. Sat for 20 minutes and no one came to take my order. Even walked to the counter to make my order but the guy told me to sit down and wait longer. Place was only half full. Never to return ever.

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: last week Friday they give spoiled  briyani I'm I eat now I get  food poison  ,, now I have medical expenses  61.5

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: Good variety of Indian Muslim food, I especially like the egg roti prata and Naan.

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: Good place for late night snack. Prata is good. Freshly made.

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: Good service is definitely! Able to tell that apart from thumb up on service, outstanding standard of cleanliness which is rarely can be seen in other restaurants. There is a lot of different varieties of food!

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: Standard really change since they changed staff. Waited for 10 minutes for someone to serve me.

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: The prata is cooked only on 1 side. The curries are good just the prata is white as snow on 1 side is already minus points

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: Wide range of variety of food and drinks, Prata is freshly make. Highly recommended

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: Not worth your $ spent. Isn’t cheap

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: Good. Eclectic. Relatively reasonable.

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: Lack of service with average good. Yet to improve.

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: First time tried its the last.

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content: Like the coffee.

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content:
Solid flavourful maggie goreng mutton and teh o ice.

Supremely good supper place. Will be back 24/7!

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content:
(Translated by Google) Sambal Sotong and Red Meat was nice.

(Original)
Sambal Sotong and Daging Merah was nice.

restaurant name: Al Mubin Restaurant - Ang Mo Kio
content:
(Translated by Google) ️

(Original)
🙂🙂🙂

Looks like any other prata stall. They're located at AMK 603 Coffee Shop, which is at block 603 of Ang Mo Kio. Standard prata and mama stall offerings. They're apparently 24 hours, so in case any one has a supper craving, they'd be open, together with the drink stall. I wouldn't get anything beyond the roti prata in full transparency, and I'd definitely not come here specially for the food.

Bought their western food, was looking at other food during the visit but the other one was not available. Preparation took quite long but the food was good. Recommended to buy from this coffee shop. However, as usual, price for western foods are a bit higher compared to the rest.
Only left with halal Indian stall called Bagus ria. No halal western food. Only stall Bello says no pork no lard.

The waiting was very long, but the food was good.   The salmons with the veg, seems like a balance diet with rice and soup with fruits too.

Try to avoid meals times. Their staffs are friendly too. Business too good. Just imagine, queuing to make payment also waited about 15 min. A typical Saturday evening.

Had a good dinner time with family here..🙂

We were given a nice big booth seat at first, however due to my mum having some issues with her legs, she preferred chair seats... the manager gladly helped us with a change..🌻

🍱 Manpuku Salmon Set... the set comes with soup, chawamushi, Idako, baked clams, main dish, rice and fruit 🍊 . Idako was left out when served and came after my dad finished the set.
That was a pretty big set. My dad enjoyed it!😉

Teppan Gyoza was good, very hot🔥! Its 5pcs per order So good that we repeated the item for round 2.

🍣Sushi and maki items were all good and fresh! 👍
I like the Mentai Ebi Fry Roll.😍

🙋‍♀️Kids meal, gotten a Turbo Jet for my girl, she loves it. The set was filled with things that kids loved!
She dont quite like the fried chicken pieces due to the sweet sauce. Portion abit too much for her cos she is small eater.... but yes, she is happy with the cute plane set!🙆‍♀️

🍎Apple juice was served in quite a big glass. Value for money.

👍Service was good, Manager Magaret was pleasant, helpful and full of patience.. another male manager in specs (didnt manage to get his name) was also pleasant and jovial.😊

Upon payment, I had problem with my membership log in, Manager Magaret was patience and nice to advice me on what to do. I was asked to check thru the items before paying..
BUT.... Jus realised when i am typing this review and looking at my receipt 🤦‍♀️ ~ my last order for ala carte Chawamushi was not served!  😭😭😭.

Total $138 for 3 adults and 2 kids.

Wished i have more nice food pictures to show. Abit tough when dining with hungry kiddos.. 🤣

Nice! Will recommend! 👍

Love the gyoza kimchi nabe, the soup which is a bit spicy and sour makes it a perfect match when you slurp it hot. The salmon teriyaki is juicy and it mix well with the tomato and cucumber. The lobster salad and ebi sushi is still my all time favourite with their generous wasabi serving.

Had lunch here at ichiban sushi (AMK) and we have a nice time, quick service and good food and drinks...tendon set is nice and the cook on the egg still runny even it was fried with tempura batter is tricky, rice that comes together with tendon is white and fluffy, unagi terrayaki sushi is nice together with the fried gyoza..had my fave appetizer of Japanese tofu and finished it off with yuzu orange drink which is just refreshing...why did I gave 3 stars? It is my 1st visit maybe next time it will be more than 3⭐...all in all, one can try this place....

Ichiban is not the cheapest dining option around, but it certainly delivers in the set menus in my opinion. Simple, casual setting over some delicious food, sounds good to me!

Always a fan of their salmon don, will always request for an extra serving of sesame oil and chilli padi for that extra kick. Unagi is thick and lathered with sauce, accompanied with egg and rice. Soft shell crab is a hit as well, crispy and flavourful.

Overall, always a great time dining at Ichiban! :)

Came here on mother day. Full of ppl but Luckily we come earlier. The person who attend us is very good. Just like he is the only one who working like that. Give queue number. Call number, bring customer to table, help for any customer request and so on. Of course Other waiter and waitress is good also, Just lack of manpower on that day. Anyway thanks for the guy in front. U are the best. The food is very delicious. We tried the cold soba (i think this is how it call.) The teriyaki chicken set is yummy too. Will definitely come again. If u like sushi, there are so many choices. Suitable for ppl who love Japanese food.
oh .. great and yummy foods 😘. salmon are fresh and juicy. foods portion just nice for sharing. serving staffs are helpful.

This is still the Japanese restaurant I goto for good variety and good valued set meals. The negative point is that you have to wait a long while to be seated, probably becoz the food is great and value for money. Though I felt the staff should be more organised and alert, not to let some patrons laze in their seats for long time even after they have finished their food. The pork miso soup set has lots of vegetables, nice amount of pork and the soup base is tasty. The beef in the cheesy beef set, is tender and well seasoned; with the cheese elevating the tastiness.

Set meals are super value for money, quality food and portion is generous with  different varieties.Been ordering from grabfood but I think dine in quality is so much better.. only issue is there are lots of managers and servers but everyone is so u friendly and unattentive.

I was here last Sunday evening with my hubby and a friend. The food was really good. We enjoyed it very much. The set meals are value for money and reasonably priced.Ordering is done through our own phone by scanning a QR code.

We were given a seat in the middle of the restaurant but due to safe distancing, we has to sit all in a row rather than facing each other. Would have preferred to sit facing one another so that it is easier to chat. Fortunately I was able to switch my seat after the next table left.

Date of review: 26 Sep 2021

We dine in ichiban for at least once a month and we are always satisfied but this time around, the quality of food degrades. The soup based dish has no taste, the kani roll became small and the ingredients became less, and taste is no longer the same. ☹️

This place has been around for quite a few years and it seems to still be going pretty strong!

Expect to find decent Japanese food with generous portions at reasonable prices. They are definitely more affordable in comparison to other more known brands in Singapore. Although their food is nothing extremely amazing, it's still a comfort go to place where you can go without feeling too much of a burn in your wallet.

Their set meals are especially worth the price, as you can great portions at extremely comfortable price range :)

Their staff was super friendly to us even though we arrived pretty near closing time. Kudos!!
Prompt service, servers are pretty attentive when we request to refill drinks. Food are good as usual.

The restaurant have wide selections of sushi and set menu. My opinion is that the food here are nice & good! Their price should consider reasonable.

If can, I would recommend to go early or during off-perk hours as there are always a queue and their waiting time can be between 20-30.minites. No reservation allow.

I really recommend this to everyone not to miss it! 👍👍👍
Food is okay. The service staff blocked out the entire row of seats near the window citing that is reserved for their staff only to open it up after 5 min when more customers came in.

Bad experience and service, the two of us eating gave us a table for two but really small, we wanted to order a lot of food so asked for a bigger table as there wasn't enough space for our food, but they would rather let us seated at individual tables side by side instead of a table of 4 with lots of empty tables for 4 as we were not formally dressed nor Singaporean and couldn't seem to afford it. Many other 2 people who ordered less than us (only 1 set meal to share) got a table for 4 and ate comfortably. The food was so so, but Hotate Mentai Yaki disappointed me as the pictures and the food really didn't match. Really not worth eating, will never come again.
Food doesn't taste great like before.  Standard drop abit.

Average menus at average pricing... Quality of prepping not as expected.. but then it was advertised as affordable Japanese cuisine nonetheless. 3 stars because of courteous and kind staffs. May not return though.
Our regular Japanese restaurant in AMK HUB we love to visit that's near our home.
The presentation of the delivery is terrible. Come on, $18 for the sushi, can you all get a properly sized container? And no ginger?

Economical Japanese foods. Foods are well presented and value for money especially the value set meal. Just that the fried squids are over fried and oily. And not forgetting the staffs are friendly and nice at this outlet.
Best for price Chicken Katsudon. Quality is consistent here. Been here many times over last 8 years. Tastes awesome. You wont be disappointed

If you don’t have the capacity to handle online orders, stop taking them. You are not only inconveniencing the customer but also the delivery person. Case in point, we ordered food at 5pm today (19 June) and the first scheduled delivery time was 5.30pm. Then it became 5.45, then 5.55 and 6.40pm. I am writing this is at 6.15pm. That is totally unacceptable and utterly irresponsible of Ichiban Boshi. The driver had to wait and potentially lose other deliveries because of your restaurant’s irresponsible behaviour. I will make it my personal mission to tell everyone about your ‘wonderful’ business.

I have been coming here regularly as there’s no other Japanese options in Ang Mo Kio hub.  The QR code for ordering did not work thus a lady staff came over to assist with the order taking on the ipad. When she ran into some issues entering the orders, the managers (in black uniform) did not step in to assist to take the order.  It wasn’t a busy time. They left the lady staff struggling. I appreciate the helpfulness of this lady staff (Judy)..  The manager could  have given us another QR code to scan when i first alerted them that there was an error with the QR . None of the managers  stepped in to help understand or resolve the issue. There was also no apologies from any of the managers. Another slip of QR was then quietly placed on the table by another staff after the food arrived. There used to be a manager in specs who usually provide good service but he wasn’t around that day.  Judy was nice enough to come over to check if we got our food promptly. Kudos to her for her attentiveness. The same can’t be said of the managers.  I don’t know the role of the managers in this outlet - clearly they did not demonstrate service orientedness or proactiveness when I visited.

At this point, it is unfortunate that Ichiban is synonymous for awful service.

We have spoken to the manager after our meal and they were very understanding but this was what happened:

Walking to my seat, a guy pushing a trolly (with trash and a bin if i may highlight) came out from the kitchen and blocked the path so i went back and stood at the side so he could pass. I watched as he rudely used his hand to gesture to someone to move out of his way.

After speaking to the manager, it seems like that guy was the dishwasher and he was rude to the staffs too.

Economic version of 🍣, just like our economic rice. Don't expect quality, but wide range in menu, great for quick fix and chill out. Could get crowded during peak hours as the seats are pretty limited and confined.
Decent spread of Japanese food. Sashimi is fresh. Personally felt the sushi rice was a tad too bland. Service is good in general. Won't mind visiting again

everything was fine, but just this male waiter in black shirt , simply just walk away ,after serving my food.
without listening to my new request order due to unable to order through the apps.

Went to have the meal slight earlier than normal meal time can avoid the crowd or Long queue wait. The staff was attentive to customer and friendly during their service. Food are fresh and delicious. Serving if the food was fast to the order. Green tea was on refillable and they taste nicely.

Super noisy.  Was there alone at about 3pm.  Theres this 2 chefs at the sashimi counter, a small build chinese malaysian and a vietnamese lady I suppose whom were busy chit-chatting all the way since I step in for my meal till I left, and still chatting!  Worst is I can even hear their conversation from the very far corner of the restaurant by the window.   Food is good I must say.  But ambience is a big minus!  Ordered a kimchi pot, a sashimi platter, a chirashi set and a soda.

Will go back again, but will peek first to see whether those 2 chaps are working together or not!  Lol.....

Assistant manager by the name of Mark was extremely rude and had a terrible attitude.
When asked how long the waiting time would be, he responded with an awful tone. Even rolled his eyes at us as he was walking away.

Green tea was not hot enough, sushi rice is overcooked and marshy, chawamushi with roe the roe is not fresh, gyoza tasted doubled fried and sitting in a place of sweet sauce. There are also fruit flies around. Never will visit again.

A budget Japanese restaurant which gives good value for money. This is a busy outlet with queue number system so be prepared for a long wait on peak hours.

Another successful chain by the RE&S group.

Ichiban Sushi is one of my fav sushi place.Aaahh their salmon mental sushi is one of their new dish and its just so delicious and pleasurable. Beautiful ambiance and the prices are affordable. You can eat everything here and they provide big meals☺️Truly perfect for me and my friend❤️Definitely will recommend it and see you again❤️
First time at Ichiban, was looking for light foods, friendly staffs,reasonable price, facing to Ave 3  along with Angsana big tree.
First visit to Ichiban Sushi @Ang Mo Kio... good service from floor manager and food is fresh and tasty...
Nice, tasty and fast
Not bad, decent Japanese restaurant with overall a 7/10 :) The beef curry was flavourful and portion was filling!
Dusty and dirty.. even the food is nice and service is good, but the hygiene at the counter table is just awful, how come no one take care of these basic hygiene ?
Food and services good. Especially their fried Salmon fish head soup which always finish very fast. Hope they can have more on the menu for the day cos usually it's sold out by lunch
The foods are good. Been here plenty of times, and they managed to maintain the quality. But be prepared for long waiting (queue) time, especially on weekends.
Nice Tendonburi. Always feel good to dine in. Look forward to another meal here.

Been coming here for a while, but in the past month, the food has been way tooooo salty. Suspect chef has long covid anosmia.

The saltiness is obnoxious, such that when u drink the miso soup, it is tasteless because everything is sooooo salty.

Please do something

The newly renovated space looks better, and seems to fill more crowd too with seemingly more chef's counters. Food wise, as expected. However, the unagi don I ordered doesn't seem to have as much ingredients as I expected, and was an off balance to the amount of rice that was given. Not sure about other outlets though.

But I gotta praise the service staff for being attentive! I called once for my green tea to be refilled and it was seen to automatically after, which I really appreciate. Thank you!

Just had dinner here . Nothing special about this restaurant. Food is normal
There are ala carte and set for you to choose with other side dishes. Plenty to choose
Prices depend on what type of food you choose.
Happy eating happy life !!!

The food is absolutely delicious and served by friendly staffs too! Will definitely come again! 😊👍🏻

The picture below is named Half Curry Udon for $6.90, and I loved it!  😊
Sushi was passable at best. Fairprice sushi is better honestly.. Soba and tempura wasn't fantastic either. Definitely NOT worth the premium
I wasn't expecting the food quality to be so poor given their other branches are good. The service is good but the food quality itself (down to ingredients) is well below expectation.

All time favourite. Located at the 2nd level of AMK hub.

Fast and good service.

Love the food but it lacked pork katsu.

Service staff are friendly.

As a regular customer of Ichiban Sushi, I tried many different combinations, no matter sushi, tampura, udon, ramen, sashimi, or the beef, pork, chicken, Ichiban Sushi never disappointed me.
The Garlic Chicken Wazen is very popular, and YES! you can't miss it.
Salmon Belly Mentai Yaki is also recommended, I ordered it almost every time!
Some dessert like a Motcha ice cream is a perfect treat after the meal.
Remember to gain your points on their customer loyalty card, to exchange some free items.

The waiting was very long, but the food was good.   The salmons with the veg, seems like a balance diet with rice and soup with fruits too.

Try to avoid meals times. Their staffs are friendly too. Business too good. Just imagine, queuing to make payment also waited about 15 min. A typical Saturday evening.

Had a good dinner time with family here..🙂

We were given a nice big booth seat at first, however due to my mum having some issues with her legs, she preferred chair seats... the manager gladly helped us with a change..🌻

🍱 Manpuku Salmon Set... the set comes with soup, chawamushi, Idako, baked clams, main dish, rice and fruit 🍊 . Idako was left out when served and came after my dad finished the set.
That was a pretty big set. My dad enjoyed it!😉

Teppan Gyoza was good, very hot🔥! Its 5pcs per order So good that we repeated the item for round 2.

🍣Sushi and maki items were all good and fresh! 👍
I like the Mentai Ebi Fry Roll.😍

food was average but we like how the staff listened to the feedback we gave to Cook the chicken liver a little less done. and they managed to perfect it !

special shout out to the staff Sam (sum) whom managed to salvage a situation we encountered while dining. he also has good knowledge in the sake there and was able to recommend to us.

would definitely visit them again.

Cozy place for gathering with friends and family.

Surprisingly the skewers tasted quite good, although the price is slightly expensive than those Japanese food you can found in town like orchard area.

Best to go if you’re looking for job-crowded place for lunch. Definitely can give a try if you’re looking for beers and wine at night. 🌸🌸

Came here in the afternoon and had the set lunch. The pork and ginger is recommended. It comes with a soft boiled egg which when poured over the rice really makes the dish quite nice. Prices are on the high end. It is set in a park and there is ample parking nearby.

The dinning environment is unbeatable. Surrounded by greenery. We were greeted by the guy restaurant manager during lunch and he was very friendly always served with a smile.
