Typical Japanese set lunch that you can find elsewhere, I feel their food is rather average but all their service and environment save one star. And Their complementary dessert is nice.

First of all, amazing alfresco setting. My partner and I went during weekend lunch and fortunately it wasn’t that crowded. Able to enjoy the peace and nature in a well-ventilated place. I like how the restaurant is well maintain and there’s a small washing area with soap and sanitizer for those who were in the outdoor seats area.

I only see 2 service staff during our visit. Not sure if the restaurant is understaffed because you need some patience to get their attention at times. Otherwise no complain about the service.

Food wise, the price is definitely on the much higher side and we were glad that the food quality and taste justify the price paid - except the dessert. Simple cake, ice cream and sweet red bean cost $15++ which I thought it’s way too overpriced. 2 simple appetizers, 2 assorted plates and a dessert set us off slightly above $100.

Overall it was a satisfying meal. Maybe will come back again for the ambience and to try the sake and beer.

Great ambience and cosy. The restaurant wasn’t too noisy and ideal for family and couple. Food was alright and a bit pricey. No drinks was served and we have to pay for chilli🤪. Service staffs are friendly esp the guy in white and the humorous lady with black rim specs. Overall my family enjoyed ourselves and the beautiful surrounding.

Great ambience and impeccable service. Food is above average but not the type that makes you feel like you must come back again, especially because it is slightly pricey. Really enjoyed the wagyu don - the wagyu was super tender and the rice was well flavoured. Skewers and sushi weren't anything to shout about tbh. Loved the tartness of the cheesecake.

Brought my mum to celebrate Mother’s Day at Tori Yard. While the food is on the pricier side, as per all Japanese restaurant, the quality of food is worth the price. The cold soba was surprisingly good (my guess it’s handmade due to uneven strands of noodle). The sashimi is fresh and thick cut too. The waiter forgot our sushi order, so we waited quite a while. We were pleasantly surprised when he served us free cups of tea for keeping us waiting. Unfortunately the sushi was abit underwhelming. While it tasted not bad but we preferred the traditional kind as compared to this new creation that has a crisp batter. Overall, it’s a nice place to catch up with delicious food.

Had a family dinner here to celebrate the start of Q3 and Q4. Ordered sashimis, agemono, sushi (salmon and tuna) based on the wait staff's recommendations. Food were fresh, really delish and service is good. Ambient is also very apt for a nice chill family time. What stood out? The yellowtail collar, stingray fin, house sushi, wagyu don, and kurobota pork. Really had a great time. Feel relaxed and ready for the work week again.

Have a great time with friends here... Tempura not bad, could be better. Enjoy the desserts, delightful ending after a heavy meal, must try the special dessert! Server are friendly but might be a little bit understaffs as we needed to wave a few times before they can attend to us.

The food here is really good! We came here on a Saturday for lunch and the ambience at the park was nice. Their service staff are also attentive and easy to get their attention. Would recommend their wagyu beef don ($30+) and chawanmushi. Nice place to spend a bit more money and chill vibes.

Near the carpark too so it's easy to get to.

Would come again!

Had a bite here after a hike. It's beautifully nestled inside the Bishan-Ang Mo Kio Park so there's greenery all around. The entrance is very insta-worthy & the night view imo is nicer. Service was prompt & we got seated and ordered their ToriYard signature maki. We waited a good 20mins+ for it to be ready and it wasn't served cold. The rice was room-temperature & so were the ingredients. Pretty disappointing after a long wait. I would still give them another chance as we went on a public holiday & they were probably overwhelmed. Wanna try their Yakitori - it was serving up plate after plate at good speed unlike our maki 😢
Good range, food quality , ambience were ok. But nothing is really memorable and making me want to come back again. Think it’s a little overpriced.
Love the embience in Bishan park. Enjoy the big cooling air even in outdoor sitting. Service is good. Food is tasty. Nice place for beer, sake, in the late afternoon.
Delectable donburi and yakitori coupled with relaxing environment with alfresco & indoor dining. If not for its overpriced draft beers, this restaurant is definitely worth the praise.

One of the best salmon sashimi I've had in Singapore! The slices were thick and fatty, and sushi quality was excellent. The salmon made us happy campers. We both had the sets, I had the saba fish set. It was well cooked and tender, and was de-boned as well so was very easy to eat.

Only thing is I didn't enjoy the soft boiled egg that the set came with as I felt it didn't compliment the dish. I poured half on my rice but preferred it without.

Sets are also very pricey.

The staff and service were great and very attentive, even though we were seated outside, we had no trouble calling the staff who seemed to be able to predict when we would need them.

Beautiful yard seatings. Plants and even we spotted a carpenter bee around the flowers!
Don are just okay - may not be their specialty - still the price is at the high end.
Come early or very late is the key to enjoy the outdoor seatings. Before 7pm people are rushing in and the breaking of quietness breaks the beauty of the serene environment.

Price is a little on the high side but it is reasonable for the superb quality of the food. Wide array of choices from Yakitori to ala-carte dishes as well as a few choices of Don. 😁 sashimi is quite fresh too!
One of the best Japanese restaurants we’ve dined at in Singapore. Great service and good food. We liked almost everything we ordered especially the yakitori, king oyster, scallops sashimi.

Food was really good, but the price is on the more expensive side. Spent about $170 (with taxes) for a 9 piece skewer set, Gindara Misoyaki, Ten Soba, 3 Rice set, 4 piece skewer on the side and 3 genmaicha. The Gindara (cod fish) was pleasantly sweet and the skewers especially the chicken momo was have a nice charcoal taste. The pork belly skewer was a little tough though. Some food with sauce is slightly on the stronger/saltier side (which i enjoy) so do a small sample before gobbling.
Service was generally good.
Note that some items can only be served outdoors such as the grillset.  Both indoors and outdoors seating were comfortable at night.
Not crowded when I visited but it was late (845pm). You can book before visiting and ask for either indoor or outdoor seating.

Japanese restaurant serving yummy simple food, located in scenic Ang mo kio- bishan park.  Lovely alfresco area & great for a stop before or after a walk in the park.

We had light bites which was the skewers & they were great
Chicken tsukune with onsen egg gives a refreshing take on the item as well.

All park restaurants have that added charm which is usually offsetted by the premium price.

Toriyard is no exception. Food wise, quality was average, pricing slightly higher which was not unexpected. Service was quite good, pleasant wait staff, common man type rather than those posh places.. attentive and smiley.

Worst thing about the place is the menu. First off, menu was only online and connection was extremely slow. Page took a min each to load. And.... It had no pictures.

So skewer chicken had a difference with grilled chicken... Although, because there wasn't any pictures... I couldn't tell what the differences were. And because there were no pictures, I didn't know what the plating was.

Buckwheat noodles in soup... Could really look very appealing, or go the totally opposite direction and be a huge letdown.

Anyway, all in all, 3/5.

Ok to have simple meal. The service is ok. But not happy with the waiter Sam.. we arrived early and made reservation but arranged bad seats while others got better view one without reservation.
The food is ok but the eel is not ok, so suggest to go for the rest if possible.
Flavorful Japanese Cuisine in the park, with flora and fauna surrounding the whole eatery. A must try when you finish your activities nearby at the park!
Not crowded but crowds starts to build after 7pm. Food taste are okay but the price is steep for out of town area.
Food is really good! But price is quite steep! Nice  Veranda setup.
Great outdoor dining, flowers overhanging the dining area. Powerful fan providing additional breeze. Order the grilled food and maki rolls.

Food is great. Value for the money. The main course Saba Shioyaki Teishoku came as a set with soup side dish, rice and dessert.  I came for late lunch and was their last order. But they did not rush to cook,  the food was done well and it was delicious. One comment l wish to make was l ordered a cold Genmai cha, and l request to refill with hot cha, the waiter said it will be charged. I was  puzzled because its just fill my cup with hot tea and not cold. But anyway l know its a policy.

Besides that the atmosphere is great and cosy.

I came here today because 5 years ago l brought my late mom here to enjoy tea in a garden. She passed away 5 years ago. This place brings back good memory of my mom.

Thank you.
We got outdoor seat for dinner, chill and greenery environment. Great food and service, recommend for family or friends casual dining.

Food: Shiitake was big, juicy, chewy, not too salty, and most important it had this smoked taste that makes you feel like you're at a barbecue without suffering the heat and smoke in your hair.
Chicken thigh was smooth, juicy, slightly crunchy skin, and no charring.
Quail eggs with pork belly wasn't anything amazing though the combination was new to me and much appreciated. It might have had more impact if the pork belly was more flavorful.

Ambience: BEAUTIFUL. Excluding the one guest who spoke way too loud at times, the place was generally pretty chill. A nice place to spend a night in the park enjoying some delicious food.

Staff: Attentive, friendly, and most importantly, chill. No issues getting someone to take our orders. Refillable drinks are refilled very timely. Just very nice people in general.

The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars was because the online menu was a disappointment.
For a restaurant with such enjoyable delicacies, the new menu decided to go with the standard izakaya style of having NO PICTURES.
Your food is great, and your menu is digital, so why not take a few photos (or grab some of the amazing ones here) and put that on your DIGITAL menu?
Maybe not for the drinks but definitely the food and the desserts. You have nothing to be ashamed about your food, so build a little anticipation and excitement for us by putting some nice photos of the food in your menu! I feel it's especially important for first-timers to this wonderful restaurant.

Came at 8.30pm with seats available. Good ambience, great staff and super good food. Sushi was one of the best I've had in Singapore, expensive but very worth it. Black pork is super flavourful as well. Will definitely come again, highly recommended! Opens till late (around midnight) so great for drinks and hanging out with friends.
Slightly overpriced but quality of food was good. Beer is quite ex. Spend $190 for 2 pax
Really good good across the board, nice selection of Sake, and some good drafts too! Worth every bit of flavour. Enjoyed the friendly and attentive service as well!

It was my first visit.
Service can be improved. It was hard to get the attention of a staff to take our orders as serving staffs do not take orders.
Everything went well until my Tsukune came uncooked in the center. I felt disgusted because I already took a big bite.
They did replace my tsukune but I don’t think I’ll visit again. Their service recovery weren’t the best.
Experienced food,ambience and service all simple excellence. Thanks for extra mile service to Jasmine and the rest of the staff....Kudos☺

Food is yummy and sashimi is fresh ,nice view ,indoor feel so cooling . If you wish to have more privacy ,can choose to seat at outdoor ,it's a nice area . Staffs is polite . Well will visit the place again.

The food here is very well prepared and is wonderful. They are very delicious and presented beautifully.Moreover, they are presented fast. The staff are very professional, attentive and approachable. The ambience of the indoor and outdoor are very cosy and warm. Had a wonderful time bonding with family member over delicious meal and well attended to by great staff. Thanks 🙏👍

Amazing charcoal flavour on the skewers!
The staffs are really friendly and would give recommendations when we were unsure of what to get.

Nice restaurant in the middle of a park. I like the outdoor ambience - very casual and chill. Service can be improved because it took some time to take order. Food was pretty good! I like the skewers, toriyard sushi and fried squid. They have an extensive list of sake. Great sake menu and I love their cups. Overall will visit again! :)
Nice food, ambience (located in a park) and warm service. Definitely one of the top Japanese restaurants in toa payoh/bishan/ang mo kio area

Today we had a impromptu lunch at Toriyard. Supposed to be 8 of us however some didn't manage to join us. The chef is very courteous during introduction of the menu. We especially like the lady server who sent us our food!! Heard that it was her 1st day there..Keep up the good work!!👍🏻Will definitely be back😊

Ambience was beautiful, but service time was extremely slow. Cooked food served should be warm but some were not. Our food was uncooked and the restaurant waived off the price for that dish. Not a very good experience as one would have greater expectations given the price point.
Nice ambience. Food is good. Beer is strong. Staff and service is engaging and friendly. Ive nothing to drop a star. Will come back and totally recommend. 👍 picture dont do justice. All is good.

Extremely good service! The food selection is quite huge as well, their donburis are really good and the portions are reasonably big, as well as their skewers, highly recommended to try them.

The prices are a bit on the expensive side, but that's the standard of such restaurants, I think it's worth a try if you're willing to spend a bit.

We are surprised to receive 1 slice of birthday cake as Jack heard that we have birthday girl when he served us ice cream.

Salmon sashimi is fresh, chicken curry don has large portion and sesame ice cream not so sweet.

Good service  and attentive to customer needs.

Not open in the morning. But they seems like selling more and promoting beer. Perhaps a heaven for beer drinker in this neighbourhood. There are many trace of Japanese decor, with huge lanterns and many seemingly art object that represent Japanese culture spew around the premise. The garden is well kept to look so natural and I love the entrance to the small tavern. Yes tavern. Hidden away in the garden on a small mold. The rising step tells me that I am ascending to some higher plane. Drinking. LOL

We came here again yesterday. Love the food and the environment. Will come more often.

Quality of the food: 4/5
Service: 5/5
Environment: 5/5
Value for money: 4/5
Overall: 4.5/5

The Mentaiko Hotate had an extremely dodgy taste. By chance the Mentaiko fell off the scallop and I tasted the scallop on its own, it wasn’t fresh and had a questionable taste to it. 🤮

The sushi is pricey at $5 a piece.

The only saving grace is the Skewers.

Really did not feel that this was value for money.

The Hotate and Squid was an absolute rip off. I really wished I hadn’t come here.

Such a pity. Food was good but overall experience was ruined by the staff in a white uniform, which I understand was the assistant manager. Very unwelcoming and hostile as a service staff. What was supposed to be a happy and positive experience was turned sour the moment we entered, no thanks to the Asst manager. Pls consider retraining this staff if he is going to be the first point of contact for all patrons.
Situated inside Bishan Park, nice place for a good Japanese meal.

Located in B2 of AMK Hub where Fairprice is, just beside the Dessert shop.
Bought voucher from ShopBack. Service was ok and prompt, waiting time was okay.
But food is subpar. Ordered curry chicken katsu and gyu don.
Look at the gyu don rice that looks like mui fan or porridge. Totally wet from the sauce which is not to my preference. Note: I didn't mix the rice btw. I'm not sure if donburis are supposed to be this wet. Beef was average, not too chewy. Red ginger not sweet enough.
Not sure if it's just an outlet problem, but I might reconsider getting mains from here next time. Sushi for quick fixes are still average and sufficient.

Visited the AMK hub branch on 5th March, 1:27pm bought the maki mix set that costs $8.20. Despite their sushi looking less appealing compared to other takeout sushi competitors around in the mall like Mr Sushi@ NTUC and Kuriya’s, I still decided to give them the benefit of doubt and went ahead with my purchase. Upon consuming, I was appalled by the sourness of the chuka maki. I then sniffed and taste tested the rest of the set and realised they have all gone bad too. Sadly, the only ones that were still edible were the mini cucumber, tamogo + crab stick ones. The sushi rice were tad disappointing too, lacking in the vinegary touch that usual sushi should have. Service wise was fine but food quality could have been better.

Grateful to Cecelia but left because of peer pressure.  The kitchen is very unsafe both because the management does no business in improving safety and pricing of items sold . I judge the whole entity as a failure..well in disguise and in perceiving that the big boss is too arrogant and too flamboyant to the shareholders and only thinks highly of the brand which is not even original in Taste.  Japanese people will tell you this whole set-up is corrupted to a certain extent and there is going to be a dispute soon from logistics down to distribution networks. In fact the NEA is going to task and remove the label from the kitchens of UMISUSHI. Appreciate your concerted effort in making the disorganisation review and help throw the disputed managers out to the public and private eateries for further questions.
Decent yummy Japanese food which is reasonably priced! Kids loves the oyakodon and chanwamushi !

Just bought the Umi birthday Don set from this outlet today at 7.25pm, it was so disappointing because my Onsen egg was broken, there was insufficient sauce for both rice and the chicken and worse of all, the 'fresh greens' were definitely not fresh! The broccoli in particular tasted sour, and it wasn't the vinegar kind of sour, but the sourness that comes from food gone bad. As I stayed nearby, I returned to the outlet at around 9pm with my bento, to feedback to the staff at the outlet about the sour broccoli. The staff replied me that the sourness was probably came from the wafuku sauce added. I explained to the staff that it was only the broccoli that tasted sour and no other part of the bento, which would not be the case if the sauce was added to the bento. The staff took my bento over and looked at it for a good 2 seconds and then asked if I wanted him to throw it away, with no other follow up action like checking if the existing stock of vegetables did go bad. This is my first time trying the bento and it was definitely not worth my time, or any others for the matter!

A cheap fix for your sushi craving. The sushi does tend to get left on the shelf for Long hours depending on the sales volume of the day.

It looks appetising and is a decent enough fix. However, the food has tasted/looked off several times towards the shop closing hours.

I would suggest adding different flavours of sushi to entice more customers to buy.

But I will return as their food is 3 stars worth of tastiness!

The worst decision I made today is to have lunch at Umi sushi Mount Alvernia.

Order a ramen and found a piece of plastic roughly 5cm long and 2mm wide inside the soup. Brought the item to counter and the staff gave me a “new bowl”, old noodle with new soup, probably boiled together as the previous one with the plastic in.

I am a breastfeeding mother and I am really worried that I may have ingested plastic (thus causing harm to the baby thru my produce) becos the plastic surely doesn’t look like a complete piece! Decided to stop breastfeeding my baby from now on, thanks to the excellence  service of Umi Sushi.

I noticed on Google review, that just two months ago another reviewer has encountered the same “plastic incident “ at Mount Alvernia outlet! Well done management!

We ordered the poke bowl and paid about 15 dollars but it was outright inedible. The fish was tasteless and the rice was regular white rice. The rest of the toppings were okay because they were just shredded vegetables. The one star is for the staff, and the best part of the meal was leaving.

Was at their Mt Alvernia branch for lunch today. Ordered their Tori Teriyaki Bento. The meat was uncooked and still red. They took it back to recook the meat and placed it back to onto the bento. Half way thru eating found a piece of plastic inside. It looks like a handplaster but they claimed it is just a plastic wrap for their seaweed that they accidentally dropped into the bento!! What a lousy restuarant with poor hygeine standard. Will never go back!
Simply express Sushi 🍣
Food is good especially the tori teriyaki  bento set for $6.90. Only the aunty that prepare the food sound very rude. Well hope she Can be  more happy working and everyone happy eating!
I like chicken rice set. The mashed potato and cabbage salad is plus to enhence the experience. 5.90 for weekday is reasonable.
Salmon sushi had a weird rotten fish smell, would not recommend for raw sushi
It was a great lunch at umisushi specially the rice dumplings.
Fast and value for money.
First time I came here the staff  no so happy when I asking him  the price bor the food but I still try to eat  don't had a happy mood.
Comfortable seating, nice food at reasonable price
Food is not bad. Price can be cheaper.
Nice place. Not too crowded. Serves fast.
Gyu don nice. But pricey ....
bad, no space to sit ◡̈
Yummy 🍙🍥🍣
Nice place for Sushi
Economical meals
Japanese food

(Translated by Google) No

(Original)
Na

I’m surprised that there’s just 1 review done for this food business. Since COVID-19 CB, my family have ordered several times (if not weekly) for their tasty and affordable meal delivery. We were initially attracted to the fair pricing (think $5 for a Chicken Chop with delicious Brown Sauce, and 2 well portioned sides well packed in divider tray). Then there’s no turning back... we start trying all kinds of Japanese & Western food selection, and almost all satisfied. And for the 1 Sushi Tray which we commented that the rice texture is too hard from excessive pressure, this flaw is corrected immediately on next order. Very impressive business owner, who take feedback seriously. This is also the reason why I felt compelled to leave this positive review. They deserve to do better and survive current difficult wave. By saying that, I’m also helping those who order food deliveries on frequent basis. Their pricing is Very Affordable!! Especially if you live around their stall @ Koufu NYP. I reside in Sengkang and enjoys special discounted delivery fee at just $3 when I order in for my family of 4. Imagine $5 x 4 meals, add $3 for transport and that is just $23 nett for a good dinner delivered to doorstep.

Finally, I would like to recommend our family’s favourites: Chicken Chop with Brown Sauce ($5), Hawaiian Chicken Chop ($6), Mexican Chicken Chop ($6), Mashed Potato that are served with the mains, Oyako-don ($5) and the 8-piece Sushi Tray ($7).
Affordable Japanese stall for students.

Food quality is quite good, but just take note of 2 things: (1) price for rice is ridiculous ($2.50) if you buy less than 4 sticks of tori. (2) during peak period, the calculation of items may be wrong as they have to do it very quickly.
Quick fix delicious meal option! Price for most of the sides have been on a constant rise, passively...

Bento sets are value for money. Staff are efficient and work as fast as they can. However, sometimes the queue can be held up because customers in front have very voluminous orders. So take care when ordering.

Upsize rice worth it.
Great meal as always.

Bad attitude. Rude staff taking orders. Please put someone more suitable in the service line and train your staff not to talk bad about customers in front of them. Not all customers can speak or understand mandarin. Thanks.
Value for money and doesn't disappoint!
Such a fun place to go eat at. The food simply tastes so delicious. It is the perfect place to stop at to get a quick bite to eat. I recommend to get the chicken balls, they are by far the best.

Food: 4/5
Service: 4/5
Ambience: 3-4/5

As a fast food eatery, I expected bland food and uncaring staff. I received a welcome surprise though. The food was quite delectable, perfect for quick snacks, and the service was quick and quite affable. Overall, a great experience.
The chicken ball and tamagoyaki are very well cooked! Exceed my expectation from a chain store. They are even better than some of the Japanese cuisine restaurants.
Rarely listens to my request for no pickles
The one who serve with bad attitude if u only buy 1 set
Yes glutinous rice was well prepared...coupled with same other sushi delights
Today is my first time trying out the yakitori..chicken ball n ckicken tori...not too bad...🙂
either cash or grabpay. very very inconvenient. only 4 narrow seats. price keeps increasing. forget it.
Love their fried chicken. It's real good
The japanese bento is good n price is cheap.Good value for money.
Some staff is rude. Place so small. Can be considered for take away maybe.
Really tasty, superb
Another Tori Q. Low price Japanese grilled food.
Great yakitori. Service is fast too.
fking best japanese on the go food
Good location & food, convenient.
Quick bites...good for kids
Always good food
Delicious and affordable.
tast good cheep fast
Crowded at peak hours.
The lifts at amkhub suck
Food is nice.
Rude service
Nice food!
Ok
Ok
nice
Terrible
Snack
Nice bento

(Translated by Google) After eating for several years, I like set B. The rice is delicious and the sauce is delicious. It is always not greasy to eat, although the softness and hardness of the meat of each branch will be slightly different, in general, it is not far off. Recommended👍

(Original)
吃了好几年了，喜欢set B，米饭好吃，酱料够味。总是吃不腻的，虽然每个分店的肉质软硬度会有些许的不同，总的来说还是相差不远的。推荐👍

(Translated by Google) It is always delicious to eat. It solves lunch and dinner packaging for busy office workers, and the taste is always delicious.

(Original)
항상 맛있게 먹고있습니다. 바쁜 직장인의 점심저녁 포장을 해결해주고 항상 그맛 맛있어요 ㅎ
Nice authentic Japanese food. Love the cold soba noodle, Strongly recommended, a must try dish. My wife love the fry photo, her favourite 😋. Service was good and reasonable price.

Was expecting a normal Japanese meal, turns out to be a great meal that must share to friends!
Ordered the saba shio fish, Koebi (fried small prawns) kake udon, and okonomiyaki. All were delicious and very much like having a meal back in Japan! Portions were bigger than expected, but value for money!
Had hot barley tea, came in a big pot, bf got iced one, free refills! Must come and try, won't be disappointing!
Do wish it's more accessible, have to drive in or change buses.
Has a very 80s look to the decor. Food isn’t bad, tastes pretty authentic. Katsu curry even had the fukujin pickles. Oyakodon also nice.

Nice homely Japanese eatery here! The katsu don is quite nice and unique with the addition of mushrooms. The salmon is ok, ebi tempera and karaage is good. The grilled squid is also fresh and bouncy! Like and check in to their fb to get a free wakami, it’s delicious! The roasted barley tea is also aromatic!

Friendly staff, cozy atmosphere. Food is alright but perhaps we ordered the wrong dishes.
What we like:
Oyako don
Milk tea

Didnt like
Sushi coated with sesame and a frozen crab stick.
Sashimi was abit soggy and ika was terribly hard.

Went at a colleague's recommendation to try during lunch. Didn't go for their daily lunch set and opted for their katsu curry rice. The curry itself is pretty good, generous. Squid was nice with the dip and the potato salad was not too bad too. My colleague had the yakisoba which was surprisingly quite delicious. Overall, a homely little place I wouldn't mind retuning to again if I'm in the vicinity. Otherwise, it's located at a pretty inaccessible place - best to drive there.

Good value, tasty and surprisingly big portions. We over ordered as we thought the rice bowls were normal sized but they were huge.

The salmon fish head was huge.

The potato salad is good but relatively expensive at $5.80 before service charge.

Food is ordered via scanning a QR code.

Tamako Meal has always been in our must visit list of Japanese Restaurants in Singapore. Their meals are simple yet authentic, never compromise in food quality and always ensure us with sufficient portion. Never miss their Giant Squid and Tuna bowl for our every visits. Owner is always friendly and chats with diners occasionally. Awesome place. 👍

Great value Japanese food. I always felt the bento set was one of the most value Japanese meals in Singapore.

I added on the squid from Hokkaido based on their recommendation and it was great too.

The place is always kept clean and tired so it is great especially for a season of covid19.
Had the katsu Don, katsu curry rice and salmon roll. Decent meal for the price paid.

This is a really bad sushi to be honest .  Cheap ingrediants and selling it over price except for the ebiko the rest are cheap ingrediants like egg,cucumbe, crab meat . The sushi rice is quite sweet . Salmon is cut as thin as a panty liner . Whats worst … Soy sauce is not japanese soy sauce .. its some breakfast egg soy sauce/cooking soy sauce … Would highly not recommend …

Alright! It's well deserving of their ratings... Staff are friendly and helpful. I would recommend anyone to come and try their dory fillets and bentos anytime.

The location is in a accessible location with nearby parking. so whether you are coming via public transportation or private vehicles you can always get a slot at your convenience.

Enjoy their hearty meals and story of Tamako!

Dropped by for dinner without reservation on Saturday night. Had to wait a bit for seats. Ordered Tamako Teishoku (beef yakiniku) using phone via a QR receipt they provided. Food took quite awhile to come but understandable as the restaurant was packed and there was takeaway orders too. Teishoku set is value for money as it comes with rice, miso soup, ebi fry (prawn tempura), nikujaga (potato with meat), deep fried dumpling, chicken karage (fried chicken) and beef yakiniku. Every item is hot and freshly made. Beef yakiniku is on the salty side but rice complement well with it. Overall had an enjoyable meal!
An old-timer cosy Japanese restaurant that have existed as far as my memories could take me. The daily set meals are good value-for-money and worth checking out.

Feels like a food court eatery. There was a musky smell indoors, and there was only one wait staff (who seemed tired even though the shop just opened) on a Sunday lunch. Expected good food due to the many good reviews, but alas somehow my family didn't like the food we ordered. Even the basic udon broth has not much flavour and is just a salty broth. Sorry we won't be back.
Small eatery offering delicious, home-cooked styled Japanese meals and dishes. Prices are reasonable. Just that waiting time can be a bit long during meal times

Excellent no-fuss affordable Japanese food in a homely setting. I love the dashi stock being used and the miso soup was not overly salty, yet very flavourful.

Lower Pierce reservoir is round the corner; very scenic, plenty of monkeys and good for a stroll albeit very humid.

It was full house when I was there. Will visit again.

My family has been coming to this restaurant for more than 10 years. This evening was the first time we had a very disappointing dinner. Quality of food has dropped a lot. Even hot tea wasn't hot. May not go back again.

Waited for some time before food was served though there were only about 3 tables. We waited about 25 minutes for our food.  Staff was not attentive to customer's needs. Was busier on phone . Food was not up to expectation.  V disappointing with the food standard.  I used to patronise their shop fee years back regularly.  After pandemic,  food quality dropped tremendously.

It was not a pleasant experience.  The sushi was soggy. The rice had the texture of porridge.  It tasted like the sushi was frozen and then defrosted in the microwave.  The staff was unpleasant and did not seem to care very much. One of the male staff who looks like the owner/manager walked in and out of the kitchen without a mask.  We will not come back.
Today's tempura Don was excellent. Perfectly done. However the miso soup was bland, couldn't taste the miso at all!. Dish cannot order take away, as it will be soggy.

Was around the corner so came to try out this place based on the good reviews on Google. Like most reviewers mentioned, this restaurant really does give a homely vibe. Ordered a bento set (recommended by staff) and a katsu curry don. Bento set of  $15.80 is really value for money as there was 8 dishes in a bento box. Curry was really good but katsu was too tough. Almost 5 stars, but we waited 20-30mins for 2 packets of takeaway so minus 1 star.
A nice and homey little restaurant. Food here is delicious but sadly some or the item on the menu is perpetually unavailable. Will be back again if we are in the neighborhood

Nice cosy place for a peaceful weekday lunch. My first time here, further down from the famous prata shop. A very low key shop front. I nearly missed it. I went on a Wednesday afternoon. Parked at the public carpark nearby.  The place is cosy and comfortable. Nothing fancy, very homely ambience. Ordered the Wednesday special bento set. Portion is big. Comes with a big pot of tea. The sashimi is very fresh. I love the miso soup. Rice is sushi rice. Overall, I like this place , good food, reasonable price. Will bring my family for dinner some day

Don't expect restaurant fare, in fact, Tamako's greatest selling point is the very heart-warming, homely meal you can't help but get addicted to.

Cozy place but still spacious: Portions are quite generous and doesn't really break the bank. 9/10 for me with the missing point easily gained if you request for the sides to be served separately.

Will be back!

Casual dinner with a couple of friends.
Had the teppanyaki beef set (changed rice to garlic fried rice), chicken chahan, mentaiko okonomiyaki, koebi and a few more dishes like salmon sashimi and sushi. Happy that we're able to order from sister restaurant Tamako Meal!

Price very reasonable, friendly staff, 10/10 will come again 👏🏻

P.s. parking might be hard over the weekends.

Again I got tricked by google reviews. 4.3 stars erm no! We came with full excitement after reading the reviews plus hungry stomachs we were looking forward for this meal, we came on dec 25 evening, the woman cashier is clearly unfriendly. Quite grumpy and irritated, heard her screamed loudly at kitchen for every order and checking if food is done, it's really not a good feeling having someone screaming/yelling near you while having your food from beginning till the end. Plus when i asked her a question about the food in the menu, she seemed to be unhappy.

I got a mother and child don, chicken isn’t fresh and has a strong chicken smell. And a unagi don isn’t good as well a strong smell of soil. Bloated after eating their food.

The food in don donki at harbour front tasted a ton better, I seriously doubt the reviews here, is this 5 star food?

Home-cooked Japanese food that’s easy on the wallet!

Paired udon with karaage and katsu curry.. ooh yummy. Simple meal but satisfying!

Your friendly neighbourhood Japanese eatery that's oozing with simplicity and charm. Don't expect any fancy games, it's just pure straight home cooked style Japanese food that's decent and economical. 98% of the dishes in the menu are below $20. Can't get better value that that surely, especially when this is not one of your usual hawker stall.
Again, the food's quality is decent and service is good too. Believe it or not , the chef cooking your Japanese meal is actually an Indian chap (see pict). How diverse and inclusive is that! 😁😋 3.5 stars.
Been around for as long as I remembered. For when you just want a quick fuss free home styled prepared 'Japanese' meal. Not cheap, but still nonetheless pretty reasonable.
Nice cosy Japanese style family restaurant.

Our family go to place. Great A5 wagyu steak and the fried rice, on top of our usual order of kawa. Next time , I would like to try A5 wagyu shabu shabu or sukiyaki with our usual with the sake..Look forward to this.....
Homely and affordable. Reached at about 1+ close to 2pm and they still allowed us to order even though they close at 2.30pm. Can change udon to buckwheat noodles. Also called Sanpachiro

Great service staff and the food is affordable and tasty. I come here often for my meal. It could be quite pack during the weekend. I order the daily set meal which I find it very tasty. The unagi fish very done perfectly. The prawn roll was nicely done too. The potato salad was crisp in taste. The mini octupus was not quite good though. It comes in big size which does not match the tiny name given. Overall I still love this restaurant.
Tamako is run the way a warm-hearted Japanese mom would: with simple, authentic dishes. Really enjoyed the Hokkaido grilled squid and unagi sushi.

I doubt the authenticity of this Japanese place but this have not stopped me from coming here over the past 10 years. I like the simplicity of their food and warm vibe of the place itself. My absolute favourite is their Zaru soba which is seemingly simple but deceivingly delicious. Go for their kani mayo sushi too with 2 big generous servings of crabmeat mayo at just a few dollars.
I never leave this place feeling dissatisfied.
Great service, sushi is fresh. Menu options are good. My frequent haunt.

Been passing by this restaurant for many times but never stepped into it.
Today's my 1st and definitely will not be my last.
Authentic tasty homely Japanese food. Ordered a salmon bento + grilled squid + udon.
The food isn't salty. We love the grilled squid. It is soooooo good. Highly recommended dish.
The portion of bento and udon is satisfying.

Location: Nestled between some high profile eateries, so you won't miss it. You may find it hard to find parking space during peak hrs, so come early to avoid the stress.

Menu: A decent variety of japanese food, whipped up by a legitimate Japanese chef. You can read abt the history of the shop on the menu itself. Have attached some images for reference.

Waiting Time: Approximately 15 to 20 mins during peak hrs.

Quality of Food: Homemade, heartwarming Japanese food. Decent considering the price factor! Delicious.

Overall: Value for money Jap food that is worth coming for.

it would be an understatement to say this place is the best place for authentic, cheap and absolutely, mind blowing Japanese food. the staff here are world class and the decor feels comfortable yet not overwhelmingly upscale. the place is kept spotless and well mantained. the restaurant itself is joined with another right beside it essentially doubling the menu and giving you the option of grilled yakitori or udon, ramen soba and Don and much much more signature drinks and side dishes. would give 6 stars if I could. 11/10

Unpretentious and good Japanese food located in a quaint estate along Upper Thomson road.

I've exclusively ordered the katsu-don here many times and have always been satisfied by it. The flavor reminds me of what I used to have about 10 years ago as a kid which I distinctly remember the taste of but could never find it again until here (cue the ratatouille flashback scene). The tender tonkatsu soaked through with delicious dashi stock and the egg cooked just to the right doneness to coat every mouthful of rice with egg and dashi sauce.

What you'll expect here is homely, good food with no fuss at a reasonable price tag. I cannot recommend it enough.

If you’re looking for a simple, honest Japanese style cuisine, and you’re nearby, Tamako is a no brainer.

You get this feeling that families frequent this place, which says a lot about the affordability and accessibility of the food. We ordered a don, and various side dishes; I recommend the home made potato salad and the croquette.

The oyako don we had was sumptuous and filling; the egg was both runny and had texture at the same time.
Old school Japanese home cook feel. I've been having their curry rice for the past 20 odd years. Their grilled salmon taste great too..!!

Splendid,the experience I had in this store is perfect.The service is commendable,the food was good,pricing was affordable,and the people there were very proactive,Everytime I finished my drink,they would immediately refill it regardless of iced or hot.In a nutshell,I am extremely satisfied with this store and will definitely come again.

Homely food, friendly owner, great prices! Love their very reasonably priced teishoku sets which allows me to savour so many things at once - on top of the main item of your choice, you also get nikujaga (my comfort food!), potato salad, ebi fry, gyoza, chicken karaage, edamame. Only downside is limited parking spaces nearby during peak periods.

Made reservation. Double confirmed my reservation when asked again.
Arrived at tamako and was informed that "we are full". When asked for waiting time, "must wait for tables". So, what's the point for double confirmation of this reservation with no tables??
Tamako has become Cannotgo. Even waiter went to hide inside the cashier.
Affordable and good quality Japanese food.  I like the service where they provide free flow of hot tea.

We had these and then some!

10/10 would return!

Awesome service and ambience as well!
Great array of selection for sake lovers too!
Homely food options. Noodles like soba, ramen or rice bowls are available. Our dons came with miso soup.

Food served cold during weekday lunch . Waited for long time to be served lunch.
Service was bad with staff more interested in their phone than customers.
Service was bad.
Food quality deteriorated .

We tried the following:
》Butashoga Ramen | Their signature shio-tonkotsu broth topped with hand-pulled pork sautéed in a sweet soy sauce and ginger was absolutely delish, I totally understand now why it's one of their bestsellers. The balanced flavours coming from the rich soup, saucy meat, sweetness from the braised bamboo shoots and green scallions was delightful.

》Miso Ramen | Such a hearty ramen which was infused with a generous amount of roasted Hokkaido red miso tonkotsu soup base, perfectly paired with the various toppings of sweet corn, slow-braised chashu pork slices, thinly sliced green scallions and beansprouts. The robust medley of flavours were simply delectable.

》Takoyaki | These Octopus Balls had a pillowy filling complimented by the mayonnaise, Japanese BBQ sauce and seaweed toppings. I took a mouthful and the flavours just bursted in my mouth, so addictive.

》Deep Fried Gyoza | Crispy deep-fried dumplings which had a substantial amount of chicken/veggie filling.

》Chilli Crab Matcha Macchiato with Fresh Milk (New) | Being adventurous at heart, I instantly knew that I had to give this one a go once I saw it on the menu. It was quite (weird) unique and certainly not for the faint-hearted! Try it for yourselves if you're brave enough like me ~

Good location, ample carpark. Small eatery, be prepared to queue. Wonderful aroma while waiting helps to whip up appetite. 24 hours. You have traditional pork ramen of choice or singapore inspired flavours like chilli crab, salted egg yolk and bubble tea.

Good place for your cravings quick fix.

Wow very nice. Authentic taste at 3am. Got the Takagi ramen. Close to Tonkotsu. Very nice broth. Chashu a bit thin like ham, but for $6 how to complain. Super value.

Venue a bit tight but ok. If you go late the tray collector thing gets filled so old soup bowls overflowing.

Got ePay but nets only. Parking’s a bit far unless gamble right up front.

The menu here is quite extensive with lots of variants and the flagship Butashoga is a pretty good at such a low price-point. Sadly, the other ramen we tried was a flop and the extra sides we had are pretty run-of-the-mill fried food. But nonetheless, at the rate they “Kanzen”, we are sure to be back again to try their other ramen.

The ramen at Takagi are very affordable for the average Singaporean. Craving for some spiciness, we ordered the Karaka and their seasonal Chilli Crab Ramen.

Initially I thought how spicy can Japanese Ramen get, right? Then I realise I was wrong. The spicy ramen here at Takagi are really spicy. I enjoyed both the flavourful ramen especially that Ajitama Egg that is done well with runny egg yolk.

We also ordered the Nori Tempura with Truffle Mayo and their most popular Deep Fried Gyoza. Love the crispiness in both the side dish that added a crunch to our meals.

I see the comments are positive, but I don't think so!
Bad attitude of the staff!
I ordered with extra noodles, but the staff forgot to add noodles for me, So I went to Ramen Station ask for extra noodles with the staff, When I asked the staff,he was quite , when I asked again he threw the noodles in front of me!
Felt like I owed him money or killed his family!!!😡😡
Restaurant was very small , All is self collect self service .
Food was normal,but is cheaper.

I find this place good and cheap.
Order the truffle Ramen the taste not that much of truffle but it's smell incredible for that price below 10 leh.
And the karage also combo with drinks.
It's cheap and also very delicious at the price of such.
Highly recommend it!
The place also seating now due to covid.

The only ramen place that you can get free Raman and additional raman for 0.50. The Raman is worth the money generous portions of the char siew. First time eat Raman and had trouble finishing the meat. They having a promotion 1 for 1 for student and the tako ball is really nice and the taro drinks with the Pearl taste great and refreshing.

Love the value the owner is giving. nowdays hawker food can cost even more than takagi.
Decent ramen at much more affordable prices. They also give the additional noodles.  Good service. Can save time by ordering online then collect at store.
My waitress, Peggy was very friendly and helpful. She took good care if us. The food was very good and freshly made. Great place to eat ramen. Highly recommended.

Limited seats ramen served warm not hot at all Self pick up and even condiments just grab as u wish as the condiments fill up to only 1/4 of it waste of container. And no Hygiene put in place when they won't notice if I throw back any unused condiments after I took them out for says 45min. But staff was good tho will give it a 3 for that. Not recommended for anyone who loves their ramen to be served Hot.

Food was decent. But there was a fight among the staff during peak period lunch time. Fighting was pretty loud. Partly due to the overwhelming orders both walk-in customers and food delivery orders.

The worst part was that I overheard the kitchen staff telling one of the staff to inform the customer to get their food while calling the customers 白痴 (idiots).

Note: it’s a self service restaurant which people might not know and the self service counter is all the way at the back.

This incident occurred on Sunday, 10/04/2022,  1.45pm.

Cheap and affordable and taste good as well. Don’t recommend the bubble tea though - taste weird.

For delivery, please be aware that the restaurant will take way longer to deliver than whatever is stated in the app. I took them an additional hour to deliver my food!

Visited this outlet yesterday to try their ramen. The prices are really more affordable than usual ramen restaurants. Generous portions given for all noodles and free extra noodles too!

The broth is not bad, not too oily imho while the char shu is average, although they do put in a lot of pieces :)

Splendid, 24 Hours, customers queuing and best of it is I work here ! Just joking

( Hi owner, my just joking means That the outlet is popular because of Me working there, sorry for the confusion )

Anyway one if your staffs, which I can said is my colleague, Named David is a very cool and nice guy. No bossing around, no putting on airs, very patient with me and understanding too. He's a great guy.

We Tagaki Ramen at AMK is Hydeine 1st.

Best ramen! Authentic Japanese ramen with rich broth and generous servings. Free x1 serving of noodle but I think it’s not needed as they already gave a generous portion of noodle in the soup. Highly recommend and will definitely come again!
Served by Auntie Peggy, friendly staff. Free additional ramen per order, i finished all as it is yummy. Affordable price.
Ordered self pick-up through Grabfood and the items were packed nicely. Noodles were ok and sufficient to fill me up. The price is quite reasonable for the quality.

Located right behind the S11 outside of AMK Hub. The stall is fairly sized to accommodate for 7 tables of diners, orders are processed quickly too despite the vast amount of delivery order the store has.

Do note that the ramen does not comes with egg by default, it will be available as a $1 top up. Broth is not overly oily and noodles are al dante. Nothing spectacular over the ramen but it serves its purpose to satisfy your ramen cravings.

Bonus: Noodle upsize is available for free!

Finally got to try the legendary 24h ramen raved about by Steven Lim korkor and it was top tier…on the list of most mediocre fast food style ramen. We got the karakamen + egg + cha shu and it was most certainly a hearty supper. I like that the cha shu slices are thin and relatively tender, though you’ll have to soak the extra pieces in the broth for a while to get some added flavor.

Cheap and delicious!! The space is a little bit small so if coming in group of more than 2 person, high chance will have to wait a while as there are limited seats for bigger groups , but the staffs are super friendly and nice!

Their ice flavoured tea is good, along with the Pearl, which is probably better than the ones at Koi HAHAHA

Auntie Peggy was super friendly and she was mindful that my children and I was standing in the sun while queueing got a table. She showed us to an area under the shade outside while looking out for a table for us..her service is tip top and food was sumptuous and value for money!! This is our first time trying after seeing long queue outside always..we’ll come back again! Thank you Auntie Peggy!

Pretty decent tongkotsu and miso ramen! The free ramen noodles top up comes in a huge portion. Knocked one star off cos personally I found the soup on the saltier side. Otherwise glad to have found a 24H ramen place!
Lovely food , only down side is that the place is very tiny.  Had to squeeze when someone walks past

Had late lunch here with my boyfriend and was pleasantly surprised to be served by Peggy, a very chirpy staff :) she ensured we had seats and checked in on us from time to time if we needed anything. Kudos to the team's training and upholding standards to good customer service

Ordered from Foodpanda a couple of times. Loving the environmental conscious packaging! and the cute little sincere note with every order, really brings up the positive experience with the brand! Not the most amazing ramen, but it's half the price and the service is awesome so heck yeah I'll support!

Tantanmen is nice, tastes more like Chinese cuisine instead of Japanese Ramen though
Takagi Ramen is also nice, quite thick broth, flavourful
Gyoza and Takoyaki is average, don't feel like it's worth the price
Matcha Latte is tasting close to Starbucks'

So why the missing 2 stars?
For starter, there are fly fly throughout our meal
Then, I saw a drop of 💧 attacking my Gyoza!! When I look up, yes indeed the Airconditioner is there...
So yea, the 2 missing stars are due to the environment, very bad, I'd be trying other outlets for the ramen, but not this outlet, scared liao 😆

I mean..., such a waste to lose points in environment..., maybe some renovations should take place 🤔

Despite the 10 min wait to eat during lunch hour, we were well attended to by Peggy. She offered to have my son stand in the restaurant area as it was really hot outside and gave him tissue to wipe his sweat. It might look like a 2 star eatery with 5 star level of warmth and hospitality.
Delicious ramen and rice chashu pork service 24hr good for everyone who live in night or day
Was at AMK outlet, no frills ramen at heartland prices. Served by friendly staff Peggy!

Huge thank you to Mr Johnny! He is so helpful, my bubble tea was not sweet and he help me to add syrups a few time without complaining! He also explain to me about the different soup base as the kiosk did not mentioned the soup base! Thank you to such helpful Mr Johnny service crew
Peggy was very professional and went above and beyond in her service. Hope to see her again on my next visit!

Aunty peggy @ the yishun outlet is very friendly. Nice n cheap ramen fix. Clean store too.
Will visit again.

Peggy at AMK outlet is a very friendly and cheerful staff as she make our food easy to order and a wonderful place to dine in at. A valuable staff an asset to the management considering her age as she no signs of ageing and in very good health. Kudos to her for giving us for such a warm reception!!! 👏👏👏😀

Oh!So Im not the first one to complain for tonight?
Yea!Your shop has the worst type of system ever!
I advise my customer to cancel after explaining the situation.the customer even gave me a thumbs up and agree to cancel.If not I think I will wait for 2hrs tonight and miss all my other earnings.

If you have only a few staff,remember! Customers in your shop are your priority!Not deliveries!Understand so far!?
Your shop already is so so so small,delivery riders like us crowding at the collection area you think is a good scene?

Use your brain Use your brain!

5 stars for the yummy food and the value for money
1 star for the very very very long wait.
Went at off peak timing at 5pm. Place was relatively empty but due to numerous super huge delivery order, had to wait almost 25 to 30 min for food

So average out to a 3 stars here.
My daughters and I enjoyed the breakfast selection which are suitable for Sunday morning brunch. The service was quick and friendly. Peggy was particularly helpful 👍

It’s been an hour since i placed my order for delivery and even the delivery guy waited at the restaurant for more than half an hour… the restaurant is STILL preparing and pushing back the delivery time. Assuming it is expedited right as I type this review, it would have reached me more than 90min since I placed the order. When my delivery arrive, the delivery man also say it wasn’t busy and they must have missed out the order. Yet they denied. Worst late night meal ever. Avoid ordering at all cost!

Food quality not bad for the price but the soup is not flavourful enough. Bad service. I asked for help as it’s my first time. The staff only pointed the ordering machine to me and did not inform me that I have to collect my drink at separate counter. When I collected my ramen, I asked where’s my tea, then the kitchen staff shouted loudly telling me to go collect from the front. They shouted as if it’s my fault for not knowing and they did not say clearly which part of the “front”! During my short meal there, I witnessed same treatment was given to another customer. Such horrible service!
Came around 1.30pm not much queue. The spicy ramen is spicy enough but if you are hungry recommend to add extra noodles. Staff very helpful -asked for more spring onions and got them

I have to say that I really enjoyed the ramen at this little joint Takagi. Expect to wait as it’s a small place. I ordered the tantanramen with extra spicy, which is really delicious. Even the gyoza was tasty. The experience was like one of those little eateries in Japan and you have to order through the machine at the entrance. Will definitely come back again when I have ramen craving at anytime as this place opens 24 hours!

Service was good but what disappoint me is the dish. When the noodles are served, the soup was already cold where it make me loose appetite when i’m adding the additional noodle as it became hard and cold. This only happened today. Previously when I visited the shop, the dishes were served hot.
Well priced for what you get. However, noodles were a tad mushy. Soup is decent!
The weather was hot but peggy was so friendly. She catered to the queue outside while even helping to take drinks for the people sitting. Wonderful service!

Definitely affordable.  I think portion is just right.. they have self order kisok at the entrance.. the only thing is instructions were not clear that there is drink collection and food collection counters. May be hard for first timers to self figure out.

Peggy  is very friendly n helpful, got us a seat pretty quick even though the place is already pretty packed. We’ll come back again for sure because of her.

Thank you

Lintdh was extremely helpful, friendly and service oriented to make you feel comfortable and at home while eating the delicious ramen although she was busy serving, clearing, cleaning and packing the food deliveries. Her smile could be seen through the mask. Great service!

Hidden at a popular heartland area, this gem definitely serve up a good bowl of ramen. Broth are fantastic but the noodles are a little lacking. The convenient location pretty much makes up for it though!

Would have given it 5 star if their self ordering kiosk accepts credit card as a payment method.

Enjoyed the affordably priced meal and sides. I also appreciate the self ordering machine that mimics the Japanese style.

Place is a bit cramped though, and the table looks like it can fit at most 4 people.

Ordered via Grabfood and was rather disappointed overall.  It's a place for affordable, alright food but avoid the drinks.

Good
+ Affordable
+ Rather eco-friendly package
+ Appreciate thought towards packaging food and drink items properly - the noodles came in a presentable manner and even tho the drink spilled, I saw that the restaurant already used tape to tape down the cup cover to try and avoid that

Bad
- The drinks were not cheap and tasted really bad. The matcha latte cost 3.6 on Grabfood after discount but tasted like sugar water with some artifical matcha taste. Tastes like a diluted + sweetened version of those 3-in-1 matcha latte mix you can find in supermarkets, definitely not worth a few dollars
- Got the "melon milk" buddy set on Grabfood and the melon milk also tastes diluted and artificial

Ordered the beef curry and the fried chicken on grab. The food was ok at best and the rice was a bit too wet and mushy for my liking. Would prefer for them to separate the curry from the rice so the rice won’t soak up the curry.

Need a quick dinner so decided to settle it here. Used Burpple 1-for-1 deal so it is very affordable.

Ordered Katsu Chicken don and Tempura don. Each set came with a miso soup. Miso flavour is not very strong.

The tempura did not come with a dipping sauce which is a bit disappointing. Katsu Chicken was acceptable.

The stall presentation was interesting and fascinating. I was drawn into the stall and made an order here. Wanted to try their wagyu or curry but I know my son won't eat those instead I got ebi tempura. It wasn't the same as donburi at other stall. It came with sweet potato tempura as well. The egg was nicely shaped and looking nice.

Didn't manage to try the ebi cause my son took them all. I will come again to try their other dishes.

Ratings
Pricing : reasonable - not cheap . Day light robbery
Service : average

Food : rice is mushy and seem to drop the standard . Food Was better when first open
Environment : coffeeshop
Delivery : average
Covid measures : ok
Pet friendly ❌🐶🐾

Seems like many bad reviews.  I ate once at the stall and do a take out once.

Eating there is perfect. Waiting time was acceptable. maybe about 5-10min? Food served warm, condiments was all at the side table. Chilli powder, wasabi and soy sauce. Egg onsen was ok, beef was good as this is a coffee shop. Agree is more expensive but Wagyu beef and it tasted good. I don't mind paying for it..

For take out, it dries out a little for the rice but thats acceptable.  They gave me soup also. Packaging was good. No leakage.

I have to say the food here is super inconsistent.

My first time ordering:
Got their beef donburi with broccoli, salmon Miso soup and mentaiko sauce.
Beef was good as it had flavourful and wasn't too dry. Broccoli we're kinda disappointing as it was just plain broccoli boiled in water and there were only 2 pieces. For the salmon Miso soup, it tasted good without being overly salty. Mentaiko sauce is spicier that your regular mentaiko and somehow the mentaiko is milder.
Overall I enjoyed my meal and this taste better than Yoshinoya if you need comparison. I also like how their portion is slightly larger.

Update: I ordered another 3 more times from them so a total of 4 times on 4 different days.

For my 2nd order I was super impressed. They added more seaweed to their don And the flavours were good. Only sad thing was the onsen egg with the broken yolk. But other than that it was a wonderful meal.

For my 3rd order, it was HORRIBLE, just look at the pictures attached. The rice was just lump together and mushy. How could they actually serve such rice to their customers? The boiled egg though perfectly cooked was just roughly handle, look at the broken egg white. For the protein this time, I got their wagyu flank beef and boy was that a mistake. Tough, flavourless piece of meat with some parts having some black pepper taste. For the price I was charged, I am SUPER DISAPPOINTED with this meal

For my 4th order which was during the week dine-in was allowed, I decided to give them another chance. Let me say I TOTALLY regretted my choice. Rice was AGAIN lumpy and mushy but this time it wasn't that bad only like 1/2 of the rice had this issue. This was during dinner time. What is wrong with them? Can't they even get the basic right anymore? Also I got the SALMON soup which this time apparently didn't contain any SALMON. Instead, was replaced with a small cube of tofu and a lot of kelp.

Hope they can really look into it and be consistent in their execution. My first 2 experience were great but the 3rd one and 4th just left be disappointed. Honestly if that was the first bowl that I had, I would have never chosen to order from them ever again. I don't know if their standards are dropping or if I'm ordering at very bad timings.

Value for $ deal, 2 x Unagi for $18.

Taste wise pretty ok, rice was ok. The Unagi lacked the sauce the gives the flavor but nonetheless it wasn't dry and meat was tender.
Not the cheapest donburi but the portion is larger than most and tastes similar to some restaurant chains. Plus point for being halal

Ordered the saba fish don and it comes with complementary salad and miso soup.

Fish is a lil too light in terms of flavor. Could’ve been crispier on the skin and marinated more.

Tried out the Wagyu Don but was utterly dissapointed. Presentation was well but the beef was hard and tasted gamey probably not removing the enough blood from the meat or not well marinated.

Same as what other reviewer said, I'm giving 2 stars for the sake of the stall is Halal which is rare to find one in a food stall environment.

Uncooked and dry rice. Not even sure if Japanese rice was used. Terrible pre cooked fried chicken which is cold. Beef has no sauce this dry . Please don’t waste your money. I want to put zero stars… because was deceived my the Japanese chef’s poster so gave it a try.

Ordered Chicken Katsu w/ Curry Sauce Donburi.

Katsu: Quite nice
Curry: Decent
Rice: Decent
Price: A bit on the high side

Ordered on Deliveroo and the food is great! Amazing quality for a coffeeshop Japanese joint. Will have to try them out on-site!

—— Added new pics from meals on-site!

Wagyu beef is blend and tough. Rather pay extra to buy from Waacow. Or downgrade to buy beef bowl from tasty street Pasir Ris. Looks good but don't taste nice. Would give 1 star but added 1 more as it is Halal (hard to find halal donburi)

This is a hidden gem in AMK coffee shop!
Nice japanese food with restaurant standard but in affordable price. You can mix and match your favourite set with the sauces based on your preference.
I tried Chicken Katsu and Saba, both are delicious! The portion is also wuite large. I love their Salom Miso Soup too!
Overall worth giving 5 stars 👍🏻
Prawns not clean properly before cooking. Disgusting. Will never come here again. Awful taste

Delicious. Can custom your own donburi, choose your main, rice/noodles, sides and sauce. Ordered Saba fish donburi. Very nice. Comes with free salmon soup. Salmon soup is also very nice. Will come back again. 😋

If there is a choice I will put ZERO STAR. I am Utterly disappointed with the food. Its so bad that this is my first time reviewing about food.

Upon collecting my way Signature Wagyu Flank Donburi. To my surprise I saw the beef looks like well done. The person in charge mentioned that the beef is like that don't bother seeing the picture as it's illustrated and he quoted 'this is OUR standard'!!!!!

The beef was dry and tough, the rice was too dry and it cost $17. Its my WORST experience.. its so bad that I have no words to for it. I went to ask around and many had experience it too. SO Please don't go through this terrible experience!! And learned from our mistake..

Ps. Do not be fool by their Head and Master chef marketing!!
Just found out this halal restaurant  recently & ordered through grab. It serves salmon & unagi meals !! Hard to find halal food that sell this kind of meals.  👍👍  love the sauce too!

Ordered Mentai Salmon Don, chicken katsu curry sauce don and tempura platter.
Salmon tasted like it has been boiled then pan fried.
The batter of the tempura platter is extremely hard and the prawn is slipping away when you take a bite. It is as though they fried it when the prawn is frozen.
The chicken katsu curry sauce don is average. Not worth the price at all
Tried the signature wagyu steak and it is quite dissapointed. Meat is a bit tough and need more seasoning. Rice is too much.

Mentaiko Salmon Don is terrible taste. Overpriced too.. if taste is good then price will be acceptable. But taste is low quality, no standard. Mentaiko sauce like machiam mayonnaise. Don't waste your time ordering Mentai Salmon Don. Add mentai sauce (mayonnaise taste) for $2 not worth it also. It would be ok if the taste is good. Unagi is decent and taste good for $12. Recommend to go shopping mall eat better, aircon, cheaper, taste better. Only wanted to support local but the result is disappointing. Enjoy your meal. STAY away from their fake "mentai sauce'

Was worried after seeing their recent reviews on Google but was very satisfied after ordering 2 times,

Taste : 9/10
Appearance : 10/10

One of the best Japanese delivery on grab💪

Excellent food! Menu is extensive and seasonal to a particularly high standard of Halal Donburi. Definitely fine dining bought into hawker centre atmosphere 😂 It can be expensive but worth it and they do different deals on different delivery platform and they even have Burpple (1-for-1). I have purchased from them through Foodpanda and they got like 50% OFF so it’s worth checking them out before you order your donburi. You could save alot! Highly recommended.
The portion is quite small and it was about 10 dollars for a curry don which is overpriced and the food was not that impressive.It is halal.

$8 is pretty value for money as you can add 2 sides.
I had the curry don. The curry was a little less unfortunately, but the meat was thick and tasty.
Will return for more.
Ordered the wagyu flank for $17. Portion and taste  mediocre. Sweet potato tempura was poor. Potato salad was ok. Not worth the money or time.
One of the worst beef donburi I had. The sauce was bad, beef was bland. Will not be back.
used to be good when it started out. karaage is crispy and the cutlet is piping hot. but my last order were neither of it. suspect they prefry and left it there sitting
Located in Food Loft @ Blk 721 AMK Ave 8 (Beside Djitsun Mall). Nice Muslim-friendly (no pork no lard) donburi in AMK. Tried the flanked wagyu don – not bad!
Super legit halal donburi. Tried the unagi tamago, as well as their miso soup. Yum.

amazing gyudon soaked in oil.... how does anyone deserved to be served this? this is not how gyudon is served in japan either.
hoping this is a mistake, may try again but can’t say I want to for S$11.
Avoid ordering from them at all cost. The delivery time just keeps on delaying.
New Japanese food stall tucked in a corner of coffeeshop. Their food is nice. Average $8 to $9 per person. You can choose two sides and either rice or noodles to go along with the food.
Top notch halal Japanese stall in Ang Mo Kio. Quality ingredients and tasty food
Food is ok but I have ordered Grab delivery from them twice and they forgot the soup both times. Unbelievable.
V good!
Do check your order before taking away.. they gave the wrong order and the whole bowl no1 eat. What a waste of food.. not everyone loves truffles..
Don is really nice but rice was a bit undercooked
Fast aervice, and friendly chef.

Order their Teriyaki chicken set. Quite disappointed. The set don't even come with a bowl of miso soup.
Teriyaki sauce too sweet. Sliced cabbage potion is miserable.
Long queue, its because one man operation.
Overrated, not really worth it.
Went around lunchtime on weekday. The queue is long, waiting time about 30min. Ordered the chicken teriyaki bento set. The chicken teriyaki is nice. Priced at 4.50.

Have been a regular devotee of their tempura set for the past 5 years. It's basically sushi teh quality at hawker center prices. So  reasonably priced that you can patronize every day. The boss is very hard-working and friendly don't be taken aback when he talks loud because the environment is noisy. I also recommend their salmon dishes which are very popular. Do visit early as there will be a take out queue that form during peak hours. Highly recommended and a culinary gem that showcase the best of Japanese food at down to earth pricing. 💎

Standards dropped a lot, and I mean a lot. Ordered chicken don earlier for lunch, waited for more than half an hour, yet rice is not fully cooked, chicken is either not fresh or not defrost well. Awful experience and probably not in my lunch list moving forward.

Tried the salmon bento and fish bento. The sheer length of the salmon slice is impressive, and while the regular fish looks slightly more modest, both of them tasted fresh, flavourful, while not being too salty. The amount of fish to rice ratio was great. The tempura carrot was still crispy at the end of my meal and the soup also wasn't too salty or diluted. Probably the best Japanese food I've tried, especially at this very affordable price point of $10.50 for two bentos. Highly recommend.

“Restaurant standard Hawker price” is what you will find on their signboard instead of Konomi Zen which is not reflected.

Past them by so many times but never bothered to try so today finally ordered their Teriyaki chicken set.
It’s lunch time there’s not much of a Q, but the customer flow is quite consistent.

The boss/Chef has an aura about him, feels like he was the head chef of some high end Japanese Omakase restaurant.
Back to their teriyaki chicken set. At $4.50 it is quite a steal if u compare it with Sakae Shushi.

I believe they use calrose rice (short grain type), it was a bit dry.
The chicken itself was oki, but becomes an impact when u eat it with their panko
Came with a fried sweet potato which was fantastic.

Overall it’s an oki but affordable Japanese lunch.

Food wise, value for money. But one thing I never like about this stall is, the queueing system. No one bothers to organise the queue. Sometimes when you stand there, you don't know if the person in front has ordered or not. And the owner and assistant don't care. When you try to order through the assistant, he will tell you chef will take order from you and hack care. I never like this type of disorganised queue system. If not for my kids, I won't bother patronising.

Delightful Experience To Your Tastebud and Pocket. Try The upgrade ($1) from Donburi To Bento Set

Teriyaki Chicken Donburi 4* - Decent portion of chicken meat with tasty teriyaki sauce. Though chicken texture can be more tender. Goes well with the rice.

Bento Set 4* - 1 well fried carrot tempura, small portion salad in Mayonnaise and a bowl of hot, well flavored savory miso soup. Crispy fried tempura batter (yummy with teriyaki sauce) was given for my teriyaki bento set.

Value for $$ + 0.5*

The stall name is not prominent, so if you miss it just look for stall number #01-59.
I ordered the teriyaki chicken bento for $4.50, very reasonable priced for  Japanese food. The teriyaki chicken pieces rested on a bed of tempura crispy flour with drizzled sauce, chicken taste soft and nice but to me is not marinated enough. The rice is probably Thai rice version with salad and a bowl of soup. The surprise touch was the freshly fried tempura carrot slide, nice and crispy!

I walk to the next aisle to finished off my lunch with local cold grass jelly with sea coconut dessert, yum!

Pros: Prices are okay but by no means cheap.
Cons: Quality is average, the salmon I ordered was burnt. The service and waiting time were terrible. I waited 30 mins for just one salmon don and they asked me for my order 3 times.

I like the Japanese food as it is affordable and value for money. I had rice, sweet potatoes tampora, salad, tariyaki   chicken and miso soup. Many people queue up to buy back or eat there. I tried a few times before I got to try it. Sometimes they don't open. People are enjoying it happily.
very good salmon. seems everyone in Q ordered this.  Ebi was nice. hwr Q needs 20-30min during lunch hr.

A cozy little restaurant along Thomson! The price is pretty affordable for all items on the menu itself! It also has a very homely feel to the restaurant itself which sets it apart from other Japanese restaurants you find outside! Food is good too! Recommended!
Truly restaurant standard hawker price. The salmon so big I was surprised it's only $6 per set. And it's delicious too.
Taste and portion size is decent considering the price. Most of the food are cooked on the spot. Stall owner is friendly and will address you as bro or sis regardless of your age.
Good Japanese food at a hawker centre! Their signature salmon set gives u a large piece of salmon fillet and love the tempura there!
Looked busy. Unfortunately I didn't get to buy as they don't have enough rice. I was there around 6pm so maybe end of day already to the stall.
Quite fast despite the longer qyeue. Fish is fresh and tasty. Had wanted to try the tempura but had to wait 30 minutes. Shows he cooks it fresh.
Cheap and good economics price for a cheap Japanese meal. Taste is as good as a home cook meal.
The best affordable Japanese cuisine ever! Tempura here is pure perfection.
This is the worse Japanese food stall ever ..lots of msg .. total failure . Pls don’t TRY.
Economical Japanese food.
Good and affordable Japanese Bento, Ramen,Soba and Don.
Go for the salmon bento. Best value for money and taste.
no queue but forgot my food. checked with them and the guy cooking shouted at me. gangster behavior.
The teriyaki chicken don and unagi don are the more popular items here.
Cheap and good Japanese food
Crunchy tempura esp the vegetables
Delicious
Freshly cooked

Fast food quality. Instant Soup is cold. Beer is good. Speed cooking and speed eating training required. The seating is top notch like an aircraft cockpit. An one time affair. How to rate the food when we cook ourselves? 🤔
Enjoyed the concept of solo BBQ! It can really be done within an hour! The portion is just right for me. Choice of sauces were good. Didn’t have a long wait on PH lunch time~ will go back again

A neighborhood joint to get a quick yakiniku fix. Food wise is alright I guess. Price to portion rato is on the higher side. Service was ok. Expect to queue during peak periods; but the online queue number service was neat. While I think the quality of the standard meat selections was fair, the premium selection touted as A5 was below expectations. There was a wide variety of condiments for the choosing. Drinks were served right out of their commercial bottles. The interior is rather cramped and quite hot, thus not a place you would want to be in other than to eat and go. The relatively short timing (yes there is a dining window) also made the whole experience feel a little rushed. Do note that the buzzer doesn't ring and just vibrates. For a while I thought there were some renovations going on only to realize it was the buzzer all along, LOL. Parking is plenty in the Hub itself.

No frills yakiniku outlet at AMK hub. Our first visit here. Jun Ming was patient enough to explain how the restaurant works (different from Suntec) and introduce us their seasonal menu (Hokkaido pork) which is a must-try.

Even though queue was pretty long, it was moving along just fine. We had a great dinner and would be back again in the future. 🙂

Interesting concept but quite pricey given that everything is self-service. Meat variations offered in menu was good but portion wasn’t enough for me even with 200g of meat. Most of the meat was mildly pre-seasoned but you can add more salt/pepper/others as you like, was delicious. Kimchi was interesting, had strong alcohol taste.

1st time having this as heard many said nice. No problem eating alone as the way they design it.  Waiting time is ok, all digitalize made everything fast and simple.  Self collect the raw meat at the collection counter.  Everyone give  50 mins only.
Nice meat but perhaps need more for me 🤣🤣

So lucky to be walking by and noticing a zero wait time.

Ordered the Quattro set as well as extra beef tongue and short ribs.

The staff are young and some are obviously new but you can tell they are trying their best at service.

So give them a smile and they would appreciate it!

The rice was the only thing that I would pick on as it seems a tad too mushy for our liking.

Tasty yakiniku at affordable prices!
Ordered the 300g pork belly + chicken rice set, as well as 100g sukiyaki beef.

Love the garlic soy sauce with the meats!
Chicken tigh is chunky, and not marinated, hence not as flavourful.

The grill pan area was not cleaned throughout on this visit, hope this can be better!

Prime Karubi and Pork Belly were really good and able to select rice amount for big eaters.
