Price is reasonable and there are different sets available for selection, or you can order the meat a la carte. Layout of the place is ideal for people who are eating alone as well. Payment is fast with self payment kiosk as well. Long waiting time of about 70 minutes so be prepared to wait during peak meal times.

Curiosity cause me to visit this newly opened self serve quick grill establishment. Quite a refreshing alternative to the pepper lunch outlet above.

Recommend to come early as I did before lunch or dinner hour as queue is norm. I selected the sukiyaki karubi set and it was delicious 😋.

The secret is in the marinate and the quick sear cooking that locks in the flavors while maintaining the tenderness of the beef which pairs well with the soy garlic sauce and the onsen egg 🥚.

Comparatively value for money especially if you compare between other meat based offerings.
Will come back again.. 😄

I really love the Wagyu Steak and Prime Karubi. The price is so reasonable and worth the money.
Great atmosphere as well as the staffs are all very friendly and attentive and you can feel the positive vibes they have.

We didn't need to wait for a seat since we visited this outlet at about 3.45pm. I ordered the A5 Wagyu and US Karubi set with kimchi. Added up to about $23.50.

The Wagyu and karubi had nice marbling, and melts in your mouth. I like that the kimchi is sweet before the spice hits. Miso soup is alright.

Will visit again.

Haven’t eat the yakiniku for a bit while. Recently just found one near by, its on the AMK hub basement 1. The food is fresh especially the meats, and with patient young staffs give efficient and friendly service. I was satisfied, set food size a bit small for me especially for this price. This is probably only concern from me.

no complaints about the food here, just not sure why they don’t provide ice. Very affordable, basic beef short plate set is well marinated and tasty! sauces are also good and there’s a huge variety of choices for all preferences

Service is excellent and the food is great! Went twice since the outlet opened at AMK Hub! The Karubi set is worth the money! For normal adults, do opt for the 200g variant as 100g is definitely not enough to satisfy your cravings!

Do also come early to avoid the extremely long waiting time, which may take up to 2 hours during peak hours. For those who can’t afford to wait, you can always go for their takeaway menu bento meals which features the exact same items and the meat is properly cooked for you!
Was here early so no q. Meat was decent for the price paid. But the hygiene standard definitely needs to be improved. Found a super long strand of hair right in middle of my bowl of rice. Disgusting

Tried the Karubi and Harami set. Meat is well marinated and the sauce complements it quite well. Quite a huge serving of rice for the sets - that's what makes you full after perhaps 200g of meat.

Order is done via scanning a QR code and submitting your choices via a webpage. The buzzer on your table will ring when your food is ready for collection. Payment is made via a kiosk at the exit. This self-service concept is different from other outlets. It's slightly weird because most of the staff are just standing around doing nothing most of the time.

Update Jul 2022: The staff will bring the food to your seat when it's ready. However there's a long wait for the food after you place the order.
Nice setup with individual grill for each person. Do be prepared to wait for a table and allocations of tables will run out. Love the array of sauces that can accompany your meats.

First time visiting this outlet. Thankful to meet lovely service staff Ms Shannon (courteous and patient) whom assisted with our orders. Nice food and waited less.than 10.minutes for our lunch.  Pleasant experience! 👍

Excellent. Despite being a self-service establishment, staff are very attentive and helpful, with special mention going to the girl bringing us into the restaurant. Took the time to explain to us how to order and pay. As for the food, not much needs to be said about it; for the money, absolutely wonderful. This restaurant will be seeing more of this face very soon. Thumbs up!
Value for money. For the price paid, the quality of beef was good. Just have to wait a while in the q
Paradise for meat lovers. The waiting time may be very long and queue numbers usually run out by 7pm. But it is well worth the wait
Quite an experience to grill with a variety of meat😙 premium selection for amateur grillers are tough as we don't know how to cook it the "proper" way 😂 P.S. my mom burnt her wagyus.

Who doesnt love BBQ?

Yakiniku offers BBQ lovers a quick and easy way to enjoy it, without the long preparation times and smells on your clothing.

Prices are affordable and value for money.

Quite a popular chain restaurant, so do come early.

This outlet is self service, very intuitive for customers that listen to instructions from the staff or who bother to read the signs. No fuss dining.

50mins dining timing but food took 15mins to be prepared, and I’m dining solo? Saw this piece of plastic among my meat and told the staff to tell their kitchen to be more careful, she went “uh ya okay” her reply toward other customer was rather substandard too.

I gave 2 stars cause the salad was nice, the rest for this price you can pay a bit more and go for free flow.
Very nice yakiniku. Fast service and delicious. This outlet is self service model, which I think speed up the overall dining time.

Affordable yakiniku place, however for big eaters may not be the best price(Big eaters may have to go for large rice[Upsize is free] and more meat). Meat is ok, ordered the Like set which has harami, short plate and tongue and ordered extra pork jowl. Best meats were the harami and pork jowl. The grill can be set to high or low temp, which is good for giving meats like harami a nice sear but not cooking it entirely to keep the inside juicy. However given that you are only given 50 mins i think most people will just set it at the highest temp. The grill is quite small, recommend going solo cause even if you go as a group you are still using the same sized grill, so 50 mins may not be enough. And because of the 50 mins time limit maybe hence why the meats are cut thin for quick cooking time. Same concept to ramen shops in Japan, you're going in for a fast meal not a social gathering. I would go again solo but if i we were to gather with friends i would go other yakiniku places.
I just feel I can get more food per dollar spent at other bbq joints. I wasn’t even full after eating the 200g beef set.

Only problem I have is that number runs out very quickly for the day if you don’t book early.

They should use the same booking system as sushiro, where you need to go down to the outlet physically to check in again in order to be part of the queue.

Nice food though, been here many times 😁

First outlet to have a self service concept. BUT I’m not entirely sure if this self service concept is going to work.

What happened was staffs basically just stood around doing nothing. 2 staffs stood at the entrance, basically doing nothing. Another stood at the self payment counter, who tried to give instructions that isn’t clear nor loud.

Further back, you have more staffs gathering together, talking among themselves, or standing behind customers, asking them if they can clear their plates the second they picked up that last piece of meat to grill.

Food wise, standards aren’t exactly comparable to other outlets, the spicy miso sauce seemed to be a lot thicker and salter; the garlic miso was quite diluted. The meats also came drenched in sauce which made for uneven and inconsistent cooking.

Management needs to look into their staffs at this outlet. If they are already this unmotivated to serve customers within their first 3 days of opening, it does not bode well for their future. Either they need a new store management who know how to handle operations, or these staffs need to go for customer service and communications training. Self service concept is not something for you to hide behind while your staffs stand in 1 corner and slack.

Joy the bandwagon to try why this one always have a long queue.  We waited for more than 1 hour to get a 3 pax table.  We ordered 3 sets with Wagyu steak, harami, beef steak slice, ox tongue, karubi and premium karubi.  The Wagyu beef is disappointing, not tender enough and also not strong enough for the fatty fragrance (already can tell from the marble pattern).  The beef steak slice is very dry.  The harumin is ok, tender and tends to be a bit chewy (but is ok).  The karubi is very good.  Ox tongue is extremely tender.  Last the stove is not coal but gas.  And the sauces are good - the Like BBQ and Salty sauce.  Overall it is not exception ally good but is definitely value for money, especially for the lower price point items - karubi.  Worth to try.  Last last last, why can't the queuing system can ask the customer to input HP number and can send SMS to us like 5 tables ahead?  This is a very common feature is many systems.

It's my third visit to this outlet today with my family. Food is awesome as always. On top of that, would love to specially give our compliment to staff Jun Ning on her approach to customers. It's just genuine and you can feel it from the bottom of the heart (I came from customer service line as well). Hopefully the management rewards her accordingly to her performance. I'm telling you she will be a gem to your company

Fuss free queue system, staff are efficient and helps to change the grill mat if needed. Many sauces to choose from and items are ready for collection very quickly after you order via the app. Overall it's one of my fave dining place.

First time there!
The fast casual BBQ aspect of the restaurant was really unique and piqued my interest.

Service was fast and efficient 😃.
Within 5 mins, I went from being outside of the restaurant to receiving my order 👍

Also would like to mention belle who was patient on explaining how to order and the different types of meat

Food was delicious.😋
Would definitely visit this place again with my friends!

Surprisingly good value meal at this outlet.  I like the orderly seating, serving, menu easy and special sauce choices...

The wagyu beef portion served was too fat a cut for me, i was impressed the young gentleman changed it for me. Great service. This is my 5th visit in 5 weeks.

waited for 15minutes to eat (came at 5) and food was really goooood! highly recommend the soy garlic sauce + BBQ sauce combination! cheese fondue is yummy too :)

Have a good time, highly recommend u to try at least once in your life!

Good place for a yakiniku fix, food came reasonably fast even during peak hours. Shannon was quick to clear the queue and usher me and the others to our tables. Only bad thing was the bottled drinks pricing. just order their hot green tea if dining in, at least feels more refreshing when eating bbq.

My fourth visit to this outlet. The restaurant still managed to uphold its standard from the day of its opening. Polite and friendly staff and most importantly the food is 10/10. I couldn't have asked for more. Will definitely come for the fifth time :)

First time customer. Very polite and efficient staff. Food was tasty (chicken!!) and I like the neat condiments set up.
Only issue is the aircon. Almost can’t feel any aircon. Otherwise, everything is good. Thank you.
One of the best outlets. A bit warm as usual. Good is fantastic 👌😊

Food wise dont have to say so much. THE BEST . however i would like to compliment one of the staffs over there. her name is Jun Ning. i missed my queue number however she did her best to find seats for us as we have kids. Her positive attitude bring up the whole place over here. Nice food, nice staff, happy customer :))

Price for the potion was okay (smallest potion, could be small to others). Not much truffle taste but otherwise still taste okay! Need to cook carefully cos some of my meat either undercooked (at first) and then burnt at edges. Egg was kinda salty.
Quite a nice place. BBQ available for 1 person.. but this place need stronger aircon, sweat a lot after eating! Would be nice if they have more options for non-beef eater.

Good meat, love the karubi, though it’s a little on the pricey side considering the portion. But meat was well marinated! Four sauces to choose from, seasonings like pepper, and salt.
Long wait though, the queues are usually pretty long!

Went there 2 weeks ago and promised a review for the amazing service that i've received from Joan.

She has been attentive to all the needs of the consumers, and i'm using this opportunity to thank her for the good service.

Food is good as well, you'll need to book in advance to prevent waiting.

Nice dining experience.
Food served was fresh and nice 👍

I was welcomed by the friendliest n helpful staff at AMK Hub branch, Beatrice. Being the first timer here, I was totally lost.. Despite the busy dinner hours at 7.30pm, She patiently assisted me n helped me thru the recommendation. I chose the Premium Beef set, and it was mind blowing.. the Wagyu beef literally melt in my mouth.. Best Kimchi.. Best Soup.. Yummilicious is definitely understatement. I was definitely return with my “Villagers” Lol
food is nice la but $15 for 8 slice of meat like abit scam city sia. go 1nce can alr

This place serves the most yummy & reasonable BBQ meat, and especially my favourite beef cuts. The staff service was also very courteous & meticulous during my visit.

As it’s a fairly new concept of a self-service outlet from their other outlets, there’s always areas of improvement. I just hope people are not so quick to criticise the staff & or systems, but rather to provide more positive & encouraging words for their growth. Everyone needs a “booster” now & then for continuous development.

Personally, it’s an awesome place to have BBQ meals with loved ones & worth the wait. Keep up the good work, peeps of Yakiniku Like @ AMK Hub!!! Don’t let negativity get to you but show them otherwise! Gambaté!!! 💪🏼👌🏼☺️
sauce is really nice. very good service. friendly staff

restaurant name: Korean & Japanese Cuisine 日本料理
content:
For some heartlander Japanese /Korean food, I think this is one of the better stalls around. They have a few outlets across the island also. Of course they are not your authentic Japanese or Korean cuisine that you would die for, but the taste is somewhat there. With such affordae prices and their portion of a meal is value for money, I can't complain.

Most of their food are made to order. Mostly are fried or teppanyaki style. The usual sauces or ingredients are teriyaki, Japanese mayonnaise, katsu items, pickled vegetables and Kimchi.

Their hotplate soba fish looks quite popular here. It comes with a seaweed soup and rice. Their bento sets looks nice too. In total they have about 40 items on the menu.

Overall its good enough to eat for lunch and dinner if you just bored of Chinese or western food.

restaurant name: Korean & Japanese Cuisine 日本料理
content: Pork bbq wasn’t bad. Ramen was soso only. I think bishan also got same stall, when I ordered deliver from that one was better.

restaurant name: Korean & Japanese Cuisine 日本料理
content:
Surprising ok. Look, the ingredients are not top quality, the short grain rice is not the expensive Japanese brand, but this is a hawker stall selling Japanese meals at $5. I give it 4 stars for doing what it is doing with this budget.

Had the teriyaki chicken don. The chicken taste a bit like western chicken chop, but it was pretty good size. The overall taste is conservative, maybe because of the neighborhood taste.

Will come back to try other items.

restaurant name: Korean & Japanese Cuisine 日本料理
content: portion versy small. salmon was maybe 3mm thin.. will not buy again..

restaurant name: Korean & Japanese Cuisine 日本料理
content: So so only. Don’t think will try again lor.

restaurant name: Korean & Japanese Cuisine 日本料理
content: Delicious chicken katsu don! The stallowner is generous and gives pretty big portions. I wish he could give me some seaweed

restaurant name: Korean & Japanese Cuisine 日本料理
content: Big portion. Good service. Can Bring 2 containers for take away to save 20 cents.

restaurant name: Korean & Japanese Cuisine 日本料理
content: so so..quite disappointed in some take away.. need to be serious on their food taste

restaurant name: Korean & Japanese Cuisine 日本料理

content: Not bad! Can eat! Ordered the Black Pig Pork cutlet, meat is juicy and the breaded Panko batter is light. Price is reasonable. Will come back!
Pack a takeaway lunch here today, new opening in this local coffeeshop, wait time for less than 5 min, overall for the price the taste is good. The rice is not as sticky as other I had which I like.

Newly open coffeeshop with many interesting shops. Tried this Japanese stall which has many branches. The curry sauce is think and flavourful, but the rice is a little lumpy and katsu was a little oily. Overall still worth to try since it is below $10 👍🏼 Hope they will improve the katsu.
Had the $9.80 pork katsu don. Flavour and portion were both better than average, but not particularly outstanding.

Tried both the katsu curry and katsu don, and they are superb.
Close to restaurant quality katsu at affordable prices. Definitely worth it.
Not too bad, but price is on higher end.
Take away the Katsu don . Will try their curry next time

Had the pork and chicken katsu curry. For the quality of ingredients,  taste, price and availability, I would give it a 4.5 star. I will definitely visit again. Btw, Katsu is amazing especially for this price point.
Wow. Absolutely delicious
Please improve standard of katsu and service instead of going worse

What a novelty that brings excitement!
We are in smiles to have a robot bringing us to our table, so cute!

We love how the food is delivered in an enclosed conveyor belt like a bullet train  zipping around and only opens up when our food is delivered to our table like a suprise box.
Thumbs up for being hygienic as I would not like to have my food, going around like old school conveyor sushi belt, uncovered and getting expose to whatever is in the air.
The service staff are attentive too.

Menu selections are very interesting, we tried lots of variety that wasn't common. It's a welcome change.

Gonna bring the kids along next time, they will be so excited over this Futuristic robot concept.

Recommend for
Large family and kids
Seats up to 6.

Will we be back?
Yes!

I see a lot of mixed reviews here so I decided to try for myself. Heard was quite hyped people queued for hours when it opened.
I visited on a weekday lunch there was no queue got immediate seating. Was quite cute there was a robot which showed me to the table. Way or ordering food was quite standard. Didn't like the table for 2 was really small and narrow.
Wowed by the menu. Didn't expect they had such a wide range of dishes, and the price was really cheap. Kept scrolling and took quite a while to order the dishes. Time taken for food to arrive was quite fast except for the Agedashi tofu, okay since they had to fry it upon order and it was hot when it arrived.
Was a hit for me for the food quality as I found them pretty good and satisfied. Nothing was not fresh or tasted bad and seriously nothing to complain for the price you are paying.
Things I didn't like was that the table for 2 was really small, so if you really order quite a lot of things you find yourself not having space to put the plates. They tried to consolidate orders by putting a few types of sushi in a plate but still the space was lacking.
Don't know if it's because of this the staff keep coming to the table trying to clear the plates. It was a mixed reaction because on one hand I found it quite disturbing wondering if the kitchen is lacking plates or they are trying to be nice to free up table space. I didn't like it when you are having a meal and conversation and the staff keep coming to disrupt.
Although the staff keep coming to clear the plates, when you need attention from them you just can't get their attention. They served the matcha cheesecake without any spoons we raised our hands for a few minutes before someone noticed us. Think it should be default to provide dessert teaspoons with the dessert or have some in the drawer under the table.
The only thing I felt funny was a female staff whenever she came to clear the plates she would always knock into something and go "oh my god oh my god".
Meal wise the bill was really reasonable. Enjoyed it.

Came in with decent expectation but was utterly disappointed by the quality and taste of the food :(

Sushi go, you have so much potential. I think you can do better.....

Fried Salmon skin very hard and clumped together.

The unagi thing really taste very creative/weird. Please don't.

Waiting time is almost an hour on a weekend lunch time. Recommended to go at around 2:30-3pm where there are lesser crowd.
Sushi standards were mediocre, for the price I would prefer other express sushi place or Ichiban Sushi instead. The butter soyu is a tat too sweet. Maybe it’s newly open, they always forgot the customers order. I overheard 2 tables with missing orders, same as us when we visit, orders forgotten but were marked as Completed in the system.
The seating is pretty small, I guess petite size people will feel more comfortable.

Just want to say thank you and congratulations to the crews! The two days opening specials are crazy especially for them, I got the queue number at 12 and only dine in at 8 yet it was definitely satisfying. The crews did extremely well to cope with the demands and imagine how much pressure they have to handle whole day from the customers. The manager even came to apologise to me for waiting so long which to me is already going extra miles for the customers. Keep it up 💪

Alright sushi in AMK Hub with an alright price point. Interior design is cute and clean. Food quality varies vastly between different sushi. Most of the sushi we had were pretty alright, with the exception of the yellowtail which tasted really dry and weird. Also because of their train system, some of their sushi arrives toppled. Another flaw would be that the 2 pax table is a little small after all the tea and shoyu and tissue box taking up the space, meaning that you can't order too many plates at once. Then again their sushi comes really slowly and one at a time. Waiting time could be improved. One of our orders was also forgotten by the kitchen and had to remind the staff about it, but due to lack of staff it was hard to get their attention.

Love my dinner there. The interior was really cute and attractive. Was lots of fun even for adults to have their food come in the cute bots. Every time it opens, we get a surprise, more hygienic than the other similar concept. The staff were very polite as well. Understand there might be some teething issues due to the sudden hype which is pretty normal. Hope everyone get to try Sushigo at least once!

Nice place to bring kids along.  Sushi is nice, affordable prices.
AI leading to our seats, interesting for kids.

Visited outlet around 4.30pm off peak period. We glad to have Sushi Go in Ang Mo Kio Hub cause previous only have one which is at Jurong Point. Even its not much customer but we found that two staff Vicky & Poh Lian providing good service. They keep attention on every customer. Always keep our table clean and tidy. Company should rewards their good service. 👍🏻  Keep going!

Had A Quick Lunch @ Newly Opened Sushi-Go. Waiting Time Wasnt Long . A Robot Ushered Me To My Seat. Scan & Order Via QR Code. Staffs Over There Were Friendly & Welcoming Too. Those Diff Emoji Faces Of Go-Bots Delivered My Food Looked So Cute Plus Efficient. The Sushi And Fried Stuffs Taste Great Too. Hope To See More Dessert Choices In Future Like Sushi Express. Spend Abt $19, Pretty Affordable. Located Near TimeZone/ Cinema, 4th Level.
Nice place to get catch up with friends. Saw a lot of parents bring kids to see the fun train delivery of food.

Queue is arnd 4hrs, went during $1 promo, started queuing at 1030. Started eating at 1430

Staff were friendly and helped us made our 3 tower stacks

Sashimi is 4/5 due to not being as cold as I'd expect. Nonetheless, great experience there

The new sushi conveyor belt concept. Very fresh Japan speed train decor. We love the conveyor belt because of the automatic delivery. The kids were having fun. It is also hygienic that the food is covered up until it reached our table. Sushi Go is very comparable to Genki Sushi in terms of concept and pricing. However, Genki Sushi's food is way much better than Sushi Go. Although the kids love Sushi Go's conveyor belt, i will still go to Genki Sushi for the nicer food.
Decent price point and varieties to choose from. Ordered thru QR code and the food will be delivered right in front of you via the 'train'.

For an experience not bad. Quite a number of sushi varieties to choose from. The Hamachi sashimi is a big disappointment, not fresh at all with the 4 pcs for $5+. Wonder why they serve unfresh sashimi in the first place to spoilt their branding.
And for $25 for 1 pax not a cheap option, didn't even order a lot of things.
Ok for 1st time experience, not really a regular goto place.

Absolute chaos upon opening time. Queue up for 1 hour+ to the end only to get a queue number that is estimated to be 3 hours or even longer, by the time it becomes dinner alr.😂 quite a number of people ragequitted. Could have just blanket cutoff the queue and not make everybody waste time queueing further. Probably will give this a miss.

Cheaper than other “train” sushi places but you can taste the subpar quality as well.

Take something you like and make it better, not worse.

After the opening craze calm down, we manage to dine in for dinner. Food was alright, service is prompt and the sushi train is cute 😁 only downside it can be abit pricey, but im guessing the recent inflation cost went up too. ( so minus 1star)

The fries was surprisingly not bad. Maybe will come once in a looong time.

Fun concept with robots serving the food. We waited an hour for our food even though we entered the store at its opening hours. The experience seems consistent as the customers who entered at the same time with us were all waiting as well. New store opened with lots of teething things to sort out in its operations.

Was initially reluctant to try this place given the many unfavourable reviews, but am so glad I gave it a shot.

The quality of the food considering the price point was excellent, way better than expected and definitely a mark above the sister restaurant ichiban sushi, also in amk hub. Loved the fried salmon skin (soo crisp) and potato salad (daughter claims its the best version ever). Miso soup was too salty for me though.

The robot "waiter" and cute trains will appeal to kids. The digital queue system was so convenient as well - you'll be prompted via text when your table is ready, so you can run your errands in the meantime.

Staff were sincere and customer centric. Well done!

POSITIVES:

Food was alright, all the dishes were yummy and pretty good. Soft shell crab maki was yummy had this yuzu dressing inside which was refreshing. Staff were lovely trying to compensate for robot’s technical failures. Poor design feature. No call button to get staff’s attention, need to stand up to walk to the staff..
Being led to our table by TEMI robot was a novel experience.

NEGATIVES:
Spicy salmon sushi came smelling weird and like smelly socks + tasted weird too.

Ordered salmon belly sashimi. Never came. One robot came but inside was empty. The order  was marked as completed order. After a few requests, staff came personally to serve it.

Dine in around dinner time on a weekday. It was fairly packed but the service was fast. The robot belt was super interesting!
Food quality was good! The price was reasonable.

Food is ok, the wait is bad.
Not sure if they forgot our order. First few orders came about 10-15mins. Our handrolls however took more than 30mins, asked the waiter to check for us, came back saying the chef will make for us NOW?

THEN our orders came 5-10mins later. Then we noticed the people who came in later than us have handroll orders go to them first.

So is the system not working properly? Or did they forget our orders? Highly doubt I'll be going back again.

Not worth the wait at all. Highly NOT recommended

I'm totally disappointed with the service and regretted coming all the way just to have my first time experience with Sushi-GO yesterday. We reached there around 1:45pm, long queue found outside Sushi-GO and was told by one of the male staff that is the the queue to take queue number and need to wait around 3 - 4 hours to dine in after getting a queue number. I don't mind waiting for a few hours, by then it could be dinner time. I got my queue number at 1:57PM for queue number A276, there is still long queue behind me. I spent my time walking around,  went for movie etc. At 3:55PM, the queue number is only A052. ! came back at 6pm. I asked one of the female staff at the counter, the queue isn't really moving, what if we cannot dine in today? Can we get a compensation like a queue number for tomorrow? She answered, they didn't expect such an overwhelmed response. The queue started as early at 9AM this morning. There is no time limit for dine in so customers tend to eat slower, chit chat. They can't give me queue number for tomorrow as it is a first come first serve basis. I'm like? So you want me to come all the way here to try my luck AGAIN? I replied, by doing all these no one will want to even come back for such service. Long waiting time. Not getting dine in. No compensation. We overheard that the queue number got until 500ish till they stop taking in. At 9PM, we received a message from Sushi-GO that they are calling our queue. We can join Hungry Ghost Festival if we have waited till 9PM for our dinner.
Freshly made sushi served by cute robots in many expressions. A good variety of sushi at affordable prices. Very satisfied meal, will be back for more!

Food - quality and taste was a 3⭐, as is typical sushi chain restaurants. The variety is quite a letdown. Many of the basic items are not available. The $1 opening promotion for sushi is only on 30 & 31 July.

The wait - ridiculously long waiting time of 1hour for a post-lunch timing and on a Monday. This is partly due to the closure of at least 1/4 to 1/3 of the restaurant and manpower shortage. Any other sushi chain doesn't make customers wait 1h.

Not elderly friendly - from the queueing system to the ordering system, the whole process aren't the friendliest and definitely not elderly friendly. There is no physical menu (except at the entrance) for elderlies to choose the sushi.

I believe this is the worst train sushi I had in my entire life. Nothing can be much worst than this. It's a total disappointment , waste of time n your stomach space.

The fried food was cold and bland. Sushi was way below average. Sushi go deserve 0 star. Whenever I need assistance, I need to walk to e counter n find staff for help.
And this one star is for floor staff Vicky. She is e one n only staff tat offer to help us clear e empty plate.

Everything is extremely slow. It took 30mins for my food to even start arriving after ordering. Half the time the food was served by servers. They even forgot some of my orders. I saw someone attempting to serve a plate to an empty table. Make sure to count your plates. There is a good chance you may have missed items.
Great place for families to enjoy sushi delivered to you by cutesy robots. Quite a novel and fun experience. Go for the thick cut sashimi - no regrets!

Extremely disappointed at the experience I had today, went there at around 2pm and was told by one staff that waiting time was about 3 to 4 hours and another that it was 4 to 5 hours. That seemed reasonable enough so I came back after 4 hours and asked for an update for how much longer it would take for my turn, the staff went to check at the computer and told me that it would be about an hour more. So I came back after another hour and this time I was told by another staff that it was likely that even if I waited till closing time, my turn to enter would not come.  I don't mind waiting for hours for the food but being told that it would take 4 to 5 hours and 1 hour more after I asked for an update, I would never have thought that I would not even be able to eat. In the first place, the management should have known that having this opening promo would bring about an overwhelming number of customers and should have set a maximum eating time like how genki sushi does it. I asked the staff why a maximum eating time was not imposed, the staff replied in a rhetoric manner asking me if I want a 30min time limit or a 1 hour time limit and told me they cannot control how long the people stay there to eat. I was also told that I should have estimated the waiting time myself, but I was already told by the staff that the waiting time was about 4 to 5 hours. Additionally, by 2pm the staff should have already been able to realise that they have given out too many queue numbers judging from the trends since opening in the morning and should have cut the queue number collection. My number was in the 200s for the 2 seater tables, and it was no where near my queue number near closing time, and to make it worse the last queue number is  almost 400. I am not sure how they estimated so badly the waiting time. The management was really awful and I am very disappointed.
To summarise:
1. not imposing a maximum eating time.
2. given an extremely wrong estimation of waiting time such that I was not even able to eat by the end of the day
3. not cutting off collection of queue number when it was very apparent that they had given too many queue numbers.
4. staff making it seem like it was my fault for not estimating the waiting time myself when they already told me that it would be about 4 to 5 hours

I would give 0 stars if I could, this is really unacceptable
Waited for 45 mins for mediocre food and non-existent service. Sushi was overcharged and some of the orders didn't come. No apology given and no service recovery. First visit also my last visit.
Quite innovative, serving by robots train. Even the entrance to table, ushered by robots too. Menu looks nice but not attractive to foods. Can be improved with more unique dishes.

If I could give 0 stars, I would. Waited so long for food, orders were messed up (people who came later than us got food first), and the food quality was just sad. Not a single food that was good. Haven't had such a bad meal in such a long time, not to mention one order was missed out (but by then it was more like thank goodness...). Sorry this is a no-go.

its very bad. we waited for like 2hours just to get these tiny small bowls of noodles and rice worth like 5bucks. i mean it iS a sushi restaurant but like the waiting time was solong?!?! at first we entered we wanted buy rice and noodles but they were SOLD OUT. so we waited. LIEK AROUND AN HOUR. then finally after we ordered.. we waited AROUND WNOTHER HOUR. (might be highly exaggerated, but basically we arrived around 1130am then we left around 1pm+)  then the food come so less one ): right now we ate at mac donalds bcs our stomachs arent full😔

but the staff are attentive and served us well, its just the kitchens kinda slow. and i guess when u go to a sushi place, just get sushi👍 btw, food is kinda ehh average.
Love every aspect of this place! The cute robots, the fun interior, and of course the yummy food (esp the thick cut sashimi). Plus points for keeping the kiddo entertained with the robots...
went last week and got a great service  Despite the peak hours was able to continuously help me with the countless refills of ginger and hot ocha.
A new outlet just opened. After submitting the order online, first shushi came abt 30 min later.   Sushies were nice and fresh. Price was reasonable.

There was lesser queue on a Wednesday 2pm. However, the varieties are seriously lacking. Many popular items were not available. Sushi was not even cold. That said it’s edible but the portioning alone didn’t even feel satisfying. Not just any rice & seaweed makes sushi.

Mentai Aburi salmon was barely torched and looked pathetic with the salmon wrapped around the rice. It was also overwhelmed by the amount of mentai sauce on top.

Kani salad gunkan looked fresh with the crispy looking seaweed but all the goodness ended there. Salad was warm and not even delicious. Just meh.

Sushi express had better standards. Feels like $1 promotion has caused them to cut corners leading to unsavoury  and warm sushi. Save your money for something better.

First had sushi-go at the Jurong Point outlet, it was pretty good and worth the price. When the AMK Hub outlet opened, the queue was superrrrr long and they close the queue as early as 7pm (on a weekday!!) Food doesn’t seem to be as good anymore, kitchen seems to be messy as a few of our orders were messed up (gave the wrong item, sent the same item twice, food did not come after awhile). Probably not worth the wait at the amk outlet 🥲

Omg I'm so shocked that all the food is so tasteless and super bad. Not expecting it until we ate it and I saw the review/rating and we waited for 1hr for it . Tako is rock hard and same for the fries. All the rice is so bland plus it keeps falling apart, the sashimi also gone case cause it's room temp and not fresh. By far the worst Japan restaurant ever. What ultimate sushi satisfaction? Yucks!!!

No number to show that the food order is ready, no one wraps your food in a paper bag, no wasabi, soy sauce provided.  I have to asked a customer service to help me,He said that the chef in the kitchen was preparing, and let me wait there for nothing. and then I would ask the customer service to provide it. Poor service.
Sushi go is seriously so underwhelming.. kinda expected more since there is so much hype previously. Price don’t justify the portions given, I would still go with either sushiro / genki over this

The service is very bad. My queue number was called but have to wait for 5+mins for me to enter. The workers messed up my order and l waited for 40mins until l called them to check my order. They were chi chatting and don’t even care about the customers. Very bad service. Will never go again.
Takes a while for the food the come out. The plates are not clean. There was something stuck to my salmon sushi (not part of the dish). The food was subpar. 10/10 would NOT recommend.
While this is a Known concept for sushi chain. Compared to other sushi chains, the speed of getting our sushi is so so so slow. We waited 30mins and only 3 out of 12 plates ordered came.

Visited the amk hub branch for lunch at 1140am. Waiting time 20min for 2 ppl still reasonable. But food tasted a little meh. The rice didnt taste like japanese rice, not enough vinegar. The sushi that tasted best were those with lots of mentaiko sauce, enough to overpower the rice taste. Tea is powder instant tea which is also a little meh..

was really skepticial of this place at first due to mixed reviews on google
so came here today and tried myself!
ordered vary dishes and i think it was ok! the ramen could be salty-er because it was no taste HAHAH. so added soya sauce myself
but the chawamusui (imo) beat genki when i love eggs myself
the chawamushi was full of taste & nice!
piping hot :)
salmon was nice too
price wise is u get what u paid for! like $5 for una tama don the portion not v big but ok to share ba!

but overall is good! can come back once in awhile to try :)
went during peak hours and service prompt

Food: 3.5/5
service: 4/5

Love the cute environment served by Robot, would like to appreciate Andy for giving us his excellent service, wa came with friends to celebrate my birthday, Andy helped to arrange the complimentary dessert with birthday tag on it sent by Robot. Staff with excellent service.

A shout out to Stephanie! Not only did she show empathy towards me but also her impeccable service!

Upon seeing me with hands full of stuff today, she rushed up to me and helped me w my bags before ushering me to the cashier for my takeaways! She's so thoughtful even towards the end of service that she took a big pc plastic bag for me to put all my stuff in! I was literally blown away  and touched by her thoughtfulness, empathy and wonderful service!

Hope the organisation will have more staff like her as it's hard to come by nowadays.

Thank you Stephanie and keep up the good work ! Hope to see you soon again 😁
Food was good. Service was efficient. Thumbs up to manager Andy, very nice and friendly. Amazing customer service, a role model for all staff to follow
This tenpanyaki deserves a better rating. Indeed v nice, but n much much better than some in the restaurant. 1 of the best tenpanyaki in food court in sg. Portion quite big. Yummy n fresh ingredients

Located inside Foodfare @ AMK hub. It was just on the left side of the main entrance, you couldn’t miss it.
All the items were sold in set, no option for additional items, meaning there was a possibility, you could be ordering 3 sets for 2 pax.
Service was alright. The cooking was done fast.
The taste was full of pepper and a bit hard to enjoy the food’s original flavour.
Also the stall only accepted cash, no other mode of payment.

I was there on 28th June 2022 to try the new teppanyaki store that replaced express teppanyaki. It was dinner time and as usual crowded. I was seated behind the first counter and a few more customers came after me.  I do not expect any service as it's not fine dining. As I was waiting I noticed the cook (won't call him a chef cooking for the customers who came after me. The young boy noticed that I was not being served and told his colleague to cook mine as I came first. He told the young boy not to bother about me while he's cooking for other customers. I also noticed that instead of cooking based on sequence, he pick and choose which one he wants to cook first. I asked for a refund and the boy mending the cashier was nice enough to give me the refund. Having said this, of course I did not taste the food because I've already lost my appetite. Never experienced this when I dine with other teppanyaki stores.

Since the new stall replaced the previous one we seldom eat here.. Too much pepper in the sauce.. unable to taste what we are eating.. standard not as good as the previous stall. Ingredients are also not as fresh..
Got hair in the soup and the staff tell me “oh hao, no worries” 🤷‍♀️
Portion is good and ingredients are very fresh!!

Just had a couple side dishes here. The gyoza super nice, just the right amount of crispness. They are homemade according to the shop worker. The stir-fried mushrooms, wow. They got a little smoky flavor from the grill and if you're a mushroom lover you'll definitely want to get this. I don't even like onions but I ate all the onions in this too because they were cooked well and the sauce was very flavorful.

The Tonkotsu Special was tasty and reasonably priced. The noodles were cooked al dente and had a nice bite soaking up the Tonkotsu broth nicely. The chashu was slightly thicker and tougher than I prefer, but still good. The Tonkotsu broth was rich and smooth yet not overly salty. The torched chicken drumstick had a nice sear. The meat was juicy and tender, coming off the bone easily. I got it as an add on, so I would recommend getting it as part of the clear chicken broth for the full experience. The pork gyoza were a tad pricey, but the filling was very fresh and not mushy, while the skin had a light crisp. It was fried on order and nicely done. Overall a satisfying meal. Recommended.

Very hard to find coffee shop nestled under the HDB blocks. The ramen was prepared very quickly and it’s definitely value for money. I tried the all ingredients ramen bowl and the ramen was cooked al dente and the broth was really flavorful. Definitely worth a try! I would have given it a 4 stars if the coffee shop was in better shape.

Visited this stall at AMK and gave their Tonkotsu Special Ramen a try. I really liked the soup, which was rich and thick, with a meaty milky flavour. Noodles were good, springy and had a nice chew to them. Their Chashu were neatly sliced and tender, which had a mild smoky flavour as well. The eggs were delicate with a silky texture. Overall, it was a competent bowl of ramen with a great value.

Price : 𝐒𝐆𝐃 𝟓.𝟗𝟎 ⁣
⁣
I had the ramen with chicken drumsticks. ⁣
In comparison to a typical Japanese restaurant, the ramen is slightly thicker. Chicken is incredible. You can simply tear it off with chopsticks since it is so soft. Clear chicken broth serves as the soup's foundation. It has a Chinese soup base flavor to it. Everything in this bowl is average. Will come back to try the tonkotsu ramen. ⁣
⁣
Tips: you may wish to pay via 𝘍𝘢𝘷𝘦𝘗𝘢𝘺 ⁣

Visited with my family for the 1st time on a weekend.
Thoroughly enjoyed the food here, considering the price point the quality is really comparable to restaurants.
The gyoza is really the main star here, perfect meat to skin ratio.
Karage fried to perfection
For the tonkotsu broth, I find that it could be even more creamier.
The choice of ramen noodles wasn't what I expected. A thicker noodle would better complement the broth in my opinion.
Otherwise, really hope this place keeps being consistent in the standard of the food.

Knowing how much calories is in a bowl of ramen.. this is not quite worth my calories in my opinion. To be fair.. it's not bad.. but I won't say I like it. Soup base was average, noodles was average, everything was a tad average. Pricing wise it doesn't match ramen shops in the malls (which is the right thing to do).

We had the Tonkatsu Special and Chasu Tonkatsu. Decent ramen bowl that I wouldn't mind coming to eat again. While definitely not the best bowl of ramen you can get, but considering this is located in a neighbourhood kopitiam with kopitiam level price, I would say it is well worth the price for a restaurant level dish.

Chanced upon this on Google maps which is near my place. This ramen is restaurant standard, but just located in a coffeeshop. Even bowls and plates used are those you usually use in a restaurant.
Price point is for sure lower than those in restaurant, but the type of ramen variety seems to be only those few. They sell fried rice menu as well.

Broth is thick and good, I like it a lot. Chashu is slightly tasteless, but it's to my liking. Feels fatty and seems like will melt inside your mouth. Eggs are the runny kind as usual, and the seaweed or nori is super huge. They have black fungus as well. If they could add bamboo shoots I think that complements the taste.
Special mention goes to the gyoza. Steamed but fried on one side. It's juicy as well, so once you bite it, the juice oozes out.
Recommend if you are nearby 👍🏾

The total cost of all the items here cost $30, the noodles are $10 and $6, while the side cost $4-5. The reason I'm giving 3 stars is not because the noodles are bad. Oh no, the reason for this is because the gyoza is overcooked and from the photo, you can see for yourself.

How could the staff send out food like this.

Ordered the basic tonkotsu

Broth, a bit light on the pork flavor, but compensated with strong mushroom fragrance. I suppose to get a deeper flavor without being too greasy.

Char siu, nothing special, thin. A bit bland, a bit tough

Noodles, pretty good, thin-style, semi-firm; not overcooked.

Price: very affordable. $6.90 for tonkotsu, but they have a $5.90 chicken soup version available

Chanced upon this while we were trying to visit a fried rice stall at the same coffeeshop during its rest day on Mon.

Really competent bowl of ramen at coffeeshop prices - chasu is flavourful and sliced to a good thickness, ajitama has perfect molten yolk and absorbed the soy sauce, tonkotsu broth and ramen are well executed. The spicy black oil was different from what I tried at some Japanese ramen restaurants, tasted a little bit like light curry broth.

Interesting to have more international influences coming into the coffeeshop scene.

2nd visit, this time remember to take picture before I stir. Lol.
Ordered their specialty again @10.80 which is good priced since it is in a coffeeshop (no point to pay high price at shopping malls just because of their high rental)
Different people has different preferences for ramen so I'll just share what I like about this.
Thumbs up for the texture of the noodles and the thick, favourable broth (those who love thick broth shld try)

Ramen lovers Should at least give it a try to see if you love it.

To be honest the broth does not taste authentic. It has this bitter taste and not refreshing or tasty.

But what surprised me is the teriyaki chicken ($5) is pretty good. The gyoza ($6) has this thick skin covering the meat inside. Worth a try too.

Found this on sethlui intro for AMK food. Must say the clear broth chicken drum stick ramen is unexpectedly nice! Meat literally comes off using my chopstick, so no fuss! I asked for less salty and yes you can ask for it on their menu.

This bowl at $6.90 is one of the cheapest good quality ramen I’ve tasted. It’s not overly salty like other ramen (if you like more salty you can let them know). The broth is not those super thick but thick enough to be flavourful. Tabao the gyoza home and it was very good too.

Highly recommended for its great price and qualify
Chicken that falls off the bone. Rich broth. Went with normal taste. Next time will try less taste. Finished the whole bowl, including the all the broth.
Meat is slightly dryer but the soup & ramen is good. Love the gyōza.

Priced way over the market rate for a coffeshop stall. Nothing outstanding about the food. Too expensive n yet stingy on the food ingredients. Order the special w extra ingredients but they gave the $4 cheaper version, had i not realised n asked, i'll definitely but short changed. Ramen soup had almost all been absorded by the noodles even before comsuming onsite. Noodle n soup has a bitter taste to it. Definitely NOT recommended to patronise. Better off w other better n value for money foodies at other stall in the same coffeshop.
My first 1 star review as imo, seriously this stall need a major revamp on its pricing/food quality.
$8.30 for a bowl of char siew ranmen. .all OK except I find the photo and manual not so clear. Hope u can improve on the manual part. See until blur.

SHINJITSU RAMEN.332 Ang Mo Kio Ave 1. Happened to come across this place after sending my dog for grooming a few doors away. We ordered the Tonkotsu ramen. The soup base is very rich with creamy texture. Two large pieces of very lean chashu and the hosomen or thin noodles is firm and tasty. This is their cheapest ramen at $6.90 per bowl. I give it a score 8/10. Will come back to try the other dishes like pork gyozs , chicken teriyaki stick, etc.

Average. Cha Shu is on the lacking side, pretty tough to chew. The rest are ok, not exactly cheap and affordable factoring quality. Compare to many local raman F&B which are just selling slightly more expensive but taste way better.

Good bits first; egg was lightly cured and still had a soft runny yolk. Chashu was lean but still tender. The nori sheet given was also quite sizeable(folded in half in pic)

Asides from these, the rest of the components were somewhat lackluster. Noodles and wood ear mushrooms were meh. Broth looked promisingly creamy but was salty and only had a hint of pork flavour. Considering that the majority of the price point of Ramen comes from the broth, 6.90+ isn't really justifiable with the quality that I've received. Maybe just get the basic ones and accessorize it with your own sides at home?

Definitely room for improvement.
Their normal taste is too plain for my preference.

A decent ramen sold in a coffeeshop stall.

Soup: Decent
Noodles: Decent
Price: Decent
It really bad. The soup is not rich, creamy and salty. It just bad. Super bad. Cant finish
I'm really sorry but have to say quality is quite bad, broth tasteless, meat is hard. Got stomach-ache right after the food, terrible. Not worth the money.

Great stall in a coffee shop to get your pocket-friendly ramen fix without going to the crowded malls. For its pricing, the ramen bowls sure have something going on, especially the soup base. Would visit again! 👍
One of the best hawker ramen. The mushroom plate is comparable to expensive japanese restaurants even though its half the price

Discovered it after my haircut nearby. Quality was good but a tad pricey for coffee shop location. Compared to nearby stalls with average prices of $3 and up, the ramen special bowl is $10.90. But it was tasty and looked and tasted authentic. Onsen egg was good, a whole large piece of nori seaweed and generous 4 thick slices of chashu. I recommend. Worth a visit.

Didn’t take photo, will do so next time and remember to ask for stronger tasting Ramen although the norm is already good enough. For $10.90, worthy dish to try though a tat expensive for coffeeshop setting.

Great tasting ramen at coffeeshop price. Love the broth which is thick and yet not overly salty like most ramen soup. One of the better ramen stalls that is affordable and in a neighbourhood coffeeshop.
Taste wise ok for coffee shop price. But can't be compared to the usual Japanese Ramen shops. Conclusion: good for coffee shop standard.
Ginger pork belly with onsen egg  taste average and cos $5.50 is definitely value for money!

Soup lacks depth and Cha Shu was tasteless.
Gyozas was not bad.
Won’t be back again
The pork gyoza is delicious and I can taste the juice comin out from the pork filling.   The quality can be compared to Japanese restaurants quality. 👍🏻
Worth the price. You get what you pay for and more
Nice and affordable

Can see that the staff put a lot of effort into preparing the food (was observing one of them putting on the garnishing). The food tastes even better than the outlet in Canberra Plaza. Thumbs up!

Not to mention you can use CDC voucher here so it’s definitely worth it!

Hidden gem in an unassuming coffeeshop.

I had the Kurobuta Toroniku Ramen and Takoyaki. Portions were good and soup flavour was *chef's kiss*, not too overly salty (which is what you would usually find in other ramen stores) but at the same time very flavourful. The star of the ramen was definitely the meat, it melts in your mouth!

Will definitely be back again for more 😋

Ordered char-siu spicy miso ramen at S$9.50.

The broth tasted good and the ramen texture was Q enough.  It was not spicy but was acceptable.  It would have been better if the char-siu was tender / succulent.

Both the staff were very friendly and have good customer service.

Will return for other ramen :)

Yummy and nice to have in amk coffee shop
Will return and hope standard won’t drop
Ramen is good, soup broth is very nice! Price is on higher end, but overall great!
Ramen stall inside of coffee shop that offered tonkotsu, spicy and miso based ramen. The ramen is good and most importantly affordable. For a good bowl of ramen with less than S$10.

Ramen was cooked to perfection, and soup was nice too. Ordered the kurobuta ramen and the meat just melts in your mouth. Staff was good and friendly, definitely will be back. Do remember to give it a try!

*Too good, finished even before I took a photo haha

dude i love this place so much. i’m a student currently and it’s one of the most affordable and best tasting ramen for its price. meat is fresh and cut on site, noodles are springy oso. the guy running the stall is a real g as well. 10/10 recomment

Soup makes the ramen overall taste good. However serving-wise not very 'King'-like. Little serving of soup for takeaway order, more like sauce, half the ramen showing above the broth. Half an ajitama egg non-marinated, no flavor if consumed without soup. 2-small slices chasu, taste pretty good. The good tasting broth saved the dish overall. (Edit: Ordered Tonkotsu Ramen)
Broth is thick and nice.. will come back again
So good, excellent ,  the soup, noodle, meat... Fantastic..
Great quality. Clean, professional looking and good gyoza sides too
Come and try.. 👍

Will not patronise again. Delivery was late which is ok but at least have the decency to apologise when we called to check. At last, the food arrived 39 mins later and guess what. We ordered 2 combos and 3 a la cartes but was missing of 1 combo (calamari and 1 drink). The service is just wow.

Absolute garbage. Tried it before 2 years ago and it was pretty good. This time I thought to order the bowl. Paid 18 dollars for it because I decided to add extra unagi and beef (sold as roasted striploin). Food is just microwaved meat on iceberg lettuce. (Picture is as delivered)

Before ordering, I was wondering why this outlet had 2 stars, I thought it was maybe due to service so I just proceeded to order. But after eating, I now understand it’s actually the food standards. I always eat Makisan but this outlet’s sushi standards r pretty bad.. the sushi rice was like old stale rice n wasn’t pleasant and all the fried things i got such as the fried tempura enoki and baby potato chips were all soggy n not crispy etc. The sushi was also a mess everyt was falling apart :( Just a feedback for improvement! :)

We tried Maki-san from the Junction 8 store last year and it was better. We ordered Grab delivery from this store in the recent weeks and it seems that either the quality has dropped, or this store does not have the same standards as the Junction 8 store:

1) the rice was not up to standards and mushy.
2) the fried items were so hard that they might be leftovers from the previous day, and they just heated it up either by re-frying or using the microwave.
3) some of the non-fried food items might have gone slightly bad (because there is a smell).

We have forgotten to leave a review on Grab though.

Also, do note that the amount might be smaller than you expect.

I think 1 of the staff like over workload because he is the one packing grab order (i saw like large order)/cut sushi and he also the one taking order...
another one look like only know how to assembly the food... he just stand there and see only...

ORDERED FROM GRAB. MISSING DRINKS. MISSING RECEIPT.

SPECIFICALLY REQUESTED FOR MORE SOY SAUCE PACKETS. GAVE 2 PACKET FOR 2PAX.

WORKERS AT THIS OUTLET SLEEPING WHILE WORKING. DO NOT ORDER FROM HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
The staffs working there were so rude lol. Didn't even acknowledge our presence , just continue to do their own chores. Nani, customer service just atrocious.
Extremely slow.
Ordered their Pork Katsu Don, it was quite disappointing. Rice was soaked in their soy sauce which tasted salty and the pork cutlet was kind of dry.

Tried it on it opening day. Not bad at all!  Will come back to visit soon.

Walau...came back 9months later and tried their oyakodon.. the rice is watery fully soak in soya sauce...

Very bad attitude from the CHINA lady. The plastic bag was so undersized. The tray can’t even seat in properly. End up the sauce had flow out to the plastic bag. So stingy to give customers such a small bag.

Way below average food serve here. Worse than my medicore cooking. Pictures speak a thousand words so i straightforward. Hot plate korean chicken is bland. Hotplate egg pork katsu overcooked. Miso soup like lukewarm hot. Saving grace for the one star is the rice. My bad for not reading review as i assume their standard will be consistent across their franchise outlet but my complacent has caused a very unhappy dinner on a weekend.
absolutely worst “kimchi” fried rice, absolutely tasteless and even mushy.  pure rubbish, should have checked out the reviews before buying food from here.

Worst ever Korean food court food. Ramen was uncooked to out-of-packet texture. Udon is just soup, udon and 2 pieces of fishcake,half an egg. Service is bad. First and definitely last time eating here. If I can give -ve stars I would have.

Should have listened to the one star reviews that I saw when queueing, don’t bother trying honestly. Ate the kimchi stew and it was so sour and the tofu was the cheap yellow circular one that you get from NTUC for hotpot. Even the 7-11 ready to eat kimchi stew for $5.20 was more worth and tastier than this $5 one (that’s not ready made lol). The rice that came along w it was the star of the show, it was better than the stew and so soft.
Ordered from grab. Very disappointed. Rice is too soggy. Teriyaki chicken has no sauce & meat is too hard too. Pork katsu is too dry. Salmon is overcooked. One of the worse that I encountered.

Dishonest stall!
I confirm and double confirm (before and after collect my order) with the stall that I ordered chicken for Kimchi soup. But, in the end guess what? No meat at all inside the Kimchi soup.
Do not understand what I say like I say don't want vegetable
ordered from grab a saba fish & beef rice but only received the rice & beef.

I ordered the hotplate chicken,
End up I received the Rice without the chicken
Irresponsible and ill-mannered staffs.

Rude staff and lousy food with servings that is ridiculous. Ordered kimchi chicken soup that came with only 3 slices of chicken. Went to ask staff and she said "oh chicken is very little, u want more u add money if not then too bad" ridiculous

Very lively environment ,nice place to chill and estimating ice cream! Will try another flavour the extra round I am here. Friendly boss too! 5 stars!
Nice ice cream especially the mango sticky rice ice cream! Recommended to try out here. Hopefully can try out their waffles in the future!
Hands down one of the best Thai Ice Cream I have ever had. Good variety with unique combinations that will surely be a must to try for anyone who visits this place.
Very nice place to chill and drink! Do try out the coconut jelly it is awesome. Handmade by the owner!

It’s a amazing ice cream
Taste good . Must try👍
Super nice environment with great vibes! Prefect to bring your date here. Highly recommend 10/10 MUST TRYYY!!

Wah I tell you, the owner of the stall damn smart. It was a hot day and i was sweating like mad so i needed a desert to cool me down. The owner instantly introduce me to the coconut jelly before i could read his menu. I tried the 1st one and got a 2nd one immediately. Haven't had a jelly desert this good in a long time. Will definitely come back for more. THANK YOU!! 🥰
ice cream very nice. owner very friendly
Great place! Coconut jelly must try!
Special ice cream couldn't find such unique ice cream in sg! Only at MBK Thai. Ice cream better than shops at upper Thomson
Awesome
DELICIOUS
Great service and dessert was tasty :)
One of a kind ice cream. Nicest I’ve ever tasted.

restaurant name: NEW KORAT MOOKATA - 711 Ang Mo Kio Central
content: Very attentive service! We ordered ala carte and are satisfied. Recommended items Spicy Bulgogi, Black pepper beef, garlic pork belly and more...

restaurant name: NEW KORAT MOOKATA - 711 Ang Mo Kio Central
content: Very affordable and decent mookata. I am happy they have a few sets for us to choose. One set is enough for 4 to 5 pax.

restaurant name: NEW KORAT MOOKATA - 711 Ang Mo Kio Central
content: Good selection and spread… what’s best is the different chilli offered… especially the red ones simply hot!  Friendly staff & good service.  Value for money.    Had repeatedly visited the different outlets as well as home delivery during pandemic.  Try it out no regrets!

restaurant name: NEW KORAT MOOKATA - 711 Ang Mo Kio Central
content: all the staff working here are very attentive towards customers !! food is all at reasonable price. will definitely go back again if me and my friends crave for mooks !! 😋😋

restaurant name: NEW KORAT MOOKATA - 711 Ang Mo Kio Central
content: Go till stall owner saved my hp no. after I make reservation last few times. And even gave me discount voucher😂..... Where to find! So far,  best Mookata after few diff places I went & ate. Still prefer this one.

restaurant name: NEW KORAT MOOKATA - 711 Ang Mo Kio Central
content: Probably the BEST MOOKATA in SG....GOOD FOOD , GOOD MOOD!

restaurant name: NEW KORAT MOOKATA - 711 Ang Mo Kio Central
content: Nice and tasty food! Fresh and good. Worth the price, definitely will be back again!

restaurant name: NEW KORAT MOOKATA - 711 Ang Mo Kio Central
content:
First time having mookata, Surprisingly it's really good! You can either order ala carte or set. We went for set for 2 persons.
Fish & prawn is surprisingly fresh 👍 I love their pork, coz it's sliced to the best size and when u grill it'll be a bit crunchy.
Their Tomyum soup is not too spicy which I like.

restaurant name: NEW KORAT MOOKATA - 711 Ang Mo Kio Central
content: Excellent service,  affordable price food is fresh their spicy chilli is super hot  i love the tomyum  staff very friendly but need to wait for table if no reservation  worth waiting 5 +1 stars  ******

restaurant name: NEW KORAT MOOKATA - 711 Ang Mo Kio Central
content: Food’s not bad. Spent abt $12/person. Outdoor bbq + cool weather = best combi!

restaurant name: NEW KORAT MOOKATA - 711 Ang Mo Kio Central
content:
Extremely long waiting time. Ordered at about 7:20PM but even at 7:52PM the food is still not here yet.

EDIT: It's ok already the food was great thank you

restaurant name: NEW KORAT MOOKATA - 711 Ang Mo Kio Central
content: portion is just nice , pricing is reasonable, will definitely come back again !!!

restaurant name: NEW KORAT MOOKATA - 711 Ang Mo Kio Central
content: Food is nice and price is adorable. Great deal!! 🥰

content: Today is the second eating yummy

restaurant name: NEW KORAT MOOKATA - 711 Ang Mo Kio Central
content: Quite pricey for the small portion. Chili sauce is acceptable.

restaurant name: NEW KORAT MOOKATA - 711 Ang Mo Kio Central

restaurant name: NEW KORAT MOOKATA - 711 Ang Mo Kio Central

restaurant name: NEW KORAT MOOKATA - 711 Ang Mo Kio Central

Very satisfying meal. Not disappointed after multiple visits. Always up to expectation. Very good to satisfy cravings for Thai food in the neighborhood. The atmosphere was very cozy and comfortable. Thailand's standards, make me feel like I’m in Bangkok. Boss Kathon very smiley and friendly person who always makes happy to each customer. TKS

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER
content:
I have so many good things to say about this place. Went there for ala carte buffet dinner with my family of 4. To be honest, we did not have high hopes and we were not expecting us to order more than 2 rounds of food. But each dish that came, we finished it immediately. Portion size was just nice for 4 of us. We ended up ordering 4 rounds of food, a total of 11 or 12 dishes excluding desserts!! Durian sticky rice is a MUST order!!

All in all, the food here way surpassed our expectations. The chefs cook the dishes upon ordering. Will definitely recommend all to dine in here at least once.

Only thing is that the location is quite a “birds dont lay eggs place” 😆

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER
content:
The most annoying thing is the food take more than 30 min to serve us. And the durian sticky rice we ordered 2 but only come 1. We need to keep remind the staff which dish not served yet. Taste wise also not as great as described on social media.
Not near to mrt nor bus stop.
Definitely won't come back anymore.

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER
content: Very good food and reasonable price. High ceiling for indoor seatings. Service good too. Alfreso dinning.  Mask off!!!

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER
content: Hearty thai food with value for money portion and personalised services!

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER
content:
Reached at 8pm for our buffet, waited for almost 40min for the first snacks to be served. Chicken cutlet was served FROZEN. After almost 2 hours of waiting and they informed that they were closing, we decided to just forget about those dishes that weren't served yet.
The waiting time super SUPER long (we met a group of friends who were there at 6pm and by 9 they still got couple of dishes tat werent out yet), to make things worst, the pork and mussles weren't even fresh.
Drinks were not included in the buffet price so their strategy could be to drag time and make you order rounds and rounds of drinks and they won't even serve you all the dishes you ordered.
Absolute waste of time, you can get better tasting food at most hawker or Thai restaurants, we ended up paying $45 per pax and got full on drinking water.

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER
content: Had to wait for very long because our order was apparently cancelled and the waiter did not inform us beforehand, instead she watched and did not say anything. We later on went on to ask and she only told us then, I felt that the customer service was bad because of the lady. Food overall was good tho. We came at 6 and received our first dish at 7+

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER
content:
Dinner was open 6-9 for this restaurant. We came in at 6pm for their buffet and orders were sent at 6.10. waited till 7.45pm for our food not to be served yet. There was a table beside that made a scene for their food not served and they got theirs served when they were clearly at least 30min later than us to arrive. Did not want to cause a scene and left after paying for what we ordered based on ala-carte pricing.

Clearly a NEVER come again. Unless you have a great patience to wait 2hrs for your food to arrive when having a buffet. It was just a pure terrible experience

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER
content: Saw their Ala-Carte Buffet on Facebook and me and my family wanted to try. When we reached the restaurant we were told that it was full so we were sitted at the outdoor area, there are oil smoke coming out of the top of the building every 10 mins, and we got choked multiple times by it. We came at about 6pm and waited till 7pm and there is only chilli sauce on the table, we were served the fried squid, but we believe that it belongs to the other table beside us. We continue waited until about 7.30pm and i start to have gastric. And there are still no food on our table. Ended up we gave up and went off. Totally wasted all my family time for coming down. We kept asking for the food but the waiter kept pushing to us that they are short handed and there is also a lot of table waiting before us. Understand that, but if you are unable to handle this much customers then you should not have accept this many customers and even offer ala-carte buffet. And also, since you have advertisements on facebook, you should expect more customers coming right? This is my worst dining experience ever. Totally BLACKLISTED, come at your own risk. 😡

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER
content: A wide variety of dishes. We ordered garlic pork, honey chicken, deep fried sweet and sour fish, fried enoki, deep fried squid, green curry, phad Thai, broccoli. Portion is huge, price is reasonable, food is delicious. Phad Thai and green curry are my favs. Its not crowded as well. A rare gem indeed! Will definitely be back for more… Boss is friendly and service is great too!

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER
content:
one of the worst buffet ever.

2 paying adults can only order 1 x scoop of ice cream and prawn/crayfish.

Stingy af policy, most of the items on the menu comes with rice or noodles that is served compulsory.

Order takes long to come and staff needs many reminder to get it right.

1/10 star would not try again.

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER
content: Good soup base as clear tomyam

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER
content:
Though a little out of the way, am so glad we gave this place a try! For the very reasonable price, the mookata was great (particularly enjoyed the garlic chicken n beef)! The place was bright n airy, with more than adequate safe distancing between tables. The extremely high level of hygiene was also a huge plus for me - hot plate looked pristine, table was wrapped with a sheet before food was served, kitchen looked spick n span. Service was warm n friendly too. 10/10 would visit again!

Understand that patronage has dipped recently due to the surge in omicron in the community. Do support them! :)

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER
content:
Forgot to take picture of food but I'm posting the photo instead.

Three things I would like to talk about

1. Food and price

The food they served was fresh and delicious, especially their corn and marinated beef! Their bomb is the signature sauce, superb! I'll rank it my top three favourite sauce. My friends and I were praising the signature sauce profusely! Another innovation of them is to use butter to grill the meat, it was super delicious! Total price we paid after 10% discount was $52 for 4 pax. That's super worthy and even without 10%, it's still under $15 with your stomach full!

2. Cleanliness

Normally mookata place will be very dirty and unhygienic and oily, but they're otherwise, the whole environment is clean and not oily at all, table don't have any dirt or leftover food. Which we all were very pleased with.

3. Staff

Staff was super friendly and attentive, despite they have to attend to other customers, they will drop by to ask how's the food and if there's any assistance needed, and also offered to take picture for us. I will rate the service 10 stars if Google allows.

Even though the location can be very ulu, but it's really worth your time to walk in and try their food.

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER
content: The Thai Sea Bass was tastefully done, so does the mookata. But room for improvement is that they could ensure the fire of the Sea Bass and mookata was bigger, because the soup and gravy did not boiled at all...

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER
content:
**update : 2nd visit following last week’s. That’s how good the food was. Ambience is nice and chill. This time, I rem go take pic of the meat platter.

Service is good. Eric & team are friendly and very easy going.

Price : $28.80 for a meat platter for 2.

Food quality : fresh and big serving of meat. We had to push each other to finish them

Location : a lil isolated. But if u drive, it’s easy to find parking spots and it’s free. I think there are buses on the main road. Not too far in to walk

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER
content:
Great place for chilling with friends and good mookata 😋😋😋 Good quality beef & meat, even the butter is special!! No thristy feel after meal *burp burp*.
They serve variety of good beer, sweet fresh coconut and drinks too!
Tables are well spaced apart, toilets is very clean, they have handwash available ard e dinning area so need not go all the way to toilet. Totally value up!

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER
content: Food is nice, portion is big, boss is friendly, recommended 👍

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER
content: Great ambience & environment! Favourite place for my lunch time as it's only walking distance. The staff are cool 😊 Price also worth so much! So recommended 👍

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER
content: Been here twice... Good food & service:)

restaurant name: Lark Lark Mookata - GARDEN by the BEER
content: Service is great, good ventilation, good food and sauces,  not expensive price. Overall very good experience. 👍 Do come and try.

content: Like the vibrance.
Authentic Thai food with reasonable porting.. Yeast so good...

Decent cafe food. Outdoor area is pet-friendly, no pets allowed indoors. Their chicken waffle dish is worth a try! Can get pretty crowded with family and kids during dinner hours. Overall nice ambience.

Went on a weekday afternoon for lunch, not much crowd on a weekday. This cafe is quite spacious, have an outdoor and indoor seating area. I ordered the Chicken waffles Chicken was tender and delicious. The only complain was quite warm indoor, seem like the air-conditional is not working. Overall, wonderful place to chill and will visit again.

First time coming to this cafe and will definitely go back again. It’s such a nice and comfortable place to chill in..The food is nice & My family simply love all the varieties that we have ordered.. 👍🏻

Visited them on consecutive Sat and Sun! Service staffs are friendly and polite. Ordered their mushroom risotto and truffle fries for both days. It was really good! Amazingly, their coffee was a gem for us. We didn’t have high expectations on their coffee yet it was the star for our brunch. The sea salt caramel latte was da bomb! Not sweet yet very smooth and produce good aroma of the coffee. Will bring our kiddos back for the food!

It's new !!! Have outdoor (pets allowed) and indoor seating. Nice, clean, spacious and cosy. Ordered the all day breakfast set which was tasty and a cafe latte. Will visit again. Only complain was the need to improve their online menu with picture of the food!

We were here for the vet's appt and was so glad for a cafe that welcomes little friends. Better than that the food is very good. The pasta was fresh yet light. We also had the croffles with a very crispy chicken. I would have stayed longer for dessert but with the current humidity we have to come back when we can sit indoors without the little friend. Very good dining experience and good offering of wines too!
Went on a weekday for brunch, was a nice and quiet place to chill. Really enjoyed the pasta, which is a recommended dish . Quite a decent amount of seafood (scallops, prawns, clams) given 👍🏼👍🏼

A nice cafe tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Consists of both indoor air conditioned and outdoor seating suitable for pet owners which is a plus. Ample seating space inside as the restaurant stretches quite far in. Service is good and relatively fast. Decor is pretty and they have interesting pieces of furniture and contrasting wallpapers and panels for a varied effect. Tried their speculoos latte and Peter’s Pancake which is quite good 👍😊

Pretty good food and service at reasonable prices. The rosti waffles were very delicious, although we wish they could be even crispier. Pancakes are fluffy, scrambled egg is creamy, bacon is not too greasy. The melon tea smells very calming although the melon taste itself wasn't very strong. The online ordering platform was missing photos for several items, which made it hard to visualize what the dish would look like or the portion size.

Relaxing simple decor. The outdoor area is pet-friendly, lotsa cute dogs there! Indoors has plenty of seating. There is also a small garden area on the other end, with goldfishes swimming around in a little rock fountain.

Wow.. love this place for its space... wide spacious and hippy green ambience... Nice!

Simply the space and deco makes this cafe super comfortable to laze and chill in.

And I'm glad the great food goes well with ambience too..

Been here twice already. And their pastas and burger is great!

And their online loyalty program is definitely tempting me to go back a 3rd 4th time...
And its only tempting because food and ambience is great..

Would definitely be back many more times
