Found a nice new cafe. Great food, pet friendly and can cycle over the next round. Just a bit longer waiting time for a seat so better to book advance 🥂

My first attempt lunch experience.

Personally, I like their main menu items, the savoury items are not to my liking.

Overall dining experience is good. Nice place and ambient.

Strong contender to the existing upper Thomson road cafes like Columbus Coffee. Overall good brunch food, with nice platting and interior design. However could do better with their coffees (quite awful Americano). They should like consider providing better utensils (fork,soon) as the current ones are obviously of sub standard quality, similar to the ones we see in food court. It’s the non polished type and didn’t look or feel sparkling clean. Furthermore, all of their fork has stains between the grooves. Asked for change but all had stains. Ended up not using their fork. Lost my appetite a little. Chicken was great but wished they drained the excess oil before serving. The plate was filled with excess oil from the chicken midway during meal. Overall 3 stars with lots of potential for improvement.

Good food and pet friendly. Will visit again
Not bad for a 3 week old cafe 🙂

Update:
Went back on their 4th week of business with more friends. Waiting time improved.

A bright, beautiful, and spacious cafe with lots of greenery - reminds me of a laidback Balinese beach club/cafe. It has a open, pet-friendly outdoor seating area too!

Not your usual cafe fare, ordered a few unique items to try. They were all delicious!

This cafe is pretty near my place but first time trying. Reservations is recommended especially for weekends. Surprised that the indoor dining area was so big.
Found the price of the food quite expensive. Breakfast for 3 easily exceeded $100. They had a promo with Citibank but we had lots of problems with it as it couldn't accept applepay or if the credit card is stored inside the phone without the full 16 digits.
Order a few dishes to share, the one we enjoyed most is the Chicken and Croffles. Both croffles and chicken were well cooked. The Roffles platter was interesting because of the rosti waffles and also liked the way the mushrooms were cooked.
Service was very slow. Not sure if they forgot the order or what. The staff are all very young and had to call them over a few times to check the status of the dishes. The sides came almost last, the Spicy Chicken wasn't really nice it didn't taste Korean but the sauce more tasted like the Thai sweet Chili sauce. The Sakura Cream Tagliatelie also came late and serving was very small which left us unsatisfied.
Drinks were just pretty average.
Really need to improve on the speed of the food served. Not sure why the cafe wasn't even crowded at all early in the morning.
Lovely ambience and tasty albeit junky food, has a nice al fresco area for pet owners and their fur kids. Deep fried chicken and croffles very yummy. Fries were good too. We'll be back soon.

Loved the interior design and spacious. Also has an outdoor sheltered seating area. Our group of 3 had the croffles with fried chicken, the crispy chicken burger, the rosti with mushrooms & pork sausages, chicken tenders with korean spicy sauce - all of them were decently good. The letdown came in the form of their tarts where the crust was soft, and it just felt liked it was kept for too many days.

Visited the place on a weekday afternoon and was delighted that there’s no crowd. Huge space with ample seating area. Had the fried chicken, sakura pasta and the creamed corn (CCB).

The pasta and chicken were great but the corn was just alright. The sour cream was not a good addition to the corn. Drinks were on the expensive side too.

Didn't expect the food to be good, but it really is! The chef does fried chicken super well. We ordered the spicy Korean fried chicken it was out of this world. The CCB is also super yummy. The CAVA burger is huge but also very tasty. My husband and I were stuffed after these three dishes due to the generous portion of the CAVA burger. For the portion, the price is very reasonable. The downside is the waiting time, it took 40 mins for us to have the first side on the table. We had to approach the service staff to check on our order. The last dish, the burger took 1 hour. Service staff is quite friendly and attentive in terms of refilling water. Easy to get their attention.

The colors they utilized in their interior design were fantastic. The colors are black, white, and jade green. This is a fantastic mix. I went on a Friday night when it wasn't too packed. ⁣
⁣
To self-order, scan the QR code.⁣
⁣
𝐒𝐚𝐤𝐮𝐫𝐚 𝐂𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐦 𝐓𝐚𝐠𝐥𝐢𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 𝐒𝐆𝐃 𝟏𝟗.𝟎𝟎 ⁣
There are around 7 clams and 2 prawns. The platings are fantastic. The taste is bland, and the prawns aren't fresh. Tagliatelle from another Italian restaurant tasted better.⁣
⁣
𝐂𝐚𝐯𝐚 𝐁𝐮𝐫𝐠𝐞𝐫 𝐂𝐫𝐢𝐬𝐩𝐲 𝐂𝐡𝐢𝐜𝐤𝐞𝐧 𝐓𝐡𝐢𝐠𝐡 𝐒𝐆𝐃 𝟏𝟕.𝟎𝟎⁣
It's served with fries. This is the night's highlight. It's served hot, with super soft and fluffy buns and properly cooked chicken. The fries are one flaw; they taste bland and are not served hot enough.⁣
⁣
Total bill SGD 𝟑𝟗.𝟔𝟎 (Inc of Service Charge no GST)⁣
⁣
I'll definitely return to try some of their other dishes and review later. Meanwhile 2 stars for overall.

Here for brunch and dinner before. The otah bruschetta with grilled cheese is a must. Dinner menu is so-so, portion can be bigger even though the food is good. Love the place as it allowed furkid to accompany the hoomans under shelter. Nice cafe in a quiet estate.

May 2022: This cafe has really good potential. Love the space - bright and spacious. Food was also good. Order the Cava Burger (chicken thigh) and the wild mushroom pasta. Both delicious. I liked how the cheese was melted on the bun and the mushrooms in the chicken burger. There is an option to choose wagyu meat instead of chicken for $2 additional but I read about how good the fried chicken was and hence was not about to lose this opportunity to taste it! Was happy I didn’t! Anyway, I wonder how the burger which included a slice of pineapple would taste if I had chose wagyu!
5 stars service, staff very patient and polite. They have special food and drink. Delicious and satisfying. The pet friendly zone is spacious without worrying about rain or hot weather.

It's a spacious cafe with welcoming staff. Ordered the mentaiko fries - which was great for sharing. The salmon was well executed but we didnt really appreciate the rosti. Overall, its a nice find in the area.

Love the recommended dishes : Sakura Tagliatelle, Cava Burger. Food is really good, best part I can get to see beautiful fur patrons playing at the outdoor area. Didn't enjoy the lemon meringue tart though.

Great neighbourhood cafe with brunch food. Rather big space lots of seating outside and inside. We ordered the fried chicken and croffles, mentaiko fries and the mushroom risotto.

The fried chicken was really well battered, light and crispy and not oily. The coleslaw was also a really nice touch cause I’m not a fan of putting maple syrup on my savoury food. I would say a must try when you come here.

The mushroom risotto was everything you would want in a risotto dish. Simple and rice was cooked just right (slightly Al dente but cooked through).

Mentaiko fries were decent but nothing special.

You order and pay through a QR code which is always a plus.

We came here after seeing Daniel Food Diary’s review (though we know to take all the bloggers’ reviews with a big pinch of salt).

In a nutshell, the food here is decent. Just skip the desserts and the coffee (which is a collaboration with local Hook coffee but the cafe does not have a barista in house). After lunch, simply hop over to Thus Coffee which is just around the corner.

It’s nice, quiet and spacious spot for catching up over lunch. On a Monday noon, it wasn’t crowded at all. We had a nice far end spot where behind the doors is the backyard with a water well.

We ordered the otah bruschetta (sourdough), seafood aglio olio, fishy business (salmon), roffles platter and wild mushroom risotto. All of us rather enjoyed our respective main course.

Thereafter, we shared the ondeh ondeh cake, yuzu cheesecake and a warm apple crumble and also had cups of coffee.

The Apple crumble looked really funky and unnatural (take a look at the last photo) plus it was too sweet. The ondeh ondeh was nothing to rave about either. Coffee was served without inspiration (no latte art cos as mentioned, no barista) - it was just bland, normal coffee but at a barista price tag of $7.

Do reserve before going especially on a weekend as it can get packed.

First visit - Order didn't go through the online ordering system and we ended up waiting for awhile to realise it didn't go through. But technical fault, can't be helped. Anyway, reordered and our food came in adequate time. The spinach cream pasta was quite nice.

Second visit - Decided to try the otah, and sakura pasta. Interesting menu, both were alright.

In both visits, the drinks were slightly underwhelming. Nice atmosphere and staff though!

Went there for lunch recently for a family of 5. Overall food is nice and the service is good. However, and that is a HUGE but, the waiting time for the food is ridiculously long at 70 minutes after ordering!!

They did let us know that waiting time for food will be at 30 minutes or more. I think it is good that they let customers know that they need to wait. Hmm... but we waited for 70 minutes... AND even if there is lots of pre-warning or notification that food may take some time to prepare, waiting for 70 minutes for the food is not acceptable. They really need to look into streamlining the process or expanding the kitchen capacity to have faster turn around time.

Apart from that, please do make reservation ahead! With such a long turn around time from ordering food to serving, you don't want to be queueing outside waiting for table + waiting for food later!

The service of this place is good. There are many attentive young servers.

Food wise, it is tasty and unique. Some notable dishes are the Spinach Creatm Tagliatelle ($15), Seafood Aglio Olio ($15),  CCB (Cream Corn Bacon $9). We ordered quite a lot of other stuff too. Can look at the photos. Food wise, it is 5 stars.

Beautiful interior and very spacious, quiet on thurs evening. Food was veryyyy average. Melon tea by the pot, teabag type. Speculoos Cafe Latte was good because its totally not sweet at all though the name. Roffles Platter was very homemade... the roffles was not crispy and abit mushy. Sakura Cream Tagliatelle Pasta was below average, too much residue water from the seafood so the whole dish was very watery but the prawns were fresh. Seafood Aglio Olio was average. Fries with truffle & parmesan was good, very generous and huge serving, highly recommend. Visited this cafe to celebrate a friend's birthday so we also ordered a Lemon Meringue Tart which didnt taste fresh, below average.

Will recommend this place only for small bites and drinks. Good for a teatime break.

Great all-day brunch and coffee. I had the open faced wagyu sandwich and my wife tried the Rosti waffle platter which is gluten free. Both are well presented and tasty. It is cavernous inside with lots of space and good ambience. Pets are allowed in their outdoor seating, which is nice!

A really spacious cafe newly opened just months ago. Comfortable and cosy seating.. serving great pasta towards the Asian texture. Love❤️ the small portions available for the small eaters🥰 #msgreedysis #greedybuddiez

Was looking for coffee after dinner and stumbled upon this cafe. Big and spacious dinning area. There is also a huge alfresco dinning area where you can bring your pets along. Very comfortable environment. At around 9+pm was still quite crowded on a Friday nite.

Cafe pricing is on the pricier side for this order. Drinks are quite unique. Ordered the iced puffed rice cafe latte and a hot speculoos cafe latte.

Puffed rice went quite well with the latte adding some texture. Giving a cereal feel when it is soaked up with latte. Recommended to try. Speculoos latte is ok but hope that they can be more generous with the speculoos topping.
Cheesecake is average.

Nice place to chill after dinner. Will be back to try their food.

Came with hubby and kids on Sunday late afternoon . Kids and pets friendly . Quite a busy cafe at that hour so I think quite suitable for noisy kids to dine in . Ambience was great as I faced to a small tropical garden ! Love the plants especially for plant lovers . haha . I think chicken croffle was not bad-recommended . English BF and spam fries soso. Cappucino can be better ( quite bitter ) as I think the other cafe around the corner has better coffee . I was expecting better coffee

Great ambience, nice deco plus 5 stars for presentation! Melted nacho cheese dripped over the entire Wagyu burger served with fries. Lovely idea. Was expected a patty but it was yakiniku Wagyu but I'm not complaining cos it was well done. Impressive. Just didn't like that fries served was only warm, likely fried and put aside for quite a while. Waffle and chicken wasn't that fantastic according to my lunch companion. But still, decent for sure. Wash it all down with a pint for a wonderful dining experience.

Celebrated Father’s Day here. Coming here to try the food because it’s recommended by danielfooddiary. The food is fantastic. We tried the otah bread, ice latte, croffle chicken & seafood pasta. Price wise is $20 ish per pax. Ambience is good too.
Pet friendly cafe in a quiet neighborhood. Quality of food is better than expected but selection range not wide- wish they have more desserts choices~

Had the mushroom linguine, mentaiko fries and spinach pasta. Enjoyed all of them. Portion size was good, mentaiko was very flavourful and had a torched flavour. Mushroom linguine had a generous amount of mushrooms and they were cooked well without too much of an earthy taste.

Could improve the acoustics in the restaurant though as there were not many people but it was very noisy. Good place to hold events but if it's so echoey it will not be conducive.

Do check out the well. It had a few dead leaves though. And the door to the back garden was locked.

Also there was a super smiley server, she was really cheerful, wish all servers were like her.

Good cafe, good choice of items/menu and friendly staff. Prices very acceptable for this area as well. We had the chicken croffles and the otah bruschetta, both tasted really good. Don't know what it is, but it's just missing the x-factor for a five star review.

Food is ok and environment is good. Nice outdoor place for people who wants to bring their pets over to chill.

This places serves western food. Can get pretty crowded and noisy during dinner times.

A little far from MRT, but this place is worth the distance.

Will definitely come back here for more next time!
Food is very yummy, and place is very bright and roomy. The croffle and chicken was a big hit with everyone, and I loved the chicken burger as well.

C.C.B was my favourite dish! Head down to the cafe to find out what I mean 😉

Attracted to the amazing ambience of this cafe! I highly recommend all of you to have a sense of it too!

- Food; EXCELLENT!! ⭐️⭐️⭐️ The food display was exquisite, the food taste just as pleasant as how it looks (I took video instead of photos, cant post it)

- Chill outdoor; can bring your pet along, I saw one doggo 😍 (it’s open 24/7 according to one of the bosses)

- Cozy indoor; the furnishing of the cafe felt like I was in a HIGH END restaurant with affordable food, there are high chairs, sofas, and other different types of sitting to choose from (closes at 10-10.30pm)

Location: Pet friendly cafe located near a vet, a small park, catsmart, petlovers, and a nearby cafe to chill with your pooches after having a walk at lower pierce reservoir, ample parking.

Cafe: Came here a few times. Cafe is very spacious for small and big groups but price wise is a bit on the high side. I find a cup of cappuccino at $7 quite exp. Got the caramelized (coffee with a whip of caramel at $8). Food is acceptable & bug portion but not so fantastic. Service is very good, staff will immediately ask a choice of cold or warm water, and provide a water for the pooch too. We'll come back for small bites and some drinks.
Interesting place to dine at a hidden corner. It has a “secret” garden that’s quite cool too with mist timing. Food is nice and ambiance is cosy, clean and spacious. 👍🏼

The cafe is very Instagramable , it’s nice for chill out n photo n meeting up with friends , beer r very affordable price .
Owners r friendly couple
Chicken is too small portion size can be improved, maybe add more vege to make it feel more worth it , we prefer smth that is bigger portion. Coffee is a little bitter , can be improved.
The English breakfast cauliflower is not really fantastic, it will be better if u can change it to mash potatoes or sweet corn or potatoes salad . The bread is too thin n small it will be better if u guys can change to a thicker one . Taste wise is perfect . Like a 4 star restaurant. Thumbs up owner .

Nice and spacious cafe in the quiet Sembawang Hills with friendly staff. Seems to be pet-friendly with many customers with dogs out front.

Had typical cafe food with some interesting twists e.g. Nacho Cheese on Wagyu Burger, Rose Matcha Latte. However feels slightly pricy, even for a cafe, (~$20), especially if you order cmmon cafe food

Would recommend to try if you're in the area, and get the more special foods on the menu (like Otah Bruschetta) instead of things like the typical American Breakfast set.
Spacious restaurant with a modern deco. Attentive and prompt service. Good food.with little pleasant surprises.

Pet-friendly place. I wouldn’t say it’s fantastic or novel but I tried it because of the good reviews. The otah bruschetta was thin and laid on top of a slice white bread. It’s quite hard to cut and dry. In terms of spiciness and taste, I’ll rate it 2/5. In the end, i grab it with my hands and eat it. I don’t think it’ll order it again because it’s not worth $18 (add $2 for cheese topping). Coffee is so-so ($7 up)

Went on a Thursday evening and the space was quiet and serene! A lot of space between tables which made it a plus for an already dog friendly establishment. Service staff were attentive and responsive. Ordered three mains: Sakura ebi tagliatelle, seafood aglio olio and a small breakfast plate, found them all to be nice! Hot latte was also good! But apple crumble was very disappointing cos it was soft and mushy, hence minus one star!

This is a halal cafe which serves western food. The set up is simple and prices are reasonable for the portions. I had the chicken cutlet with pepper sauce on a hot plate. It was served with a good portion of mashed potato which had the sauce in an indentation in the middle. Nice presentation.

This place sits where Ren² chicken rice used to be. A hidden gem. Acceptable portions at affordable prices. My personal favourite is the black pepper pasta. If you're looking for the 'atas' fare, maybe go elsewhere. Food is served up expeditiously and whilst hot and steamy!
Don't take my word for it. Try it for yourself!

lamb chop was delicious and staff are friendly. only nit is the hot grill plate has ridges which makes cutting the lamb chop difficult. also the lamb chop gets overcooked on the grill plate. plus side of it is your food stays hot longer. perhaps have a tiny discount (something like 20-50cents discount) for customers who opt for a less premium normal plate. that may entice customers who want a no frills chop/steak for good price to order the chops/steaks.

Excellent service and affordable place to eat . Staff was very polite and explains to us regards the Halal certificate. Food was great , taste like the high class restaurant. Highly recommend place to dine in.  I will come back again to try out the rest of the menu.

Spring chicken was very good, my children and my favourite. The skin is crispy and meat is juicy... like the fresh vege at the side. Tried a few times and the consistency is there.
Sunday night crowd comes in around 630pm... Good to come slightly earlier if there's young kids to feed.

1 Star - Lots of Fries🤔
Very disappointing when being given 2 halves of 2 different proportion sizes half spring chicken when I ordered 1 whole spring chicken😔
Gave me a dry out half spring chicken🙄
If there's no whole spring chicken, then remove from your menu. Offer buy 2 halves with $3 off🤔
Still have to pay extra 30¢ for your advertisement box🧐
Fantastic food, great service, very clean and hygienic makan place and reasonable price. Staff is friendly, owner is very welcoming. Food variety and quality , 2 thumbs up !!! MUST TRY !!!

Aglio Olio was spicy and superb!
Root Beer Float came with a generous scoop of vanilla ice cream, bigger than A&W.

Could’ve improved on the physical menu for better first impressions (it was an aged and flimsy laminated sheet)

Dear Patrons, thank you for your support😀 I appreciate the two Stars review from you guys.
Thank you for the understanding and we will definitely improve to suit your taste buds! We welcome you back and get 1 free meal on us😉

Very nice Seafood Marinara Spaghetti, little bit of spicy, thats what i m looking for. Love it.
Polite waitress and waiter. Clean and neat place.
Food is pretty average but price abit ex for such standards. Fries abit tough, chicken chop abit dry. Hope they improve as they are newly open.

Food is above average. beverages could be improved as the drinks we ordered were all too "light" in taste. Milk tea came out really looking like milk, very mild taste of tea. Calamansi ...same issue...mild taste of calamansi.
Fries both the original and sweet potato is good, home style as all the small bits and pieces are served to you, no waste!
For their food prices, just about right as they operate as a standalone cafe

Homely family business that serves up amazing food. Uncle mentioned that they only use fresh chicken and coconut for their curry chicken. Definitely could taste the difference. Opens during CNY, will come back again.

Had the spring chicken and chicken cutlet with rice. Price quite reasonable though on the tad high which can be understood due to business expenses
Will visit again.

Been here a few times. Go for their curry chicken (enough to share for 2 small eater), salad (well balanced texture and taste; good for sharing between 2 to 4) and their fried rice and spaghetti / noodles dishes. Give their burger a miss (chicken one was made of minced meat patty that is mushy and taste bad; It would be better if the meat is the chicken chop or cutlet type).
The food and service is top tier, nice environment,and affordable as well. 10/10 would recommend 😊
Food's pretty good... Too bad we didn't get to try the spaghetti we wanted due to ingredients unavailability

Had tried a few times ever since I chance upon this makan place. They have recently come up with a new dish "Tom Yam Pasta" and it's delicious. The chicken satay is absolutely tasty and tender, satay sauce is perfect. Not forgetting the Root Beer float 🍺 , which is my all times favourite drink. The staffs are nice and friendly, it makes you relax and your meals enjoyable.

I was quite excited to try this new Western food shop. However, I was fairly disappointed. The food was pretty tasteless. And eating the salmon felt like eating erasers. The price is pretty high too. On the bright side, the staff were all very friendly. Hope that they can improve on the standard of their food.

Food is decent, environment chill and relax with friendly staff.
A little expensive for the food otherwise perfect
Good food generous potion, friendly cashier aunty. Thank you for the food 🙏
The meat is huge, and the food is great tasting too..price is affordable as its a cafe in hdb estates

Newly opened in Jan of 2021. I stuck with the classics - chicken cutlet and fried rice. It's a very classic Singapore western food taste profile. Not amazing, but not bad either. A bit salty for me, but I'm sure the general public should be ok.
One of the Best hawker-style Western Foods I've tasted so far!

Yummy and crispy Spring chicken. The chicken chop on hotplate is nice too.
Worth to try!
Affordable good tasty western food
Nice cozy place to have food and drinks. A great place to catch up with friends!
Friendly, good services, nice food and nice environment. 👍🏻
Fantastic food and service. Good value for money
Worth the money..
Very very Nice so delicious
Nice.Delicious food!
Nice foods, i like very much
Great place!!
Affordable and delicious!
Rice a bit hard

We were there on a Saturday at about 7pm. There was a short but constant queue. Order was fast and wait time reasonable.

We ordered the Hot Plate Combo Grill, which has beef, pork, chicken, bacon, sausage, coslaw, egg and fries. Fries and pork were quite good and the rest were pretty normal. But for $10, there is really nothing to complain.

I m not sure what the hype is all about. There seems to be always a queue. I ordered the chicken chop and it comes with a small portion of chicken. Taste is normal. Old school condiments eg. French fries,coleslaw, baked beans and a tiny leaf of lettuce. At $6 is about on the low side but with smaller portions, that is about right pricing. Overall can eat if around this area and feel the urge.

This western stall has a 古早味to their food. It’s like old style western food they served back in the days. The chicken chop and gravy was quite tasty. Coleslaw was quite nice too…it had pineapple gave quite a good flavor I think. The queue is very long for weekend dinner times though. I waited for over 30min. Not sure if it is really worth queuing up for, but worth a try if the crowd is not too bad.

Ordered takeaway. I like how they give a buzzer even for takeaways.

I got their chicken wing rice. The chicken wings were good. Well marinated without being overly salty. It comes with a sunny side up egg and coleslaw as well. I have to say their rice portion is quite big. But the disappointing thing is that the rice served is just plain rice. I was kind of expecting it to be have some flavour because there are some stalls which offer chicken wings with flavoured rice like those you get from chicken rice stalls. But overall worth the value.

Meat quality & taste of beef, chicken and pork is good. But their combi grill is extremely not value for money :( - makes u pay more for 3 small cuts of meat which I personally feel adds up to less meat than if u just order regular chicken/pork chop…

Finally I decided to queue for this, pretty amazing as the queue is long but the system is good.  I got my food in a short time.  The friendly aunty that took the order is very organized.

I have ordered pok chops and chicken cutlet for my girl.  Well the pork chop meat is thin  but I felt is enough for us.

My girl said is delicious and couldn't finished hers.

For a 6 sgd chicken chop
And a 6.50 pork chop
Portion is decent huge.
Recommended.

Fish and Chip, Pork Chop, chicken cutlet you won’t go wrong. 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
Affordable western food in AMK Central.
Sometime the waiting time can be slightly long due to their popularity.

Tastes above average hawker western food.. the portion really worth the price paid.. use shopee pay to get even further discount!

Update 08/05: this stall tastes so much better than the one at S-11 food court that used to be quite famous until their standard dropped...

This old school western food stall located in AMK Central Market, has been around for years. They sell affordable old fashioned western food like chicken cutlet, fish & chips, mixed grill with sides baked beans, fries and salad.

Their mains are served in generous huge portion, covering almost half the size of the plate, which you can see from the pictures. Fried with a crispy outer layer, the meat within is thick and filling too. It brings back wonderful childhood memories of myself, eating plates of oversized chicken cutlet with same cheap side dishes like canned beans and coleslaw.

Their food is wallet friendly and definitely worth the try.
Chicken cutlet $6, was tender and juicy. Well fried with a crispy crust. Sides were standard western fare.
Not bad western not the best but still good reasonable priced tasted not bad

$6 or $6.50 for chicken chop and fish & chip! Two big slices with generous side dish. Fish was still hot after 15minutes, and Pork Chop tender. (Menu no lamb)

Queue is long, but serving is fast too.
Hilarious to hear the lady boss keep barking orde to the cook (husband?) haha. Will definitely go again.

Takeaway the famous pork chop AND LOOK at the value for money omgosh it was 2 big pieces of pork chop and sides for $6.50. cheaper than Aston's !! It was still nice even though dabao a bit cooled down
Went around 8pm on a sat and still had a slight queue but didn't have to wait long. Good plate of old school western food. Nothing special though.

Hands down one of the best western food out here in singapore, possibly the best in Ang Mo Kio. The chicken was cooked to perfection with the meat being both tender and juicy, you wouldn’t think any chicken thigh could be this good. Cherry on the top, the skin was crispy bare in mind it was takeaway. Definitely coming back for more chicken.
Generous portion and value for money western food. Definitely worth coming back for different dish as their menu has a variety of selections
super nice chicken chop and pork chop. unbelievably tender! the auntie is damn fierce to the uncle who is cooking tho cause of the long queue 😂
One of my favorite western food places. Affordable and taste great! There's always a queue but kitchen is quick with orders.
ordered chicken cutlet, thin crispy coated.  coleslaw very fresh and well made, bit stingy on qty..overall food and presentation is good, cutlet well seasoned.

I ordered a plate of chicken chop, my daughter a plate of pork chop.
Portions are big and generous.
Sauce is dilute and I have tasted some better ones
Meat is good.
Overall good.  Not exceptional though, my fussy taste buds tell me :-)

Old-school comfort Western food best eaten on the spot. Tried the black pepper beef slices with rice and found the beef succulent and not too tough. The black pepper sauce was not too overwhelming and paired well with the beef. The buzzer system also makes ordering and waiting very orderly so overall a very pleasant experience 👍👍
Good western stall to get some pork chop.
Chicken cutlet and fish and chips are nice. Old style stall from the 80s but now updated with larger size today. Good stuff.

Nice western foods, the line is long and so does the wait. We had porkchops $6.50, portion is big for two persons, meat is tender and juicy, french fries are crispy and coleslaw is nice too. Will be back to try others.
Generous portion, reasonable price, delicious, short wait and friendly service, what more could one ask for.

I had chicken chop today , was quite impressed with the taste , when I cut into it , it's so juicy and the marination was awesome . I could taste the flavour sips into the chicken,  oooh lalalala , it's so delicious!!

I love the coleslaw,  it has pineapple in it, my favourite😋😋 yummy.

I do not stay around  Ang Mo Kio but whenever I' m nearby , I will definitely go for their chicken chop .

Another recommendation is their spaghetti beef bolognese , don't miss it 👍👍

Hope this review , will make you feel tempted to try their great food😋👍.

It's worth to travel to Ang Mo Kio

Stay safe , Healty and Happy Always .

Hi everyone, I am shirley, the daughter of the cook of vincent western food. My mom is the auntie taking order. Recently, just this year two of my parent's long term employee are no longer working for us (>20 years). Vincent western food is lacking manpower and it has been difficult to find employees and my parents are very stressed and tired with the workload. If you have any one that wishes to work, please direct them to me and contact me at 96575643. PLS let vincent western food continue! If we are still unable to find employee, my parents will handle the stall themselves which mean longer wait time and possibly shorter opening hours due to old age. we seek your kind undertstanding.
Good Western mix grill ,changeable options if you do not eat beef

Ordered food through Deliveroo, food was pipping hot when arrived and it was delicious. Surpassed my expectations for it's pricing. Had to go out of my way to recommend it here. Spring chicken was tender and well seasoned, fries was fried till perfection, beef was tender and coleslaw was super refreshing with chunks of pineapples.
food is nice & cheap, this plate cost S$4.80~
Best old school western food ever eaten, at hawker, succulent pork chops, 6 stars
Your old school western food! We love it so much and will coem back here again... Hope to see more new menu in the future  😄😄😄

this is one of the best western food i've eaten! they serve restaurant style food in a hawker centre, and the food is really worth the money! the food is not very expensive and the portion is really reasonable, i would recommend trying this!

u better ramp up order management...got high tech ordering tags still can forget it order for more den 30 mins take away...written down but mind went blank..how nice it is ,we won't be patronising  again
Nice food
Food not fresh. Meat very hard teeth also want to drop. Ask for another pkt of chilli owner face turn black.
Well marinated, juicy and soft for Hot Plate Steak, worth to wait and fast servings.
The aunty serving was friendly and the food was big in portions, worth the money spent.
Super value for money western food!! Food service is friendly and prompt!
Worth for repeated visit.. price below average, quality above average..
Decent western food and at an affortable price.
Reasonable price
The price is slightly expensive but the staff is friendly.
Decent Western Food
The prize is reasonable
Nice pork chop
Standard drop very dramatically
Food is good

(Translated by Google) Yummyyy

(Original)
Yummyyyy

Ribeye steak is cooked just nice between rare and medium, very juicy and tender. I give high credit to its black pepper source! Kids’ always like their cheesy fries, must try their cheese source! Big portion and combinations of variety of sides. Really money worth choice.

Hawker stall with really good western food run by a bunch of hainanese folks. We had the chicken chop and pork chop, and they were very well done and tasty!! I would also recommend the fish & chips for its huge portion size.

The fries were crispy, and the garlic bread was delicious too! Very value for money, and top notch quality western food.

Best chicken cutlet and chop in Ang Mo Kio, some says North east as well. Great seasoning, generous portion and fast service. The lamb chop are good too! Highly recommended if you are around the area.
Still that good ol' taste. Well marinated and juicy but their chicken chop seems to have shrunk in size. While the chicken cutlet now are as big as the plate it came on.

Pan fried local style, the chicken chop comes with brown sauce, baked beans, coleslaw, fries and a slice of garlic bread. The pork chop is also quite tender. Portions are hearty, but the taste of the chops can be better.
After I read online that this uncle from 711 S-11 opened stall here. I've always wanted to try it for myself. This smell .. this taste... Brings back memories! The coffee a bit meh though...

A place where I grew up with. Definitely to see them back after closing down at the previous location. The store offer cheap and affordable western food like Chicken Chop, Fish & Chips from $6.50.

There are other food stores to check out that the kopitiam too, like the famous BCM.

Rasa Sayang has a special place in my heart as a food stall serving Western food in Ang Mo Kio. One of my favourite places for Western food in Ang Mo Kio. I like the salmon fish it serves. The popular dishes here with most people are: Chicken Cutlet, Chicken Chop, the Chilled Ribeye Streak. Non-aircon coffeeshop environment.
Old school western fare. Chicken cutlet is still good, chicken chop was too dry.
This stall has not changed after so many years. The price is still reasonable and portions are huge! Every time I am in the area, this is my top option!

Food that brings us back in time. Tried the chicken chop that is tender and marinated just like we do it at home, old school flavours. The chilled ribeye was correctly done(medium well) tender and juicy, the cost at $13.90, no frills steak at its best. Waiting time approx 15 to 20 mins, very reasonable with the crowds and takeaways.
The famous s11 western food at amk central 711 is here at 347. Came to have a quick dinner. Taste still about same. And maybe due to cost cutting measures, portions have decreased.

I can imagine the fuss with wanting to taste nostalgia. Other than that, I'll say,  take your money elsewhere. We were there on a weekday evening and there were about 5-6 customers ahead of us in the queue. We got to order in about 10 minutes and I'd have to commend the kitchen for delivering at such record speed. After ordering, we waited for about 8 minutes before our orders were ready. The Mushroom Sauce Chicken Chop ($6.50) had a piece of flabby skin that was not charred to extract at least 30% of the fat. It was just cooked and not actually the way I prefer to eat my chicken skin. The piece of chicken, although tender and juicy, had quite a fowl-like odour which reminded me of chicken chops at cook houses. I have no idea how this store used to taste like, but I do not like their style of cooking now. Fries were just tasteless, not salty and blah. The slice of bread although nicely toasted, had the taste of Planta which I hate. The Grilled Salmon ($9) was under seasoned with a strong fishy taste but the doneness was just right. It was soft within and melted in the mouth, not overdone and flaky at all. The worst of the lot would have to be the Butter Garlic Lamb Chops ($12). We got a sinewy cut of the meat and the butter garlic compound was an absolute horror. It was made of Planta margarine and dried rosemary..nothing in it had the taste of butter or garlic! All in all, it's great if you miss the taste of 90's style western food at an inflated price. Otherwise, it's just cheap ingredients, canned beans and junk sold at a premium price. I could walk over to the coffeeshop next door and get a chicken chop at $5. Perhaps our taste buds have evolved and we're now spoilt for choices when it comes to customizable fancy sides like sauteed mushrooms, roasted sweet potatoes, mac n cheese and the like.

The “S-11” western food is finally back! Glad to see the entire family back in the stall as we have been patronizing this stall since my secondary school days.
Try the chicken cutlet. It’s so soft and nice! Hope to see fried rice back on the menu.
Nice old school western food
Ordered the chicken chop for takeaway. Have patronised this stall many times. Chicken chop with mushroom sauce is not bad. Old school kind of taste. Generous with chilli sauce. Service is good too.

Good point is that meat is tender. However, taste-wise is just okok. Perhaps because the chicken chop is marinated more salty, the spaghetti was made diluted and bland (to the extent that the flour taste from pasta was so obvious and the spaghetti tasted amateurish though texture was al Dante). Auntie was also very irritated when I tried to ask if they had alternatives to tomato base... For $7.30, it did not feel worth nor did the portion make up for it.
Great food, love the pork cutlet. Lady boss very friendly

To myself, considering 7SGD for an order of pork chop or chicken cutlet is pretty high cost in heartland of AMK Ave 3, both meals taste and presentation do not possess the weight to fetch the amt. The pork chop is dry luckily the mushroom help that, the coleshaw is soggy and the tomato bean has blunt taste.

Glad that they reopened. The serving size is still as huge as I recall. The chicken cutlet is tender and the amount of bread crumbs used was just right. It gave the cutlet just the right amount of crunch that wasn't too hard like some other places. Would be coming back again. Currently they only have the spaghetti option. Hope they bring back the fried rice soon.

My 1st visit to the famed Rasa Sayang Western and I ordered the steak with mushroom sauce. I asked for medium and it came out perfectly done and taste factor was definitely very good for coffeeshop standards! Will definitely be back to try other dishes!

Perfect old school western pork chop, the grilled taste was not overpowering and blend well with mushroom brown sauce. No wonder it’s always sold out!
Was so good that I’m commenting in midst of eating 👍🏻
friendly uncle too, can see whole team take pride in serving a good plate of food to you.

had the chicken chop which made rasa sayang western food famous.. comes with fries, baked beans, garlic bread, coleslaw on the side.. but the winner here is definitely the brown sauce... comforting food and value for money..

If you stayed or studied around Ang Mo Kio Central area, you should be familiar with Rasa Sayang Western Food that’s located at the S-11 coffeeshop next to Jubilee Square

A few years ago, the stall was taken over by a group of young owners, and well, the standards dropped drastically.

I’m really excited that the original owners have reopened at a coffee shop opposite AMK Hub, about 10-15 minutes’ walk away!

While most people ordered their value-for-money chicken cutlet, I ordered their Chicken Chop ($6.50) which is probably one of the best old school Hainanese western food I’ve ever eaten.

While the sides like fries, baked beans and even the slice of garlic bread is nothing exciting, the star of the dish is their mushroom sauce.

Perfectly balanced, not overly salty, with hints of chicken stock and slices of soft button mushrooms, this sauce makes the long queue worth it.

Chicken was grilled well and lightly charred to add a layer of smokiness that compliments the sauce.

P.S. Don’t waste the sauce, use the fries to scoop up every bit of it! 😋

Quite satisfied with the huge piece of chicken cutlet.  Nicely cooked.  I was the last customer at 8.30pm today.  Several others were turned away as the food was sold out way before the closing hours.  Queued for about 15 mins.  Waiting time for food was about 10mins.

#rasasayangwesternfood

Went over to try during lunch time. Conveniently located, it is opp amk hub, and the way over is all fully sheltered.
Tried their ribeye steak and is very happy with it! The meat is really tender and was cooked to medium rare ask requested! The mushroom sauce goes perfectly well with it as well~ Love the fries as well! Dipping it in the baked beans sauce. The only item that was not up to par was the garlic bread. It doesn't have much garlic taste and it was rather sandy instead of crispy.
This is definitely a place that I will be going back to if I am around the area.

One of the iconic western food stall in Ang Mo Kio, they used to be at the S11 coffeeshop at block  711 for quite some time before taking a short break and they are back in operations at a coffeeshop walking distance away from their previous location. Decided to check this place out since i was in Ang Mo Kio. The coffeeshop was packed with people and it wasn't easy for me to get a table.

Ordering was pretty straight forward, you will be issued a buzzer once you have paid. I ordered the chicken chop which was SGD$6.50. Food was ready in no time. Portion wise, seems quite little. My chicken chop was a little tough. It was seasoned well as certain parts tasted extremely salty.

Overall, quite disappointed with the overall experience. There are many western food stalls outside that are better in terms of quality. Dont think that it is worth the hype.

The taste is almost 90% similar to last time.. but it's good enough for me to give 5 stars.. maybe give auntie/uncle warm up for like 1 month then the taste will be 100% the same..

Very value for money and nice.. but expect around 30min wait during meals time..

The distance is the same as walking from amk hub to the s11 coffee shop..

Please do support the uncles and aunties
Great crispy chicken cutlet with good portion for money. If you are alright with waiting at least 10 minutes for really good coffeeshop western food then you should, nay, MUST try this.

Great value for money, strongly recommend a visit when you are in AMK. Run by Hainanese family.

Opens at 11:30, come abt 11:15 to beat the queue.
Pork chop is tender and taste is still as good when it used to be at S11. Fish and chip is great too. 👍

Great food from both outlets but the one at the s11 got some rude stall assistant ,ask him what time they opening(I was there at 12pm) ,he just no open rudely,n shoo me away ,from that day ,I just go to the one opp the AMK mall ,where the old stall assistant moved to n for the food ,go for the sunny egg fried rice, spring chicken n both the chicken n pork chops r great
Previously in AMK central s11. Now reopen here. I would say its the best chicken chop ever.  Great sauce and tender chicken. 6.50 and its worth it.
Value for money. Previously at S11 amk Central. This hainanese western stall is a classic example of simple Western  food goodness. Uncle and Aunty still same same.
Chicken cutlet is the best value for money. It is super crunchy and the portion is so big I could never finish in one sitting. The rest like chicken chop and fish and chips are ok only.

Chicken chop is indeed nice, meat is juicy and tender, worth the four star rating I am giving. Not five star, because of the pricing, which is abit on the steep side. $7 for chicken chop, not many people can accept that pricing.
One of the old skool type of western food ...been eating since young where they are formerly @ S11  blk 711 coffeeshop & now after @ blk347
The original rasa sayang. Grew up eating this. All the staff are white haired and experienced. Good stuff cannot bluff

The signature is the pork chop with mushroom sauce. Sauce is good and the pork is also grill nice and fresh and so it taste good

Order fish and chips and lamb chop before. Both are not bad but still lose the pork chop.

The fries are quite bland with no salt taste so recommend to add cheese

Portion are huge and most cannot finish for most people
Taste of memory, for those who visited the stall when it located at Amk S11 Beside Jubilee Sq.
Fried chicken wings freshly cooked. You can see the golden brown of the crispy crust!

Came to this highly recommended Western food stall in AMK.

Ordered a Chicken Cutlet. Waited for only around 5 mins. Super fast.

The chicken cutlet is huge, probably as big as an adult's face, and it comes with coleslaw, baked beans, French fries and a toast. Have to say that it's very worth the $7 I paid for it.

Nice crunch to the cutlet and its not too dry, just under-seasoned. It made me wished for some gravy or sauce to dip the chicken into.

Overall, not too bad for the price I paid.

Nicely lit stall with an even nicer uncle recommending me what to order. Ordered the ribeye. Food came fast and presentation was good compared to typical hawker western. Taste very good for the price you pay. Will be back to try others.
The fries are great. It has this soft potato flavour. The fried fish is huge! Had to share with my son. All in all good old school western food

Food is good. But owner attitude is bad. Tartar sauce diluted but still gave little then ask for more. Said need charged $1 when is so watery. Then some buyers haven't claim their food. The owner shouted say who buzzer keep beeping come and collected in a very rude attitude. Nice food but bad attitude. Just caz biz good doesn't mean should be cocky.

It has been in Ang Mo Kio  since the 80s. Used to be located in the food centre beside Jubilee square. They have now moved to a coffeeshop recently at BLK 347 after a break. Their chicken cutlets and chops are still the most popular. Old school, affordable with a good portion!
Traditional western food. Love their cutlet
just a simple old school western meal. will prefer it to be less salty.

Lamb is overcooked, over salted. Pork is drier than the desert. Chicken thigh is basic, salty. Fries are soggy, presumably big batch, then it cooled down. Onion rings are under. Chicken wings are bland. I don't recommend.
Good portion of food, ordered beef steaks, serve with toasted bread, Cole slaw, bake bean, tomato, only at $13... will definitely visit again.
Just a normal Fish and Chips, nothing astounding. Fries quantity was pathetic, should have provided more.
Ordered fish and chips at 5.50. The aunty told me to wait 7min to collect as there are a few orders in front of me. The fish and chips is normal standard. Probably could have provide more fries.

Food is okay. Really like their mash potatoes but by the time evening comes, the mash potatoes is out of stock. So, if you want to eat mash potatoes, must come earlier. Service still okay la, lady boss sometimes polite and nice.

Have ordered takeaway Fish and Chip and Pork Chop from this stall many times this year. The portion is huge for the price. A set meal come with french fries, baked beans, coleslaw, garlic bread, lemon and sauces. I avoid ordering fried rice as it was cold and hard. On Sundays evening, they sell out fast. Must go before 7pm! Take note that the cashier auntie maybe a little rude sometimes.

I haven't been here for many years... But I definitely know standard has dropped and the famous fish and chips now tastes different, their garlic bread was hard and dry I didn't even know I was eating bread?!... Hope they can get back their original standard...

Used to love their fish n chips few yrs ago. But now the fish a bit fishy. Like that their fries r those thicker zigzag ones, the coleslaw taste good, nice garlic toast (fresh loaf kind). The fish n chip comes with a big slice of lemon. For $6.5, the portion is fair

This stall has no name, so its "signboard" just says "Western Food". Located in S-11 hawker center, which is the one just beside Jubilee Square. There is only 1 western stall, so it's quite easy to spot. One of the few underrated Western food stalls in hawker centers.

I've been here quite a few times and I must say I like the really generous portions and affordable price. A usual chicken chop at $6.5 gets you the chicken chop, fries, garlic bread, baked beans and coleslaw. Portion is easily visible in my photo.
I got the photo of the salted egg yolk fried chicken cutlet. Too fried for my liking, but still a sinful and enjoyable meal overall. Salted egg yolk sauce is a bit little, but it was quite thick.

The auntie used to be a bit rude since last time, and customer service was bad as well. But over the years I've observed improvement. And who cares about bad attitude, as long as the food is good right? (Cues those expensive restaurants with bad service staff attitude)
Those days where you feel like having a cheat day/meal? 😜 Yeap this is right where you wanna go to.

ordered chicken chop spaghetti for takeaway, was informed that chicken chop was out of stock, so they recommended chicken cutlet instead. was expecting chicken cutlet spaghetti, but everything was deep fried. came with fries, bread and chicken cutlet. bread was hard as rock. i barely ate anything, aunty was rude too. never going back again.

The aunty was SUPER rude, took wrong order and blame it on customer. I ordered pork chop and she gave me chicken chop INSTEAD! Told her it’s the wrong order and she start accusing that I placed the order wrongly. Is ok, I placed a second order for my pork chop! Frustrated!

Ordered Salted Egg chicken cutlet.

Full of flour and the Salted Egg sauce is so watery and bland.

Do not come and try.
My family bought dinner almost every week here. Salty-eggs chicken, fried price, beefsteak, fried chicken swing  are  our favourites food here.
The service was efficient. I had the chicken cutlet, everything was fine except for the hard garlic bread.
They have thick pork chops on without a thick price tag.
SALTED EGG SAUCE IS TERRIBLE, FULL OF FLOUR.
This stall used to be rasa sayang which has moved to another part of amk. Standard of food has dropped drastically since then. Go to Vincent's located at nearby hawker centre for better food.
Will be 5 star rating if aunty taking order wasnt rude. Not once but twice!!!
CHICKEN CUTLET FULL OF FLOUR
With that kind of price, you can have better western food elsewhere.
Aunty there taking order super rude just want to earn money
Frustrating experience where they kept screwing up the order. Taking very long
The service is good.
Previously ordered chicken chop fried rice, didn't expect to be served chicken pops fried rice instead. Rating could've gone lower if it wasn't for the decent fried rice.
Ordered tiger prawn n mushroom spaghetti , but given frozen small little prawn . DO NOT WRITE IN MENU TIGER PRAWN

Western food with a wide selected compared to typical Western store. Has baked rice but its basically fried rice layer with cheese on top. A good break away from typical Western food flavour. Portion is decent and the food is served with plating similar to a restaurant which makes the portions look much bigger compared to normal stalls.
Worst burger my brother has ever eaten; stuffed with wedges. Pan fried mushroom was bitter, wedges was still a bit raw, black pepper sauce was terribly salty and chicken chop was burnt.

Ordered a dish that came with free mushroom soup...except that they didn't even have mushroom soup. The cashier said they would compensate me with more fries and salad. However the serving was still pretty meagre. The chicken took a long time to arrive, and I had to go back to ask about it. They then proceeded to hand me a buzzer. So I guess I had to wait a second round. Eventually the food came, chicken was ok though the sauce was good, overall I felt it wasn't worth the $7.5 though, I'd skip this and go straight for the $1.3 dim sum...there's some serious competition at this place and there's no excuse for advertising a free food item that isn't ready...how strange.

If you liked this review please hit thumbs up so more people will see it.
doesn’t listen when asked for no olives takes forever quite long but the food edible so i eat :)
OK food, worse attitude from the guy on duty at night. Used to be decent.
Fish not ready during lunch hour, person taking orders very unclear with his communication.
cancelled our online order right before it had to be delivered :)? what the hell
Very very rude the guy with tattoos.
Nice Steaks

Ordered grilled pork chop and chicken chop with spaghetti. The pork chop was one of the better one I had tried as most of the time pork chop tends to be tough. The sides were nice especially the curly fries, they were hot and crispy. The chicken chop was good too though the spaghetti was more average (a lighter version). I will definitely visit again.
The ribeye steak is definitely one of the best in value and taste. Not a fan of pork but the pan seared fish is great too. Love the mushroom soup and it a must have item.

Portions are big n very value for money

Really like the buttered corn as very gao like those in Malaysia

Curly fries taste like MacDonald but after taste got heavy msg taste.

Chicken cutlet is indeed bland n has frozen chicken taste like other mention. Chicken chop w black pepper so so nothing special

I will come back for the corn. It’s that good.

Ordered the chicken chop with mushroom sauce ($7.90) for takeaway. One of the better ones out there, the sauce was thick and flavouful. The chicken chop was tender and juicy. Curly fries was nicely done too, crispy and fragrant. The corn was sweet and nice. Salad was average only. Will definitely return to try the other items.

Very nice place for value for money grill. It is located in a coffee shop. The place is very casual and relax atmosphere. There are a few other stalls in this coffee shop.
Ordered a ribeye steak in black pepper sauce at a good price. It is nicely done and comparable to those restaurant standard. Also ordered the lamb shank. Not too bad for that price.
Overall it is a wonderful experience. Definitely great value for the price and I will be back if I need a steak fix in a casual manner.

Ordered 2 rib-eye steaks with garlic merlot sauce at $16 each thanks to Shopee. Redemption was fast and easy. Good quality for the price - steak was juicy and tender with minimum amt of fat and loved the garlic merlot sauce, curly fries was crispy (I suspect it's the frozen ones you can get at the supermarket), corn was sweet and well flavoured, but I found the coleslaw to be too sweet. Overall, highly recommend!

I seldom post 5 stars, but this simply blows away.
We ordered fish and chips, lamb shank and mushroom soup.
Really good. Lamb shank meat easily slide off the bone, no weird gamey smell. The black pepper sauce complements well.
Mushroom soup flavory with real mushroom bits and spice.
Fish and chip also very good.
Paying slightly more than usual coffeeshop price but u get a high quality western food.

Ordered the ribeye with garlic merlot sauce (200g) and I must say it’s totally worth the price at $18.90.
The ribeye I have at other places usually serves with the bone intact but here the chef took away the bones and made it so much easier to eat. Ordered medium done to perfection. As the sauce blends well with the meat too, every mouth is full of flavours. Portion is big too and one feels really full after the meal. Curly fries are nicely done and very crispy.

Highly recommended 👍🏻

Overwhelmed by the wide selections and price tag at first sight. But take note that it's a masterpiece from an ex-hotel chef. I went on and ordered their Rib Eye Steak with Garlic Merlot Butter Sauce at medium well doneness. Should have gone for medium rare when I saw my friend's cos I'm afraid of my piece of steak keep bleeding 🤣 Anyway, plus point for curly fries!! 🙌

We tried their Rib Eye Steak (medium doneness) with Black Pepper sauce and Hickory Smoked BBQ Pork Rib from their many items for lunch. Serving sizes were big and waiting time was around 10 minutes. Crispy curly fries were really nice. We had different views on the corns and coleslaw. Meats could easily be torn apart. Only thing was that pork rib sauce was a bit too salty.

Ordered the bbq pork ribs and rib eye steak with garlic merlot sauce. Ribs were nice and tender, steak was a little more well done than desired, however dishes were overall value for money with generous portion sizes. I've in particularly enjoyed the sweet corn on the side. Purchase shopee vouchers to get $2 off selected dishes.
A western food gem in AMK! The mushroom brown sauce was really good and we love the curly fries! There is an ongoing Shopee promotion where you can get $2 off every payment transaction!

Went to this area actually to look for something else then came across this western sounding western food stall, but manned by 2 chinese people. They were busy with orders so tried a combo n a fish plate. This is easily one of the top coffee shop style western food. Breaded fish has fish, pork is not overpowered by the usual western food sauce from other places, curly fries is not overly oily taste. The big menu makes it easy to see the dishes n order. However the ordering area is hot. It is filled with lcd screens and very hot spotlights.
Been there a few times. Yesterday, as a privilege of the last customer during the day hour. I was given extra fries for free. 😍 absolute value for money. Taste of the food is also very nice.

Ordered mushroom sauce rib eye steak. Ordered medium but was unevenly cooked. Otherwise no complains, was a good plate of steak with nice amount of sides. If u want fuss free quality western food this is worth a consideration.

Rib eye garlic butter medium rare.
The searing wasn't sufficient. It was soggy. The steak itself could do with a little more salting, it was flat.
Still, it wasn't expensive and the curly fries are some of the best I've had.
Where else can you get ribeye for this price?

Yeah the fries are addictive.

Gonna come back for other stuff and order more curly fries.

Liked the mushroom soup, and ribeye with merlot sauce. BBQ ribs was fall-off-the -bone tender. Battered fish n chips is a bit soggy, tho well flavoured. Huge serving of curly fries; but taste like the frozen type.

Came on Thursday 5.30pm, had a line and waited for about 10mins to place our order.

We had the fish & chips, chicken wings w Cajun rice and mushroom soup.

My thoughts:
Fish & chips was the battered kind!!!!! Something to be mentioned as it is not common to find battered fish outside of restaurant establishment. The fish was rather thick and well seasoned, the batter was really light and crispy. The tatar sauce that came w it seems like self-made and was strong on the raw onion taste. It matches well with the fish. $7.50 for this battered fish and chips is a steal.

Chicken wings w cajun rice on the other hand was alright. The chicken wings was slightly soggy, but well seasoned. The cajun rice had a pretty strong smoky taste, probably from capsicums. It came w 1 slice of broccoli. Overall feel of this dish was meh.

Mushroom soup is really good, different from outside. The ingredients was blended really finely, so not much mushroom chunks (abit sad tho). However the taste of the soup is very yummy and didn't feel too jelat. I could probably down 2 bowls of it.

Going to come back to try out their grills as we heard so many people ordering their steaks while eating.

This Jones is definitely better than the other Jones. Food wise/price wise all win. The presentation u know they put in effort. Sweet corn/coleslaw and yes the curly fries definitely on point. So for anyone who wants a decent western meal can come here and try out their huge variety of choices . I will be definitely be back to try all their food on the menu. Shangri-la chef ok don't play play .....

I believe in the category of coffeeshop western food this is the best I have eaten so far. I ordered chicken chop and it’s nicely grilled whereby it is not over cooked and dry and not rare and undercooked. Taste profile might be considered less flavourful by many but alright by me. Feel like this way I can taste the actual taste of the raw material and not just flavouring and msg. Side dish is curly fries which is fried skilfully such that it is not served drenched in oil. I just noticed I used a lot of “not” expression to describe the food here. It’s is definitely not what you get at all coffeeshop western food stores out there.

The breaded chicken cutlet is big and well fried but the meat is bland. The tenderness of pork ribs ($16.90) is decent, comes with garlic chilli sauce which is moderate sweet.

The corns are sweet. Curl fries are well fried. Fried rice and mashed potato are average. Coleslaw is watery and below average.

In general, the portion is huge and main dishes taste better above average. Quick fix in the neighbourhood area.
Good, reasonably priced western food.  The BBQ PorkRibs tasted awesome, garlic fish nice too.

Value for money, delicious and large portion. The Steak was really good and the garlic butter was fantastic, definitely a must try! Chicken is really tender and juicy, buttered corn is really crunchy and nicely buttered with generous servings of curly fries. A must go to for those staying in the area!

Came here to try after watching their FB marketing Champaign.

Chicken chicken chop with mushroom sauce, $7.50.  At first thought it’s definitely more expensive comparing with other coffeeshop western food. However they made it up with proportional portions and the mushroom sauce is really good.

Prawn Aglio Olio $8.90. Is pretty decent with 4 beautiful prawns that’s pretty well cooked.
However I feel that it’s a bit too spicy on the general side.

Overall it’s good enough for me to come back once in a while. Next time I’ll try their steak.

Great food at affordable prices. Ordered a Ribeye and it was cooked beautifully. The garlic butter Merlot sauce is incredibly creamy with a good amount of flavor that goes well with the steak.

Very highly recommend.
hidden in a humble kopitiam in ang mo kio. nice variety of dishes. tasty curly fries with just right crispiness. buttery corn. mushroom soup was nice too
I ordered F2 Blackened Cajun Fish. Wow the fish was extremely saltish. Had to down my drink to dilute the saltiness. Worse Fish & Chips I had 👎
Something more than I expected and the food delicious. Especially their signature ribeye steak with merlot butter. I will come back with friends and recommend it to others.

Review from a westerner: This a great little shop! Burger is the best you'll find in a coffee shop and very affordable for the quality. Haven't had a bad meal with these guys and our kids love it too. :)

I have my first meal at Papa Jones BBQ and Grill today. The menu is VERY extensive. I choose the Grilled Chicken Chop with black pepper for my first meal here. It's really very delicious. Even my mum, who is with me, can not resist trying the fries. Fabulous cheat food on a day off from my healthy lifestyle.

Owners were warm and friendly.
Fries were packed separately so that they won't be soggy after the tapao journey.
Food is above average so i will go back again.

Its a nices and wonderful places to enjoy
A great meal together with family and friends

Bad choice, the fish and chips set is one of the most horrific ones I have ever tried in my life. The fish was so chip and low quality. . Oh my god.will never patronise again , not at least that meal.
The pork rib is like boil type with sos add on top only. The only thing ok is the fried for me other than that doesn't seen to be good.
Really enjoyed my meal here! Portions are generous and food is of high quality. Will definitely patronise more often :)
Not cheap. I will say the price is reasonable. The quality of the 🥩 and lamb shank is nice. Have not tried the rest of the menu items yet.

NOT YOUR USUAL WESTERN HAWKER FOOD.
Their medium rare steak is perfect!
so tender and delicious.
Sauces are very generous and goes well with the meat.
Curly fries are golden crispy perfection.
You can really tell that the food is prepared like restaurant-level style.
And the best of all, price is very reasonable! 👌🏻👍🏻👏🏻
Rare find especially in a neighbourhood setting for a good steak 😋 love the garlic butter merlot sauce! Would definitely be back!
Several trips her, must try Mash potatos,  rib eye steak and braised lamb. Corn is also quite nice for me.
Breaded Fish with Pork Chop gives good value for money.

The meat was tender and delicious, the buttered corn as well. Some improvements can be that the coleslaw needs more sauce, and definitely reduce the amount of salt on the curly fries. The fries texture and crispiness was divine!
Not bad can give it a shot, garlic sauce not too strong and portion reasonable
Surprisingly, the curly fries are exceptional good
Great tasting western food of almost every item listed. I've tried almost all of it. Great curly fries! They serve satisfactory amount of food but not excessive. Affordable neighbourhood prices.

Staff was friendly, price is affordable. I ordered their soup of the day (tomato) and F4. Pan Seared fish with Cafe de Paris Butter. The wait wasn't long and the food was fresh and flavorful. Would recommend.
Don't let the normal outlook of the stall fool you. The food is really damn good, flavour starts off like not very much but at the end of the dish you will be wonder where all the food went!

Been eating here everyday. Their steak with garlic butter is so good!
The chef is the friendliest man too. My paylah messed up so I double paid. Only realised 4 days later. When I explained the problem, he refunded cash to me with a smile :)
Ruined my expectations of hawker western food. BECAUSE ITS SO GOOD
Decent for a coffeeshop western. Cheap too. Despite long queue and only 1 uncle cooking, food come out fast and hot. 👍👍👍
Great steak and curly fries!

First time trying out this outlet in Djitsun Mall. The one at Kovan was fine.
Must compliment the staff for fast and good service even it was a Sunday evening. Food was good and not too expensive.
We had 2 combo meals and pizza for only about $53 including tax.
Will definitely come again for meals soon.

0 frills "steak" restaurant...

Prices in generally are reasonable, but I felt that it was a tad overpriced for the quality of meat served.

I'd still come back cause its the local steak spot when I'm craving some beef...

Dining environment is pleasant. Ordered Rosti n Sausage and make it a set with mushroom soup and root beer. Added a onion rings basket. Overall food is good and value for money. However root beer is served 3/4 full and scoop of ice cream is small. Hope that this can be improved.

Pasta is quite good, but the prawn is stuck to its shell & hard to deshell.

The brownie ice cream dessert - the brownie is too sweet; it needs the ice cream to dilute the sweetness.

Unfortunately Buddy Hoagies had removed waffles from its menu, which was one of the highlights for visiting. It’s disappointing and we might not be going out of our way to visit it as a result.
Been A Few Times There. Tried The Rosti And Taste Great As Well. Mushroom Soup Creamy With Lots Of Mushroom Bits. Affordable Western Food Worth To Try.

Nice dining environment away from the crowd and hussle at AMK central. Set lunch was a good deal with main plus drink, soup and bread at a decent price. Have always liked the rosti here which is affordable and tasty. Service was fine and will return again if nearby.
One Of My Favorite Places To Visit When I Have e Sudden Crave For Western Cuisines... 😋 Their Almost Everything In List Are Cheap & Good!!
Looking for western food for dinner. Search using goggle and found this place. Food and service is quite good. Can try.

A frequent patron here.
One of the best places to have western food apart from Ashton's.

Pictures speak a thousand words.
:) Do note the crowd during peak hours.

A 10-15mins walk from AMK Station, located in Ditjsun Mall.  First time there and I love the food there! The staffs are also friendly and quick to serve. Got the Double up black pepper grilled chicken and the fried one. The portion was pretty big compare to Astons! It was very filling for both me and my bf. We also got the tom yum crab pasta which is very creamy and has the subtle tom yum taste and it is not overwhelming compared to other Tom Yum pasta. We both added $6 for the set meal (mushroom/minestrone soup , garlic bread and root beer float). Overall the dining in was a pretty good experience. There's GST and service charges but compare to other Western restaurants it is still affordable. Can get the double up chicken and share with your other half too! Would definitely go back!
Very good Ribs and grilled chicken. Buddy gave us 2 small potatoes without us asking, so that we can share. Nice touch! 😋
The only reason that I visit Djitsun mall is for this restaurant haha. Love the peppery grilled chicken. Staff were polite too. Thumbs up!

The last time I visited Buddy Hoagies, the chicken was dry and hard. The ribs tasted like it was left from the previous night, very dry. That was almost two years ago, if I remember right.

I gave it another shot today. I head inside the restaurant half expecting the chicken being dry and hard again. I was greeted by friendly staffs. Nice.

I ordered the mixed grill that comes with a sausage, chicken and pork, served with coleslaw and onion rings. The set came with a drink and either a mushroom soup or minestrone soup. I chose the former.

The mushroom soup tasted bland. It’s white in colour. I do not know if it’s supposed to be that white. They serve a slice of soft bread with garlic spread. Nothing fancy.

The main course came before I could finish my soup. Fast. Too fast. I’m fine with it since I did not like the soup. This time round the chicken was moist. Thank goodness for that. The pork was smaller in size but tasted moist too. The coleslaw was not heavy on the sauce. Maybe if they give you a small wedge of lemon for your coleslaw would be nice. Anyway the onion rings were cold. If felt like the cook had made a basket of it and just left it there till someone orders it. Should have ordered the hot veggies instead.

Overall, pleasant experience especially the friendly staffs. Food wise, eerrrmmm, ok.

I've walked past this cafe several times but this was my first time actually dining in. We were pleasantly surprised by the sheer variety offered. The food was also reasonably priced and the portions were generous.

I had the BBQ chicken with baked potato and fries. I loved how juicy the chicken was. The fries were crisp on the outside and soft on the inside, yum!
Cheap and good Western food. Try the rostie.

It was not crowded when I went. The grilled chicken was nice. Rosti was crispy on the outside. Brownie with vanilla ice cream was good too. Attentive staff, appreciate
Ms/Mrs. Jia Xuan.

First time trying buddy hoagies in the restaurant and was pleasantly surprised (and satisfied) with the quality of food! We took away once during covid period and it was disappointing but so glad this visit changed our minds!
The fish was very fresh with a nice thin crispy batter, chicken was of a decent size despite it being part of the combo and the rib eye steak was perfect without the gamey taste. The baked potato was done perfectly, with the skin being easily separated from the potato -unlike most other places! Will be back to try other dishes.

5 stars for the wonderful dinning experience and friend, attentive staff. The food were well prepare and presentation. I must say my family were impressed by the quality and portion! The portion was generous. The deco of the restaurent was very well design to give a relaxing mood. It provide a very pleasant dinning experience, my family like it, we will certainly back again. Well done!

Haven’t been to this place for a long time! But during the first time trying out at this outlet, the food was really delicious! The restaurant is very spacious! Must try for the Rosti! Rosti is actually a type of potato that is baked. A bit like prata though. I also like the sausage that came with the Rosti. It is curled like a snail shape. I even liked the beverages served in the menu.

Value for money place. I come here every weekend cos all the Tuition Centre’s are here thus a convenient place for a meal.

Nice ambience for about $15 per pax for lunch.

The grilled fish with Tom Yum sauce was our favorite but unfortunately they took it off the menu as it was a temporary promotion.

The current promotion of lamb chops aren’t that great. Too thinly sliced and tough..

Nice Western food for the price at a restaurant, has promotions for lunch but went there for dinner so it was quiet and not so crowded, suitable for small group gatherings and family, kids get apple juice when they order from the kids menu.

Spacious and good lighting, water is self serve and you can pick either hot or cold water from the dispenser.

Ordered the chicken baked rice while my friend picked the steak. Her steak was juicy and the doneness was medium just as she requested. I enjoyed the cheesy chicken bake rice, as I find the rice fragrant and the cheese went well with it.

Desserts wise they have a couple of interesting choices, drinks as well but we were rushing off elsewhere so if you have time and just want to chill at the restaurant you could order dessert and drinks to share.

Service staff were friendly and nice. Overall a pleasant experience. The food is homely and will visit again.
Fast and efficient, friendly service, good food.

Brought my family here for the 1st time.  This place definitely deserves a ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ mainly for the pricing and no nonsense good service.

However it failed to get the last star due to its sloppy mushroom soup, garlic bread could have been a bit more toasted.
The saddest part was the steaks were too “Chao Tah”.  Otherwise my steak would have been superb.
Food was Super delicious, price was reasonable 👍🏻and their ambiance there was very nice with 90s style design.overall had a nice time and good food there, would go back again 😁

I love rosti but the rosti here was a total disappointment. It was just bland and tasteless and the sour cream was a joke too! It taste completely plain, not sour enough, not creamy enough. Mac and cheese was also lack of flavor. Pork ribs doesn't have the smokey grill BBQ taste. Everything just, bleh. Service was prompt but that's it.

Nice food! Very old school western food, like those that were widely available in SG. Very similar to swensen’s. Good value for money, would recommend!

Nice environment for families, there is a little play corner to keep the little ones entertained.
Valuable for money..taste wise average , can be improved...cosy place for a quick western meal fix.
Good food for the price range. Free set meal upgrade for lunch time.

Value for money
Love the grilled chicken and baked potato
Lamp chop is great too
Chicken wings also yummy

We used to always visit this place when it was at Khatib.  It's moved to AMK for 4 years but we always come here once in a while as a treat. We know the owner and the food is good. I didn't take photos of the food today (too famished), BUT here's a pic of their awesome brownie with vanilla ice-cream!
Reasonably price, convenient located, nice food and service
Very nice food and service. I have given one less star as one thing not to try is the tiramisu. Is like a pudding and have a very firm texture.

Always good value with delicious food at super reasonable prices.
The bbq ribs were so yummy !! Will definitely return soon !!
Having great time with my friend here, the foods are not bad.
Good service during weekday lunch. Food is nice and reasonable price. A nice place to bring kids too. Have student meal. The ice tea is nice.
That rootbeer, when serve is not full, stingy, potato also ,need to dig it and taste like normal, not recommend, won't come again.
Food here is tasty and decently priced. Rosti was crispy! Chargrilled chicken was juicy as well. Service was attentive and friendly. Will definitely return. 😊
The soup just lack of depth, the carbonara a bit to salty for my taste but it may be just nice for others, otherwise the food is ok
Very good fried fish hoagie which is uncommon to find in Singapore. Personally like it better than the typical sandwich franchise offerings. Good pricing and casual ambience for family meals.

I ordered Flamed Grilled Chicken with 2 sides - baked potato and hot veggies. The highlight is the flamed grilled chicken with the tic tac toe marks - they make you wanna play with it. But my stomach said, "Feed me!" So I did. And lovin' it (even without the chicken gravy). By the way, don't get fooled by the thin looking chicken meat. It has no skin or fatty parts so you are getting real flame grilled meat. I wish I have 1 more stomach within me for another piece of chicken!
Awesome service! Very friendly and attentive staff. Food portion is reasonable and good.

Great food, great ambience, and really great customer service especially from waitress Angela. We appreciate the pleasant experience. The customer service team was distinctly a few grades above any other restaurant that evening. Kudos to Angela for being really thoughtful and offering to charge when she knew that our phones had run out of battery. Would definitely come back for the customer service. Give Angela a raise already! haha
