the food is really worth it. portion is very big and it's not too expensive. The soup and garlic bread is not the best but everything else is really good for the price. I would really recommend the ribs.
Their steaks are always the best among it's price range
Reasonable price and good food. I used to come here for lunch and nice place to get together.
A family friendly outlet with open ceiling, a nostalgic ambience with rock stars photos on the wall, menu valued for money and friendly staff that makes a heartful satisfied dinner of the day!
Western Food At Economical Pricing. Worth every penny. Better cook than their WWP branch
Had a nice gathering with friends in the past week. The food is good value for price. The fish and chips was done nicely.

Nice western food at reasonable prices but seating arrangements are very bad. All diners seated back to back with no safe distancing measures. Not a safe place to patronise during current Covid-19 situations.
Bad fish and chips. Barter is too hard. Coleslaw is bland. Onion rings is soggy. Won’t be back here again

We dined in from 12+ to 3pm and we're served by polite, friendly and attentive crew. The Manager allowed us to bring a birthday cake from external when I commended that the slice of cake on the menu was too small. It was an enjoyable experience. Highly recommend Collin's @ Jubilee!

Excellent food. Ordered premium mixed grill (lamb chop, chicken chop, pork chop) and seafood bouillabaisse. All meat from the premium mixed grill are extremely tender and juicy, even in 100% cooked / well done situation. 👍 seafood bouillabaisse is tasty, seafood is fresh and tender. Must try. 11am to 5pm, weekday (except public holiday) has 20% off.

Food was decent and there was a promotion for the tomahawk steak which was super delicious. The meat melts in your mouth when savouring.

The seafood plater was a good sharing plate as well making our meal of 4 a happy and enjoyable one.

Had the October promo. Ordered 1 main and free 2 side. October special pork platter usual price $30 plus going for $15. Very big portion and super value for money.

Highly recommanded. Love the fried squid and the marinate. Service is excellent and friendly.

loved the lobster pasta. lobster cooked well, pasta was flavourful, and exactly how I like it. ordered the set with the mushroom soup which had a hint of truffle scent, as well as the lychee soda which was very refreshing. decent meal with good service!

ordered mixed grill ($22) and the portion was shockingly small compared to the ones served at other Collins outlets I've been to. Pork chop was much smaller than the size of my palm and chicken chop was obviously cut by a knife which reduced it to half its original portion

First time back after a long while. Ordered the chicken chop which came with spaghetti aglio aglio. The chicken was done well but the latter was just a tad away from being cooked al dente. To be honest, it was still uncooked. The server kindly changed this for me. I asked if the chef is new - she affirmed this. Also, my daughter ordered the salmon baked pasta but she was served baked rice instead. She was ok to have this, but the staff should really be more careful. It was not as if the staff were overstretched because of the lunch crowd - we were there after half past two and there were only a few tables of diners.

Charging for water at a restaurant is a total put off for me.
Unfortunately, I have placed my food orders.
Add to your food cost, because not all will will looked at your 50 cents hidden on your haddock or duck.
Food was good, no complaints except your salad was not fresh.

food was good, but only if you are a student. Istg the prices here have skyrocketed since I last came here to eat. recommend the food 8/10 but if you come here make sure ure a student. if not the prices here are like 16.90 for a bowl of spaghetti. bit I must admit try the dessert pizza. picture of the student meals are below

The food is beyond amazing and staff are great and friendly
Reasonably priced and great ambience
First time at this branch. Food as usual nice. Nothing to shout for though.

I had their classic series Bi Feng Tang Fish and Chips (I requested to change out the corn cob for coleslaw) and it tasted fresh and great! It was well-fried, not too dry and oily 👍👍The garlic crumbs topping enhanced the overall taste and aroma of the fish! No fishy smell at all! Received good customer service from the team too, especially the malay lady (didn’t managed to get her name) 👍👍

There was promotion for lunch , would say that was not as expected as it is talk about.
Salmon with spegathi was just ok ..my friends steak was soso only.

We tried out their promo menu as suggested by their staffs…not bad at all..

Their pastas are nice… too bad.. forgot to take the picture of it.

Very nicely battered Fish & Chips.
A better deal if you are a student, they offer half price for students for some of their dishes for lunch

Haven't been here for a while. Good quality food at reasonable prices. Family had an enjoyable and fulfilling meal. Steak and deep fried food were great! If anything, the ribs needed more sauce and the seafood baked rice wasn't that tasty.
Portions are huge, food tastes great, value for money!
waste of money. truffle fries with no truffle and parmesan, and mixed grill meal that is the size of a kids meal. the duck was the worst, literally one drumstick that doesn't taste great

Went on Sunday around 3.30pm, got a table immediately without queuing.
Many more choices for food than the franchise HDB stall.
Food tastes good. Staff is helpful.
Many oders for delivery during our meal time.
This restaurant provides lunch promotion during weekdays. You may pay a visit.
Prices increase main course costs at least $20 now. Fish is hard and chewy??!! Best is their whole calamari very soft with smoky taste, won’t come back again

The food is good, the pork could be better.
Service is excellent and food were served very fast.

Best Chicken Chop I've ever had in Singapore! I paid $15 for a Chicken chop with a drink and a side under their lunch special on weekdays! I'll definitely come back here again. I recommend Collin's for those looking for a good western meal. I also loved the fast service and friendly staff.

Staff seems bored at work

Barramundi is ok. Gave feedback that Vegetable and mushroom is very salty but no respond from the manager. I had to drink lots of water to flush it down..

The Home made baked potatoes is good

One of our favourite venues for meals when the family decides to eat out.
The prices are reasonable and the portions are rather huge so it is value for money.
Being a member gives you 10% discount.
The lava cake is superb.
Not wanting to be bias, should visit this restaurant at least once and decide for yourself. At least satisfy your curiosity.
Only inconvenience is that no booking or reservation is allowed and you have to queue up like the others, but if you have time to spare, give it a shot.
Staff were friendly and helpful. Food was also tasty and worth the higher price. Penne Au Gratin was too bland for my liking, but the prawns inside were perfectly cooked.

This is lousy food!!! Feel angry to eat!! This is last we eat at amk restaurant collin!!! Pork rib charcoal the meat is cold!!! What the chef experience of this?? Just learning to cook? This is last we eat at collin....

Great ambience. Staffs are very polite and attentive. Some waiting time due to reduce seatings. Food servings are quite fast and all very nicely presented. Currently they are running a GSS 50% off Wagyu steak @ 37.50+  comes with a drink, side veg bowl, soup and garlic bread. Very worth it. Steak is nicely done n juicy. Soup is tasty and good to go with the crispy garlic bread.

Good variety of dishes, from appetizers to mains. Quality and taste of most of their food are above average. A few items l'll always order when l'm there are their mushroom soup, angus beef and seafood risotto. Another couple of positives are their fast and efficient service and  reasonable prices.
Tried out the chicken cutlet. Feels like the cutlet is just a thin slice of chicken meat flatten and fried. Not really worth the price tagged to the dish.

First time at a Collin's, always been intrigued by their dry aging fridge, so decided to give it a try. Ordered the US  Mishima Wagyu ribeye steak (MS5, 250gm) and carbonara. I think they were doing pretty ok with their offering, till I get to the over cooked part of the steak - which was thinly sliced in the first place - making it pretty hard to sear and control doneness. Still very decent I think.

Food here is generally good. Portion is generous in most cases. So far I have not tried anything that stands out for me. Service was alright. Not much queueing on a public holiday probably due to COVID. Cost is slightly above average. Ambiance is ok for conversations. Parking is plenty but some distance away.
Standard seems to have dropped during the pandemic. Asked for Medium Rare but Wagyu was cooked to Medium instead. Clam Chowder was shown on menu to be the white, cream based, type but what came was the orange, tomato based, type.

food is great at good portions and reasonable prices. there's a wide selection of western dishes so it's worth a second visit to try more.

staff is friendly and helpful. there's a fired oven for your pizza so you have a real authentic taste!

The food is good.. i enjoyed my sirloin steak and my folks enjoy the food they ordered.. but the order taking got messed up. We ordered a seafood mixed combo but was served a beef mixed combo.. maybe the naming should differ so as to prevent mixed up.. overall its ok, we came for the food afterall

3rd time went to Collin's, my hb like de food & ambience there, we went there for my hb birthday celebrations, coincidentally they hv Xmas set offer, really worth the price, till now he still missed his bday meal... 😅🤭

We would like to think that the waiter discreetly warned us a couple of times subtly over selection not being wise. 1- repeating and reconfirming a meal selection/add on a couple of times, 2- end up not serving the add-on(paid $2), 3-we even asked for the add on and then it was served. Moral of the story: listen to subtle signs there.
Overall it was okay, approximately $170 for six of us, inclusive of drink and soup or dessert; there was a set meal option available to all main courses with an addition of 6.50-drinks were already close to that price.

Went during lunch and so you get either a selected drink/side/dessert with any main. The size of the portions actually differ from outlet to outlet. The portion here is actually good for me but when I dined at the Balestier outlet, it was a very generous portion with a mountain of pasta and salad that it was enough for 2, but that outlet has since closed.

Service crew is helpful and polite and food was served relatively quickly from time of ordering that I actually suspect if they had already pre-cooked everything and just microwaved it to serve.

Payment was slow, queued almost 10 minutes just to pay and that is a long time to stand considering that there were only 2 other person in front of me.

Very great experience. Food was delicious and worth it. Delightfully surprised that they use haddock (and not dory) for their fish and chips. Haddock has more flavor and has a firmer texture. Fries are thoroughly seasoned with spices and crispy. Even came with cheese and tartar sauce.

Duck confit was moist and just falls off the bone.

Would definitely return and I highly recommend the fish and chips.

01:07/19
The Argentina beef is tender but not beefy like American Prime Beef. The salmons bake rice with egg goes very well with the cheese. Both dishes are ok but the portion is rather small. Will probably return for 250g waygu beef next time. The service staff is fantastic.

The queue starts at about 6pm for dinner. Overall, the food is pretty yummy. The buffalo drumstick is really flavourful and tasty. The sweet potato fries is crispy and soft, even though the sweet potato itself is not sweet. The black pepper medium steak is tender. The side salad comes mixed in a sour and sweet sauce which makes the vege very appetising. The prawn marinara spaghetti is al dente, and the prawn is very crunchy and lightly marinated with a salty fresh taste. The chicken chop taste great, and not so much fats. The oven baked haddock fish with penne is quite okay. The texture of the penne is just right, and the tomato sauce is nice and not too sour. The fish could have a bit more taste though. The add on mushroom soup is the standard kind, and can do better.

Decent prices, great atmosphere, an extensive menu, and food that does not disappoint. Be prepared to queue for a while (~15min in my experience), and it is certainly worth the short wait. Heard that their fish and chips is really good, but I haven't tried it yet. Will certainly try it in future.

One of the waiter stood so close and knocked me without apologising. The chair was wet, had to swap a clean one.
Affordable with below average food.
Raspberry drink should be removed from Menu.
Plating needs additional training. Plate was so big that two of it took the whole table space.
Utensils full of water marks and some stubborn food stains.

Chicken was dry, salad with citrus dressing a very safe approach.
Pork heavily covered with black pepper, could season it better.

Difficult to decipher why the waitress kept wanting to clear the plates while we are still on the dishes.

Asked for bill twice (was off peak) and the waitress told us it's paid. Out of integrity I asked the third time.
Billed and never would I dine here again.

Not recommended. Dine at your own risk.

Limited tables available be prepared to  queue up and wait during dinner peak hour. Waitress are friendly and don't feel pressured to order fast and get on with life. Tried their signature crispy chicken cutlet, very crispy and nice, not oily too. The corn cob is a little soft and felt overdone but still alright.
Being here few rounds for some dinner. Serving size was good. Food is good too.

This is one of Collin's' more consistent outlets, taste-wise. For the price, I'd head to El Carbon a few blocks away though, coz the sauces and dressing are more or less the same and service is just a-ok.

Horrible experience with their membership system. My friend and i each of us apply as their member to enjoy the 10% discount plus $20 offset after we heard that we can split the bill and enjoy the discount and offset.

When we bill, the manager told us the system got problem splitting the bill so we only can use one member account.

Would recommend if anyone want to enjoy the benefit ask them split the bill first before signing up. You need pay through paypal first

Will come back again as i still got $20 worth of points to use. Overall the food is nice for the price but service can be better.
So-so food but service was good
Portin is good. Food tastes ok. Fried squid a bit too hard to chew.

Good grills with affordable prices. Their staff were all very friendly and helpful which made the dining experience all the more better. The cheese pizza was not bad too, with its crispy crust. Only drawback was that the place was quite noisy during peak hours. Prepare to queue too.
Was there for lunch. Good and fast service. Staff was friendly and food was delicious. Mainly western Italian food.
Great place to enjoy Western food. Nice and cozy environment.

Really agree the chicken cutlet is one of the best. It’s crispy n well flavoured.

Fish n chips is not bad but chicken cutlet really much better

Really have the old school no frills n yet good tasting. It’s quite cheap at $5-6 though portion is avg size. Big eaters need to add on.

Highly recommend to try

Love the chicken chop and cutlet. The mushroom sauce is heavenly with thinly cut fries. This food is such nostalgia and has been my old school western go to place. Shout out to all who is staying near by to give it a shot if u have not! Friendly and humorous stall owners that will brighten up your day too!

Old school taste, old school straight talking, bit actually friendly, auntie. We are taking deep fries chicken, cutlets, grilled meat, canned beans, fried buns and fries. Classic Straits style 'western' food food the 70s. It looks like the stall has been around that long too.

Maybe ask them not to fry the bun though. Unless you can lower your cholesterol at will.

my #1 spot for chicken cutlet rice. auntie has always kept the price low at $3.80 and sizeable portion since i was in poly and now in uni. now got option for upsize since i brought my boyfriend hahaha.

its true to describe it as old school taste! my mum likes to buy the chicken wings that is comparable to arnolds chicken. still recommend the cutlet rice over anything!

This stall sells street-style western food and their chicken chop is one of the favorites here. The chicken chop, was lean yet tender enough, retaining its tasty juices. It was topped with their custom made mushroom sauce, which is addictive, super delicious and fragrant.

Fish and Chips at $5.50, you will get 2 crispy fish fillets, coleslaw, baked beans and a fried bun. The fillets were crispy on the outside and succulent on the inside, I was pleasantly surprised that it tasted great and old school.

Fried Chicken Cutlet at $5.50 too, was a no frill, old school type of western food.  Freshly deep fried in a wok of hot oil upon order and served immediately with the sides. The cutlet has a thin, golden exterior crust which was exceptionally crispy, and the meat was tenderly and juicy.

It brings back wonderful childhood memories. Kudos to the stall owners and hope they keep this old-school western food tradition going on.
The food does not live up to the reviews. Tried the chicken cutlet - taste and portion average. Not sure why people like the fried buns as it was oily. Not impressed.

Nostalgic! Still as good as ever 20 years ago and  now!!! Back then my friend and I, we were really sad when we found out that the clementi stall no longer existed. Have been trying to find out if they were closed for good/relocated until in the recent years, my friend saw a fb post and found out they have relocated to AMK. Imagine how happy we were. Just last week we dropped by, had some fries while reminiscing the good old days and dabao chicken chop, fish & chips, spring chicken. Everything was delish and I already can't wait till my next visit.

Chicken Cutlet which you can't taste anywhere else in SG.
The magic is in the skin.
It has an alluring, smokey crunch in the skin, and will leave you wanting more.
Have it with their butter rice, and you'll find a match in heaven.

Residents who lives or lived in Clementi or Sunset Way will recognize the stall owner right away.
With his waxy and slick hair combed all the way back, you will also be struck by nostalgia as the aroma and taste of that familiar cutlet bring you back memories of the past.

The Chicken Chop is excellent too!
That is if you can decide which one you want to fill your tummy with.

Used to eat there when still in Clementi when i was in Poly

Then they closed down and search high and low for them.

Sad to see the halal is no more. Wished they can make it halal again. Their spring chicken is the best. Comparable to Arnold's.

Their chicken cutlet also one of the best I've tasted. Fond memories.

I think the father passed away. The son take over.

Uncle, make halal leh. I miss your food.
Food is really nice and will recommend their chicken cutlet. The owners are really friendly people as well. Been patronising this stall since their original stall in clementi.

Lady Boss is menopausal. Or maybe woke up on the wrong side of bed. Bad lousy attitude, and refused to give more chilli packs when we requested. Fries were too salty and dry. Disappointing, not worth the calories. Will never patronize again.

Now with this covid situation, hope they close shop better if want to continue service and quality like this.
$4.50 for chicken chop, very affordable
The Auntie who took down order and serve food, she is super friendly. My Family loves her friendly character and we make like a go to makan to her shop!

Definitely the cheapest in the Bishan-AMK area. Quantity was adequate. Taste was above average.
The lady from the stall is pleasant and friendly.
Extremely tasty old school western food with fried buns included! Food is very affordable and the Aunty serving was super nice 🌻🌻🌻
Juicy tender chicken chop! Amazing! Fries were a little over fried tho.
GREW UP EATING UNCLE'S WESTERN FOOD SINCE HE WAS AT CLEMENTI AVE 4. 26 YEARS DOWN THE ROAD , THO DIFFERENT LOCATION , STILL GO BACK TO HAVE THIS WHOLESOME WESTERN FOOD.
I have been eating their western food since10 year old at clementi 308. Now I'm 40
Old school western food. Friendly auntie
Reasonably priced western food.
Good food
Good price and nice good portion
Prices is reasonable, owner friendly
Cheap food, affordable meal
Nice food
Freshly cooked food
Delicious

(Translated by Google) The crispy fried chicken is delicious!

(Original)
脆脆的炸鸡，蛮好吃!

Had a enjoyable lunch here. Ordering system was easy and food was served in a fast speed.
Took the lunch set with a drink, upgrade soup and upgrade dessert.
All the foods are standard and tasty but not superb. Lobster bisque was average. T bone steak was good but i got a medium well close to well done although I ordered for medium, a bit disappointed for this. The orea cheese cake was good.

Overall the food price considers to be at a slightly higher average, unless the food is super delicious. It's still a good place if you don't know what to eat as they serve quite a big range of food varieties.

Came here using the Great Eastern rewards 1-1 special promo for my birthday month and it was truly a happy experience. Slipper lobster and pasta is really yummy!! The hulk mocktail (taste like green apple) was very fragrant and refreshing as well… The staffs (sharlene, etc) here were friendly and wide food selection to choose from. There’s a clean washroom in their restaurant.. We also ordered using 1-1 (2-5pm) promo from Jack’s place fish&chips and steak&chicken combo. Overall it was a nice place to chill and dine, will be back again!

Came for a birthday celebration. This place brings back all the memories.
Set lunches are value for money.
Love the mushroom soup and garlic bread which were the mainstays since many many years ago
Had the chicken and steak which came on a sizzling plate w baked potato and long beans as sides.
Baked potato was delish w the sour cream , bacon condiments

Table wasn't properly cleaned when we sat down.
Had to request for staff to help us clean it.
When our meals came, we also had to specially request for staff to put the sour cream topping on the baked potato. But I guess they were short-staffed.
Quality of food; seems to have dropped over the years. But I like the fact that the ribeye was a rather good cut, not too fatty/chewy. Though the blood and sauce and oil mixed together wasn't a very pleasant sight.
Too expensive, would only come occasionally.

It has been a long since I was last here and the food seems to have gotten better, at least in my experience. Forgot to take pics of the other items we had but the steak was great! Love it that it's served on a hot plate and the steak was not too tough even though we had it medium. Bill came up to $194 for 7 pax with a 1-for-1 main course set.

Had the 1 for 1 deal. Chicken chop was nicely seasoned & tender, while the baked potato with sour cream & bacon bits were pretty yummy too. Hard to fault at this price. Lost a star due to dated & old furniture. But tasty food comes first of course.

Sadly on our 3rd visit on 12 July, the sizzling hot plate was no longer sizzling, and food was served lukewarm only. Wife couldn't even finish her plate, which she usually can. What a letdown that standards have dropped so quickly. Dropped to 2 stars from 4.

The Lobster Thermidor was very well cooked: The salad was fresh and the butter rice was flavorful. The amount of cheese and cream on the lobster was generous and was delicious with the lobster meat.

Jack's Special steak was also great except it was slightly overcooked from what we wanted.

Atmosphere-wise the place was quite loud so don't expect a cosy quiet experience.

System glitched and doubled order a dish for us, causing some awkwardness when the extra dish came.. 😨😨

Steak was as so-so as I remembered… not recommended for the price, though the fish and chips and chicken were ok.

Overall lighting was dark and made the place seem old and run-down, although it being old is very much true.

Btw, the pasta was some next level dry and weird. Don’t recommend to try unless you want to reminisce days during outfield when you’re eating the infamous pasta ration pack 😰😰😥😰

Food Is not bad but the waiting time for the food are rather long after you scan through their barcode and order the food,  you have to wait around 30mins,  I have made prior seat reservations for 2 pax at 7pm and got in to order the food and food came around 740pm.

The mashed potato sauce also taste very normal,  nothing fantastic. The Vegetables were very dry and hard to chew too (tasteless)

What upsets me most is that they no longer have the fish n chips menu that I always ordered,  the current food that they are having on the menu also taste normal.. Not really fantastic like before.  I won't give a full 5 star for this place anymore.

Beef Steak (SGD $14 / $25) @ Jack's Place.
.
Founded in 1966 by Jack Hunt and subsequently expanded by Say Lip Hai from 1974 onwards, this old-time casual steakhouse was once ridiculed for selling 'up-market' Western fare in heartland HDB locations.
.
Seniors may well recall those times in the early 1980s, when a set meal here - consisting of a soup, sirloin steak, salad, baked potato, fruit cocktail, and coffee/tea, cost just SGD $5.20..... at a time when a typical meal was less than SGD $2.
.
These days, their steaks remain as good as before, grilled to your requested doneness, served sizzling on a hot plate. The beef ribeye is juicy and tender, with a satisfying light chew, and robust meaty savoury salty flavour.
.
The accompanying boiled vegetables (broccoli, cauliflower, carrot) have bright vegetal sweet flavour, while the soft baked potato with starchy sweet notes has old-school toppings served tableside - rich sour cream, crisp spring onions, chewy bacon bits. Filling.
.
They also specialise in the tenderloin cut, with 1 option being an eye-catching tableside flambe.

It has been 3 years since I last visited Jack's place Ang Mo Kio branch. Love the tenderloin well-done texture. Comes in a set with oreo cheesecake but lobster bisque and cake standard has dropped. The lobster bisque does not taste lobster, the oreo cheesecake is not as good as other retailers cheesecake. Overall acceptable. As a cheesecake lover, i have tried so many places but given the price of the set meal, consider acceptable, not fantastic. The asparagus look pathetic.

The beef striplon is quite good. But i ordered medium rare but came medium. Supposed to minus 1 star from it. But the portion and balanced set meal has made it up. As for the lobster aglio oilo, was just very much average. But Will definitely visit again with the wide range of beef sets.

My wife and I went there for the national day promo. Two mains , half dozen oysters and two durian puffs for 56++.

It was decent. We loved the steaks like usual. The oysters were pleasant. My wife didn't like the sauce on it. But the puffs were warm for some odd reason.

The Set is good portions for two pax, but prawns were very hard & Sweet corn was difficult to chew, preferred baked potatoes but was not allowed to change. Prefer more green veges instead of big pieces sweet corn that's difficult to chew.
the waiters and waitresses were kind, and the sirloin steak was good, even though it was abit more 'medium well' than 'medium rare' ':D but still very good food, definitely would come back anytime!:)

Ordered the combo mixed grill which is one of their signature dish. Was disappointed that the dessert I wanted was not available due to a late delivery by their supplier. But overall am satisfied with the food quality. Ample public parking but need to walk a short distance. The restaurant is also quite spacious.

Went on Sunday 6.30pm, but was informed that the 250g ribeye is not available only 180g left, banana split has blackened refrigerated bananas and could not be served, we had to remind them to serve the wine that we ordered. They accidentally added a $25 takeaway item to my table and she didn't seem to believe me when I said we didn't order it. She even asked others from my table if they ordered and refused to take it off the bill until another server told her it was for another table. The restaurant was not even full. Quite disappointing experience.
Oysters were fresh, very worth the quality. Delicious!

My go-to place if I would like to have something nice but still affordable.

The staffs in this branch are really friendly. The aunties and uncles were working here for many years. I hope this place can survive this covid situation.

I usually ordered steak here, and personally I found their steak is one of the best in Singapore. The meat retain the juiciness of the meat. It is also tender.

Expected damage would be around 25-35 per pax (depending what you ordered). They offer lunch set menu which is super affordable and worth the value. You can check on their website.

2person lunch at $88..one platter($16), 2 main dish($22x2), 2 soup($6.90x2 they forget to serve the desert,we also forget there's a desert and we left)...food quality is not bad, price is also acceptable. But next time come after 2.30pm they have 1for1 free main dish.

Very lovely peaceful place with delicious food to relax and eat. Manager Amy is the current manager managing the restaurant with her fellow staffs. Her staffs and herself really do their level best to satisfy majority customers. Keep it up. All the best.

Dinner ribeye steak was good.
The potatoes are the same as always.
Vegetables has improved though, tastes better now.

4 stars as the online ordering system doesn't seem to update the wait staff of the drinks, and the food came first. It was solve when we asked for our drinks.

The floor manager look like you own him money. He would do his own things and let customer wait at the counter waiting to be seated even though there is empty space. He could have let customer sit down 1st and look at the menu 1st. The cashier counter also look messy and look very unpleasant for a restaurant. The place filled up with oil smell and your body will have the oil smell when you leave the place.

I am here at Jack's Place Ang Mo Kio branch to celebrate 2 of my friends' birthday & my own birthday.  The service is really bad here.  The staff are all busy & greeted us with a black face.  There is no service at all & they are charging 10% service charge.  They even charge 50 cents for water.  Very disappointing.

Was there with my family on a busy night around 9pm. All of us agree that service was fantastic! Thank you assistant manager Fernando and team 😃

1. Even before we were shown our seats, the lady service staff pre-empted that orders might take longer due to shortage of manpower. We didn't wait more than 10 min after our orders. That's more efficient than I mentally prepared for

2. E-menu showed certain bundled items as unavailable, but they were mostly available separately. Fernando patiently helped to take the orders and proceeded to serve our food. (Disclaimer: We took quite a long while to decide)

3. Service staff was able to acknowledge our request for help with a simple hand gesture while continuing to serve another table, instead of simply ignoring us.

4. We stayed till closing and all the staff were cordial throughout without "black faces" or veiled sarcastic comments.

Kudos to the team!

Sidenote: One improvement that can be made is to the e-menu.
Root beer float was marked unavailable, but root beer and coke float were both available.
Value set was marked as sold out even though it is available on public holidays, but the soup and drinks were available separately.

Call if a stroke of bad luck when most of the reviews I'm reading are positive. My food was terrible. My beef was done to medium when I requested for medium rare. The curly truffle fries were over fried, something I never expected any establishments to get wrong, especially one that has been around for the longest time. The iced lemon tea was sweet beyond honey.

The only 2 that were good and edible were the slab of salmon and the ice cream, which I believe is outsourced.

Staff were a hit and miss. Some were extremely polite and hospitable, while some just ignored you like you're transparent.

Not returning for sure.

My Family tradition since young to celebrate occasions at this particular outlet. Family friendly experience is consistent thru the decades.

Though nowadays there many new fancy places that served steak, glad that Jack’s place standards manage to stood the test of time.
Always good value for money. Family place.

The escargot was average, the chicken chop and fire steak was slightly disappointing. The meat could be cooked to a better consistency and the sauce was not to my liking. However the bake potato was good. Given the food quality I would prefer other options.

Was here on 2 Aug 2022. This place has been here since early 90s if I remember correctly.

Weekday 2pm I wards this place is very quiet to have a good meal.

Food was below average. Had the chicken soup which was bland; garlic bread was ok. Steak was tasteless as well; though to be fair the meat was done to medium rare as per my request. Dessert was chocolate cake that wasn’t great.

I won’t be back.

The best thing about this restaurant is the staff's service.  I've always experienced good service from the staff at Jack's Place AMK when dining in, or taking away.  I hope the management takes note of this and keep their staff in these difficult times.

Went to AMK Jack’s Place during Christmas Eve night at 7pm. There was only two groups in front of us in the “walk-in queue”. There was a longer line at the “reservation queue” and people had to wait despite having made their reservation. Waited for slightly more than 30 minutes before we got our table. There was only a fix Christmas menu for us to order from (but you can order the appetisers). The service was smooth and staff were friendly & pleasant. The food was of quality as well & didnt had to wait too long before our food was served. Overall, a good experience on a busy Christmas Eve.
Their healthier choice teriyaki chicken with brown rice is not bad ($9.90++). Golden wings, which came with a side of coleslaw was quite good too. Service could be abit more attentive and responsive.

Been coming here since young, food still tastes good, potato in a jacket still tastes as good as before. My parents still hold fond memories of this place - the deco (which includes the Christmas mugs they use for their Christmas lunches)

Food service was a little slow in my recent visit.

However, food portion did get smaller. Dad ordered the chicken and mum ordered the chicken and fish (for a dollar more). Dad’s chicken portion was actually smaller than mum’s.

TLDR: food is still great, food portion got smaller and perhaps pricier too.

I found the meal to be satisfactory, and their potato with sour cream to be delicious as usual. The restaurant was crowded during lunch, but I found the staff to be attentive and responsive.

Perhaps a downside is that the soup was a bit plain, but no major complaints other than that.

Very polite and helpful staff. Food was decent. Game chicken was moist and juicy, even the breast meat (and I'm normally wary of eating chicken breast because it usually comes overcooked). Truffle fries were good. My sister's fish and chips turned out pretty well too!

I am actually skeptical to visit them again but since my agent gave me a voucher, I'll use it.  The steak, as with my past experience, was tough and hard to cut (asked for medium).  Soup and the gravies are all too salty.  Dessert is a very small scoop of ice cream, yes the scoop is smaller than usual.  Will not visit anymore.

Bad service, very bad service from the lady staff by the name starting with 'S'..

Went for lunch with my mum but she was greeted and served rudely by S.

Food standard has dropped greatly. Would rather eat elsewhere.

Came here since last visited Jack’s Place a few years ago. It is one of the old branch where it had its standalone restaurant. Order the chicken chop in hotplate and served with their signature potato with servings.  Below are the pictures of other dish such as salmon and curly onion fries

Good measure of social distancing with tables well spaced out. We tried the breaded fish & chips and lamb chops which were nice. Cream cake on sale near the counters are old school styled.

They ran out of mango gelato which perhaps can be managed if stocks are planned earlier in advance because ice cream usually have a longer shelf life

Been eons since I've stepped into this pre-loaded eatery and now rekindled (I've joined their memebership), not because of vouchers but the meals are value for money, and if like me, you like a little nostalgia from time to time, this is one the places. Try their lunch sets, fast serving and decent portions with no overkill. I had mine in AMK. Upgrade to bisque soup for a change. Come here for a quiet anniversary or dates.  As their slogan says, it's steak and more...
Tried their off peak hour 1 for 1 deal. And it was ok. Food portion was huge. The doneness of the beef was overcooked when we ordered medium rare. The chicken was marinated well and delicious.

5 stars given for the excellent service provided. Service staff did inform us of a possible 10min wait time (was a Sat) but before 10mins they led us to use the VIP room instead. They were quick to provide utensils for my baby and food came relatively quick even though it was full house. Food from Jacks place was not as good as before, speaking from a regular since I was a kid. For example, the type of potato is not as fluffy and sweet that I recall and the boiled veges are quite tasteless. Still love their tea with milk and satisfied with the meal.
a bit slow on the service though but the food is still great !

Had a nice lunch there on Wednesday. Ordered the steak lunch meal, fish lunch meal and seafood baked rice student meal. Steak was cooked correctly as ordered, fish was fresh. Baked rice portion was huge even for student meal and comes with plenty of prawns and calamari.
Overall, they still retain the old school western taste...it’s a must to drink their Kopi if you are a Kopi lover! 😉

Ordered their chicken and mushroom Alfredo, the chicken tasted "old" and hard.

Guess this should be remove from menu
Big & spacious restaurant. Staff are helpful & patient. On weekdays from 1430hrs till 1700hrs they offer 1-for-1 meals which is value for money.
Was served by Amy and Sharlene and it was an amazing afternoon at Jack’s Place! Thank you both for your kindness and positive attitude towards us on a busy Saturday afternoon. ☺️

Perhaps our taste palette have changed.. these American style barbeques just don't satisfy anymore.

The lamb shoulder for example, I'll have the Chinese style ones from 刘大妈 anytime.

As for the beef brisket, I can't quite say it was 油而不腻, for it left behind such a greasy sensation. Even for the taste - we asked for salt and pepper half way through the meal.

So, I think we'll have our BBQ meat fixes with the Chinese joints.

Good value and high bbq quality with meats smoked well! Ordered p1 platter and enjoyed the chicken and pork belly. Sides like the mashed potato were yummy as well. Also special mention for the octopus which I enjoyed, given I'm not a fan of tako. Accompanying sauces made the meats even more yummy. kudos to the friendly boss kelvin :)

My favourite western food at cheap affordable prices! Their meats are always well charred and moist. I love the beef brisket the most but the last time round, the beef brisket was out of stock. Nevertheless, the chicken chop is delicious too. I especially enjoy the ratatouille as a side dish which is rarely seen in other western stalls. Will always eat again!

Oh man, this is seriously yummy and super worth travelling down to an industrial area for. Love the smoky flavours, tender meats, big portions, and superb seasoning. Price is very reasonable.

The P1 platter is to die for: it has pork, beef and chicken, and the interesting chili sauce goes well with the meats (very spicy though so don't dip too much lol).

As for the sides, the ratatouille was rather average but still hearty, and the garlic fries were good enough even without dipping into sauces.

We're planning to go down again or order delivery for house dinner parties next time.

A long wait for food on a weekday evening but it was worth it as I had gained an appetite by then. The chicken was flavoured well and grilled with a slight char. The generous side dish of ratatouille was hearty and made up for the wait.
—-
Came back another time and ordered takeaway. Ordered the grilled fish of the day (sea bass) and beef brisket. The fish was fresh and the beef was tender and the beef fat melts in the mouth. Order the mash, it’s really yum. 👍🏼

Food deserves 5 ⭐️, but be prepared to wait.

The meats were tender and had some smokey flavour. My preference is the chicken. Beef was alright but I think another cut may have been better as smoked. Still quite an impressive little joint. Oysters were nice too. Overall good value for money.

Hidden gem among the industrial area. Parking is easy. Ordered beef brisket (with mash potato), pork belly (with garlic fries) and mad spice chicken (with ratatouille). Pork was well done, no gamey smell, flavor was just right. Beef  brisket was well seasoned but I feel it’s abit too dry. Chicken had the strongest flavor, charred with crispy skin. Perhaps some of the charred can be removed first because it tasted bitter. Price was very reasonable. Worth a try.

Amazing BBQ food! Reasonably priced and really tasty.

Ordered a platter combo ($25) that came with 2 sides.

Definitely worth dropping by.

Should have read the latest reviews before going. Used to visit this place a lot before its temporary closure. Standard has really dropped. The beef brisket is dry and doesn't taste great. The cheeseburger bun and patty are burnt to  the extent that they leave a bitter after taste. Only the fries is nice. The big guy (not the boss) taking my order doesn't look keen to work there, which is obvious based on how the food turn out. Don't think will come back again unless the quality improves.

On my first visit here, tried the lamb 🐑 shoulder with sweet potatoes. You can smell and taste the charcoal 🙂 so pretty satisfied. Been back regularly. Great stuff. For sides I'd recommend the pasta or sweet potatoes.

Excellent joint, decent enough crowd on a friday night and it was easy to find seats. The meat platter A at $25 with 2 sides was value for money and a good way to try the various meats. I particularly liked the beef brisket and chicken. Sides (mash and ratatouille) were decent and came abit cold but owner kindly helped heat them up. I would say that the platter is probably good for 2 hungry girls but probably a little small for 2 hungry guys. Food came fairly quickly and as a nice touch, the coffee shop also serves beer on tap.

Tender and well grilled meat! Overall, the meat is great but just wished that the portion is slightly bigger. The aglio olio was a miss though. Maybe can pick other sides instead. Will still come back to try other stuff!
Maybe we got in on a bad day. Beef brisket was too chewy. Chicken was undercooked at some parts. Kitchen seemed a understaffed. Pasta was simple and great though.
First time here and it was a really good experience. Really enjoyed their food and you can hardly find food stall using charcoal to cook their food. Will definitely come here again.
Great western gourmet food in a industrial estate food court. Close to restaurant quality but at food court price.
Pretty good food wish there was more salt. Will drop by if I ever pass by again.

Delicious! I love the chicken with the creamy sauce and pork belly, the sausage too. I was shocked with the "side dishes" as it is like a 1 meal already like the pasta. Will definitely come back again. Highly recommended!

It’s a bit below expectations based on the other strong reviews. Aglio olio was dished together with the chicken that came with a cream sauce - hmm? Pork belly was dry and the sweet sauce didn’t help to ease the flavor. There was nothing garlicy about the fries and it was rather salty. Egg was on point. I supposed the salad in garden greens would compliment the dish better.

The chicken here is really fantastic. Been coming back multiple times for it. The other meats, which I previously tried in the platter, were generally alright but nothing too special, with the beef brisket too fatty for my liking.

Overall, very delicious & well-presented food at a reasonable price. Quality is beyond expectation given how affordable their items are. Be sure to try their chicken!
The aglio olio and pork belly are so good taste, price also reasonable, cost me only $11:50

Ordered the beef brisket which to my opinion was way TOO dry, really not up to a restaurant standard. The set was around $13, portion was ok, just the quality of the meat has been extremely disappointing.

Hubby tried the duck leg confit which was better although also overcooked. He had the pasta as the side, seasoning was not bad but again pasta was over cooked.

Last ate here few years before Covid-19. Chanced again upon this place while collecting something from the office space here. Totally amazed by their beef brisket and pork belly, their sides also is really worth it as we ordered aglio olio pasta! Owner was also super pleasant and polite, had really good vibes here with good prices too! Will come again :)

Unfortunately the quality has dropped significantly since it's re-opening

Used to be a frequent visitor back in 2020-2021 and the meats and pasta were great then, hence the three stars. However, we eagerly visited them upon hearing that it's re-opened but the pasta was average at best and meat was dry and that is considering an increase in price (which is justifiable in the current market but the drop in quality is not)

Hopefully it can go back to how great it used to be

An extremely satisfying dinner. The BBQ chicken is simply awesome...you can taste the smoke, as you bite into its tender and juicy meat.

As recommended by so many other reviewers, the whipped potato is really a must to try!

If there is a 6 star rating, I'll definately give 6 stars⭐

Checked out this western stall that specialized in smoked meat at one of the coffeeshop of the industrial area in AMK street 62. I was there around 2pm and the lunch crowd has already died down. We order the meat platter for 2 which comes with 2 choices of sides (SGD$25), creamy pasta (SGD$5.50) and a Agilo olio (SGD$4.50).

Food didn’t take long to be served. The meat platter consisted of smoked brisket, pork belly and turkey.The sides were garlic mash and fries. Meat was average to be honest, Mash was bland, could do with more seasoning. Pasta was quite decent though, I liked the idea of having an onsen egg to go with the pasta.

Will I come all the way for this? Probably not. But in general, for the portion wise, it’s quite value for money.

Great char-broiled meats at such reasonable prices! I've been there a couple of times and their meats are always so nicely charred, flavourful yet tender. Took away their Mad Spiced Chicken($7.90) on an astonishing bed of shredded cabbage with sesame sauce and a Pork Belly with Ratatouille($8.90) and gotta say it tastes absolutely the same as savouring it right there. Give it a pass if you hate the taste of carcinogenic charred meat with a passion - coz they consistently get it right!

Surprised by the crowd at this quaint coffeeshop. Went on a weekday and the crowd started to pile in after 7pm.
Ordered a platter consisting of beef brisket, chicken and pork belly which comes with two sides. It was awesome! Perfect for a mini get together of 3 or even 4 if u order another side or something.
I loved the smoked beef briskets, plenty of fats in this one tho. Not for the faint of heart. The bbq chicken has a good flavour, well grilled I will say.
Pork belly was a bit on the dry side but I enjoyed the flavour it had.
We had two sides, the ratatouille and the garlic fries. The fries wasn’t too overpowering, with the garlic taste just showing through enough. Having the ratatouille with the meats balanced off the meal.
In all I’ll say it’s good food that should go into a good gathering. Oh the Coffeeshop serves Archipelago brews too!

Must try it yourself. Come early to avoid the crowd. Easy parking. If you love smoky favours of meat then this is the place you must visit. The soup and mashed potatoes by chef Kelvin is to die for. Also do call to check availability for their weekly flown in oysters from france. BTW the kopitiam also has draft 🍺 and delicious thai food too.

Surprise find in a very quiet part of AMK. The mushroom soup & toast was comfort food after a long day, while the meat platter & sides are good to feed a hungry bunch 😊. Will be back to try the other beef items.

Located in Link@AMK, lies a western stall with a rather extensive menu. Food is self-collected. Tried the Creamy Pasta which was $5.50 but sizeable - pretty affordable.

My only gripe is that the pasta comes with an egg and salad, and when the salad's sauce mixes with the cream in the pasta, it tastes sour and weird. Will prefer if the salad was served separately on the side. Hope to try their meaty stuff one day!

Great value, big portions. Wish it was more juicy though.

We came around 3pm on a weekday. Ordered a platter that came with bbqed180gm-ish beef brisket, chicken chop thigh and two slabs of pork ribs.

Chicken and ribs were a little too dry. But love the brisket. Felt they were pre-cooked and reheated though.

Good thing they came with refreshly made bigass sides! Carbonara as sides!! House salad was tasty too.

All this for 26$ that feeds 2-3pax!

There were only 2 pieces of pork ribs given for a $18 spanish pork ribs set… i finished the meat in 2 bites.

Fish was good and portion was good.

Stumbled on this little stall (located in Orange Point) in this industry park when googling for makan places. It has indeed lived up to its name for the food is charcoal grill. Most of the meat has been sous vide prior to grilling which eventually shorten the waiting time. Taste has been enhanced by the burning charcoal grill. It allow the customer to choose different side such as linguine (with various sauces) or garlic fries. Visited the stall on a Sat evening 6PM, and waiting time is about 10 to 15mins. Service is swift and the staff is polite as well. Price is pretty reasonable. Will visit this stall again for sure.

Fell way below my expectation but has the potential to be great if some changes are made.
The pork ribs were cooked just right and had plenty of smokey flavour. What let it down was the amount of bbq sauce - too little and barely having any sweetness. The meat marination also needs work. It tasted very flat. Just smoky and very salty with not much other flavour to give it depth so it got sickening quite quickly. Ratatouille was microwaved - film on the sauce and some parts of the dish were piping hot while other parts were not even warm. It marred the experience of an otherwise pretty decent side dish.

Surprisingly tender and succulent lamb ribs with smokey vibes. The drinks stall, which I understand is owned by the same owner, carries Archipelago Brewery creations that would complement the smokey bbq meats perfectly. An excellent gem hidden in an industrial estate!

Had the platter with 3 meats (lamb, beef & pork) and they were all delicious but i must say the lamb pale to comparison with the other 2 (and it’s more expensive). The pasta was cooked to al dente although I feel the flavour can be stronger abit (it’s only $5.50 by the way). This meal costed us about $37.50 but the portion was quite generous (definitely enough for 2) and there are 2 side dishes that came with the platter (we had mash potato and sweet Potato). Overall quite worth the price and the food are good.
One of the best BBQ meat in Singapore (My opinion). Love the salad and pasta because of the well marriage of flavors 😋

Tried the Beef Brisket with aglio olio.
Beef Brisket was soft and tender with good grilled flavour.

downside was that it is quite oily which doused the spaghetti as well, the amount of fat to meat content is pretty high but hard to complain as it’s brisket and further, at this price point.

(Pardon me for the photo of the half eaten brisket, it was difficult to resist tucking in immediately)

Used to be an office go to; quality has significantly deteriorated. Brisket is chewy and dry, used to be succulent and melts in your mouth.

Disappointed, probably won't visit again.

Happy with generous portion salad bowl choice with grilled chicken for lunch. Was able to finished all the food as the salad bowl paired off nicely with grilled chicken and wasabi taste paste. The boss of the stall is friendly too.

Will come back if around link@amk again

#salad bowl #characol #grillchicken #coffeeshop

Had the aglio olio but it was unfortunately super salty. The taste was still not too bad i guess, if I ignore the salt, and the price of $4.50 is pretty affordable for a plate of aglio olio. The egg is also a really nice touch! They just gotta take it easy with salting the dish it'll be alright.

Without recommendation from a friend, I would have missed this gem - that would have been awful. Located in the industrial corner of the Ang Mo Kio Estate , which mostly are a ghost town after office hours, Mad Charcoal chose to open the coffeeshop into the late (10pm, I heard). Some standard dishes and the other items were created to what the freshest the market has to offer that day - which will please all crowd that chose to slow down for the night. When I first visited, i saw only a few customers, on a Saturday night!! From dismay, the mood swing quickly to a gastronomic excitement. Value-worth European Gourmet had us convinced, and we are sure that, most if not all blind-tested connoisseur  would place the gourmet to be from a posh restaurant. We were back another 2 days later with our child - it is that good. Now go try.
Extremely nice and delicious western food. Prepared and cooked with charcoal caused the taste nice and something different. Price is reasonable and the food portion quite big.

Had high expectations for this place, and ordered their Angus Steak for $35. Steak was greasy and overcooked — requested for medium rare, but got almost well done (see picture). Apparently their standards have dropped; went at 12pm when it was not yet crowded.

I want to start off by saying: generous and cooking done right!

I was actually on a hunt for good western nearby my place and happened to chance upon this hidden jewel inside this industrial area (yes its a pain to get to if you don't have a car!).

I had ordered the p1 platter combo (as shown in image) and my sides as ratatouille (yes shocking to find this on the menu in a kopitiam!) and mash potato. Not the best ratatouille i've had but its on par with your average french restaurant in singapore. Mash done right as it was creamy and smooth. Pork chop was crispy on the outside juicy on the inside with the fats perfectly cooked (which melts in your mouth if done right!). Great moist chicken with a smokey creamy sauce and finally, a BBQ glazed beef brisket. I was skeptical at first thinking it was average but this place totally caught me off guard and for $25, you can't find an alternative that gives this much food on a plate!. The chef was really nice as when I was collecting the dish he explained the different cuts off meats. The finale was when he finished the dish off by cracking peppercorns onto the main platter.

My only regrets here is that I got greedy and took a bite of everything, which caused me not to enjoy the chicken and pork as the smokiness from the brisket was overpowering. If I had to complain, the only thing would be to travel to this kopitiam. I would recommend people to drop by if you're in the area.
Excellent western cuisine at affordable prices. The owner is friendly and welcoming. My family loved all our orders! Everything was fresh and done to perfection.

I ordered pork belly. This shop really love up to their name, the pork belly actually had slight tinge of charred flavour and the fats of the pork belly is well rendered. They are also generous with the side dish. The price was ONLY $9.90 Definitely willing to try again. Regretted that I didn't order the other stuff there.

A diamond in the rough.

The best no-frills cheeseburger I've ever eaten.

The grilled brioche bun is amazing, and the beef is seasoned well (for those who are not into savoury foods, this is slightly on the salty side).

You can ask to separate the shredded raw cabbage so that the burger would be only cheese + patty + bun.

The other items on their menu are great too, such as the pork belly which has an amazing charred taste and the beef brisket (can be a little fatty sometimes, but the sauce is great).

We opted for self pick up at a specific timing half a day in advance.
However, when I arrived and said that I'm here to pick up my food, they then began to cook.
Had to wait an additional 15-20mins for my food to be cooked which caused me to be late for a family dinner.

It would've been nice if they prepared and had the food cooked and ready to go by the timing given.

We ordered the P1 platter combo and the M9 spicy sausage.

The platter was decent but the chicken was pretty good.

Spicy sausages were nice too however, it didn't come with the mash potatoes as shown in the picture.

Overall, I'd say it's still a pretty decent meal!
It's OK. Meat precooked and then heated over charcoal fire as some parts of my beef brisket meat were still cold when served. $9.90 for beef brisket with 1 side so relatively economical.

We had crispy chicken and rosemary lamb loin. Both good portion size, nice plating. Overall well executed western food and at reasonable prices!

Must try

Bought chicken chop to try. The sides were salad and mashed potato. Chicken chop was nice, grilled to perfection but the sauce provided was too little. Fries were not bad, a little bland though. Salad was refreshing and crunchy. Mashed potato tasted like flour, bland and powdery. Service was alright.

Tried their medium rare beef sirloin steak, is only $11.9, considered as one of the best western stall(kopitiam) in AMK area.

Their chicken steak/pork steak costs only $6.9, and they serve super generous portion!
1st visit to the stall, tried pork chop (not much western food sells pork chop). It was tender and juicy. Great taste.

First time ordering this place thru grabfood. So glad I took a chance to try. It's fantastic, portion alot w fries crispy n seasoning just right, salad n mashed potatoes as well... Steak yummy n peppersauce shiok. Standard like restaurant kind. This stall will be my to-go steak meals.

A rare sight to see pork tomahawk steak in a coffee shop western stall as usually they are only sold in cafes or restaurants. The sauce is great and the huge meat is tender. Comes with crispy waffle fries, salad and mashed potato. Highly recommended!
Best western along amk Ave 10. Whenever I have graving for western will walk from Choon boon market over here just for their western.

Opening hours is similar to restaurant timing as there is a break from 2.30pm to 5pm.

Pork tomahawk is only limited to 10 servings per day and they open from 11.15am. So if you go after lunch hours... hoping they can increase the par level.

Ordered chicken & pork chop. Pretty much like Collins but it's way much cheaper. Black pepper sauce is spicy and so is the alio olio. So do remind the counter staff if you are ordering for the kids. Overall its very nice and tasty. Meat is not dry and rather juicy. Serving is generous and value for money.
Ordered  a tomahawk pork steak,  a bit of char but just nice to me! Crispy  and juicy , reasonable  price and huge portion 👍🏻 strongly recommend

13/02/2022 sunday afternoon 2pm

The Axe is a new western stall in the area. Definitely better than the one in 409 hawker center! Must try! Cheaper, bigger quantity, friendly staff, and definitely more delicious!

I ordered the Mexicano grilled chicken for $7.90. The chicken skin is crispy and you can tell it is grilled slowly with care, hence the 10 minute waiting time. The mashed potato gravy has black pepper and tastes yummy. The aglio olio is okay but very large portion even when I ask them for less. I chose salad over fries, but the lettuce is chopped roughly anyhow with too sweet dressing. Overall, very big portion and hearty and enjoyable. Worth!

The mexicano version has a lot of raw onions and cheese, I think buying the normal grilled chicken for $6.90 is even better.

Also check out their buff 招财猫 (lucky cat)!!!

The juiciest pork tomahawk I have ever tasted.
So good until I have to get a takeaway shortly after I tried it at the coffeeshop itself
I tried the famed Pork Tomahawk and was grossly disappointed….. I paid $16.90 for a piece of meat that was rather tough and tasteless. Overrated.
Not eating there often now after they change their side dish salad. Last time was fresh salad, now is those similar to KFC type. Yucks, I hope they change back.
ordered myself a chicken chop & totally enjoyed #alwaysAfirst saw they offer a wide menu selection, can’t wait to try the other items another time
The food is not too bad but pretty disappointed that they changed their garden salad (unlike the ones they show in their menu) to typical coleslaw..
Tried the spring chicken sometime ago, really tasty. Will visit again as i don't go there often in afternoon

Went on a Monday 9pm, there was only a few people. Ordered the fish & chips which was $7. Here are some of my thoughts.

1) The fish and chips is Battered Fish! Which is not easy to find.

2) Yes the battered was pretty good. Considering that now is H.A. and only can dabao, the fish was still warm and crispy after 15mins. I guess it's because of the dabao box that they used.

3) The tatar sauce has a slightly heavier onion taste, which was good.

4) crinkle cut fries was well seasoned and the mash potatoes goes very nicely w the dish.

The only down side is that the fish is quite thin, they give 2 pieces, but it's really more like a dory fillet cut into half. But I got no issue with it cause it's only $7 :) Will be back again for sure!  Didn't manage to take a picture and drown it down cause it smells too good 🤣
I really like the Aglio Oglio here, will continue to try other food.
Reasonable price and tasty food!Addicted to their meal and whenever we feel like eating western they are the first thing comes to our mind.Thank you for providing a delicious food brothers.

Tried the pork chop fried rice - generous portion of meat that outlasted the rice 😂 pork chop was fatty and flavourful, and the fried rice was good too. Mashed potatoes and gravy was nice! Would prefer more options for accompanying sauce/gravy for the mains though. Prices are reasonable, even a little cheap for the amount and quality!

Waiting time (ordered at lunch) is a little long right now, but it's to be expected since it's just opened and the coffeeshop is popular for working crowd nearby.
The salad is very bad taste and only two kind of vegetables inside, and the price is $4.50, not valuable.
Excellent service & reasonable prices !
Quality drop to so so only. Guess they cannot cope with too many customers during peak.
Food is great and portions are generous!
Not bad the quality
Service good and food is also good.
Cheap & Great Western Fix
Nice side dish.
Super place.

The service staff were very polite and helpful, restaurant vibe was good.

The food was... Interesting.
The mushroom soup is diluted and watery, there was very little mushroom taste.
Truffle fries came hot, there was some truffle oil smell but it was missing any truffle taste.
Same thing applied for the pork, ribs, sausage, chicken chop and steak. All of them were well cooked and the food texture was ok.

However, all of them didn't taste what they were suppose to taste like. The steak was slightly redeemable because of the sauce.
It's weird, this is the first time I've encountered this issue.

If you have to come and visit here, just get their beef dishes. For other Western food, there are several in the close vicinity that's better and cheaper.

Truly a gem hidden in the heartlands. Special shout out to the Rib-eye steak as well as the Home cured bacon thicks. The ribeye was cooked perfectly to medium-rare and had a very nicely charred crust. The bacon was full of flavor and the juices oozes out into your mouth.

Definitely worth the visit! Prices were decent for its quality as well.

Came on a Sat night and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of steak and value for money of this little gem tucked away in a housing estate. We had the platter to share which has 200g steak, 1/4 ribs, crispy chicken and sausages. Argentinean ribeye was delicious. Must be medium rare. The service is quick and food came out quickly. Don't forget about dessert as well. Definitely recommend for others to try this out.

Amazingly good! The ribeye steak is the best, the staff is very friendly, I always feel like I am with friends when eating there. I have a serious steak addiction because of Steakgrill. Prices are also good, especially on the lunch menu. Make sure you book a table, as the place is always full. I really really recommend Steakgrill!!!
Frieds were crispy.  Chicken crispy outside but inside was on the dry side.  Beef good quality.  Sides were good.  Ice lemon tea quite diluted.  Service is slow but friendly.  Price reasonable.

Came to this place with the recommendation of a friend. Tried their rib eye and truffle fries. Its really good! The service staff were very attentive as well! Nice environment for enjoying food w friends!

Huge HDB carpark nearby if you drive, took a while to find our beef, service was quick and we had the $70 Double Ribeye steak 650g (Argentina/NZ) and includes two Sapporo Premium bottled and we opt for truffle fries, also tried their home cured bacon $10. We can’t be happier, both steaks were great. Highly recommended if you are tired of hawker fare

Food is decent , the chef presentation is good n have their own style which is different. Price is good , portion is generous but I think they can work on their coffee when it comes to breakfast..other than that it's worth the time and money . Good job guys

First time visiting this restaurant. Walked in and was told all tables fully booked, even when we were prepared to wait. So did an online booking and visited the restaurant the next day.

Ordered Ribeye and Home Cured Bacon Thick. Ribeye was juicy and nicely grilled. The Bacon Thick was excellent. Prices are very reasonable, no service charges nor GST. Will be back to try their other items.

I feel it is really ok nia. Nothing i can shou about. It does taste a litte bit better than your average family steakhouse. Ordered medium came medium. Mac and cheese is alright. Ordered a set and mushroom soup was diluted and salty. Fish and chip should be good because it is served woth snapper but the whole piece dont hold well and it was a abit disasterous to eat it. The nett price is drawing point.
Back again to this nice cosy restaurant inthe heart of AMK. The steaks are juicy and done perfectly. Duck breast is yummy. Pork tenderloin fillet is nocely done.

A rare find to find a great steak house in the heartlands. The staff here are so friendly, and service is rather prompt too. If you're stuck for choice, they wouldn't mind recommending what to eat. Another thing I like is that they're pet friendly, so pet owners feel free to bring your pups or cats along, as long as they're leashed.
Food here is pretty delicious too. I enjoy a good steak and the sides here are delectable. They have one of the better Mac and Cheese sides I've eaten compared to some other steakhouses. Definitely a bang for your buck considering the range they have here.

Generally good food quality. The affogato is served with strawberry vanilla, my wife didn't like it but I'm fine. Good price value for neighborhood location. The truffle pork chop is genuinely grilled to excellent flavour and tenderness.
Please try their mixed grilled is really value for money 😍 Foods is nice and the staffs is very nice also, please made reservations before you come, because always full house 😊

The steak was delicious and not too expensive. The atmosphere of the restaurant was really nice as well and the service was top tier, they were very polite and friendly. I saw that some reviews had mention a long wait but I did not experience any problems in regards to the waiting time. Definitely worth a try and would go back there again.

Table reservation was made before HA, and Edwin was kind enough to notify and offer takeaway for the main event, which was the A5 Wagyu for 4 pax.

Pricing and order was clear and speedy, with care taken to ensure quality of food served. We ordered 1/2 rack of ribs and 720g A5, along with side dishes.

Packaging was done to ensure the best possible quality when served, and Edwin even offered to load the food to my car.

Impeecable service and taste! Will definitely visit again, be it for dine-in or takeaway.

Let's support our local businesses, those who take extreme pride in the service they provide!

nice cozy place to eat steak within the neighborhood area.

food is decent and service is good .

place is small but cozy .

extensive menu … i had steak , decently done  to my liking .

take note no credit card payment . paylah! ok .Nets ok .

recommended.

part 2:

back again , this time back to try breakfast !

decent for the price and portion !

recommended!

We always enjoy the steak and pasta here. The steak is accurately done to our liking and in our opinion value for money. Last night we had the different meat combi which allowed us to taste beef from different origins w/o breaking the bank. Service was friendly and good.

the bit chunks of mashed potatoes are to die for. well-grilled beef. tuna salad is so fresh. although we got it after our mains of steaks, it leaves us with a refreshing end. i also admire the small selection of alcoholic beverages, its giving living-room vibes. would love to kick off to their breakfast menu too.we’ll definitely  be back.

Great value and quality western cuisine. We liked their ribeye steak, pork chops and bacon spaghetti. Can skip the bananas shake though. For those who prefer beer, they serve good beer at reasonable prices, all without the 10% service charges.

I've been to the restaurant numerous times and the food has consistently been top-notch and absolutely delicious!! I really love that they are innovative and when you ask for recommendations, the staff is always fantastic with recommending me very tasty dishes 😋😋😋😋 It's the perfect place for a family dinner or gathering with friends. Thanks for the lovely experience, will definitely be back again!

Google steakhouse at AMK and this place popped up.

Not too bad for a steak within a HBD neighbourhood. We had the ribeye and NY sirloin steak, both were quite good considering the price was very reasonable.

The pull pork burger was equally tasty as well. Moist enough and with the cheese on it, not bad at all.

Onion rings and the affogato were alright. But the French fries were super crispy and it's like McDonald's curly fries except it's not curly 😂
Mushroom soup slightly watery but tasted decent. Ribeye steak tasted great for its price and was nicely cooked. Fries were very crispy. Chocolate brownie was amazing. Would return again.

We tried Ribeye steak and some other dishes. Yes, the taste is really splendid. Atmosphere is relaxing, pricing is not too expensive too. Service team is awesome, always trying their best to serve their customers.

Quite a nice spot nestled deep inside AMK Ave 10 blocks. Took us a while to find the place. Food is decently priced and lunch comes with free flow of iced lemon tea.

We tried a range of items and in general the burgers was good but the Cajun grilled chicken was a bit undercooked (pinkish).

Friendly wait staff….
Decent priced steak and taste good too. Love the pulled pork burger. The beer and cider are rather well priced at $6+ we will come back again. Last order at 8.30pm.

A hidden gem in the neighbourhood! Considering the quality of the food we get at the prices, it's very reasonable and worthwhile. Get the mac & cheese for sides - unlike the usual, obviously microwaved packed ones you eat at other western places, this will not leave you with regrets! The home cured bacon thicks were so good too, we came back for more!

Pork chops were tender so it wasn't hard for my grandma to chew on, and I enjoyed the cordon bleu as well :) if you have some more space for the pulled pork quesadillas, I recommend you getting a portion! We got them to go and had them for supper, still good!

Plus point: they're pets friendly (as long as you're sitting outdoors)! It's better to call in to inform the staff if you're bringing a pet, so they can keep the tables outside for you :)

Pretty tasty steak, had a ribeye for 20 sgd, price is net, there was no gst and service charge. Overall was well cooked and tasty steak, came with fries that were crispy, and some salad. Overall ambience is decent and comfy, was not crowded on a Saturday afternoon. They have pasta and grilled chicken at more affordable prices around 10 dollars.

The food was really good and the staff was super friendly!!! We had the Australian Wagyu platter, which was recommended by the staff and it was really tender and delicious. The only downside was the wait time, which was understandable as they have very limited seating and the tables were full when we came. Next time we will try the Double Ribeye platter, which was another recommendation by the staff. However, I suggest booking on their website or whatsapp them as walk ins may not guarantee a open table. The staff were nice enough to take our numbers and called us when they had an open table. Overall it was a 10/10 experience!
Awesome and delicious food at reasonable prices. Hidden place, sad to see it become too popular cause then we will need to queue haha. Support your local businesses!

A hidden gem in the AMK neighbourhood provides nice steak. The steak approximately 250g with a great thickness and worth for money. The grilled chicken also taste good and the portion of it was great.

Good food and service.
Small restaurant with ~10 tables
Not hifi, but neat and tidy with friendly staff
Good steak at affordable prices in a quiet HDB neighbourhood. The pork jowl is so tender with hint of apple. Reservation recommended.

a hidden gem in the heartlands. service was immaculate, hearty portion of well cooked steak of a good cut. second time patronising this outlet and I have all the praises for their consistency and value for money. super affordable wine and beer available too. Their goma tuna salad came with large chunks of fresh tuna in fresh veggies, it was delightful. Better than Astons, anyday.

Me and my partner had their truffle pork chop and that alone made us give this simple down to earth restaurant five stars. The meat was juicy, savoury, succulent and satisfying. Everything was on point. The onion rings were crunchy and perfect. Mac and cheese was delicious too. The only underwhelming thing was the strawberry smoothie, compared to the meal.

@steakgrillsg is a cosy restaurant that serve delicious and affordable cuisine.😋😊

Let's see what we have here:

1. Quest fries S$9
Crispy fries served with in house cheese sauce, chicken and bacon bits.
Their fries is really good esp with the cheese sauce. 😋 their fries is crispy and fragrant. Must order. 👍
,.
2. Home cures bacon thicks
Thick cut belly strips that had been cured for days, smoked and then grilled
This is flavorful,best for people who like pork with more fats. I personally prefer their pork chops instead.

2. St Louis Rib 1/3 S$16
Applewood smoked ribs served with in house sauce
This ribs is tender with some fats and lean mix. Portion is so value for $.
,.
3.Ribeye 250g S$21
All time favorite with a good balance of fat and lean
( I don't eat beef, but my foodie friends like this)
,.
4.Prawn Arribiata S$15
With chilli, prawns and pomodoro. I like the pasta noodles it is spicy and tasty. I could finish the whole plate myself. 😋The prawn could be better though.
,.
5. Truffle Pork Chop S$16
Pork tenderloin grilled and topped with truffle cream sauce
I personally like this very much without dipping the sauce. It is lean meat yet not tough, very nicely marinated. I strongly recommend to order this 😋 love this.👍

Review posted on my IG: Yummymich

Love the food here but the service is not great..... came at 8pm and waited for 10 + mins in front of the 'please wait to be seated' sign before a service staff approached us and said that they were full for the day and cannot accomodate us. they said that they thought we were browsing/takeaway so they didn't approach us which is... super passive???? we didn't want to flag them also because they looked super busy walking in and out serving people, and they also sat and attended to another group before us that was also waiting in line but they ignored us... anyway food is great though but come early/make a reservation and make sure to be forthcoming when you arrive because the staff is not 😬😬😬
As we seldom eat beef, decided to try their fish, chicken and pasta. All were nicely cooked and seasoned, including the side dishes. Recommended!

This eating place is hidden in the Any Mo Jio HDB estate, and it has both air-conditioned and alfresco sitting. The meat platter is nice, especially the prepared beef, which is tender and juicy. The starter platter on the other hand is just average. The restaurant is overall good value for the food served.

Perfectly crispy fries and great service.

However the steak was chewy and more medium-well than medium-rare, and the mac and cheese just didn't taste good.

Nachos were bland, but the roast pork it came with was tasty. They don't really go well together though, it's not like they can be eaten together...

All in all would only come back for the fries.
This place is great! Food is pretty good, large portion, for their prices it's 100%worth it. Highly recommend! It's best to make reservation💕

First visit, reached there after 2pm. Well grill and flavourful. Would visit again.  👍🏻

1
Had NY Steak. It's yummy and affordable. We finished everything. We came back again for St Louis Ribs Half Rack. It's equally as good and sufficient for 2 people.

Had a takeaway order though the place looks cosy for dine in.

Ordered the Cajun grilled chicken and truffle pork chop - would prefer the pork chop though i can’t really taste the truffle. Grilled chicken was pretty bland to be honest and the house salad portion is too little..and so is the proteins.
